job summary: Ace Info Solutions, Inc. (AceInfo) is a mid-size federal contracting firm with a focused vision: empower our clients, challenge our employees, and grow our business. Founded in December 2000, and employs over 550 professionals. We have a deep commitment to ensuring quality and customer satisfaction with a mature corporate infrastructure, strong management and quality practices. AceInfo is prime on 95% of our contracts, is headquartered in Reston VA, and has geographically dispersed office locations throughout the country, to include: Kearneysville, WV; Chesapeake, VA; Fort Collins, CO; Boulder, CO; Quantico, VA; Kansas City, MO; Bowie, MD; multiple Washington, DC Metropolitan locations, and project presence in 23 states in all time zones. We offer excellent benefits and salary packages including free medical/dental/life insurance premiums for staff members.AceInfo does provide relocation for internal employees and external candidates, within 50 miles (minimum) of work location.AceInfo is looking for an Application Development Lead, to work in Juneau, Alaska. Candidate must have over 5 years of experience leading Software Development and Maintenance of applications successfully. The Lead will execute and manage the contract tasks and be responsible for overall service delivery of Application maintenance and support activities for the contract which include, Fisheries database management and software engineering, Improvement and Maintenance to Database Systems, Applications Development Support for Operation & Maintenance of existing fisheries systems and project management/planning. The Program management systems are written primarily using Oracle backend database with programming logic written in a combination of PL/SQL, Java/JEE, Struts, Spring, Hibernate, Java Script, and related technologies (SQL Server and MySQL are also used), Apache Tomcat and JBOSS servers. A variety of project management approaches are used including Agile and JIRA based SDLC.The Lead will do coordination and work with stakeholders that include fisheries SMEs, functional/Technical and management personnel. Alaska’s fisheries are valued at over $2.5 billion per year and provide over half the volume of fish landings in the United States. Job title: Sr. Programmer/Analyst - Located in Juneau, Alaska
education level/skills required / respon: You've been doing software development in some of the core technologies in use today including Java, C#, ASP.NET, MVC, and JavaScript....
job summary:
Make a new life in the land of vacation! Leave the software engineering work behind as you head out on the water for an evening of fishing, appease your eclectic interests with cultural events, enjoy the comfort and familiarity of a small town, and do it all while advancing your technical career.


Although you realize there is more to life than work, you're not willing to compromise on your commitment to learning, improving, and excelling as a professional software engineer. See if some of these things ring true with you:

You've been doing software development in some of the core technologies in use today including Java, C#, ASP.NET, MVC, and JavaScript
You can map business requirements to a database design and walk your stakeholders through the stickier parts of the business process, but you also work with other developers to address database performance and security concerns
You have software programming hobby projects that dive into JavaScript frameworks like Bootstrap and Node.js; you're eager to do more
You understand and believe that people are the most important part of the software development process, not just tools, technologies, and procedures
User interface design may not be your gift, but you've realized that users expect more; you've taken steps to improve the user experience of your applications
Now you're wondering, "What's next?" and "Where do I want to take my career?" Consider that after a year at RDI, you would be:

Working directly with clients in a consulting role, helping them understand how new software will change their business processes and what needs to be done for smooth implementations
Working with a wide support group of peers, both locally and across other offices, who are available for support and assistance, and always willing to help
Influencing technology, process, and design choices; you'll be able to point to significant decisions that were made and see the results you've affected
Living a full life--one that is personally and professionally rewarding--and looking forward to what the next 1, 5, and 10 years with RDI look like
The RDI Juneau office is located in one of the most beautiful places on earth. We have a strong commitment to the local community and are looking for people to help us continue building on our strong reputation. You likely have a background in enterprise web application development and 5-10 years of experience in software development, but we're more interested in what you've accomplished. Opportunities at RDI are endless for the achievement-oriented professional.


If you'd like to be considered for this position, send us your resume and a quick summary of two significant accomplishments. One of them should be related to a team project and the other an individual accomplishment highlighting your role as a consultant. Each description should be a paragraph or two long; the more descriptive (fewer bullets), the better. Check out www.resdat.com and contact us to learn more about why we offer great career opportunities.


RDI is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Unfortunately, we are not able to provide any visa sponsorship or transfers for this position.

job summary:
***This recruitment has been extended to allow for a larger applicant pool. If you already applied you do not need to reapply.***

The Department of Corrections, Division of Administration and Support, is currently recruiting for an Analyst/Programmer II/III/IV position located in Juneau, Alaska.

We are looking for a highly motivated individual who has experience in developing and maintaining web based applications, thrives in a team environment, and is seeking an opportunity to utilize and improve their technical skills.


This position requires a competency in web server applications and tools to provide end user presentation services for the department's Offender Management Systems to 1,500 department users and various other external agencies and public access.


Key responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to: 
Development of new web applications and extensions to existing applications; Integration of a web based user interface to the existing offender information database structure; Development of user interfaces to new functional capabilities of the offender information management system; Maintenance and support of code enhancements and extensions; Maintenance and support of the existing DOC web applications and use interfaces; Contributing to the design of system enhancements and extensions; Technical application report writing; Creating and maintaining technical documentation; Performing installation, maintenance, and trouble-shooting activities for net-based and other software applications; and Developing training and reference materials for the user interface. The desired candidate will possess some or all of the following knowledge, skills, and abilities: 
Strong working knowledge of Java/Java 2EE language and MyEclipse development tools; Strong working knowledge of HTML and MS IIS; Good working knowledge of Apache, and Tomcat; Good working knowledge of Subversion Source Control; Has implemented and supported web based applications; Has maintained a web based application for a large user population; Familiarity with MS Windows and Linux based (Ubuntu, CentOS) servers Familiarity with Photoshop; Familiarity with JasperSoft Reporting software; Familiarity with Spring, and Struts; Familiarity with Informix a definite plus; Ability to communicate technical issues and ideas verbally and in writing to all experience levels; Ability to create intuitive, easily learned, and understood user interfaces; Excellent problem-solving abilities and adept at learning new technologies; and Ability to adhere to guidelines and policies, meet deadlines, and accomplish team objectives. This position is based in the Juneau Central Office, and requires a detailed security background check for all staff. He or she will be a valued member of the programming development team of the department, and will be joining a dynamic team of dedicated professionals. If this sounds like where you want to be, then we want to hear from you. We offer a dynamic team and professional, challenging work environment dedicated to providing effective user tools and support.


Special Note: Analyst Programmers are flexibly staffed. This vacancy may be filled at either the II, III or IV level depending on the applicant's training and/or experience. Please respond to all of the minimum qualification questions.


Individual positions at each level in this class series may require expertise in a particular area of programming or analysis. Recruitment and selection will be on the basis of these requirements.


For some positions in these job classes a background investigation including fingerprinting is required. 
***This recruitment is open to all applicants.***

An associate's degree in Computer Science or Computer Information Systems may substitute for nine months of the required experience.

Hiring Freeze Exemption

This individual position is EXEMPT from the hiring freeze. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply.


PREA NOTIFICATION

The Department of Corrections follows and maintains federal and state requirements standards including, but not limited to, Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA) standards which apply to all public and private institutions that house adult or juvenile offenders. PREA standards preclude the department from hiring or promoting anyone who has engaged in, or been convicted of any conduct which would violate PREA standards related to sexual assault including:

Sexual abuse in a prison, jail, lockup, community confinement facility, juvenile facility, or other institution;
Convicted of engaging or attempting to engage in sexual activity in the community facilitated by force, overt or implied threats of force, or coercion, or if the victim did not consent or was unable to consent or refuse; or,
Has been civilly or administratively adjudicated to have engaged in the activity described above. The above is in compliance with PREA and its implementing regulations, 28 C.F.R. Part 115, Subpart A, Section 115.17, Hiring and Promotion Decisions.

job summary:

The State of Alaska, Department of Revenue (DOR), Child Support Services Division (CSSD) is currently recruiting for an Analyst/Programmer IV position in our Anchorage office.
An exciting opportunity to grow and learn skills. Under the direction of the Data Processing Manager II, the incumbent will function as an Analyst/Programmer IV at the full proficiency level. This position independently performs systems analysis, design and development work on highly complex applications. The position is the Division expert in web design and JAVA and .NET programming. The position defines functions and assigns tasks to an analyst/programmer III and reviews and evaluates progress and completion of those assigned tasks.

The Division's applications are used by Alaska Child Support case workers, Child Support clients and associated case parties, Department of Law, Court employees and judges, and other US states Child Support case workers. This is a senior level appointment that requires strong experience in system analysis and design, as well as programming. The individual selected must be especially fluent in high level languages and show initiative in the solutions of extremely complex applications.

Key responsibilities include:
Independently design and develop highly visible and highly complex custom web applications, or modules within applications, using a mobile first responsive web design, JAVA, JavaScript, XML, Faces, Wicket, Spring, Hibernate, CSS, and HTML.
Independently design and develop custom client/server applications using C#, .NET Remoting, Office automation and LINQ. Requires the ability to do independent analysis and design and coding in Java, C#, XML, HTML, XSLT, and JavaScript.
Independently design and develop interface routines with other applications and hardware (such as mid tier, mainframe, and Oracle WebCenter Content, etc). Generate interface routines for SoftwareAG EntireX RPC calls to retrieve mainframe data from ADABAS files. Develop mainframe programs written in NATURAL to retrieve, compile and format ADABAS data from our NSTAR system for retrieval, processing and presentation by web applications.
Independently design and develop application integration to myAlaska, Oracle WebCenter Content, DOL employer information, and the Divisions mainframe systems, with technologies for inter-application functionality using SOAP, Web Services, J2EE APIs, advanced HTML, and XML integration.
Write structured Transact-SQL routines to perform application and database (SQL Server) updates. Act as MS SQL database administrator for the division and perform SQL server management including security, analysis reporting, changing the recovery model, etc.
Serves as team leader for projects that involve implementation of new systems, subsystems and components of the division's web and client/server applications. Independently determines the types of programs and routines that will be required to develop the computer system. Provides technical expertise in developing the division's web and client/server systems.
Independently defines functions and assigns tasks to an analyst/programmer III and reviews and evaluates progress and completion of those assigned tasks. Instructs analyst/programmers in best practices for web and client/server design and development. Provides custom analyst/programmer training in web and client/server design and development.
Mentor mainframe programmers in Object Oriented Technologies during the re-platforming effort from the mainframe to the web. This task will require some learning of the mainframe NSTAR system. The ideal applicant will possess the following demonstrated strengths:
Web design, JAVA, JavaScript, XML, Faces, Wicket, Spring, Hibernate, CSS, and HTML.
SOAP, Web Services, J2EE APIs, advanced HTML, and XML integration.
SoftwareAG EntireX RPC calls to retrieve mainframe data from ADABAS files.
Structured Transact-SQL routines to perform application and database (SQL Server) updates. NOTE: PLEASE READ CAREFULLY!

job summary:
Buzzbizz Studios is looking to add another front-end Web Developer to help create and administer a wide variety of custom websites to our team. The perfect candidate will have successful experience in web coding fundamentals and is comfortable working with static websites.

Buzzbizz Studios is a creative agency serving businesses in Alaska. The company's mission is to provide cost-effective & attention grabbing media production for local businesses so they achieve superior marketing results that lead to dramatic increases in profit.

We are:

A rapidly expanding marketing firm based in Anchorage.
A fun place to work, where individuality is encouraged and hard work is rewarded.
A professional environment providing hands-on continuation training to every member of the team.- A team that thrives on an atmosphere of mutual respect and personal mentorship at every level.

You are:
Have you been a freelancer working alone with a handful of clients, looking for bigger challenges, and want to join a team oriented atmosphere? Then you need to send us your resume and links to your proudest sites.

Other great candidates are those recently or about to graduate with information technologies related degrees who are trainable, resourceful, and are looking for a great jumping-off point to the start of their career.

More about the job:
Creating websites: You will be working with our Marketing and Graphic Design departments, to create custom websites. You will be given a graphical proof of a website, along with a set of instructions on what kinds of animations and interactivity to be provided with content. You will be tasked to make fully responsive websites based on these instructions and assets. We have a preference for static HTML5 websites over CMS-based template sites.

Administering Websites: You will be tasked with content fixes on our current client websites, along with any bug fixes and feature additions.

Applicant needs to have a familiarity with Adobe software. You should feel comfortable talking to clients about technical issues, though most client interactions are handled by the Marketing/Sales team.

We are looking for a team player who absolutely loves HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS. We want to make websites for local small businesses that are so good, it makes national websites jealous.

Required Education: Bachelor's degree

Required experience: Five years with HTML5, CSS, PHP, Java, Wordpress

Required Skills: -Strong HTML5 Skills- Strong CSS Skills (including Responsive Design)-Familiarity with jQuery and jQuery plugins-Basic Wordpress and Drupal Administration-Experience in transferring domains and hosting

Preferred Skills: -Experience with PHP Programming-Experience with MySQL Database Administration-Experience with administering Apache servers-Experience with administering DNS Zone files-Knowledge of HTML5 Features-Knowledge of CSS3 Features-Ability to make custom jQuery plugins-Experience with Adobe Illustrator-Experience with Adobe Photoshop-Experience with Adobe Dreamweaver-Knowledge of SEO Best Practices-Knowledge of how to mirror a website.-Knowledge of "Parallax" web design

If this opportunity sounds like a perfect match for you, please respond to this post with your cover letter and resume attached in a Word Document format.

Please Note: We are looking for an in-house employee, but are open to private contractors or telecommuters if the conditions are right.

job summary:
Join Netcracker Technology, a wholly owned subsidiary of NEC Corporation, to work for a forward-looking software company, offering mission-critical solutions to service providers around the globe. Our comprehensive portfolio of software solutions and professional services enables large-scale digital transformations, unlocking the opportunities of the cloud, virtualization and the changing mobile ecosystem. With an unbroken service delivery track record of more than 20 years, our unique combination of technology, people and expertise helps companies transform their networks and enable better experiences for their customers.


Position Summary:


This position is primarily responsible for acting as the technical team leader for Netcracker and for enhancing the relationship with the client and other vendors in the integration and data migration work stream. Responsible for managing the technical resources within this work stream, as such, this person will be working with project sponsor, overall project manager and development team to assign appropriate resources for the project, within the scope, schedule and budget to ensure deliverable's are met.


Should have sound technical background in the integration and migration related work, and be responsible for the conceptualization, design and implement a sound data migration methodology and approach that includes both hardware and software components. Person should be capable of understanding the logical data models and document the Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERD). This role involves interacting with Business Analysts, Data integration developers, and solution architect to translate business requirements into a logical model.


Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

Define and implement the methodology adopted for the project
Develop technical specification and best practices for a successful delivery

As the global leader in licensed sports merchandise, Fanatics is changing the way fans purchase their favorite team merchandise by partnering with top leagues, clubs and soccer brands worldwide to offer the largest collection of timeless and timely gear from every pro and college team online, on your phone, in stadiums or on-site at the world’s biggest sporting events. Kemper Services Group is seeking a Software Developer III for our Information Systems department located in Jacksonville, Florida. If you are an experienced Java developer and want to learn Guidewire, apply today. Training will be available for the successful
hire.


In this role you will provide technical consulting and support initially on Guidewire ClaimCenter and subsequently on Policy and Billing Centers. You will act as a technical resource in the many phases of the development and implementation process. You will
conduct code and design reviews, develop code, unit test and sign off on technical specifications including design documents, functional designs and requirements. Knowledge of estimation process and participation is required. You will provide on-call production
support assistance in addition to defect resolutions (planned and unplanned).


Position Responsibilities:


• Application Production Support


• Infrastructure upgrade Support


• Defect corrections


• Small and major enhancements


• Compliance changes


• Medium to large Business Operations requests related to Claims


• Larger business transformation projects that will impact Claims


Position Qualifications:


• 3-5 years of current Java/J2EE development experience is required.


• 7-10 years of Information Technology related experience is a must.

• Home and auto insurance industry experience is preferred.

• Strong problem solving skills for post implementation support are needed.


• Must have strong written and verbal communication skills to interact effectively with vendors, claims senior business partners, business support, and other IT employees on-site, remote, and off-shore.


• Education or experience equivalent to a college degree in an information technology related field, supplemented by insurance or computer-related courses/knowledge.

Competencies

The CSX Competency Framework is the foundation of our Talent Strategy and is what drives CSX performance. CSX accordingly selects and develops talent based on each of the following competencies: analyze issues and make effective decisions, advance the business, engage, coach, and build a diverse workforce, build partnerships, improve service quality and processes, execute effectively, demonstrate personal leadership, and demonstrate functional and technical agility.

Job Requirements

Work hours may vary in length and schedule (may include a non-standard work week)

Applicants will be required to engage in ongoing background checks through the duration of this position with continued passing results.

Safety Commitment

Safety is a way of life at CSX, encompassing every aspect of company operations. Guided by a policy of ensuring the safety of our employees, our customers and the communities we serve, CSX works relentlessly to prevent accidents and injuries. Not only is it the right thing to do, but when a company puts safety first, everyone benefits: the employees and their families, the customers and the communities. In line with our commitment to safety, the applicant selected for this position may be required to successfully complete a background check and drug test. Passing results must be received prior to start date in new position.

About CSX

CSX, based in Jacksonville, Florida, is a premier transportation company. It provides rail, intermodal and rail-to-truck transload services and solutions to customers across a broad array of markets, including energy, industrial, construction, agricultural, and consumer products. For nearly 190 years, CSX has played a critical role in the nation's economic expansion and industrial development. Its network connects every major metropolitan area in the eastern United States, where nearly two-thirds of the nation's population resides. It also links more than 240 short-line railroads and more than 70 ocean, river and lake ports with major population centers and farming towns alike. More information about CSX Corporation and its subsidiaries is available at www.csx.com. Like us on

Facebook

and follow us on

Twitter

.

Closing Statement

At CSX, two of the company's core values are People Make The Difference and Safety Is A Way of Life. We are committed to offering our team members the most competitive compensation and benefits package available, unlimited opportunities for development and growth throughout an exciting and rewarding career, and the safest work environment possible. CSX is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. job summary:
As the global leader in licensed sports merchandise, Fanatics is changing the way fans purchase their favorite team merchandise by partnering with top leagues, clubs and soccer brands worldwide to offer the largest collection of timeless and timely gear from every pro and college team online, on your phone, in stadiums or on-site at the world’s biggest sporting events. A top 50 Internet Retailer Company, Fanatics comprises the broadest online assortment by offering hundreds of thousands of officially licensed items via its Fanatics ( www.fanatics.com ), FansEdge ( www.fansedge.com ) and Kitbag ( www.kitbag.com ) brands, as well as the largest selection of sports collectibles and memorabilia through Fanatics Authentic ( www.fanaticsauthentic.com ). A multi-channel company, Fanatics operates more than 300 online and offline stores, including the e-commerce business for all major professional sports leagues (NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, NASCAR, MLS, PGA), major media brands (NBC Sports, CBS Sports, FOX Sports) and more than 200 collegiate and professional team properties, which include several of the the biggest global soccer clubs (Manchester United, Real Madrid, Chelsea, Manchester City). The company's in-venue and event retail portfolio includes the NBA, NHL, NASCAR, Wimbledon, Kentucky Derby, The Ryder Cup, Manchester City, Texas Longhorns, Pittsburgh Pirates and New Jersey Devils, allowing fans to experience a seamless shopping experience across online, mobile and physical store locations.


Primary Purpose


Our customers are very important to us. Keeping customers happy and building enduring emotional bonds with them is critical for our business and our brand. We are seeking an awesome individual to join our Order Management team to assist with areas such as Order Creation, Order Maintenance, Customer Service and Support. This role will focus on defining, designing, building and executing systems and integrations to enable our core order routing, order maintenance, inventory allocation, and on-line returns capabilities. BUT…that’s not it. Order Management is a large suite of features and there are many more exciting things to do.


We are looking for someone who likes to understand how systems work, who enjoys building things, who seeks opportunities to learn new technologies, and who wants to become the domain expert to whom others turn. We are looking for a smart, savvy technologist who loves data, loves applications, and loves sports.


Principle Duties and Responsibilities

Assist in the development, debugging, and maintenance of software components using a combination of technologies and in accordance with the established SDLC. C ollaborate with others in crafting and implementing the technical vision.
Provide post go-live support for new features and be responsible for supporting the SLA of the deployed solution so as to minimize the impact on business operations.
Participate in a small, experienced, energetic team on a rapid, agile development schedule
Deliver. Say what you will do and then do it. Be the person who just gets it done!
Education & Experience Requirements

BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or Information Technology.
1-2 years experience as a developer developing, documenting, and implementing great features and products or equivalent course experience.
Solid understanding of object-oriented programming (OOP) and computer science foundations.
Knowledge of some of the following: .NET 4.0/4.5 Framework, C#, ASP.NET, MVC, WCF, Web API, Java, J2EE, JSP, XML, CSS, JQuery, and/or web services.
Knowledge of SOA & integration tools and methodologies.
SQL, stored procedure, and scripting capabilities.
Analytical and creative problem solving skills.
Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to adapt to an existing, complex environment and the ability to learn new concepts and software is necessary.
Understanding of Agile/Scrum principles and excellent teamwork skills.
Sense of humor, willingness to laugh at danger and an appreciation of the ironic are all pluses.

Interface with end users and support personnel. Provide recommendations for enhancement and improvements to software applications. Document custom software application data flow and logic. Perform upgrade and migration of software applications. Maintain knowledge of a variety of concepts, practices, languages and procedures within the field of Web application development. Continuously monitor industry trends, technologies, and standards and be able to research, recommend, and apply new technologies as they emerge. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.


Responsibilities:
Resolve production issues minimizing system down time, and ensure that the application software is operational during normal business hours. Pro-actively identify and correct software application errors.
Develop, design, analyze, write, modify, implement, document, enhance and maintain corporate software applications and custom interface applications to third party vendors.
Develop custom scripts and applications to better serve the end users needs and automate batch processes. Recommend improvements or work-around for end user needs.
Recommend enhancements for corporate software applications and custom programs.
Maintain test environment that simulates production environment including a relatively current view of production data in the test database.
Document the data flow and logic for custom applications, reports and interfaces.
Provide concise design and other program documentation for custom interface applications and reports.
Participate in defining all files, libraries, programs and inter-system dependencies, along with the applications function.
Research new technology and recommend improvements and changes to the current production environment based on efficiencies gained by new technology.
Mentor and motivate junior developers on technical practices and theories.
Lead development project of one or more team members.
Provide accurate and concise project or technical details in writing and verbally.
Participate and or create technical standards and evangelize them.
Estimate development project efforts.
Miscellaneous duties as assigned.

Qualifications:
Computer Science degree.

8+ years experience programming applications in an enterprise production environment.

Advanced knowledge of languages used in assigned area, such as ASP.NET, ADO.NET and/or Entity Framework, C#, Java Script, HTML, Stored Procedures, WCF / Web Services, .Net Remoting, Window Services.

Practical knowledge of JQuery, multi-threading, XML, XSLT, XSD, Design Patterns, SQL Profiler, Team Foundation Server, .Net 1.0 – 4.0, AJAX, User interface controls like component one or Telerik, MS Enterprise Library, and COM.

Ability to identify performance issues and make recommendations accordingly.

Knowledge in Agile, RUP and/or Waterfall SDLCs.

Ability to work autonomously on tasks or be a key member of a larger team on critical projects.

Highly motivated, Self Starter, Detail Oriented.

Able to clearly mentor junior developers on technical practices and theories.

Successfully complete projects on time and budget.

Ability to contribute to technical direction of teams.

Ability to effectively motivate others.

Ability to concisely communicate with project technical and business teams.

job summary:
When it comes to making a meaningful difference in the lives of our members, Life & Specialty Ventures and its family of companies is always ready.


We are a profitable and growing organization that offers many of the industry’s best individual and group life, dental and disability insurance products. We’re also an organization that’s committed to providing each employee with the chance to make his or her own meaningful difference. Our team is ambitious and passionate, and our work environment is relaxed and fun. Are you ready to join us?


We’re currently searching for a Web Designer II or Sr. Developer to join our dynamic team in Jacksonville, Florida or Little Rock, Arkansas.


The Web Designer II creates and designs user experiences using web technology. Works with Developers, Project Managers, Marketing, and other business units. Analyzes business requirements, creates wireframes and design mockups, receives and implements feedback, and codes the approved designs using HTML, CSS and JavaScript frameworks.


Web Designer II Essential Duties:

Creates user experiences using web technology.
Analyzes business requirements.
Creates wireframes and design mockups, receives and implements feedback.
Maintains existing websites and web applications.
Works on personal development. May perform other duties as assigned.

The Sr. Developer analyzes, designs, develops, implements, maintains and tests software applications as they relate to company systems. Makes recommendations of workable solutions to processing problems. Focuses on timely and cost effective methods for achieving deliverables. Conducts detailed analysis of defined system specifications and makes recommendations for workable solutions. Works on small to mid tier projects that have system-wide impact. Requires skill in multiple technical environments and an increased level of business knowledge. Additional responsibilities include documenting product functionality, supporting QA and deployment activities, troubleshooting production defects.


Sr. Developer Essential Duties:

Provides support in a timely manner for existing applications including analyzing data or system errors, answering user questions and running production applications or reports.
Develops and tests new applications.
Coordinates with various departments on systems development, support and testing.
Reviews business requirements.
Designs application architecture.
Works on personal development. May perform other duties as assigned.
Required Skills
Web Designer II:


Expert HTML5 and CSS3. Expert JavaScript UI framework experience (Bootstrap minimum). Experience in creating responsive, cross-browser compatible, HTML layouts. Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop minimum). Design and mockup tools (Balsamiq, Blend, etc.). Experience in creating Wireframes, Design Compositions, and other design documentation. Ability to analyze and interpret Web Analytics, Heat Maps, and Usability Test feedback. Experience with Content Management Systems and web publishing. Experience managing or contributing to Corporate Intranets and Public Websites. Experience with content workflows and web publishing. Demonstrated understanding of user experience design for work applications (versus marketing). Excellent communication skills.


Sr. Developer:


Ability to multi-task and work within time constraints. Critical thinking and problem solving skills. Ability to write effective technical specifications. Advanced programming skills in VB.Net, C#, Java, Javascript, C or Perl. Advanced experience with performing SQL queries in Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, DB2, or other industry leading database engines. Advanced skills in developing platform independent object oriented and client server applications. Advanced skills in reporting design and structure with one or more industry tools; i.e. Microsoft Reporting Services, Crystal Reports, or Business Objects. Advanced skills in developing standards-based inter-application communication using SOAP or other XML-based web services technologies. Experience developing, managing, and deploying web-based applications using HTML, JavaScript, AJAX, Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) and other web technologies. Ability to use at least two of the following operating system platforms: Windows, Linux, Unix, and Mac OS X. Experience using full-term software development lifecycle, including the use of a revision control system like Microsoft Visual SourceSafe or Subversion. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills including the ability to address a wide range of audiences.


Required Experience
Web Designer II:


Basic Required:

Bachelor's degree in Art / Design, Computer Science, or Information Systems
3+ years related experience
Or equivalent military experience

Preferred:

A Digital Arts degree
Experience in the Life, Dental, Disability, or Health Insurance industry

Sr. Developer:


Basic Required:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Information Systems
5+ years IT experience required
Or equivalent military experience

Preferred:

Master's Degree; Microsoft Professional Certification or Project Management (PMP) Certification
5+ years of programming/systems analysis experience. IT related experience in the Health Insurance industry

The Opportunity


As an experienced Software Engineer you’ll develop big data applications, web applications and cloud services for new products in our cutting edge Clearsense data ecosystem. job summary:
If you're looking for a career that's more than just a paycheck, then you're looking for Citizens Property Insurance Corporation.


We are seeking dedicated people who want to be part of Florida's future, helping Floridians protect their most important assets - their homes and businesses. We are Florida's property insurance provider of last resort, protecting many property owners statewide. With over 1,200 employees in Jacksonville, Tallahassee and Tampa, Florida - we offer opportunities with the personal satisfaction of public service - helping people and communities in a real and concrete way.


The qualified candidate will be responsible for developing and executing performance and/or load-based tests using automated approaches against new or modified applications and systems, primarily in a web-based environment. You will develop, implement, and champion strategies and approaches to increase test coverage. Working with a variety of groups across business units to improve, streamline, integrate, and communicate the performance test activities across project and release cycle efforts and actively participate in certifying the level of performance quality of Citizens’ applications prior to release.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Facilitate software performance requirements gathering meetings and estimate efforts based on empirical experience and proven methods.
Create and maintain system load profiles (workload characterizations), including mathematical models used to predict system performance under stress.
Develop and execute performance test suites for projects and regular release cycles.
Collect and communicate test results and metrics from other IT system groups.
Identify, communicate and track issues to closure working in close collaboration with cross-functional development team including managers, analysts, and developers.
Write, review, and present performance test reports covering the results of testing activities.
Establish and champion Performance QA standards, procedures, and processes.
Coordinate load test environment change and configuration management.
Install, configure, and upgrade relevant performance test tools including load generators and monitoring software packages.
Aid in the promotion of the latest industry trends and develop roadmaps for Performance Testing Services.
Present performance testing reports to management.
May coach, counsel or train less-experienced staff, may also direct the work of others, may provide input in the performance management, goal setting and review processes

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Proven interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills, including technical documentation skills.
Ability to lead teams, manage multiple tasks, work in a collaborative team environment; be responsive to project and customer needs, and work under tight deadlines.
Ability to work well within a cross-functional development team and build relationships with developers, testers, and release managers in order to collaborate and deliver working, valuable software.
Advanced knowledge of performance testing best practices and methodologies.
Advanced knowledge of the software QA process including the ability to create traditional testing artifacts including test plans and test scripts.
Understanding of JVM Tuning, Garbage collection, analyzing thread dumps, heap dumps
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts and ideas in a simple and understandable business language.
Capable of learning new tools and programming languages with little formal training.
Ability to administer the LoadRunner software and ability write and support performance test scripts using LoadRunner or similar tool.
Ability to use performance analysis tools on client, middleware, and backend application components.
Strong knowledge of the software development lifecycle and of varying software development methodologies and how the tester role and testing processes work within each.
Strong knowledge of database concepts including SQL programming skills.
Understanding of Real User Management, Service Level Management and Operational Level Agreements concepts.
Ability to generate system performance math models.

REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/ Information Technology or related field OR 4 years of relevant experience.
6 or more years of experience working in Quality Assurance testing, either manual, automated or performance based, in an enterprise-level web-based environment.
6 or more years of relevant experience working with enterprise systems development including experience programming in languages such as C, JAVA, VBScript, Perl; including four or more years of experience in performance testing using HP LoadRunner or similar tool
Experience with application and system monitoring solutions, such as Wily Introscope, Windows PerfMon, SQL Server Profiler or similar tools.
Experience with web-based JAVA applications with large scale relational databases using DB2/SQL Server.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience as a designated lead and/or Project Manager for a software testing effort.
Experience in Agile and Lean development methodologies including Scrum, XP, and Kanban.
Experience or certification in COBIT or ITIL or similar standards.
Knowledge of Java and related technologies: J2EE, Spring, JavaScript and/or Web services, SOAP, SOA concepts.
Knowledge of web 2.0 technologies (e.g. AJAX) with a preference given towards Ext JS, Ext GWT.
Exposure to virtualization especially VMWare.
Knowledge of Property & Casualty insurance industry.
Experience testing web applications for the insurance industry.

Citizens offers a competitive annual salary commensurate with experience, and an excellent benefits package including retirement savings with an 8% company match, medical, dental, group life, long and short term disability and professional development opportunities.


Citizens is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer


Relocation Assistance is available for this position.

About Citi
Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.

Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.
Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent
10+ years industry experience.
Experience in managing global infrastructure.
Ability to architect and implement solutions which maximize system availability
Working experience in Corporate Banking / Financial services.

job summary:
The Software Engineer provides technical expertise in the design, development, and support of complex EDI integrations for freight-forwarding applications that service air, ocean, customs brokerage, and logistics.

Essential Job Functions


Leverages extensive knowledge of EDI standards (ANSI X12, EDIFACT) to develop and support complex integration projects.
Works with Technology Manager and developers to provide expert development of EDI projects, executing development against project plans, supporting user acceptance testing and bug fixing.
Provides timely EDI support for internal customers and stakeholders, swiftly reviewing support requests and providing expert recommendations on how to resolve EDI issues.
Strong written, verbal and interpersonal skills. Able to work well as part of a team, and also take ownership of, and work independently to solve problems and complete projects on time.
Follows policies & procedures, best practices, and code reviews for the software development team.
Edits and debugs existing implementations.
Protects operations by keeping information confidential.
Provides information by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing development and service issues.

Other Skills & Abilities


Strong proficiency in IBM B2B Sterling Integrator, and experience in HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, SFTP, SMTP, AS2, AS3, VAN, and web services.
Strong proficiency in Java, SQL/PLSQL, MSSQL, and stored procedures.
Strong proficiency in inbound and outbound interfaces for various transaction sets, including 814, 867, 650, 810, 824, 837, 835, 820, 830, 850, 856, 860, 861, 862, 834, 999, 900, 940, 945, 990, 997, 204, 210, 214, 310, 315, 270/271 and 276/277.
Strong proficiency in Software Design, Software Documentation, and Software Testing.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook, etc.)
Additional proven experience/knowledge and ability with Software Development Fundamentals, Software Development Process, Software Requirements, Software Architecture.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with written, verbal, and communication skills
Must be able to work in team environment
Must be highly motivated and energetic with a proven ability to work in a fast paced and continually changing environment.

Education & Experience


Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, or related field, or equivalent experience.
2+ years IT experience in EDI implementations.
3+ years development and mapping with Sterling B2B Integrator.
Specific experience in freight-forwarding a plus.

Certifications & Licenses


Professional certification may be required in some areas.

Physical Requirements


Talking, hearing and using hands to operate computer equipment
Vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus
Job may require extended sitting or standing, use of standard office equipment.

job summary:
R1Soft powered by Continuum is looking for a software engineer with strong customer focus to provide support of our cloud based backup and disaster recovery solutions. The ideal candidate will provide a mix of maintenance and support while also contributing to new feature development of our backup and disaster recovery product solutions. We are looking for a well rounded, full stack developer with a curious mind who enjoys contributing in a smaller start-up environment.


Responsibilities:
Be an expert on your piece of the product.
Research and recommend implementation approaches for your area.
Work either individually or as part of a team to implement high quality features on time, following best practice for designing, developing, testing, and debugging.
Produce documentation and present your work as appropriate in design reviews or tech talks.
Be a part of a Scrum team and contribute to all team Scrum ceremonies.
Collaborate effectively with remote colleagues.

Qualifications:
3+ years of experience developing java applications
Experience in web based UI technologies and frameworks
Experience in Java, C++, and C#
Experience in writing/integrating with REST and SOAP APIs.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline
Experience working with embedded relational databases, HQL, H2, Derby, and/or SQLite
Experience in troubleshooting/debugging
Experience working with technical support and customers.

Preferred:

• Experience developing cloud based solutions with continuous integration and continuous delivery..

• Experience with NoSQL technologies.


About Continuum


Continuum is the only channel-exclusive IT management platform company that allows its Managed Services Provider (MSP) partners to maintain both on premise and cloud-based servers, desktops, mobile devices and other endpoints for their small-and-medium-sized business clients. Continuum’s SaaS platform enables MSPs to efficiently backup, monitor, troubleshoot and maintain clients’ IT infrastructure from a single pane of glass, all backed by an industry–leading Network Operations Center (NOC) and Help Desk. The company employs more than 1,300 professionals worldwide, monitors 1 million endpoints for its 5,800 partners including MSPs servicing more than 55,000 SMB customers and web hosting providers protecting nearly 250,000 servers worldwide with Continuum’s R1Soft product line. The company established the Continuum Veterans Foundation, a nonprofit organization providing financial support to charities focused on helping veterans find jobs in IT. For more information, visit https://www.continuum.net/ or https://www.r1soft.com/ and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter @FollowContinuum


Equal Opportunity Employer


Continuum Managed Services, LLC is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.


About R1Soft


R1Soft is recognized as the leading commercial backup software for Web hosting providers. Known as the fastest, most scalable, yet affordable Continuous Data Protection™ software for both Windows ® and Linux ® platforms in private and public clouds, R1Soft’s Server Backup Manager (SBM) is deployed by nearly 1,800 Web hosting providers and protects nearly 250,000 servers worldwide. For more information, visit: http://www.r1soft.com/ or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter @R1Soft .

Job Description

JPMorgan Chase & Co

. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.6 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at

www.jpmorganchase.com

Risk and Finance Technology (RFT) builds and supports the firm's financial infrastructure to ensure Finance professionals have access to the tools and information necessary to deliver drive success. In partnership with Global Finance Operations, Corporate Systems Infrastructure (CSi), and others, we deliver solutions that meet the requirements of our key clients. RFT provides technology support for general ledger, profitability, cost allocations, treasury, accounts payable, reference data, project accounting and fixed assets, and reporting tools and the Risk applications.

As a Senior Application Developer, you will participate on project teams, doing application analysis, development and modification and provide design recommendations for developing and integrating programs per written specifications. You will follow Application Engineering guidelines, processes and procedures and champion the use of these within teams, looking for ways in which to continuously improve them by researching emerging IT products, services, processes and methodologies. Additionally, you ensure appropriate business measures are defined in partnership with the business, and in conjunction with the Service Delivery team. Part of your role includes utilizing multiple programming languages and software technologies to ensure that applications are fit for purpose and are maintainable going forward and you may be required to undertake some database development work. You will also contribute to the development of information models, such as entity relationship diagrams and objects and make complex modifications to existing software applications and modules in accordance with high level specifications, application support, and industry standards.

Your responsibilities include analyses of service level issues and suggested enhancements which have been escalated by the Service Delivery Team, in order to diagnose and address underlying system problems and inefficiencies, assess and recommend for buy versus build decisions. This may result in a decision to purchase, develop in-house or go with a third party vendor. The outcome needs to ensure optimal value for the business in terms of the total cost of ownership for the system. You will also have the opportunity to test and implement cross-business applications as well as participate in technical design and engage with third party suppliers on support issues.

A Senior Application Developer maintains working relationships across all businesses, across RFT, and between technology team members by promoting teamwork. You will manage the day to day workload of junior team members, monitoring project milestones and critical dates to identify potential jeopardy of project schedule and identify / mitigate risk as well as develop, train, and coach junior team members, including providing on-the-job training.

Qualifications

College degree, specialized training, or equivalent work experience

At least 5+ years of programming/application development work experience

Requires experience or understanding of multiple programming languages, systems, as well as systems design and project management methodologies

Comprehensive expertise in the software development process

Previous supervisory experience is also beneficial

job summary:
Where Creating the Best Hope for a Healthier Future Begins...


Provides technical skills required to translate system analysis type definitions to reports, charts, and diagrams, from which programmers can efficiently perform their tasks. Responsible for grasping overall concepts and objectives of the entire system study and programming projects.


Please note that this a grant funded position.


Additional Summary Specific to Job

Responsible for performing database and application design and programming to support the needs of the departmental component and its various projects.

1. Learns and understands the structure and data of existing databases in order to communicate with clients/users and departmental personnel.

2. Investigates, understands, and documents database models, including the creation of entity relationship (ER) diagrams, data dictionaries, and other documentation for both technical and non-technical audiences.

3. Interviews clients/users and departmental personnel to determine data needs and develops / executes queries to meet those needs.

4. Communicates query results to departmental personnel and seeks opportunities to improve mutual understanding of the data.

5. Develops, documents, and utilizes detailed data management SOPs.

6. Learns and understands existing departmental applications from end to end.

7. Interviews clients/users and departmental personnel for problem definition to ensure programs are written and updated to meet the user's needs or changes are made to resolve any existing problems.

8. Develops program specifications for programming modules, ensures that specifications provided are thorough and detailed in order to avoid problems in coding development, programs to meet specifications, performs testing, develops documentation to ensure conformity and consistency with system and department standards, and ensures that documents are approved by supervisors and clients/users.

9. Writes, tests, implements, and updates existing computer programs. Codes straight-forward to moderately complex as well as complex programs and ensures that the programs conform to departmental standards.

10. Thoroughly and adequately tests all functions of the program prior to submitting it to the lead analyst or supervisor for quality review and verification.

11. Prepares the proper paperwork and follows correct procedures (SOPs) for implementing new programs or changes in production.

12. Assists with acceptance testing of purchased software and/or upgrades to existing system software to ensure user/client needs are met, and is responsible for maintenance of completed/existing programs and systems.

13. Participates in structured technical and functional walk-thrus with project team members and reports status of programming to supervisors on a regular basis to ensure a full understanding of the project and the status of completion.

14. Resolves problems that arise with existing production systems to ensure efficient and proper functioning of programs and systems.

15. Consults with resource materials as needed.

16. Other duties as assigned.


Organizational Requirements

Programmer Analyst II


Minimum Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related field or relevant experience in lieu of education.


Minimum Experience: Two years of relational database and web application programming experience.


Depending on skill and education, this position may be filled at either level:


Programmer Analyst III


Minimum Education: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field, or relevant experience in lieu of education.


Minimum Experience: Three and a half years of relational database and web application programming experience.


Departmental Requirements/Preferences

Knowledge of computer hardware and software, and experience/skills in database and application design and programming, including:

Strong understanding of relational database concepts, preferably Microsoft SQL Server.

Detailed knowledge of moderate to complex query design and report creation.

Experience providing analysis of data to clients/users and departmental personnel.

Knowledge of maintaining web pages using HTML, CSS, and/or other languages.

Prefer experience with extract, transform, and load (ETL) processes.

Prefer significant experience with Java programming, including database access.

Prefer significant experience designing, writing, and maintaining web applications using Java technologies.

Prefer experience with integration testing of web applications, preferably utilizing automation tools such as PhantomJS and Selenium or similar.

Job Description:
J.P. Morgan Chase is a leading global financial services firm. The firm is a leader in investment banking; financial services for consumers and businesses, transaction processing, asset and wealth management, and private equity. Under the JPMC brand, the firm services millions of customers in the United States and abroad. This includes many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients.

About J.P. Morgan Corporate & Investment Bank

J.P. Morgan's Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services. The world's most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. With $18 trillion of assets under custody and $393 billion in deposits, the Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.

JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets over $2 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers, small business and commercial banking, financial transaction processing, asset management, and private equity.

Client Intelligence is a platform that provides analytics on clients, deals, bankers, products, and profitability measures at the detail and aggregated level across key business metrics and dimensions. It contains a service-oriented, secure and scalable information platform; it is a system of record for the integrated, cleansed and enriched information and a suite of CRM tools.

We’re looking for a Senior Java Developer to join a fast-paced, high-energy diversified team.

Responsibilities:

Develop high-profile applications through Object-Oriented design using Java & J2EE technologies.
Ensure adherence to architecture standards, risk management and security policies
Identify efficiencies and ways to improve design and development processes
Review business requirements/functional specifications requirements and provide oversight and guidance on proposed technology solutions
Establish and maintain a strong working relationship with all businesses across Technology and among technology team members.
Communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical individuals at all levels
Work effectively within collaborative team to identify and resolve issues
Design, analyze, develop, code, test, debug and document in solving business problems for one or more business areas

Qualifications

Qualifications:

6+ years of experience in information technology with an emphasis on application development, demonstrated experience with applications development throughout the entire development lifecycle
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Ability to work on multiple projects and manage many priorities
Strong written and verbal communication as well as strong interpersonal skills
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Ability to absorb problems & present creative solutions within required timeframes
Must be able to demonstrate significant relevant work experience, or had experience of several major technology implementation projects
Demonstrated experience working with, and across, multiple teams in a global organization
Be self-driven, ability to work independently or with multiple teams

Essential Technology Skills:
1. Java/J2EE, JMS based messaging, Multi-threaded programming, JavaScript, JSP, AJAX, CSS, Flex, HTML5, AngularJS, and Struts.

2. Spring framework, Hibernate framework, MVC Framework

3. XML, Web Services (Spring REST)

4. Strong in Oracle PL/SQL development and designing data model.

5. Apache, Tomcat, Maven

6. SQL performance tuning, web application performance analysis and tuning, analyzing performance metrics

7. Debugging skills – Java, web application and SQL debugging

8. Defensive Programming e.g. prevention of cross-script attack, sql injection, path manipulation.

9. Source Code Management (Subversion/GIT)

10. Defect Management (JIRA or equivalent)

Essential Professional Skills:
1. Aptitude to learn business knowledge and new technologies.

2. Organization skills, be able to prioritize task base on priority level.

3. Clear verbal and written communication.

4. Be able to adjust quickly to changes.

5. Ability to multitask and quickly respond to critical issues and changes in requirements

6. Adopt best practices in day to day work to improve efficiency.

7. Be able to partner with people from other teams to get work done together

Nice to have Skills but not required:
1. Experience with Cloud Technologies

2. Experience with distributed real-time computation technology – Storm/Spark.

3. UNIX scripting knowledge.

job summary:
We're looking for an experienced Java developer to help design, architect and develop innovative new features for the IrisPR platform. The ideal candidate has experience with Java apps and a great attitude.


IrisPR is a Phoenix-based tech start-up with an experienced leadership team and exceptional product. We have a positive brand reputation in the PR industry, and have our sights set on becoming the industry leader.


We are looking for a Java Developer with a deep sense of product ownership and is comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment. Still interested? Great! Here’s what we’re looking for.


You will:

Write clean, well-designed, reusable Spring based REST services with Java.
Write code that scales and is easily maintainable by other developers.
Lead effort to optimize for performance and remove bottlenecks.
Architect systems to anticipate future scale and complexity while still enabling rapid experimentation and delivery of new features and products.
Create testing processes that ensure code quality as development progresses.
Help build the team and mentor junior developers.
Our Ideal Candidate Has:

5+ years of experience building Java applications based on Spring, JPA, Hibernate, with familiarity in Spring Boot, AWS deployment.
3+ years of professional software engineering experience in web technologies, web services and REST.
Experience working with Oauth is a plus.
A degree in Computer Science or STEM field, or related work experience working with data structures and algorithms.
Experience working with SQL databases like MySQL or PostgreSQL.
Experience working within noSQL databases like MongoDB or Cassandra and mastery in merging disparate data forms is a plus.
Experience working within a SCRUM or Agile team, where you practiced TDD.
Experience integrating other API's or systems together. Familiarity with SOA.
High degree of competency working in a Unix environment.
Experience working at a startup with a focus on delivering scalable products.
Ability to formulate articulate opinions on product design and engineering issues with a focus in finding the most effective solution.
A deep sense of product ownership.
Recent management or leadership experience.
To apply, please send resume, LinkedIn profile, and anything else that tells us what we should know about you to jobs@myirispr.com.

You won’t just shape the world of software.
You’ll shape the world of life, work and play.

Our Software Engineers not only understand how technology works, but how that technology intersects with the people who count on it every day. Today, innovative ideas, insight and new perspectives are at the core of how we create a more powerful, personal and fulfilling experience for all our customers. So if you’re interested in a career creating breakthrough software and making an impact on an audience of millions, look no further.

American Express is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative payment products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team!

Choice Hotels International is a cutting edge software development company that develops software to manage, reserve and book hotel rooms in its portfolio of 11 branded hotels. Choice provides innovative enterprise SOA solutions based on Open Source and AWS technologies. Choice is a tightknit team where you can enhance your skills in an environment that emphasizes creativity, sharing, teamwork, professionalism, and outstanding quality software. You will work alongside some of the most talented and dynamic professionals as they work to provide exceptional solutions to the many challenges our business and franchises face. If you are bright, driven, enjoy working with the latest technologies and have the right blend of business acumen, technically savvy and customer-facing skills then this opportunity is for you. If you are willing to work hard, looking for a place to learn and grow, and have the skills we would like to hear from you.


The cool stuff you do:

Writes correct and clean code with guidance; consistently follows stated best practices and Choice SDP and guidelines.
Participates in technical design of features with guidance.
Rarely makes the same mistake twice, begins to focus on attaining expertise in one or more areas (eg, AngularJS/Java/Oracle/Cassandra) development, performance best practices, efficient use of data stores, messaging, etc)..
Learns quickly and makes steady progress without the need for constant significant feedback from more senior engineers.
Internal or external certifications in one Choice core standardized technologies.
Makes steady progress on tasks; knows when to ask for help in order to get themselves unblocked.

Self-sufficient in at least one large area of the codebase (multiple services in a pillar, all frontend code related to a main funnel flow) with a high-level understanding of other components.
Capable of providing on-call support for their area including systems that they are not familiar with.
Can be called upon to give technical interviews to new possible candidates.

Your education and experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, or related field, from a four-year college or university, or one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Can have up to 1 to 3 years relevant experience in software development, information systems, or equivalent technical environment, including previous experience in the development of highly transactional, mission critical applications in heterogeneous environments/architectures for multi-user systems.

Front End Technologies (1 to 3 years).

Job Description:
Client is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. job summary:
Albertsons-Safeway Company is one of the largest food and drug retailers with 2,300+ stores. The Albertsons-Safeway family of brands includes some of the most prominent brands in food retailing, with a growing base of loyal shoppers. Thanks to the professionalism, diversity, spirit and friendliness of our people, we have locations across the U.S.


The Information Technology Department has an opening for a Programmer/Analyst. This position is located in Phoenix, Arizona.


Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

• Determines and implements the most efficient and cost effective solution.

• Act as a liaison between clients and application area.

• Lead troubleshooting and root cause determination and proactively identify opportunities to fix issues.

• Must be able to make sound decisions based on incomplete information, under pressure and maintain project focus.

• Developing strong working relationships at levels in the business and IT community to ensure overall project satisfaction.

• Provide application design guidance and consultation, utilizing a thorough understanding of applicable technology, tools and existing designs.

• Analyze highly complex business requirements.

• Design and create technical specifications to design or redesign complex computer platforms and applications.

• Analyze problems outlined by Business Systems Analysts in terms of detailed technology requirements and capabilities.

• Ensure logic and design is in alignment with core architecture of the system/application.

• Analyze existing product software and recommends modifications which will enhance operating capacity and meet

business requirements.

• Verify program logic by overseeing the preparation of test data, testing and debugging of programs.

• Oversee overall systems testing and the migration of platforms and applications to production.

• Guide new documentation, departmental technical procedures and user guides.

• Develop positive and sustainable partnerships with business stakeholders, Enterprise Architecture, and other partners across the enterprise to create strategic roadmaps and detailed project plans for business and IT driven initiatives.

• Support, maintain, enhance existing applications

• Deliver full development lifecycle for new applications

• Investigate and resolve application issues encountered in live production

• Create and maintain application documents, especially for newly acquired applications


Qualifications:

• 4 year degree (Computer Science, Information Systems) and/or equivalent combination of education or work experience.

• 5+ years of programming experience including experience integrating applications across diverse technical platforms.

• 5+ years of VB6 experience and strong VBA programming experience (Access/Excel)

• 3+ years relevant work experience in a C-based programming environment

• Proficient with coding and analysis in C#, VB.net, and PL/SQL

• Experience in Java design and programming, a huge plus

• Strong experience with database technologies (Oracle, DB2, SQL Server).

• Strong experience with the full software development lifecycle and software development methodologies (Waterfall, Agile).

• Excellent organizational and troubleshooting skills with attention to detail.

• Strong knowledge of programming documentation processes/procedures.

• Strong ability to understand client expectations and to resolve issues that may affect delivery.

• Ability to build constructive relationships with senior application architects and project managers and gain their trust.

• Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively in a matrixed organization.

• Strong ability to mentor, coach and train lower level programmer analysts.

• Self-starter, with a demonstrated ability to learn beyond formal training with a strong aptitude for delivering quality products.

• Excellent communications skills (written and oral), customer service and problem solving skills.

• Ability to contribute to making critical and successful decisions under pressure.

• Must possess superior problem solving skills, be action-oriented and decisive.

• Excellent organizational change management skills and the ability to balance competing priorities in meeting business deadlines.

• Excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal communications skills.

• Ability to effectively articulate and present complex concepts, ideas and strategies to business end-users

• Extensive creativity, drive, high energy level, and the ability to self-manage.

• Adeptness with asynchronous programming, a plus.

• Background in Microsoft Silverlight, a plus

• Self-sufficient, and willing to learn other programming languages/ platforms

• Excellent oral and written English communication skills.


How to Apply: Interested candidates are encouraged to submit a resume by visiting careersatsafeway.com

two decades, Asurion has led the technology protection industry around the

providers enabling them to focus on their businesses and to provide services
that delight their customers. Asurion's 14,000+ employees worldwide specialize
in fulfilling the needs of more than 280 million consumers.

value open source technologies, solve challenging and unique problems, and

impact.

you enjoy testing code and giving software a good beating before it’s released

numerical and graphical data.

about how to break software by finding bugs, and apply this knowledge with

1 - 2 years combined experience

environment.
Excellent analytical,

objectively participate in team discussions.

job summary:
Full-Time Adobe (AEM/CQ) Developer
Brentwood Corporate Office-111 Westwood Pl. Brentwood, TN 37027
Job#: WDCObrtTN066249c

Robots need not apply.
We"re looking for a free-thinking web developer!! You"ll be part of a small, nimble team that"s building a consumer facing site for the largest senior living solutions company in the nation. You"ll get a competitive salary package, work/life balance and the chance to grow. We work hard but also play hard and hope you will join in the fun. Our team isn"t afraid to push boundaries, as long as the focus on developing a stellar user experience. You"ll take ownership of the development servers and the code. We"re not into giving orders and hand holding. You"ll get your hands on the wheel and do a fair share of the driving.

We are a very small team. You will be responsible for developing components in AEM (we will train on AEM) and doing a lot of the back-end heavy lifting. Being a small team you will also be over the maintenance of our dev environment in AWS and managing/submitting tickets to our staging and prod servers who are managed by Adobe.
Not only will you be developing but you will be helping to create our sprint schedule, stories, etc
We need someone that will add value, is more free thinking and is comfortable working with less structure.
We will need you to have 2-3 years of Java development experience under your belt.

Brookdale. Bringing new life to senior living.

Required skills and qualifications:

Minimum of 2 years of experience in Java development
Focus on usability, with the skills to steer both front-end and back-end design
Must be able to think outside of the box to offer input and suggestions
