Brookdale is the largest senior living solutions company in the nation, with 1,150 communities and more than 82,000 employees. That translates into tremendous advancement opportunity and high job security. We offer a number of benefits include a sign-on bonus, paid time off, retirement plans, disability, medical, dental, vision and life insurance.

If you"re a Brookdale associate, please consider referring someone though the Good People Program!

Brookdale is an EOE-(Equal Opportunity Employer) and drug-free workplace.

Brookdale offers a number of benefits to full-time associates including, but not limited to: medical, dental, vision, disability, life, paid time off, educational reimbursement. All associates, age 21 and older, are eligible to participate in the 401(k) retirement savings plan.

job summary:
CTS is looking for experienced Java developers who have a passion for solving problems. At CTS, you get to do more than just sling code, you get to build solutions as a full time consultant with a company who cares about your career. We provide a clearly defined path to help you advance, and you can keep your skills in check with training in the latest technologies and company-paid certifications. CTS serves local clients in Nashville, which means you won’t be a road warrior. You’ll work with a local team of smart, dedicated people like yourself, and we’ll plan monthly team events so you can have fun, too. Tired of the same old thing? Take your talents to a company that inspires personal and professional growth and values your ideas.

Collaborate with team members to find better, more efficient ways of doing things
Solve challenging business and technical problems

Learn from your peers and from our years of experience through training classes, engineering reviews, and our mentor program
Grow in your career, and enhance your technical abilities.

What you’ll need:

The most important thing you will need is a passion for learning new things and solving new problems, because that’s what we do! As a consultant, you will also need strong written and verbal communications skills to work with your team and with our clients. You’ll also need a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS or directly related field and at least 4 years of experience with full life cycle web application development using Java/J2EE and relational databases. Experience in .NET development is also preferred. Any experience with Hadoop, Ruby on Rails, or Salesforce would be a plus!

The Applications Developer is responsible for the development, implementation, and maintenance of Universal Lighting’s applications supporting the corporate business system. This position works as a part of ULT’s technical team and interfaces directly with all application users to define program requirements. Consults with users to gather information about program needs, objectives, functions, features, and input and output requirements

Writes and maintains program development, coding, testing, changes, corrections, installation and operating procedures


Provides technical assistance by responding to inquiries from others regarding errors, issues, or questions about programs


Trains end users or technical support staff to use programs

• 2-3 years of experience preferred


• Fluency with Oracle Application Express (APEX) preferred


• Fluency with SQL, PL/SQL and Java preferred


• Working knowledge of Oracle Applications, Oracle EBS preferred


• Strong analytical skills required

• Communications


• Technical/Professional Knowledge and Skills


• Planning and Organizing


• Managing work (includes time management)

• Initiating Action

Job title: Software Engineering Lead (Senior Manager)- Deloitte Global
education level/skills required / respon: Experience with C#/.NET, Java or other software development language. Deloitte leads with purpose, solving complex issues for our clients and communities....
job summary:
Deloitte leads with purpose, solving complex issues for our clients and communities. Across disciplines and across borders, Deloitte Global supports our network of member firms by developing and driving global strategy, programs, and platforms, and creating new solutions and transformational experiences. Our people share a passion for igniting change and a strong service orientation that shapes our organization and those it supports.


We are looking for someone experienced in architecting and building custom software solutions with strong focus on reliability (e.g. performance, availability, scalability). Unlike anywhere else in the industry, we are creating roles and teams that combine deep software development knowledge with expertise in developing solutions that are highly performance and highly available to drive unmatched service reliability.


Our mission is to deliver services that matter and achieve and sustain speed & reliability. You will be at the heart of fulfilling our mission by bringing your architecture and software development experience to the table to own and lead the vision and implementation of engineering reliability end to end. You will drive continuous improvement of the management, design, and operations to achieve speed and reliability to enable business agility and happy users.


You will be part of our technology organization and have a great opportunity to work across various parts of Deloitte, including our development teams, project management office, and other stakeholders to drive reliability upstream in the application lifecycle and across our operational environments.


In addition to leadership and management experience, technical expertise is critical in order to imagine and drive technical improvements across our database, networking, and infrastructure teams, and to partner with our application teams, implementing more robust and performant applications for our internal solutions and business solutions (Tax, Audit, Consulting, Finance and Advisory Services).


You should be someone that brings new thinking and is excited with the challenge of eliminating failures and improving mean time to recovery to milliseconds instead of minutes or hours. We want someone who relentlessly pursues excellence, is a deep and broad technical expert, and can build trusting relationships across teams.


Responsibilities:


Role Specific Responsibilities

Providing leadership, architecture, development, and project management expertise in making our systems fail rarely, and are fast to fix when they do fail.
Drive reliably systems engineering design and recovery by minimizing manual involvement and leading continuous improvements that create an operating environment that includes dynamically monitoring, alerting, and automated self-healing and recovering.
Drive recommendations for the design, development and delivery of applications to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of solutions.
Identify and/or analyze problems relating to mission critical services and manage the building of automation to prevent problem recurrence; with the goal of automating response to all non-exceptional service conditions.
Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning.
Oversee the incident management and drive root cause analysis initiatives to identify continuous improvements.
Drive Operational Testing and Performance Engineering to certify solutions and provide critical thinking & recommendations to meet availability and performance targets.
Improve our monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolution capabilities.
Create clear presentations and communication to stakeholders that highlight the impact of the issues and solutions to service disruptions. Communicate the state of reliability to prioritize technical debt & improvements on technology team roadmaps. Equally capable at presenting analyses and recommendations to leadership or discussing the technical merits of solutions with engineers and architects.
Lead, build, and grow a diverse team across geographies toward a common goal; partner with our application development and project management teams on coordinating investigations into customer facing service issues.
Own the day-to-day health, uptime, monitoring, and reliability of services and server infrastructure.
Lead, own, model and drive DevOps culture and behaviors.
Practice and enforce Agile and Scrum methodologies.

Education: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent


Years of Experience: 10-15


Qualifications

BS or higher degree in Computer Science/Engineering or related field
Strong experience architecting highly available and performant systems across databases, infrastructure, and application technologies
Experience with C#/.NET, Java or other software development language
Advanced understanding of .NET architecture (SharePoint is a plus), network programming (e.g. sockets) and protocols (e.g. TCP and UDP)
Firm sense of accountability, ownership for end-to-end project lifecycle with solid project management and communication skills.
Experience and knowledge of database technologies, particularly MS SQL
Strong knowledge of virtualization and its benefits for improving reliability
Experience problem solving issues on globally distributed systems and critical product service environments
Experience operating and supporting mission-critical applications (e.g. incident and outage management)
Extensive experience working across teams and operating in a DevOps culture; capable of influencing and leading others to exhibit DevOps behaviours, processes and approach
Capable of technical deep dives into infrastructure, databases, and applications as needed, yet cognitively agile enough to have strategy discussions with leadership
Knows what is possible using latest networking, infrastructure, database, and application technologies to driving automation and reliability improvements
Passionate for making things better and driving action
Brings new thinking to challenge existing technology and processes & drive change across the organization
Experience building, growing, and leading technical teams across geographies
Excellent at building relationships across teams and communicating for influence (written, verbal, and presentation)
Desire to understand our businesses and users
Experience with SharePoint is also preferred

job summary:
Senior Java Developers! Are you ready to take on creating, designing, and supporting software running on various platforms for a growing Fortune 500 retail company? Are you the go-to for gathering requirements and assisting in setting project scope? This position requires a strong knowledge of relational databases, Java development tools, Unix-like operating systems, mobile & portal technologies, and version control systems. If this sounds work you have done and want to do, apply now!

Tractor Supply Company (TSCO) is the largest operator of retail farm and ranch stores in the United States. We currently have more than 1,500 TSC stores in 49 states and an e-commerce website at TractorSupply.com. We are a growth company and research indicates we have an opportunity to grow to 2,500 domestic Tractor Supply store locations. It is very exciting to be a part of this $6.3 billion organization.

Information Systems Professionals who thrive on challenge and who earn their teammates' respect are discovering exciting new careers at Tractor Supply Company. Not only do we offer a bright future with a stable and growing company, Tractor Supply offers the opportunity to be part of an enthusiastic team that is growing professionally. With brand new offices for IT in Brentwood (Nashville) Tennessee, and new projects underway and planned, this is the time to check out Tractor Supply. As the largest operator of retail farm and ranch stores in the United States, we are dedicated to values that support the needs of those who live the life "out here".

Tractor Supply Company offers a very attractive compensation and benefits package including medical (day-1), dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurances, matched 401(k), discounted stock purchase opportunity, holiday pay, vacation, personal and sick days and more.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities

Meets with technical leads, architects and vendor partners to determine project scope and vision, set system goals, identify and resolve system issues, ensure the system is implemented as designed and in adherence to the implementation guidelines.

Partners with the business analysts to review and refine business requirements into core system capabilities.

Assists developers, analysts, and designers in conceptualizing and validating solutions that meet business requirements.

Prototypes new requirements for the purpose of enhancing technical functionalities and information process flow.

Develops and/or configures builds, reviews and unit test software/solutions. (30%)

Assists in QA efforts on tasks worked by providing input for test cases and supporting test case execution.

Works directly with the business users to provide support including the design and development of customer training materials, and conducting customer training sessions.

Mentors team members on new technologies in area of expertise.

Works with Enterprise teams to ensure changes are properly documented, communicated, audited, and deployed in compliance with established procedures.

Provides 24X7 rotational technical support to solve business problems and documents resolution. Education and Experience

College diploma or university degree in computer science or related field and/or 5-9 years equivalent work experience in a Software Development position (Java is preferred).

3+ years experience working within Unix/Linux.

3+ years experience with web service technologies (REST, JSON, SOAP, HTTP, SSL, XML/XSLT etc.) is preferred.

Retail experience is preferred.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities/Training/Systems

Strong technical and analytical ability in any programming language (Java is preferred).

Strong knowledge of relational databases (Oracle preferred).

Strong knowledge of portal technologies (Liferay and Oracle preferred).

Strong knowledge of Unix like operating systems (Linux preferred).

Strong knowledge of version control systems such as subversion and Git.

Strong knowledge of web and application servers such as JBoss, Tomcat and Apache httpd is preferred.

Strong knowledge of presentation layer technologies such as JSON, JavaScript, HTML, JSF, JQuery is preferred.

Strong familiarity with Continuous Integration concepts and tools is preferred.

Strong knowledge of the Agile software development methodology is preferred.

Strong knowledge of automated testing tools such as JMeter and Grinder is preferred.

Ability to work independently, work in a fast paced environment, and manage workload prioritization to deliver high quality work products on time with minimal direction.

Demonstrated collaboration skills with the ability to handle conflict and to work with a distributed team.

Good communication skills, both written and verbal.

Good critical thinking skills.

job summary:
Indiana Health Information Exchange's (IHIE) Solution Engineering team develops technologies that directly impact the quality, safety, and efficiency of healthcare. We are seeking a Java Developer with expertise in design, development, maintenance, and support of client-facing applications, including architecture, frameworks, security, and management. This position will focus on adding new capabilities for end users and support staff, addressing production issues, and migrating/modernizing components of the existing infrastructure. If you enjoy tackling new challenges where obstacles fuel your fire to find answers, then IHIE may be the place for you.
Summary: Works closely with the IHIE Developers, Product Owners, Support/Integration Teams, and partners to design, develop, document, test and debug technology solutions. This role will exercise strong analytical, troubleshooting, development, and testing skills across multiple data feeds, processes, and repositories.

Essential Functions:
Essential functions include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Designs, develops, documents, tests and debugs new and existing application code.
Proficient in Java development, Java frameworks (Spring, Struts, JSF, ZK, Grails, etc.), and Object Oriented Programming concepts, design patterns, and techniques.
Experienced with related application development technologies, such as HTML, XML, XSLT, SQL, JavaScript, security frameworks, testing frameworks, open source web servers such as Tomcat, and relational databases.
Skilled with using & administrating tools such as Eclipse, source control (branching, merging, versioning), Hudson/Jenkins, Maven, build automation, bash scripts, basic Linux commands, cron jobs, etc.
Capable of integrations with other systems through consuming or offering Web Services or APIs.
Experienced with modernizing applications though implementing frameworks, platforms, and processes that would improve the efficiency of building & maintaining functionality.
Serves as technical expert on development projects.
Participates in full development life cycle including requirements analysis and design.
Writes technical specifications based on conceptual design and stated business requirements.
Supports, maintains, and documents application functionality.
Analyzes code to find causes of errors and revises applications as needed.
Participates in application design meetings to understand user needs and determine technical requirements.
Consults with product owners to prototype, refine, test and debug applications to meet needs.
Participates working in agile/scrum environment.
Participates working in continuous integration environment.

Requirements:IHIE Attributes:
Adaptability and flexibility in a rapidly changing environment
Passion for innovation
Strong desire to address complicated business opportunities with technology
Entrepreneurial spirit – challenges the norm, brings fresh ideas to the table, finds creative solutions to problems
Ambitious and determined to move forward regardless of obstacles

Education:
BS in computer science or related field from an accredited university required

Skills and Experience:
Strong attention to detail
Ability to work in a cross-functional team
Ability to learn new and complicated technologies, techniques, tools, and business processes quickly
Experience handling demanding projects and juggling multiple priorities
Strong communication skills
Ability to research, understand, and take ownership of existing application code

Preferred:
Experience in healthcare helpful but not required
Experience and/or familiarity with the Agile and/or Scrum methodologies preferred

In exchange for your technical expertise and creative problem solving, we offer an excellent benefits package including medical/dental/vision, 401(k) matching, 20 days PTO your first year plus 9 company paid holidays, very casual work environment and dress code, and a dynamic, fun-loving company culture!
IHIE is the nation's largest and most advanced health information exchange helping to ensure health information is where it needs to be, when it needs to be there to improve care coordination and patient outcomes. IHIE was formed in 2004 and currently serves over 90 hospitals and processes more than 14 million clinical data transactions each month. Learn more at www.ihie.org.

The main purpose of the role is to provide maintenance and support for operating and managing the North America Customer and Contact Master Data Management Solution (MDM). The owner of this position works closely with the MDM IT Solution Owner in order to set priorities and execute solution support monitoring and tasks.


As IT Solution Support Engineer – NA Master Data Management , you will:

Create design specifications to support the solution
Code / Configure technical solutions to resolve system defects, system enhancements, system monitoring efforts
Create and execute test scripts in support of solution testing and deployment
Support the solution deployment process
Utilize system requirement specifications and system design documents to create technical solution

Responsible for maintaining and continuously improving the system and achieving quality objectives through daily actions
Who you are
You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.

job summary:
Software Engineer, Predictive Intelligence
Location: Indianapolis, IN
Department Description:
The Salesforce Marketing Cloud is a leading global provider of cross-channel digital marketing solutions that empower organizations of all sizes to communicate with their customers through email, mobile, social media, and web. We're driven by a deep understanding of marketers' needs-because we're marketers too. No other digital marketing company invests in product innovation the way we do, giving our clients access to truly cutting-edge technology. Joining forces with Salesforce, pioneers in cloud computing, we offer an even more superior experience to our customers and employees.
Role Description:
The Predictive Intelligence product development team is responsible for the design, development and operations of cutting-edge business solutions that use sophisticated algorithms and data science to analyze large volume of user behavior data (views, clicks, searches, purchases, abandonments, etc.), and predict the next best offer, content or product for each individual customer. Marketers use this actionable data to seamlessly deliver real-time personalized messages to their customers across channels.
We are looking for a full-stack software engineer to play a pivotal role in the development of new features to power our industry-leading suite of products. As a core member of this team, you will work closely with the functional counterparts in your organization to understand complex business requirements, and build cutting-edge solutions following the lean/agile development process.
Your Impact:
Design and Develop high-performance and impactful software to solve complex business problems
Deliver highly functional systems and tools to support the Data Science initiatives, such as: recommendations, personalization, predictive scoring, and analytics
Identify and improve the efficiency, scalability, operability, and security of systems. Participate in design and code reviews
Work closely with product management, design, quality assurance, and operations team to understand our customer needs, and effectively translate them to technical specifications
Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and concise way to non-technical counterparts
Adopt, embrace, and promote agile and test-driven software development practices
Minimal Required Skills:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or equivalent technical field. Master's degree preferred
5+ years of experience designing and developing large scale distributed platforms/systems/applications
Strong CS fundamentals, including proficiency in algorithms, data structures, and OOP
In-depth working knowledge of at least one object-oriented compiled language (e.g., C#, Java), and a scripting language (Ruby, Python, JavaScript, etc)
Solid understanding of RDBMS technologies and SQL
Experience with REST based APIs design (XML, JSON, etc.)
Excellent problem solving and debugging skills
Ability to work independently as well as in teams, in a fast-paced environment
Enthusiasm towards new technologies
Strong communication skills, both written and oral
Preferred Skills:
Experience as lead/architect on SaaS application/platforms
Experience with search related technologies (ElasticSearch, Lucene, Solr) highly desired
Experience with MongoDB, HBase or similar NoSQL software is a plus
Experience solving big data problems using Hadoop, Spark, and related technologies (Pig, Hive, Scoop, Storm, Scala, and etc.) highly desired
Experience with queuing solutions such as RabbitMQ, Kafka, SQS, etc
Good grasp of web technologies (HTTP, sessions, site performance, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” five years in a row and one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.
*LI-Y
*LI-CW1

job summary:
Position: AngularJS/JavaScript Web Developer

As a Web developer, you will build and maintain AngularJS-based Web sites and applications as part of a highly functional team of passionate development professionals.

What We Want You To Accomplish

Help guide our team of Senior-level developers as we make the transition from Flash-based technologies to HTML5.

Build out the catalog of HTML5-based sites and applications as needed by the business and team.

After the transition is complete, you’ll work with our high performing team as we move to the latest technologies and beyond. You help create a paradigm shift in the company as we utilize and maintain new technologies, to give our customers the best experience possible.

Core Activities Include

Assisting in the roll-out of the AngularJS version of our core, $80-million SaaS. This will include working with the technical lead to oversee and review code from an off-shore vendor.

Work with technical leads to refine our coding standards in regards to AngularJS, JavaScript and other HTML5 technologies. This may include leading or assisting technical leads in training the entire team in these standards.

Develop a plan to migrate existing and future AngularJS applications to Angular2.

Assist the rest of the team in resolving customer issues that arise as they work with our software.

Maintenance and creation of Cordova-based mobile applications. This could include creating short turnaround proofs of concept to meet business needs.

Core Requirements

Extensive experience developing and maintaining AngularJS sites.

Extensive experience integrating various JavaScript frameworks and libraries into AngularJS.

Ability to write JavaScript code by hand, including modifying existing libraries.

Experience with CSS and design frameworks, including tweaking CSS to specific browsers.

Experience with creating responsive designs. Bootstrap knowledge is a bonus.

Experience with version control systems and build tools such as Jenkins.

Some experience or knowledge of Java is a bonus.

Some experience or knowledge of Oracle or other relational databases is a bonus.

Basic knowledge of what is required to develop and deploy applications to various mobile storefronts.

Experience utilizing Amazon Web Services is a bonus.

job summary:
Indianapolis, IN

InfoReliance has an opportunity for a Senior Java Developer to support our United States Marine Corps customer in Indianapolis, IN. In this role you will be a part of a high-performing InfoReliance team dedicated to excellence in support of our customer in providing software development, systems engineering, and O&M; services for a myriad of highly complex, Government-designed and Government-owned enterprise business-critical systems relating to Financial Management, Human Resources Management, Integrated Pay and Personnel Management for the USMC, Navy, and across the DoD.
As a Senior Java Developer on the team, you will have the opportunity to conceptualize, design and develop new Java-based business applications, components, and interfaces as well as to enhance and provide maintenance for existing applications.
The following list covers client supported system technology stacks, including programming languages, database technology, and supporting software that you will have the opportunity to work with in this position.
Programming Languages & Database Technologies
Java (Spring, JSF, JMS, Struts, XML, SOAP, WebServices)
WebLogic
Oracle 11g
ActivePerl
PL/QL
Bash scripting
Python
TOAD
Supporting Software
Apache (Chainsaw, Maven)
Eclipse IDE for Java, EclipseLink JPA
JRockit JDK
SQL Developer
Subversion
TortoiseSVN
Hudson CI
SonarQube
QTP
In order to be successful in this role, we expect that you will have the following skills and experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related area preferred. Three years of relevant work experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.
Proven ability to deliver high-quality Java-based applications using Object Oriented design and development concepts
5+ years of applicable development experience
Consultative skills, including the ability to understand and apply customer requirements, including drawing out unforeseen implications and making recommendations for design, understanding potential impacts of design requirements, and the ability to make and defend logical decisions
Must be proactive and be a logical thinker.
Demonstrates the ability to multi-task and use technical & creative problem solving
Java SE/EE certifications are highly desireable.
Clearance Requirement: U.S. Citizenship, eligibility to obtain a DoD Secret clearance.
Thank you for taking the time to read about our opportunity and to consider InfoReliance for your career. We look forward to talking with you about this position.
Why InfoReliance
We invest in the pursuit of interesting and challenging work. We have built our success by seeking out and solving highly complex business problems, anticipating and delivering creative solutions to meet emerging needs, and providing our customers with optimal and sustainable business value. We set the bar high for ourselves as a business and for our employees.
We are looking for employees with ambition, who aspire to achieving big goals, who seek to make a positive and real impact on our clients’ success. We are seeking those with the knowledge, the curiosity, the insight, the engagement, the humility, and the determination to succeed. In return, we offer the opportunity to work with a group of similarly motivated individuals, who bring their unique backgrounds, achievements, work and life experience to bear on tough problems, creating an environment where great ideas are made and thrive. We support our employees with professional development opportunities, from the perspective of both training and the ability to gain hands on experience in new areas.

Most importantly, our leaders and employees understand what collaboration, dedication, and teamwork really means and demonstrates that knowledge through their actions every day. Bring your best – there is no limit to what you can achieve here.
Our Benefits

All benefits are effective Day 1 of your employment with InfoReliance. Our reputation is built upon the talents and integrity of our employees. We value the contributions of each and every person that is a part of our organization. We offer exciting, challenging career opportunities, competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package to include the following:
10 Paid Company Holidays Annually
18 days a year of Paid Time Off (PTO) Annually for new employees (accrued)
Comprehensive Medical and Dental Coverage
Tuition & Professional Certification Support
401(k) plan
Flexible work arrangements, where possible
Flexible Spending Accounts for Commuter Costs, Medical and Dependent Care
All employees are eligible for our performance-based bonus program recognizing our outstanding contributors.
About InfoReliance
InfoReliance Corporation is an Information Technology (IT) consulting company headquartered in Northern Virginia that creates and implements software, system and cloud solutions that transform the business operations of our clients.
Microsoft Federal Solution Partner of the Year 2014 & Microsoft Public Sector Services Partner of the Year 2013 & 6 Time Microsoft Partner Awardee. Microsoft Consulting Services and Cloud Services Partner. Office 365 Reseller
Amazon Web Services (AWS) Advanced Consulting Partner, AWS Reseller
McAfee Security Innovation Alliance Partner

InfoReliance does not discriminate in employment opportunities, terms and conditions of employment, or practices. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, gender, religious or political beliefs, national origin or heritage, disability, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any characteristic protected by law. InfoReliance is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor. We welcome and proactively pursue priority referrals of protected veterans
As an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer, InfoReliance is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. If you are an individual with a disability unable to use our online tools to search and or apply for jobs, please send an email to sara.mallory at inforeliance.com and indicate the specifics of the assistance needed, or contact Sara Mallory at 703-246-9360
This option is reserved only for individuals who are unable to use the online tools due to a disability or medical issue. It is not intended for other purposes or inquiries.
To view all current InfoReliance employment opportunities, please visit our careers website at http://www.inforeliance.com/careers/index.htm .

job summary:
Indiana Health Information Exchange's (IHIE) Solution Engineering team develops technologies that directly impact the quality, safety, and efficiency of healthcare. We are seeking a Database Developer with expertise in design, development, maintenance, and support of application databases, including ETL, integrations, stored procedures, and reports. This position will focus on supporting ingestion of incoming data, standardizing and normalizing storage, optimization of queries, creation of procedures, and manipulating transactional and bulk datasets in a variety of formats. If you enjoy tackling new challenges where obstacles fuel your fire to find answers, then IHIE may be the place for you.
Summary: Works closely with the IHIE Developers, Product Owners, Support/Integration Teams, and partners to design solutions for data processing, storage, and exchange. This role will exercise strong analytical, troubleshooting, development, and testing skills across multiple data feeds, processes, and repositories.

Essential Functions:
Essential functions include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Analysis and Design – Investigate requests and elicit detailed requirements, root cause definition, or workflow specifics. Produce technical implementation recommendations, plans, and designs, often by collaborating with teammates or stakeholders from other departments.
Database Development – Develop new solutions from scratch or modify existing code and databases through business logic updates, optimization, and re-engineering. Sophisticated n-tier engineering is often required, including a combination of scheduled jobs, stored procedures and functions, schema design, referential and data integrity management, data quality checks, exception handling, and reporting. Mainly within an Oracle environment, but with some PostgreSQL and MS SQL integrations.
ETL and Integrations – Standards-based and proprietary data exchange with both internal and external systems. Emphasis on configurable properties and reusable component-based solutions that allow solutions to benefit multiple consumers. Utilize industry-standard tools to manage ETL jobs and logic.
SDLC - Participate in scrum rituals like grooming, planning, and stand-up meetings to coordinate work efforts. Produce Unit Test results and support UAT efforts and needs, including creating or finding applicable test scenarios. Organize versioned source code and coordinate deployments across multiple environments.

Requirements:IHIE Attributes:
Leadership through collaboration and motivation
Adaptability and flexibility in a rapidly changing environment
Passion for innovation
Entrepreneurial spirit – challenges the norm, brings fresh ideas to the table, finds creative solutions to problems
Ambitious and determined to move forward regardless of obstacles

Education:
Bachelor's degree in computer science preferred or related experience

Experience:
4+ years experience with SQL and relational databases, specifically PL-SQL, Stored Procedures, and Oracle
4+ years experience with software analysis, troubleshooting, design, development, and testing
4+ years experience with data integrations, processing, and ETL

Skills/Characteristics:Required:
Strong analytical, diagnostic, and troubleshooting expertise
Proven success designing efficient, scalable, and maintainable data management solutions
Proficient at manipulating large bulk data imports/exports as well as transactional, real-time integrations
Fluency in SQL and query development tools, particularly Oracle PL-SQL and SQL Developer
Experience with ETL processes and tools
Experience with working across multiple application development or operations teams

Recommended:
Ability to read and interpret Java source code
Experience with PostgreSQL or Microsoft SQL Server databases
Experience with Scrum or Agile SDLC
Experience with the complexities of medical terminology and health data
Experience with common health data transport protocols, such as HL7 v2 and CCD

Preferred:
Experience in a HIPAA regulated environment helpful but not required

In exchange for your database development skills, we offer an excellent benefits package including medical/dental/vision, 401(k) matching, 20 days PTO your first year plus 9 company paid holidays, very casual work environment and dress code, and a dynamic, fun-loving company culture!
IHIE is the nation's largest and most advanced health information exchange helping to ensure health information is where it needs to be, when it needs to be there to improve care coordination and patient outcomes. IHIE was formed in 2004 and currently serves over 90 hospitals and processes more than 14 million clinical data transactions each month. Learn more at www.ihie.org .

Keywords: Developer, Database, Database Developer, Oracle, Solution Engineer, SQL, Scrum, Agile, Oracle Developer, Stored Procedures, PL/SQL, ETL, Reference Cursors, Explain Plan, Execution Plan

Location: Indianapolis, IN

Are you excited about the opportunity to influence the software industry by being involved with visionary technologies? Do you want to work on consumer facing, but enterprise grade services? If your answer is yes to any of these questions, this is your opportunity to join a dynamic Technology team at salesforce.com, the market leader in cloud computing. Independently designs and delivers code for features and products with a quality mindset.

These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” five years in a row and one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.

Job Title: Java Developer Requisition ID: 16003IQ Job Category: Applications Job Type: Regular Primary Location: USA-IN: INDIANA-INDIANAPOLIS Schedule: Full-time Remote Work Authorized: No Relocation Assistance: Not Available Travel: Yes, 5 % of the Time Clearance Level: Secret Employee Status: Regular Posting Date Aug 3, 2016 Description CSRA provides software engineering and migration services for the United States Marine Corps (USMC) Technology Services Organization (TSO). We partner with the TSO to deliver mission-critical and critical-to-customer applications in support of the active and reserve components of the Marine Corps and Navy, the Defense Finance and Accounting Service (DFAS), the Air Force Reserve, and the Air National Guard (ANG). CSRA plays a pivotal role in supporting the DoD’s only integrated payroll and personnel system, the USMC Technology Services Organization’s (TSO) Marine Corps Total Force System (MCTFS). We provide software engineering and migration services, data warehouse, data management, and business process improvement support for the TSO.

We support more than 550,000 marine records for active, reserve, and retired members, MCTFS interfaces (153+) with internal/external systems and agencies at DoD, Federal, and State levels. Creates appropriate documentation in work assignments such as program code, and technical documentation. Designs systems and programs to meet complex business needs.

Prepares detailed specifications from which programs are developed and coded. Ensures programs meet standards and technical specifications; performs technical analysis and component delivery. Gathers information from existing systems, analyzes program and time requirements. Assists project manager in preparing time estimates and justification for assigned tasks.

Designs programs for projects or enhancements to existing programs. Writes specifications for programs of low to moderate complexity. Assists support and/or project personnel in resolving moderately complex program problems. Works with client and management to resolve issues and validate programming requirements within their areas of responsibility.

Provides technical advice on complex programming. Develops test plans to verify logic of new or modified programs. Conducts quality assurance activities such as peer reviews. Creates appropriate documentation in work assignments such as program code, and technical documentation.

Remains abreast of industry technical trends and new development to maintain current skills and remain current with industry standards. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

job summary:
The Application Developer is responsible for designing, building, and testing of software code that supports and enables Lids’ functional business system activities. The individual works with the Application Development team and various project teams, coordinating application development planning and testing, as well as developing enhancements that enable a positive end-user experience. The Application Developer is responsible for communicating project status, any technical issues uncovered and their resolution.


The Application Developer produces application programs in accordance with a specified business need, while following the Lids’ IT technical development standards and processes.


Under the direction of Senior Application Developers, and/or the Application Developer Team Lead, the Application Developer is responsible for:


The planning, design, modification, and development of software programming applications.
Identification of data sources, providing data flow diagrams and documentation of processes.
Writing code for database access, modifications, and constructions including stored procedures.
Designing, reviewing, analyzing, and modifying programming systems including encoding, testing and debugging to support the organization's application systems.
Consulting with users to identify current operating procedures and to clarify program objectives.
Continually enhancing and expanding technical knowledge of the systems and tools utilized by the Lids IT.
Supporting and adhering to all company policies, procedures, and guidelines, including maintaining an in-depth awareness of all compliance related requirements.
Communicating with employees at all levels of the company.
Other duties as assigned.


Minimum Requirements


Extensive knowledge of the manufacturing and distribution industry and its functions including the following areas: Finance, Manufacturing, Sales Order Entry, Supply Chain Management, Inventory Management, Retail Sales, and Merchandising.
I n-depth understanding of the software development life cycle (SDLC) and is fluent in multiple programming languages and expert users of application development tools, such as TOAD, Visual Studio, .net framework, SQL server, Oracle, PHP, MySQL, JAVA.
Strong interpersonal skills and the willingness to teach and mentor Associate Application Developers and other IT individuals.
Willingness to learn from other associates.
Good knowledge of project management methodologies and requirements.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to influence or persuade others in positive or negative circumstances.
Ability to manage tasks with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong commitment to customer service.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
Willingness and ability to accept after-hours support calls and the dedication to resolve after-hours calls to resolution, as necessary to support the business.
Ability and willingness for extended travel (business meetings and/or training).

job summary:
Sr. Object-Oriented Programmer Analyst


Job Description


American Airlines, Inc. has multiple openings for an Object Oriented Programmer Analyst to perform the following duties: Support development activities in applications in the Crews and Flight Operations area. Support and develop multiple web-based Java or .NET applications, and web services. Interface with management, business analysts, project managers, IT Architects, other developers and internal customers to understand requirements and develop needs according to business requirements. Maintain and enhance existing services, applications, and platforms including, but not limited to, bug fixes, feature enhancements and performance tuning. Application integration development using approved languages, tools, and platforms. Troubleshoot and debug complex issues; identify and implement solutions. Perform testing of various types including Test Driven Development, unit, system, integration, and non-functional testing. Participate in promotion of software releases across all environments and change management. Support production issues on call. Work with a team to create detailed project specifications, requirements and estimates. Work with production operations department to ensure deployments roll out smoothly and customers receive appropriate support. Research and implement new technologies to enhance current processes, security and performance. Document software designs. Develop and enforce policy and procedural changes within the development group. Develop coding standards and adhere to best practices and security guidelines. Participate in code reviews. Work closely with software architects to ensure decisions meet long-term enterprise needs. Analyze system requirements, design, and document solutions using specified tools and methodologies.


Job Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in CS/CE/CIS/MIS/Engineering/Technology or related field plus 4 years of experience in software engineering or development and demonstrated experience in:


JAVA experience (must include Java EE, Eclipse, WebSphere) or Microsoft experience (must include C#, ASP.NET, SQL, Visual Studio); JavaScript, XML, HTML, and CSS; Working knowledge of Oracle Databases; IBM MQ, and JMS for integration design and development; ESB and SOA, Web Services methodologies for integration design and development using SOAP based API’s; Working in a Linux/Unix environment using shell commands; Scrutinizing applications and services to ensure they adhere to security standards; Object oriented design / programming including design patterns and best practices; Project management methodology, including IT delivery methods; Working in an Agile development environment; Networking (Sockets, TCP/IP, UDP); HTML5/CSS3, AJAX, jQuery; Updating and maintaining airline integration systems; Development and implementation of applications with standard UI components, creating custom UI components, connecting applications to Back End services; Eclipse development platform and Eclipse Plugin development.


Work Schedule: 40 hours per week/8 a.m.-5 p.m./M-F.


Job Location: Fort Worth, TX


Respond to: American Airlines, Inc.


Attn: Shelley Matz


4000 Sky Harbor Blvd.


Phoenix, AZ 85034


To submit resume, apply online at: http://www.aa.com/ Reference # 2431

At BBVA, we’re working to make banking better for everyone. That’s where you come in. We’re looking for smart, team-oriented people who want to be part of a world-class workforce that gives people the tools they need to meet their financial goals, all while delivering an outstanding client experience. Learn more below.


Responsibilities
About BBVA Dallas Creation Center


BBVA Dallas Creation Center started with the goal of transforming the way financial products and services are delivered to our customers by creating unique and amazing experiences that revolutionize the way we do banking. Read more about the Dallas Creation Center here - https://www.bbva.com/en/news/disciplines/technologies/new-dallas-center-accelerates-bbvas-shift-digital-first-mindset/


At BBVA, we are looking for candidates like you – talented individuals who possess ambition, creativity and integrity. As we continue to expand our Dallas Creation Center, our focus is hiring the next generation of talent across data analytics, software engineering, and user experience and design – those who are recent graduates with Computer Science background.


Responsibilities

Work with technical leads and product owners to understand desired application capabilities and testing scenarios
Work within Agile teams to design, develop, test, implement, and support technical solutions across a full-stack of development tools and technologies
Lead the solution design, availability, resilience, and scalability of your solution and continuously improve software engineering practices
Stay on top of technology trends, experiment with and learn new technologies, participate in internal & external technology communities, and evolve to mentor other members of the engineering community

Spanish language skills preferred

Cloud technologies, DevOps, CI/CD concepts and tooling
Spanish language skills preferred

About BBVA:


BBVA is a customer-centric global financial services group founded in 1857. The Group is the largest financial institution in Spain and Mexico and it has leading franchises in South America and the Sunbelt Region of the United States; and it is also the leading shareholder in Garanti, Turkey’s biggest bank for market capitalization. Its diversified business is focused on high-growth markets and it relies on technology as a key sustainable competitive advantage. Corporate responsibility is at the core of its business model. BBVA fosters financial education and inclusion, and supports scientific research and culture. It operates with the highest integrity, a long-term vision and applies the best practices. The Group is present in the main sustainability indexes.

job summary:
Job Title: Software Engineer
Reports To: Chief Information Advisor
Department: Information Technology
Location: Dallas, TX or Noblesville, IN

About:
RYZE Claim Solutions, is anchored by the strengths of the companies brought together to form this powerful hub of comprehensive claim services. With expansive service offerings, multiple business lines expertise and comprehensive claims knowledge, RYZE provides a wide range of solutions over a vast geographic area. These services include Daily Property, Catastrophe, Flood, TPA/Claims Administration, Casualty, Reinspections, Audits, Appraisal Services, and Training.

Description:
RYZE Claim Solutions is seeking a talented individual to join our growing team. This exciting in-house opportunity in the insurance adjusting industry is waiting for a highly-motivated software engineer with experience designing, implementing, and supporting both new and legacy software applications.
This position requires understanding and experience in both .NET/C# and Java. Additionally, strong preference will be given to candidates who have a solid understanding of systems and network administration and database design and administration. The individual must work onsite at either the Dallas, TX location, or the Noblesville, IN location. Must be available for regular business hours and occasional weekend or evening work may be required. Travel may be required up to 10% of the time with more frequent travel for training the first 3-4 months of employment (percentage undecided, needs to be open.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Designs, codes, tests and maintains software using both .NET/C# and Java/J2EE technologies
Provide technical software support to employees, contractors and partners of RYZE
Utilize revision control software to maintain all custom software and configurations
Work with other technical staff and business users to identify opportunities to improve business efficiency through the use of technology
Work with technical staff, business users, and partners to help define process and system requirements and specifications
Under the direction of the Chief Information Officer, design, implement, test, and maintain new tools and technical systems
Maintain, support and expand the functionality of existing software systems
Other duties as assigned
Required Skills and Competencies
Solid understanding of Java and J2EE technologies, with a minimum of 3 years of experience writing server-side and web presentation Java code
Solid understanding of C# and .NET, with a minimum of 3 years of experience writing server-side and web presentation C# code
Familiarity with ODBC and JDBC, with a minimum of 2 year experience writing code that queries and updates databases.
Strong understanding of OO programming concepts and data structures
Solid understanding of MVC architecture
Experience designing, implementing and supporting RESTful services
Experience working with integrated development environments, with strong preference given to candidates with experience in Visual Studio, Eclipse and Spring Test Suite.
Strong technical and analytical skills
Solid experience in problem analysis and resolution of software issues
Must excel in an agile environment where critical thinking and strong problem solving skills are required for success
Innovative thinker who is positive and proactive
Able to communicate and interact professionally with internal staff, clients, partners and consultants, including frequent interaction with executive management

Suggested Skills and Competencies
Experience working in both UNIX/Linux and Windows environments
Experience using git
Experience with IIS and Apache Tomcat
Comfortable working with a wide range of open source technologies
Familiarity with the configuration of Microsoft SQL and MySQL databases and creation of database schemas
Experience with and understanding of systems and network support in Windows and Linux environments
Experience in the property and casualty insurance adjusting field

Education and/or Experience
Bachelor (4-year) of Science in Computer Science or CIS/MIS
Four years of relevant work experience

Additionally in order to work for RYZE you will be required to take a drug test and go through our criminal background check process.
Employment with RYZE is "at will," terminable by the employee or the company at any time, with or without notice, with or without cause, except as otherwise provided by law.
RYZE is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

job summary:
Software Engineer in Test- Entry Level


Who We Are: Kibo. We provide industry leading eCommerce, distributed order management, and mobile point-of-sale solutions to retailers and branded manufacturers. Our cloud-based commerce suite enables customers to meet consumer demands anywhere, any time, and on any device. We have US offices in Texas and California and international offices in London.


Who You Are: A highly motivated individual interested in driving high quality software development! You will be contributing to the development effort of several enterprise level multi-tenant SaaS solutions, as well as mobile applications. The primary focus of this position is to drive high quality by building automated tests and tools that enable engineering wide efficiencies. You are passionate about creating superior software.


Why You Should Apply: This position offers you the opportunity to work with a newly formed organization on their industry leading eCommerce solutions. This role offers amazing growth potential for individuals looking to take their career to the next level.


Key Responsibilities:

Review business requirements and specifications for consistency in quality standards and preparation for testing .


Write and maintain detailed test plans, test cases, and test scripts both manual and automated .


Work under general direction with the ability to act independently when determining methods and procedures on new or existing functionality.


Work on complex projects and problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors and additional specialized technical knowledge.


Work with analysts and stakeholders to determine and refine feature requirements.


Create automation scripts for both functional and regression tests.


Record and track issues/defects; follow-through with resolution and validation.


Work closely with the business and development groups from conception to completion of multiple simultaneous projects.


Perform an integral role in the software development lifecycle as a participant in the development scrum team.


Skills & Requirements:

Experience with or knowledge of test automation best practices


Strong knowledge of web and internet technologies


Knowledge with software development life cycle


Excellent documentation skills communicating with technical and non-technical internal staff


Experience with Java and/or other programing languages


Experience in creation of test plans


Experience in creating test cases


Manual / Functional testing


Strong troubleshooting skills


Preferred Experience:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience


Automated testing and proficiency with Selenium or similar tools


Knowledge of JavaScript, jQuery, AJAX, CSS, HTML, JPA, JUnit


Knowledge of RESTful web service design principles


Knowledge of Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) and reusable components


Knowledge of AWS services and/or Cloud based methodologies


Knowledge of Hudson or Jenkins with builds


Experience with Linux/Unix preferred


Previous experience in the e-Commerce industry would be helpful


This Job Description indicates the general nature and level of work expected of the incumbent(s). It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities required of the incumbent. Incumbent(s) may be asked to perform other duties in addition to those described above.


Kibo Software Inc., is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of any status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local municipalities.

job summary:
Cloud Elements is a cloud application developer and integrator based in Denver, CO. We partner with leading SaaS, PaaS and big data vendors such as Google, GitHub, SendGrid, Twilio, Stripe, Box, SalesForce.com, ZenDesk, Hadoop, and MongoDB; that is an impressive list and it continues to grow! Software Engineers at Cloud Elements get to work on building really cool SaaS applications; developing both our proprietary SaaS services, and building out custom client solutions.

This role is an exciting, challenging, and dynamic position that will empower you to work on core product development. You will be encouraged to use your creative problem solving, resourcefulness, and coding mastery to build leading edge SaaS applications!

You will be working out of The Addison TreeHouse co-working space near Dallas, TX.

What we would like you to have:

3 years of software development experience
Required - Java, SQL, JavaScript, JSON, Subversion or Git, Tomcat (or other Java application server)
Desirable - REST, API knowledge, Ruby, Node.js, Sencha EXTJS 4.x+, jQuery, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Maven
IDE: Eclipse or IntelliJ
At least 3 years of Java, SQL and Web 2.0 application development experience.

Know how to use build tools such as Maven.

Knowledge of Sencha’s EXTJS framework is desirable but not required

Challenging work with leading edge technology
Career growth
Benefits - Medical, dental, 401k, flex PTO, equity!
Bonuses for mentoring, training/conferences, doing extra credit work, employee referrals!
Flexible work locations: You will be working out of our office in the Addison TreeHouse located near Dallas, TX and occasionally from your home office.

We'd love to hear from you! Please upload your resume and share with us your GitHub link or other source where we can take a look at samples of your work.

job summary:
Plano 3 (31063), United States of America, Plano, Texas

Software Engineer, Full-Stack

Do you want to work for a tech company that writes its own code, develops its own software, and builds its own products? We experiment and innovate leveraging the latest technologies, engineer breakthrough customer experiences, and bring simplicity and humanity to banking. We make a difference for 65 million customers. At Capital One, you'll be part of a group of makers, breakers, doers and disruptors, who love to solve real problems and meet real customer needs. We want you to be curious and ask “what if”?

As a Capital One Software Engineer, you'll work on everything from customer-facing web and mobile applications using cutting-edge open source frameworks, to highly-available RESTful services, to back-end systems using the hottest techniques in Big Data. You will drive the design, implementation, testing, deployment, and post-release support in an agile application development environment. You will execute on engineering and release priorities successfully through strong leadership and communication. Whether a bug fix or an awesome feature, you will own your work and deliver the most elegant and scalable solutions.

Responsibilities:

Work as part of forward leaning team of makers to design and develop software solutions
Research competing platforms and contribute to the product development process
Drive innovation through rapid prototyping and iterative development
Identify and enable adoption of new technologies and patterns particularly in Public Cloud, API and Web frameworks
Demonstrate strong technical ability, awareness and track record of proposing and integrating technologies and solutions
Maintain all-round view of solution, understanding both business and technical challenges and also both functional and non-functional needs of solution
Provide technical leadership to the design, development/implementation, and testing of business solutions, integrating legacy and new technologies
Work with the developers, quality engineers product managers and subject matter experts to design and develop end-to-end solution options
Develop and recommending novel and innovative approaches to solving business and technical problems.
Focus massively on delivering with speed and quality
Keep up-to-date on new technology, standards, protocols and tools in areas relevant to the rapidly changing digital environment
Apply sound Dev Ops and automation best practices
Prepare and present potential technical solutions and advising the business on the technical and business value of the proposition
Actively participate in internal and external Communities of Practice

Who you are:
You yearn to be part of cutting edge, high profile projects and are motivated by delivering world-class solutions on an aggressive schedule
Someone who is not intimidated by challenges; thrives even under pressure; is passionate about their craft; and hyper focused on delivering exceptional results
You love to learn new technologies and mentor junior engineers to raise the bar on your team
It would be awesome if you have a robust portfolio on Github and / or open source contributions you are proud to share
Passionate about intuitive and engaging user interfaces, as well as new/emerging concepts and techniques in web design

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree or military experience
At least 5 years of hands-on experience in software engineering
At least 2 years experience in JVM based web application development
At least 2 years experience in HTML5 and CSS
At least 3 years of current experience with Java development
At least 3 years of experience in API development
At least 2 years of experience using Angular JS

Preferred Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in object-oriented and functional programming in Java and JavaScript
2+ years of experience building RESTful web services with server-side frameworks like Spring Boot and Play
2+ years of experience working with NoSQL and distributed storage technology including Hadoop, HBase, Cassandra, Elasticsearch, and Redis
1+ year of experience with microservices architecture
1+ year of experience with front end technology stack, such as React.js/AngularJS and Babel/TypeScript
1+ year of experience with Scala and Groovy languages
1+ year of experience in AWS or similar cloud computing environments with infrastructure and configuration management tools like Ansible, Docker, and Mesos

Capital One will consider sponsoring you for employment authorization for this position.

job summary:
Raytheon IIS is the #1 provider of real time imagery and signal intelligence as well as the world’s best flight control system UAS safety records. We are a leader in cyber security supplying 10x the detection capabilities of our nearest competitors as well as being the source of protection for several of the most sensitive systems in the world. We provide one of the world’s largest immigration and control systems and are the #1 provider of weather data in the United States. IIS is the only company with support personnel on every continent and in the war zone, providing mission support services for more than 8,000 unique customer missions each year, in 80 nations. 

Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services, located in Richardson, Texas is looking for a candidate to join our world-class engineering team as a Software Engineer. As a candidate for this opportunity you should have a good foundation in one or more software development languages (preferably C++ or Java) and be able to use various software tools on HP or SUN workstations in a UNIX or LINUX environment. The candidate should have a fundamental understanding of software principles, theories, and concepts related to software engineering (including software development lifecycle and software development process) and Object Oriented analysis, design, and programming. 

The Software organization partners with Systems engineering and other disciplines to provide affordable, cost-effective software solutions to IIS programs and initiatives. They will provide SW architecture and database design, SW development and sustainment through traditional or agile methods, and SW integration and test (SWIT), including continuous integration techniques.

· Bachelor's Degree in engineering, computer science or similar

Description

Citigroup Architecture and Technology Engineering (CATE), is a an organization comprising:

Enterprise Architecture, Infrastructure Engineering and design, application development engineering, emerging technology and technology vendor management. CATE’s goal is to improve IT’s time to market and the effectiveness of our IT environment and processes. The approach is to integrate the disciplines of Architecture, Development Engineering and Infrastructure Engineering to maximize the consistency and quality of these services and to accelerate the adoption of technologies that provide competitive advantage to our businesses.

Candidate will be part of the CATE Authentication and Access Management Engineering team and work closely with CTI Operations as well as other partners to assist with all aspects of engineering the Authentication Infrastructure.

Qualifications

Knowledge and Experience:

5-7+ years Java/J2EE programming experience
SOAP and restful web services programming in Java
Working experience of RDBMS databases (Oracle, MySQL, etc)
Expertise in one of the following web and application servers: Weblogic, Websphere, etc
Working experience in Unix/Linux scripting and Linux server technology.
Working knowledge of application security
Strong interpersonal communication skills to maintain good relationship among different teams is required
Tools and Utilities: SOAP UI, Java IDE (Eclipse), SQL Clients, LDAP Clients, Source control utilities, Packaging and Build tools (Ant, Maven)
Testing Methodologies: Unit testing, System Testing, System Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing, Functional Testing, Regression Testing

Nice to have:

Agile methodologies (Scrum or Kanban)
Knowledge of Mobile application development
Working experience of LDAP
Application security experience (SSO, Federation (SAML, OpenID, OAuth, etc) and Multi factor authentication.

About Citi
Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.

Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.

Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.

job summary:
GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The JavaScript Developer II is responsible for the detail design, documentation, development, unit testing and maintenance of planned and unplanned internally developed applications created for Availity business partners. The position is also responsible for the design, documentation, evaluation and system performance testing of externally purchased software products against major business processes and specifications. Incumbents may be called upon to serve in multiple roles in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial corporate environment.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Application Development


Writes application code for a range of simple to moderately complex system designs
Writes programs that span platforms. Code to and/or create Application Programming Interfaces (API)
Writes and/or modifies application code to enhance existing programs or developing new programs
Identifies system and functional requirements
Reviews code developed by less experienced Developers and recommends changes
Writes detailed technical specifications for subsystems and identifies integration points
Reports missing elements found in system and functional requirements and explains the impacts on subsystems to other Developers, System Analysts, Product Owners, Technical Leads, System Architects, and Product Managers
Supports transition of application throughout the Product Development life cycle
Documents applications and/or code that needs to be migrated. May require more coordination points for subsystems

Collaboration


Consults with Developers, System Analysts, System Architects, Product Managers, and vendors (occasionally)
Accurately scopes project time and resources required to complete programming objectives
Reviews and confirms project scope and time line estimates with senior Developers, System Analysts, and/or Project Managers
Guides less experienced Developers as needed with regard to project estimates, development, and testing

Testing


Performs unit testing and debugging. Establishes test conditions based on code specifications. May collaborate with senior Developers and other team members to debug more complex errors
Consults with senior Developers on testing plans and results
Work with senior Developers to resolve/debug program errors
Reviews vendor research. Conducts vendor product gap analysis and makes valid comparisons

The above cited duties and responsibilities describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to the job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all the duties and responsibilities that an incumbent may be expected or asked to perform.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE


Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent in relevant work experience
4 - 8 years of progressive work experience designing business processes, process mapping, working on process improvement initiatives, and business applications system design
Experience testing and debugging business application systems and processes
Experience developing software products for clinical environments and medical labs
Experience integrating both in house developed software and externally purchased software for large applications
Web portal development experience
JavaScript (Node, Angular, React, Bootstrap, Knockout)
Experience with data modeling, relational databases, data structures and design a plus
Experience working with Product and Business Management teams a plus
Experience working in an entrepreneurial company a plus

SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE

Technical Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Knowledge, skills, and experience to write detailed technical documentation, specifically business requirements and functional specifications for application development
Ability and experience to facilitate JAD sessions or other requirements gathering processes. May work with senior Developers to resolve/debug program errors
Knowledge and ability to apply OOD ( HTML, XML, Java Script,and Patterns) and impact to the application development process
Knowledge of web development methodologies (preferably Agile/Scrum), application design, navigation, and information architecture
Knowledge of database design and query language
Understanding of web services (REST & SOAP)
Understanding of unit testing a plus
Working knowledge of MVC a plus
In depth knowledge of HIPAA X12 transactions a plus
Working knowledge of EDIFECS a plus
Demonstrated proficiency using PC skills such as; MS Suite products, flowcharting tools, e-mail, and electronic calendar scheduling

Soft Skills:

Strong relationship management and collaboration skills requirements and functional specifications for application development
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships, supporting company leadership and other team members
Ability to work under pressure. Maintains composure and professionalism in an interrupt-driven environment
Ability to manage multiple and changing priorities/tasks
Must be flexible and embrace change

CUSTOMER SCOPE


Seeking a working knowledge in the following areas:

o Test Driven Development

o Pair Programming

o HTML, JQuery, and CSS


Understanding of Git a plus
Knowledge of AngularJS a plus

Description

The Kindred

Clinical Systems Development team

is looking for the right

Programmer Analyst

to join the tight-knit, award-winning team of developers in a multi-application, multi-language environment where creativity and dedication are rewarded. This position is located in

Louisville, KY.

Our Environment:
Our team supports the hospital division (90+ hospitals), developing and enhancing several applications running in multiple environments. We have a fast paced, fun environment and are looking for team members who can join the team, contributing their knowledge gained through past experiences and ready to learn new and exciting things with us. We believe in providing creative technical solutions for our users, working hard and having fun.

Ideal Candidate will:
Be an analytical thinker, excited about tackling new problems and learning new technologies.

Be a Web developer, as well as a true solution developer comfortable using a wide range of languages and technology.

Have experience with ASP.NET and MVC

Have experience with JavaScript, CSS and frameworks such as JQuery, Bootstrap, and SASS.

Have experience working with IIS.

Have a love of programming, and significant time spent programming just for fun. We’re looking for those who know that being a geek isn’t just a job…it’s a lifestyle.

Have ability to be productive in writing and documenting sophisticated applications using many different object-oriented languages (e.g. C#, C++, Java, etc.) in an enterprise-scale environment.

Have extensive experience developing within multiple environments (client/server applications, web solutions, procedural environments) on multiple Operating Systems, and be comfortable learning different technologies and languages as needed.

Have experience with application design techniques, user interface design, and development of design documents.

Have a willingness and understanding of how to properly document your code and applications.

Have working knowledge of database environments, access languages and products such as SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, Sybase, DB2, SQL, PL/SQL, ODBC, and JDBC.

Be able to demonstrate skills in performing the analysis, design, and implementation of automated enterprise-scale distributed business systems and infrastructures, including a desire to have direct responsibility for analysis, coding, development, testing and application design enhancements.

Have a proven history of providing solutions as a self-driven individual developer and as a member of a much larger team.

Have a history of development following a regimented SDLC.

Technologies in use:
Windows, Unix/AIX, C#.NET, ADO.NET, SQL Server, Perl, C++, HTML, Javascript, b-tree index, XML/XSLT, Java, Python, mobile platforms, and several others.

#MON-CORP
