Solid, powerful, and confident written and verbal communication skills – the ability to communicate complex thoughts and ideas in a clear and concise manner.

Experience with modern source control systems (git, Subversion, etc)

Skills working directly with end users.

Multiple years successfully leading other developers.

Experience in accurately estimating timelines and work efforts, and a history of hitting your estimates.

History of documenting your designs and development for current/future reviews.

Experience enhancing and supporting large-scale, mission-critical applications.

Ability to multi-task, working on multiple projects and/or provide ongoing enhancements and support to existing applications.

Positive, can-do attitude with a self-starter personality.

**ABOUT US: **

CBS Interactive is a premier online content network for information and online operations of CBS Corporation as well as some of the top native digital brands in the industry. Our websites dive deep into the things that people care about: business, entertainment, games, news, sports and technology. With more than 290 million unique visitors each month, CBS Interactive is a global top 10 web property and one of the largest premium content networks.

CBS Interactive’s Media Group is looking for an Associate Software Engineer to join the site engineering team responsible for handling the code and core components of Download.com and TVGuide.com. Experience with or understanding of agile development

Experience being part of a development team, including working with version control systems like Git or SVN

Familiarity with software development methodology and release processes

Willingness to work closely with Product and Quality Assurance teams

BS degree in Computer Science or Engineering

Must successfully pass a background check

Preferred Qualifications

Working knowledge of PHP Symfony

Experience with AWS Services or other Cloud Platform Technologies

job summary:
The role of the Applications Consultant for Humana Government Business is to plan, analyze, design, develop, test, and implement information systems of increasing complexity within the framework of the Humana Military systems architecture to support the company's objectives in the most effective, efficient, and economical manner.

Our Department of Defense Contract may require U.S. citizenship for this position.

Humana is currently in a bidding process and this position’s availability is contingent upon Humana being awarded a federal contract.

System Planning, Analysis and Design.

Contribute significantly to systems analysis and design efforts with the responsibility for tasks associated with the initiation, definition, and specification of information systems. These systems can include multiple inputs, outputs, databases, business objects, web services and user interfaces.

Assist Systems Manager or Director in planning education, documentation, and installation approaches in conjunction with the appropriate support documents.

Provide preliminary workload requirements in all phases of systems development activities associated with a project for review by Project Leader, Systems Manager or Director.

Document development materials in accordance with Humana Military and Project Leader standards.

Prepare detailed programming specifications from business requirements as directed by Project Leader, Systems Manager or Director.

Relating to Development, Testing and Implementation.

Write, update and test systems in accordance with Humana Military standards using in-house developed and third party controls. Programming tasks will range from low to high complexity.

Guide junior staff in coding tasks.

Prepare and execute detailed systems test plans and assist end users with acceptance testing as needed tests to ensure high application quality in terms of usability, speed, security and accuracy.

Plan system installation and conversion support as directed by Systems Manager or Director.

Prepare all necessary system, operations and turnover documentation as directed by Systems Manager or Director in accordance with Humana Military standards.

System Maintenance.

Administer, document and perform work required to correct problems with and make minor modifications to existing systems as directed by Systems Manager.

Provide on call support as requested for various applications systems.

Project and Change Management Accountabilities

Utilize Project Portfolio Management Methodology.

Use project portfolio management application to manage assigned projects

Create, update and store all required project artifacts as assigned in the project repository designated in project portfolio management application.

Participate in and contribute to Scrum sessions (Agile Methodology), Phase Review (Waterfall Methodology) sessions and other project work sessions as required.

Utilize Formal Change Management Process.

Submit code and object changes for turn according to established Humana Military processes and schedules.

Verify that system turns completed successfully in the QA and production environments.

General Performance Accountabilities

Relating to General Performance.

Report time and progress on assigned tasks in accordance with Information Systems development standards.

Perform other tasks that may be assigned by supervisor for the purposes of training and career development or are in the best interests of the company.

Extend professional knowledge and skills through departmental supplied facilities and self-motivated opportunities.

Qualifications

Role Essentials

Four years of progressive information technology experience

Bachelor’s degree, technical area preferred or technical training equivalent

Two years of current .Net and SQL Server experience

Good oral and written communication skills

Experience with Microsoft Visio or similar diagramming tool

Ability to work well in a team development setting

Demonstrates job competencies and expectations of the Senior Applications Engineer

Development experience with VS 2008 or VS 2010 and the following: ASP.Net, C#, JavaScript, VB Script, HTML, CSS and SQL

Experience with SQL and development utilizing MS SQL Server back end databases

Role Desirables

Microsoft Certified Solutions Developer Certification

One year of current experience as a SQL Server DBA

Management Experience Project

Healthcare related experience

Understanding of SDLC, OO principles, design and architectural patterns such as MVVM

Experience with MS SQL Server Stored Procedures and SSIS

Experience with IBM DB2

Working knowledge of Java or Objective C programming languages

Experience with Rapid Application Development software tools such as Telerik RAD Controls

Reporting Relationships

You will report to a Technology Manager.

Additional Information

Humana is an organization with careers that change lives—including yours. As an innovator in the fast-paced industry of healthcare, we offer our associates careers that challenge, support and inspire them to use their passion for helping others and to lead their best lives. If you’re ready to help people achieve lifelong well-being, and be a part of an organization that is growing and poised to make an impact on the future of healthcare, Humana has the right opportunity for you.

job summary:
We’ve got a great team but we have a lot of high level work with a lot of history. We need someone who can jump in and understand where we are on various projects (in lots of different technologies) as well as be able to coach junior developers.


Generally, we’re doing web apps with some mobile development and SharePoint thrown in. Our work is split between small projects and customers we have partnered with for years.


This is a great environment for growth and professionalism. We’ll look to you for architectural decisions (not top down architecture) and to lead projects, features, and challenges.

Web application development using HTML, CSS, JavaScript.

Backing up/migrating dbs, writing stored procedures and SQL jobs.
Checking in, getting latest, and submitting code reviews on a regular basis.
Doing code reviews for teammates.
Daily standups and open lines of communications with the team–IM, email, and office chatter.
Customer communications–not a lot, but working directly with the stakeholders is extremely important.
Mentoring/assisting junior developers.

.NET stack
SQL Server
JavaScript
Good communicator
Clean, maintainable code
Team player

Bonus points for:
AngularJS
Knockout
Swift/Objective-C
Java

Job Title: Java Developer

Location: Jeffersonville, Indiana

Job Type: Direct-Hire/Full-Time

V-Soft Consulting is currently seeking a Java Developer for our premier client in Jeffersonville, Indiana . This is a full-time position in the travel industry .

Job Description

An opportunity exists for a technically strong Java Developer to work with a fast-paced software company in the travel industry. The successful candidate will be part of the development team responsible for designing, developing, testing and implementing online booking engines and supporting products. This position will work as an experienced developer on the team and directly assist entry and mid-level developers with functional requirements, testing, and project specifications.

Duties and Responsibilities

Work with clients and product managers to understand requirements and create designs

Analyze existing code, enhance it and implement new features

Participate in design sessions and code reviews

Create technical documentation

Deploy applications to production environments

Technical Requirements

Java

Spring

Struts

Sonar

Consul

MySQL

Git

Practical experience with web services, XML, XSLT and data binding

Application server and relational database experience

Strong background in MVC frameworks

Solid OOP knowledge, use of design patterns

Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills

Able to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical personnel

Must perform as a team player

Must laugh at Manager’s jokes

Desirable Experience and Knowledge

Hands on experience with Struts and Tiles

Experience with MySQL, triggers, stored procedures and database optimization

Experience with Apache, Tomcat, Ant and Git

Experience within Travel Services, including middleware providers

Experience and willingness to work with distributed teams

Familiarity with Eclipse or IntelliJ

Knowledge of JavaScript, JQuery, DOM, browser compatibility issues is a plus

Knowledge of eCommerce systems and online payment processing

Education and Training

Degree in Computer Science and/or 5+ years of equivalent, relevant education/experience

Qualified candidates should send their resumes to PRATIMA@VSOFTCONSULTING.COM

V-Soft Consulting Group is headquartered in Louisville, KY with strategic locations across the US and in India. Known as an agile innovative technology services company, we were recently recognized among the top 100 fastest growing staffing companies in North America. V-Soft is a trusted partner with experience across diverse technology stacks to help business get IT done. V-Soft has a large quantity of expertise in-house complimented by on-demand talent via our IT staffing division.

job summary:
Position in the dynamic and growing area of Information Security

. The Application Security Consultant is responsible for assuring that security requirements are designed and built into Humana’s development projects. The Application Security Consultant works directly with developers and project managers within Humana’s development community. Key project artifacts include Process Risk Assessments, Security Architecture Designs and Final Security Reviews.

This role works under the direction and supervision of the manager of Enterprise Information Protection - Assurance. The goal of Enterprise Information Protection is to effectively manage risks to Humana’s business relating to Information Technology, infrastructure, applications and data.

The successful candidate must possess an understanding of IT and development terminology and processes, be organized, have excellent written and verbal communication skills. Firsthand knowledge of .Net and Java development and subsequent coding vulnerabilities would be helpful although not mandatory. Must be able to multi-task and be proactive in addressing issues quickly.

Specific Responsibilities will include:
Conducting Application Assurance Reviews which include key application security requirements

Consulting with development teams on Application Security Project Requirements

Assuring security coding practices

Conducting web vulnerability, static and dynamic code scanning

Identifying technology and control risks within each project

Recommending improvements in procedures, processes, operations and systems across Humana’s secure SDLC

Other special projects as necessary

Qualifications

Role Essentials:
Strong Communication and Leadership skills

Extensive experience in IT Security background with hands on experience

Ability to work well under pressure to meet deadlines.

Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic and changing environment while managing multiple projects simultaneously.

Strong attention to detail.

Strong communication both written and verbal

Strong analytical and problem solving skills

Proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite

Role Desirables:
Bachelor degree in Information Systems or Computer Science strongly preferred.

CISSP

Microsoft certification (e.g Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP), Microsoft Certified Technology Specialist (MCTS), Microsoft Certified Master (MCA), Microsoft Certified Architect (MCA), Microsoft Professional Developer (MCPD), Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE), Microsoft Database Administrator (MCDBACNA, MCSE.

PMP.

Six Sigma Certification.

Additional Information

Humana is an organization with careers that change lives—including yours. As an innovator in the fast-paced industry of healthcare, we offer our associates careers that challenge, support and inspire them to use their passion for helping others and to lead their best lives. If you’re ready to help people achieve lifelong well-being, and be a part of an organization that is growing and poised to make an impact on the future of healthcare, Humana has the right opportunity for you.

Apply now, or join our Talent Network so you can stay informed and up to date on what’s happening at Humana.

job summary:
VML is all about putting everything you are into everything you do. We're a full-service advertising agency that thrives on moving brands forward by inspiring a human connection.


VML is seeking a Front-end Developer for a government client based in Memphis. The front-end developer is innovative and provides creative new ideas for tackling front-end development challenges using a suite of front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS, JavaScript and all the associated industry-standard frameworks. He or she contributes to the successful completion of major projects by investigating, analyzing and resolving complex application problems; designs, codes, compiles and tests complex websites and applications; employs standards, security methods and tools related to building enterprise web applications; works with project management and leadership to provide time estimates and schedules for projects; communicates regularly with department management and functional users on project requirements, activities and status; participates in technical reviews and feasibility studies, interprets documentation; and follows software engineering standards, processes and techniques.


The Front-end Developer:

Works closely with our creative team to bring award-winning designs to life through the use of modern front-end web technologies
Is a master at CSS and javascript and utilizes front-end frameworks to create advanced, interactive, web experiences

job summary:
POSITION TITLE: Software Developer

DEPARTMENT: Information Systems

CLASSIFICATION: Exempt

REPORTS TO: IT Manager

POSITIONS SUPERVISED: None


POSITION PURPOSE


This position will include basic computer support, basic database programming, and web programming. This position will be focused on all IT areas including programming. Will perform duties related to researching and creating reports from the core banking system and ancillary systems. Will work closely with computer operations and systems analyst to provide timely information for producing reports for use throughout the credit union, will work closely with network administrators to produce customized web pages for various sites throughout the credit union. The position will also work with all areas of the IT department to ensure daily operations and helpdesk responses are provided on a daily basis.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES


• Interact extensively with IT systems analysts to determine internal customer needs by enhancing applications.

• Review application designs and enhance programs.

• Troubleshooting for possible software bugs.

• Implementing fixes within the systems.

• Check for system compatibility.

• Assist in development of reports and ensure their accuracy and meet the needs of the business unit.

• Assist in translating requirements of the internal customer into highly technical specifications in brief.

• Document technical specifications.

• Assist in testing of solutions for technical and business compatibility.

• Instruct system users in the use of computer applications; answer questions and assist in resolving problems regarding the methods and procedures for using software applications.

• Maintain various records and documentation for department systems.

• Assist in development of straightforward report generation programs.

• Support month end, quarter-end and year end functions supporting membership data delivery.

• Assist in the delivery and successful implementation of new system releases three times a year.

• Keep up to date with knowledge in technical sector developments in the industry.

• Assist with database maintenance on a regular basis.

• Assist in the implementation of vendor supplied solutions with core banking vendor.

• Provide first level support for internal customers.

• Other duties as assigned.


QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE: Preference for bachelor’s degree in related field or 5+ years of computer programming experience.


KNOWLEDGE:

Understanding of computer operations and information needs.

Working knowledge of programming languages (JavaScript, Java, SQL, HTML, XML)

Firm understanding of programming and information systems.

Knowledge of business software applications.

Familiarity with development lifecycle (all areas).

Financial experience a plus.


SKILLS/ABILITIES:

Strong analytical and trouble shooting skills.

Ability to produce applications and reports from databases.

Project and organizational skills.

Ability to adapt and be flexible in fast paced environment.

Good communication skills.


WORKING CONDITIONS Typical office environment.


We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Job Description:
SAIC has an opening for a Senior Java Developer for the PDSS team in Millington, TN. This full-time position will support the Navy Personnel Command for program support of the EMPRS and BUPERS On- line systems. The candidate must be able to work collaboratively in a team environment and will develop software in web or thin client environments. Candidate will interface with end- users, system engineers and database administrators on a regular basis so interpersonal skills are a must. Candidate is expected to have the analysis skills to solve problems.


Maintain, Design, develop, and integrate multi-tiered Java based applications supporting Navy Personnel Command projects.
Design software tools and subsystems to support software reuse and domain analyses and manage their implementation.
Work as a leader or member of a team.

Review existing programs and assists in making refinements, reducing operating time, and improving current techniques.
Provide support to developers and business analysts with data design and reporting requirements
Formulate and define specifications for software applications or modifies and maintain existing applications using engineering releases and utilities from the manufacturer.

Design and implementation of databases and data architecture
Be responsible for quality assurance review and evaluation of existing and new software products.

:

5+ years of experience with JavaEE, specifically JSPs, Servlets, EJBs, JDBC, and JMS
5+ years of experience with a Java application server with in depth knowledge of administration and internals; IBM WebSphere is preferred

job summary:
Summary:
The World’s Brightest Minds Always Innovate

At St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital, we know what can be achieved when the brightest scientific minds face the fewest barriers. That’s why we provide world-class facilities, state-of-the-art technologies, and extraordinary support for your research to ensure scientific progress is never halted from a lack of resources. At St. Jude, you will be part of a collaborative, bench-to-bedside environment where you can see, firsthand, how your science translates into survival for the children we serve. Responsibilities:
St. Jude is recognized as a global leader in mapping the genetic landscape of pediatric cancers. Our Developmental Neurobiology group is expanding its computational biology research program, and we have an immediate opportunity for recent graduates in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, or Computer Science who will co-lead the computational analysis of unprecedented genomic datasets generated for primary brain tumors and model systems.

Our lab is among the leading groups studying the genomic landscape of childhood brain cancer, with a strong track record substantiated by several transformative publications in top tier journals such as Nature and Cell. In this position, you will work closely with other lab personnel and coordinate exciting collaborations both within St. Jude and with other world class labs across the globe to conduct highly integrative studies with comprehensive NGS datasets, including WGS, WES, RNA-Seq, ChIP-Seq, and high throughput single-cell sequencing. Candidates with deep understanding of cancer genomics, genetics or epigenetics, strong problem solving skills, attention to detail, critical thinking, and expertise in next-generation sequencing data analysis are highly encouraged to apply for this position. Minimum Education: Degree which must include research related to bioinformatics (such as analysis of RNA-seq, WGBS, ChIP-seq, proteomics data, or biological pathways; development of algorithms, statistical methods, or scientific software). MS required, PhD preferred. Minimum Experience: Experience with programming languages such as Perl, C, or Java required.

Experience with Python and knowledge on statistical analysis package such as R and Matlab is highly desired. Candidates with publications as evidence for the strength and quality of their scientific training are highly encouraged to apply. EEO:
St. Jude is an Equal Opportunity Employer Not ready to apply? Become a St. Jude Career Insider to stay up-to-date on our opportunities.

The Technical Lead works with the Application Security team, which is part of the Information Security organization within IT Technical Services.

This posting represents 4 Technical Lead positions to be filled – one in each of the Application Security areas identified below:
Finance & Reliability
Supply Chain
Human Resources
Information Technology
Applying for this position will allow the candidate to be considered for 1-4 of the Technical Lead positions through a single application and interview process.

Application Security - Responsibilities
Developing and implementing for SAP and other enterprise applications the security strategies, procedures, standards, and tools necessary to enable business functionality while securing sensitive data and otherwise supporting the Company’s internal controls guidelines.
Providing analysis, development, documentation, testing, and maintenance of activity roles, job roles, profiles, and authorizations for all SAP landscapes (including ERP, HR, Portal, BW, CRM, SCEM, APO, SRM, Solution Manager, CUA, Netweaver Gateway, ILM) and some non-SAP landscapes (including Sabrix, Vendavo, and SuccessFactors).
Partnering with Application Services to design, build, and sustain the security layer for SAP implementations enterprise wide.
Managing SAP user populations through Central User Administration (CUA) to grant access to multiple SAP clients from a central location.
Monitoring and enforcing security policies in accordance with International Paper’s Global Information Security strategy, plan, and operating model.

Application Security - Customers
All IP employees
Contractors, business partners, and vendors who use SAP and related applications
SAP support groups within International Paper

Application Security - Organization
Work within the team is organized around four areas in support of our business partners:
Finance & Reliability
Supply Chain
Human Resources
Information Technology

Team members working to support each business partner area above include representatives of the following groups:
Technical Leads
Build & Compliance Team
Business Partner Support Team

Position - Responsibility
The Technical Lead will be responsible for supporting the goals of the Application Security team by
coordinating team involvement in business projects for the assigned business partner area and for some projects that span areas. The employee will perform tasks independently with general guidance from the Application Security Manager.

With regard to the assigned business partner area, specific tasks may include but are not limited to:
Designing and implementing security solutions from general business requirements
Collaborating with teammates and IT partners in support of projects
Participating in project team meetings as the primary liaison for Application Security
Updating and communicating project plans to accurately reflect security activities and efforts
Directing team partners from the Build & Compliance and Business Partner Support teams
Articulating project status and issues to multiple levels of management in multiple organizations
Consulting with business partners to provide recommendations and strategies for securing systems
Coordinating infrastructure and application architecture activity among multiple projects
Creating, generating, and analyzing reports and information in support of project activities
Teaching security concepts, processes, and procedures to teammates and business partners
Recognizing and addressing system or process vulnerabilities to internal controls
Working with business partners to establish working processes and procedures
Partnering with the Build & Compliance and Business Partner Support Leads to set expectations
Identifying and updating system data required to support role and user administration processes
Helping establish and follow defined processes and procedures for each of the above responsibilities

With regard to the Application Security team’s operations and initiatives, specific duties will include but are not limited to:
Serving as project lead for assigned internal improvement initiatives or area-spanning projects
Working with the Application Security Manager to formulate strategy for the organization
Engaging with IT leadership to determine, establish, and implement effective security practices
Building functional specifications and working with SAP development to build complex functionality
Validating and testing functionality introduced by custom development, support packs, or upgrade
Researching application support tools to resolve system issues and identify opportunities
Reviewing work of teammates to ensure adherence to processes, procedures, and standards
Participating in internal and external audits and user, license, and other security-related data reviews
Creating, updating, and communicating project plans
Identifying, implementing, and guiding others in improvements to processes and procedures
Supporting teammates in resolving user application security issues including root cause analysis

Position - Key Challenges
Communicating the importance and value of taking time to properly secure transactions and data
Balancing improvements and efficiencies with competing business and technical initiatives
Collaborating and communicating effectively with all Application Services, IT, and business partners
Understanding a broad mix of applications and processes in the supported area

Strong technical experience in an IT role (typically 7-10 years)
Experience with SAP products (ERP, HR, Portal, BW, CRM, SCEM, APO, SRM, Solution Manager, Netweaver Gateway, CUA, GRC) and/or SAP-related products (SuccessFactors, Vendavo, Sabrix)
Experience with SAP technical tools (ABAP, Java, OSS, eCATT, ALE, IMG, Firefighter)

Experience with large scale IT system deployment projects
Ability to plan and execute project life cycle phases (assess, design, build, test, sustain, retire)
Demonstrated skill interacting with customers, business partners, and peer groups
Experience managing projects and explaining project management concepts, techniques, and tools
Familiarity with business and/or corporate processes in the designated area of responsibility
Experience developing and explaining process flows based on business and customer requirements
Experience with business analysis and design
Ability to formulate security solutions after working to understand business process requirements
Exposure to internal control concepts and requirements (Sarbanes-Oxley, segregation of duties)
Familiarity with SAP or other application security model and authorization concepts
Familiarity with role based security and monitoring a plus
Familiarity with authentication, SSO, and SSL concepts a plus
Familiarity with directory packages such as LDAP or Active Directory a plus
Experience with desktop software tools such as Word, Excel, Outlook, Visio, and Project
Experience analyzing data with Excel or Access a plus

job summary:
The Build & Compliance Lead works with the Application Security team, which is part of the Information Security organization within IT Technical Services.


Application Security - Responsibilities

Developing and implementing for SAP and other enterprise applications the security strategies, procedures, standards, and tools necessary to enable business functionality while securing sensitive data and otherwise supporting the Company’s internal controls guidelines.
Providing analysis, development, documentation, testing, and maintenance of activity roles, job roles, profiles, and authorizations for all SAP landscapes (including ERP, HR, Portal, BW, CRM, SCEM, APO, SRM, Solution Manager, CUA, Netweaver Gateway, ILM) and some non-SAP landscapes (including Sabrix, Vendavo, and SuccessFactors).
Partnering with Application Services to design, build, and sustain the security layer for SAP implementations enterprise wide.
Managing SAP user populations through Central User Administration (CUA) to grant access to multiple SAP clients from a central location.
Monitoring and enforcing security policies in accordance with International Paper’s Global Information Security strategy, plan, and operating model.


Application Security - Customers


All IP employees
Contractors, business partners, and vendors who use SAP and related applications
SAP support groups within International Paper


Application Security - Organization


Work within the team is organized around four areas in support of our business partners:


Finance & Reliability
Supply Chain
Human Resources
Information Technology


Team members working to support each business partner area above include representatives of the following groups:


Technical Leads


Build & Compliance Team


Business Partner Support Team


Position - Responsibility


The employee will perform tasks independently with general guidance from the Application Security Manager and will be responsible for supporting the goals of the Application Security team by managing the Build & Compliance team. The team’s primary duties will include but not be limited to the following:

Providing build support for business and Application Security projects and sustain activities
Updating activity roles that underlie access to SAP systems
Maintaining job roles required for user provisioning
Managing configuration, transports, and other technical aspects of system support
Supporting the design of security solutions from general business requirements
Building functional specifications and working with SAP development to build functionality
Updating system data required to support role and user administration processes
Researching application support tools to resolve system issues and identify opportunities

Ensuring compliance with security-related statutory and internal controls requirements.
Supporting internal and external process and system audits
Monitoring IT Sensitive Access
Providing data for SAP user license reviews
Providing data for IT cost allocations


In support of these duties, the Build & Compliance Lead will manage the team’s work activities with other members of the Application Security lead team (Manager, Technical Leads, and Business Partner Support Lead). Specific tasks may include but are not limited to:


Designing and implementing Build & Compliance processes and procedures
Leading Application Security involvement in internal and external audits and security-related reviews
Consulting with partners and teammates to develop service level agreements for build activities

Identifying, implementing, and guiding others in improvements to build processes and procedures

Explaining security concepts, processes, and procedures to employees and business partners
Articulating project status and issues to teammates and business partners in multiple organizations
Reviewing the work of employees to ensure adherence to processes, procedures, and standards
Working with the Application Security Manager to formulate strategy for the organization
Setting objectives, holding 1:1 conversations, and completing performance reviews for the team

job summary:
Because we seek distinctive candidates, our interview process is thorough and progresses through a series of telephone discussions and in-person meetings. The process allows you to learn more about our Company Group and to find out more about your qualifications as a candidate. Incoming resumes are reviewed against our current needs and candidates with appropriate backgrounds are invited into the recruiting process.

Job Description:
This position is responsible for designing and implementing testing tools and frameworks, developing and writing test plans, automating testing, user acceptance testing, and training and mentoring other team members. You will be part of an engineering team working in various products environments including web application and database components. Your responsibilities will also include aspects of project management, release management, team coordination, and verification and validation of production issues.

Additional Requirements:
? Experience with web applications and databases on multiple platforms and in a multi-user environment? Experience working with software development teams to improve software quality
? Experience working with production support to verify, validated and resolve production issues
? Experience defining, reviewing, and executing system and performance tests
? Java development experience including OOD; scripting language (Perl) experience; SQL knowledge is a big plus
? Experience with commercial testing tools (Rational Quality Manager, Rational Functional Tester)
? Familiarity with both Windows and Linux platforms
? Experience in creating, reviewing and executing both positive and negative scenarios for Products under Test
? Experience estimating testing effort for new projects
? Experience with Agile Testing is a plus
? Experience leading and supporting user acceptance testing

Our Interview Process
HR interview. All candidates meet initially with someone from the our Company Group HR team, either by telephone or in person, to further review background and qualifications and to discuss the specific requirements of the position.
Case interview. The case interview will be with one of our consultants or research team members and will address skills and experience. Additionally, structured thinking, intellectual curiosity, collaborative style and drive for results are evaluated. Interview cases are typically drawn from the interviewers? experiences and may include specific scenarios for those candidates with a focused background.
Final interviews. Final interviews take place in one of our office locations and consist of a round of meetings that include several senior members of our leadership team. Those meetings provide you with the opportunity to ask questions, learn more about our culture and environment and meet our people face to face. We typically make offer decisions shortly after the final round of interviews.

job summary:
Schedule: Full-time Job ID: REQ20004292

POSITION SUMMARY

The IT Senior Software Designer has specific responsibilities leading application development systems object-oriented analysis & design, while interfacing with and steering our vendor partners. Delivery of reliable and secure software solutions meeting the operational specifications required through development of the system logic. Reviewing and guiding the designs of other team members through reviews. This role is empowered and accountable for software systems designs, including loosely coupled designs across verticals and platforms. Triage, debugging, surveillance & monitoring are all key activities for non-development environments. Professional growth of knowledge across both technical and operational domains is required. Expectations include innovation and critical thinking leading to decision making driving towards efficient, simple solutions answering to complex business needs. Partner with fellow COE team members, Planning, Architecture, Infrastructure, and Operational teams towards constructing solutions while progressing towards the approved enterprise technology stack. As a technical leader, this person is able to balance a wide-range of priorities, while considering short-term and long-term implications of each decision for our patients, clients, and team members. This position is also responsible for looking for synergy across Specialty applications, and realizing benefits gained sharing features across home delivery applications. Travel is expected for 10% of their time.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Partner with and technically lead employees and vendor partner consultants from different locations in the development and delivery of Specialty software applications.

Works to develop skills, self-motivated, provides feedback to others, and oversees resolution technical issues and complexities. Identify process improvement and code synergies achieved through innovative ideas and critical thinking.

Consult with business departments as needed. Ensures projects/initiatives are completed within designated time frames and tracks progress reports to management. Acts as liaison between application development teams and across vertical partners to resolve issues, mitigate risks and monitor results.

Leads resolution of urgent and on-going problems to ensure their team’s contribution to overall reliability.

Trusted advisor to Operations and cross-functional team members, providing data and technical insight from the application metrics, pertaining to business impact.

Ensures defects are quickly assessed and/or mitigated and resolved, whether in non-production or production.

Represents Information Technology in cross-functional meetings and projects. Prepares for, implements and communicates new corporate initiatives and processes within assigned team. QUALIFICATIONS

College degree in Information Systems or related field, or equivalent work experience.

Proven technical leadership skills in leading high talent teams in local and remote locations.

7-10 years experience in software development, preferably 1-2 years at ESI or in the PBM industry.

Focus areas for this role will include the contact centers, digital channel engagement, and overall patient and physician engagement. Experience in these areas is a strong plus

Ability to be an agent of change, handle complex technical problems into smaller simple solutions, and create a culture that supports high team morale.

Thorough knowledge of IT concepts, procedures and practices in the Software Development Life Cycle.

Demonstrated knowledge of Agile process and iterative development as it applies to software delivery.

Experienced with n-tier architecture and distributed systems.

Pega, SOFEA/ MULE, J2EE, Oracle forms, Oracle PL/SQL, Eclipse, .NET, iOS, HTML5, design patterns and software development experience is a plus

Advanced problem solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively with other departments to resolve complex issues with innovative solutions.

Demonstrated ability to prioritize work load and meet project deadlines.

Experience with strategic work planning and budgeting.

Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions.

Strong customer service focus.

Excellent communication skills, written and verbal.

Familiarity with health care or PBM industry very helpful.

Willingness to work a flexible schedule to accommodate project deadlines.

Willingness to travel limited amounts.


LI-CK1 ABOUT THE DEPARTMENT

Application Development is focused on creating, testing and deploying client and patient applications that run our renowned customized service delivery system. These teams use traditional and Agile application development disciplines, depending on client, partner and patient requirements. The following functional areas make up the Application Development community\:

Home Delivery & Application Services This team leads application development strategy and execution, and business relationship management for Home Delivery and patient systems. They also manage all centralized functions for quality assurance, release management and production support operations.

Home Delivery Home Delivery oversees application development strategy and execution, including business relationship management for all Home Delivery, Contact and Digital systems.

Pharmacy Benefit Management (PBM) The PBM group is responsible for application design, development and strategy for all core PBM systems including Benefits & Eligibility, Clinical Programs, Coverage Review Determination, Supply Chain, Retail Networks, Client Data, Adjustments and Claims Adjudication. This team partners with Clinical Solutions, Client Services, Supply Chain, Operations, Product and Account Management to bring innovative solutions and service to clients and patients.

Specialty The Specialty team manages application development, strategy and execution, and business relationship management for Specialty systems.
ABOUT EXPRESS SCRIPTS

Advance your career with the company that makes it easier for people to choose better health.
Express Scripts is a leading healthcare company serving tens of millions of consumers. We are looking for individuals who are passionate, creative and committed to creating systems and service solutions that promote better health outcomes.
Join the company that Fortune magazine ranked as one of the 'Most Admired Companies' in the pharmacy category. Then, use your intelligence, creativity, integrity and hard work to help us enhance our products and services.
We offer a highly competitive base salary and a comprehensive benefits program, including medical, prescription drug, dental, vision, 401(k) with company match, life insurance, paid time off, tuition assistance and an employee stock purchase plan.
Express Scripts is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. Applicants must be able to pass a drug test and background investigation.
Express Scripts is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

job summary:
Responsibilities:
The High Performance Computing Specialist works with a small team of specialized individuals responsible for the architecture, design, implementation, and maintenance of software and computing systems in the High Performance Computing Facility (HPCF). Responsible for assisting St. Jude researchers with porting, optimizing, debugging, and modifying their codes to run on HPCF systems. Responsible for performing benchmarking on HPCF systems and tuning system hardware and software for optimal performance. Responsible for developing training materials and documentation relevant to HPCF systems. Assists HPCF systems engineers, HPCF system administrators, storage team, and networking team with day-to-day operations. Maintains a complex range of scientific application software and source code repositories. Minimum Education:
Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or a related field is required.
Doctorate in a field of Computational Science or Computational Mathematics with experience in high performance computing is preferred. Minimum Experience:
Two (2) years of systems administration experience in a high performance computing environment is required.
Previous experience in a scientific research environment is preferred.
Previous experience with parallel software development is preferred.
Practical experience with machine learning and/or statistical techniques such as probabilistic graphical models and Bayesian inference is required.
Practical experience with software development in Java, Jython, Python, or another programming language in common use for imaging analysis is required.
Experience with using and developing macros and/or plugins for common image analysis tools such as Imaris, ImageJ, FIJI, MATLAB, Arivis Vision4D and CellProfiler is highly preferred.
Experience in current imaging techniques, acquisition software, and modeling and analysis of light and electron microscopy image data and modeling and analysis of high-throughput -omics data is highly preferred.
Experience with high performance computing and general purpose GPU computing in support of imaging analysis is highly preferred. EEO:
St. Jude is an Equal Opportunity Employer Not ready to apply? Become a St. Jude Career Insider to stay up-to-date on our opportunities.

job summary:
Altamira brings a commercial mindset to solving the most complex national security problems by delivering mission application development, multi-intelligence analysis, and data science technologies and solutions to the defense, intelligence, and homeland security communities. Altamira’s culture of innovation and excellence, and mid-market-size, positions us as the premier next generation leader bringing technology solutions to mission


Altamira is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.


Altamira Technologies is searching for talented Software Developers to support the US Army’s 513th Military Intelligence Brigade functions as an Echelon-Above-Corps multi-discipline intelligence unit. The GETS mission is to deliver GEOINT toolsets (the development of software tools and tooling that reside on the GETS platform) through an enterprise-grade, Software as a Service (SaaS) platform. GETS supports many agencies and organizations on multiple networks, including every Combatant Command (CCMD) and military branch. All Information Technology (IT) administrative operations, development operations, and end-user support operations reside at Fort Gordon, GA. GETS hardware is currently located in Hawaii, Germany, and Georgia, with other instances planned. From those locations, GETS services are available via network connections worldwide. The specific mission focus pertaining to this performance work statement involves daily operation of GETS IT hardware, integration activities with GEOINT processes, direct end-user support, and development of new automated technical capabilities to satisfy the supported commanders’ stated requirements.


Job Responsibilities


· Provides analysis related to the design, development, and implementation of hardware for products


· Develops test strategies, devices, and systems


· Performs stress and performance tests on a variety of computer hardware including circuit boards, processors and wiring


· Web/widget-based applications for accessing geospatial data


Develop using Java, Javascript, Matlab, IDL, CSS, C++, HTML, Python and other programming languages approved by the government. Web-services shall be compliant with OGC standards.


Active TS/SCI clearance required


Required Experience


· Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, engineering, or related science field


· Experience with GEOINT Enterprise TPED System (GETS) preferred


· Ability to work independently or on a team to solve engineering problems.

job summary:
Job Description:
CACI International, Inc. is seeking a full-time Software Developer to our their team in Augusta, Georgia. As a member of a small development team, the software developer will actively participate in development cycles, work closely with other developers, and participate in the planning and implementation of application architecture decisions. The candidate will work on Fort Gordon, which is located near Augusta and Evans, Georgia. This area boasts a low-cost of living, great schools, beautiful weather, and multiple outdoor activities. Additionally, Augusta is Georgia’s second oldest and second largest city that hosts the annual Masters Golf Tournament.

Duties and Responsibilities :
This position is for a motivated developer who can move from a Java server-side microservices to building an HTML web interface using front-end frameworks such as jQuery, Dojo, Bootstrap or whatever tool is right for the job. One day you might be integrating with third-party web-services, and the next you may be laying out a new web page. Your daily development will be on a multi-network, multi-node enterprise web-application with a large customer base. Since the environment is spread across multiple distinct networks, you will face many challenges that require thought processes that are not typically found within your everyday web-app development. This type of experience cannot be gained in a school setting. So, we are seeking developers who can change direction rapidly, utilize flexible thought processes, and can work in a close-knit team environment to produce the high quality product that our customers expect.

If you have ever felt like your organization was scrimping on hardware or software, you will find it refreshing to sit down in front of three large high-end monitors and the latest computer hardware. You will work closely with a highly responsive system admin staff who go above and beyond the call-of-duty to ensure things are working smoothly and that you, the developer, have everything necessary to be productive.

Experience and insight on architectural improvements and fixes are welcome at all levels of this team. Even junior team members are encouraged to add value wherever possible.

Primary Responsibilities:

Develops software components that require knowledge of Java and related technologies.
Code, test, and debug existing programs and programs in development.
Assist in preparing documentation of software design.
Work closely with other developers from the beginning of a product life-cycle to its release.

Required Qualifications :

TS/SCI Clearance
3+ years of experience with either JAVA or Perl
Ability to analyze and develop software components based on knowledge of Java and another web service technologies.
Must be goal, project, and detail oriented and be willing to work independently as necessary.
Demonstrated knowledge of website and basic application security principles and best practices.
Ability to obtain Sec+ prior to starting

The clearance level required is dependent on the type of clearance supported by our client.

Desired Qualifications :

Experience working with web application development in Linux environments is a plus.
Experience with the following:
Apache htttpd
CSS
MySQL
Postgresql/postgis
XSLT
Geoserver
REST
SOAP

Company Description :
CACI employs a diverse range of talent to create an environment that fuels innovation and fosters continuous improvement and success. Join CACI, where you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. A Fortune magazine World's Most Admired Company in the IT Services industry, CACI is a member of the Fortune 1000 Largest Companies, the Russell 2000 Index, and the S&P; SmallCap600 Index. CACI provides dynamic careers for over 20,000 employees worldwide.

CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Join our award-winning team and work in a challenging, creative environment! Maine Information Network provides digital government services to the State of Maine as InforME. We work closely with state and municipal agencies to manage the state's web portal,www.Maine.gov, and build online government services for citizens and businesses.


We are recruiting for an Application Developer. This position will be part of our development team, reporting to the Director of Development, and is primarily focused on development of new web applications and maintenance of existing web applications. This person is responsible for working on various eGovernment web applications, including eCommerce applications. Will work with project managers, system admin, security analyst, and other developers. Best qualified candidates will have experience working in multiple programming languages (primarily Perl and Java desirable), and multi-tasking in a fast-paced team environment. Important qualities include the ability to work quickly, take initiative, prioritize, pay attention to details, and to understand and work with existing/legacy application code.

job summary:
Software Development

• Develops simple software components to solve complex problems that require solid knowledge of Java and related technologies. Candidate should expect to be responsible for contributing personally in problem definition, design and coding daily

• Develops code that must meet java coding conventions, including well documented public interfaces and internal code, as an example to junior developers

• Periodically leads a small team of junior developers in parallel development of multi-component projects

• Reviews and audits internally developed and third-party code as part of the release management process


Software Design

• Participates in planning and design of new applications, or application subsystems

• Clearly communicates software operations to development team and customers

• Develops public software interfaces (API and SPI) with long-life expectancies for use by local and external developers

• Break down a single complex problem into smaller simplified problems that can be solved incrementally building up to the overall solution


Training and Mentoring

• Contributes to training and mentoring of other developers, through the course of duties

• Stays current with emerging technologies and identifies opportunities to train the team


Software Documentation

• Delivers clear technical documentation along with each software component

In order to qualify for this position, your resume must provide sufficient experience and/or education, knowledge, skills, and abilities, to perform the duties of the specific position for which you are being considered.


• Must have an active/current Top Secret/SCI clearance

• A senior candidate is required to possess a solid understanding of Object Oriented Programming (OOP) design

• Working knowledge of data persistence techniques including at least relational database design and integration with Java is required. Experience with alternative (NoSQL) data systems is desirable

• Working knowledge of SOA concepts, especially asynchronous messaging, is required

• Experience with Linux systems is helpful

job summary:
MacAulay-Brown, Inc. is seeking a full-time Mid-Level Software Developer to join their team in Augusta, Georgia. As a member of a small development team, the mid-level developer will actively participate in development cycles, work closely with other developers, and participate in the planning and implementation of application architecture decisions.


The candidate will work on Fort Gordon, which is located near Augusta and Evans, Georgia. This area boasts a low-cost of living, great schools, beautiful weather, and multiple outdoor activities. Additionally, Augusta is Georgia’s second oldest and second largest city that hosts the annual Masters Golf Tournament.


Work Environment:


This position is for a developer who can move from a Java server-side microservices to building an HTML web interface using front-end frameworks such as jQuery, Dojo, Bootstrap or whatever tool is right for the job. One day you might be integrating with third-party web-services, and the next you may be laying out a new web page. Your daily development will be on a multi-network, multi-node enterprise web-application with a large customer base. Since the environment is spread across multiple distinct networks, you will face many challenges that require thought processes that are not typically found within your everyday web-app development. This type of experience cannot be gained in a school setting. So, we are seeking developers who can change direction rapidly, utilize flexible thought processes, and can work in a close-knit team environment to produce the high quality product that our customers expect.


If you have ever felt like your organization was scrimping on hardware or software, you will find it refreshing to sit down in front of three large high-end monitors and the latest computer hardware. You will work closely with a highly responsive system admin staff who go above and beyond the call-of-duty to ensure things are working smoothly and that you, the developer, have everything necessary to be productive.


Experience and insight on architectural improvements and fixes are welcome at all levels of this team. Even junior team members are encouraged to add value wherever possible.


Primary Responsibilities:

Develops software components that require knowledge of Java and related technologies.
Code, test, and debug existing programs and programs in development.
Assist in preparing documentation of software design.
Work closely with other developers from the beginning of a product life-cycle to its release.

Requirements:


Qualifications:

United States Citizenship is REQUIRED.


3-5 years of experience with several standard object-oriented languages (including 2-3 years using Java).


Able to analyze and develop software components based on knowledge of Java and another web service technologies.


Experience working with web application development in Linux environments is a plus.


Must be goal, project, and detail oriented and be willing to work independently as necessary.


The ability to obtain and maintain a Top Secret security clearance.


Demonstrated knowledge of website and basic application security principles and best practices.


Benefits:

Great medical and dental insurance.


401(k) retirement plan with company match.


Paid vacation, floating holidays and flexible work schedule.

Must be a US Citizen

Project Overview for the J2EE / Java Developer

The Clinical Knowledge Management (CKM) program is part of Veterans Affairs' Connected Health Office (CHO) that provides benefits and services to Veterans. A primary goal of the CHO is to design and implement user-friendly, high-quality mobile devices, software, and services for Veterans and their medical caregivers. Specifically, the CKM program ensures a seamless clinical, portfolio, architectural, and operational optimization of these mobile health applications.

Responsibilities:

The Contracted J2EE / Java Developer shall support mobile health applications by providing maintenance activities including, but not limited to: Reviewing and correcting or replacing of the middle-tier service layer for VistA data integration Developing or maintaining of shared MAE services (e.g., MDWS and VistA exchange) to support mission objectives Writing scalable web services in Spring / MVC Develop and configure J2EE Containers

Experience with Git and distributed version control systems

UI layer : Knowledge of mobile applications development (IOS and/or Android), Backbone, Node.js, Angular.js, Cordova (Phonegap), Xcode (Objective-C/Swift), JS/CSS/HTML5, and JQuery
Databases: Oracle, MySQL, MongoDB
Development build tools: Git, Ant/Maven, Gradle, Jenkins, Docker, continuous integration

Working with legacy RPC-based systems

Bachelors degree in Information Technology, Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics or related field

job summary:
We believe that , when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny. We are driven by our purpose to champion every client’s goals with passion and integrity. We respect and appreciate the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. We challenge conventions strategically to create value for our clients, our firm and the world. We live and bring to life the concept of ‘own your tomorrow’ every day. We champion our employee strengths, guide their development, and invest in their long-term success. We hire optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people with the desire to help our clients and one another succeed.

As a company, we were established by Chuck over 40 years ago to champion Main Street over Wall Street, and to help Americans transform themselves from earners to owners. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future.

Our Opportunity:
The Core Middleware Platforms team within Schwab designs, develops and supports Middleware platforms responsible for a variety of mission-critical platforms, including:


Authentication Platform
Enterprise Service Bus
Enterprise Messaging Service

What you’ll do:
You should be a programmer/engineer at heart and someone who truly enjoys designing (and building) solutions using the latest technologies, patterns, and architectural concepts. You'll be the supporting the overall technology direction within the group and working with the various engineers on the latest patterns/concepts and technologies. You should be a recognized technical contributor and have a special passion for developing common enterprise services. You will actively collaborate with the development teams and technology leaders across Schwab technology on product development, best practices, and automation.

What you have:
You must have the ability to be self-directed and interact with small and large teams. You should be comfortable in a fast-paced technology environment that continually embraces new technologies and techniques. You will have experience with the following:


IIS (7.5 or 8 preferred)
Visual Studio (2010, 2012 or 2013)
Experience with web services (SOAP, REST), XML, JSON, and XSLT preferred.
Hands-on capabilities with modern web technologies (AngularJS, MVC, Web API, jQuery, other…), a plus
Experience with implementing different unit testing and continuous integration/continuous delivery frameworks
Leadership capabilities
Strong interest in industry trends, technology innovation, and best practices
Experience with Agile Development Practices, particularly Scrum, a plus
Well versed in DevOps principles and practices, a plus
BS/BA/MS in Computer Science or equivalent discipline
Professional experience building distributed, scalable enterprise-class applications using Java

What you’ll get:
Everyday Wellness: Healthy Rewards, Onsite Fitness Classes, Healthy Choices, Wellness Champions

Financial Fitness: 401k Match, Employee Discounts, Personalized advice, Brokerage discounts

Work/Life Balance: Sabbatical, New Mothers returning to work Program, Tuition Reimbursement Programs, Time off to volunteer

Inclusion: Employee Resource Groups, Commitment to diversity, Strategic partnerships

Not just a job, but a career, with an opportunity to do the best work of your life

Learn more about Life@Schwab .

Charles Schwab & Co., Inc. is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversifying its workforce. It is Schwab's policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, legally protected medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, military status, citizenship status or any other status that is protected by law.

job summary:
Company Description

Dematic is a global engineering company that provides a comprehensive range of intelligent warehouse logistics and materials handling solutions. With a global knowledge network of more than 4,000 skilled logistics professionals, Dematic is able to provide customers with a unique perspective in world-class materials handling solution design. Our commitment to solution development, combined with engineering centers and manufacturing plants in North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, ensures Dematic has the range and capability to provide reliable, flexible, cost-effective solutions globally. Our successful track record has led to the development and implementation of more than 5,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium, and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors. Dematic generates a global business volume of approximately $1.8 billion.


Job Description

Dematic Reddwerks is seeking a Software Engineer at our office in Austin, Texas. At Dematic Reddwerks, we view order fulfillment within the four walls of a distribution center as a single, interconnected process. Our Warehouse Execution Software (WES), powered by Distribution Science ®, combines execution with intelligence. We synchronize the discrete and low-level processes to create a real-time decision engine that drives labor and equipment at the highest efficiency. Our software provides customers the operational agility they need to handle the demands of an omni-channel environment.


Education/Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills:


Minimum Education : Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Technology or a substantially equivalent field.

Participate in troubleshooting of customer support issues
Investigate and fix bugs
Develop isolated small- to medium-sized features for the Dematic Reddwerks WES platform
Work on development tasks under the supervision of an experienced engineer

0-4+ years Java development experience
Proven experience meeting deadlines
Demonstration of previous, independent project work
Object-oriented design experience
Database experience (preferred)
Full-stack development experience (preferred)
Skills:

Strong J2EE foundation
Strong computer science background (algorithms, databases, data structures, operating systems, etc.)
Willingness and ability to independently learn and contribute in a challenging environment
General independence and self-motivation

General Requirements

Job Family Responsibilities:


Assists in routine design, maintenance, enhancement, testing implementation, and support of software. Provides assistance with the development of software test requirements for routine modules under development, may execute routine test specifications. Assists in providing estimates for routine modules under development, and may estimate own work. Provides assistance in reviewing routine customers standards specification and other documentation to determine software engineering requirements.

Performs basic tasks and functions for professional field of work. Seeks advice and guidance on non-routine or problem areas from others. Identifies problems as they occur and takes appropriate steps to solve them in situations where the problem is not difficult or complex.


Education:


Typically BS/BA in related discipline or advanced degree, where required. Certification may be required in some areas.

Typically up to 2 years of successful experience in related field and successful demonstration of Key Responsibilities and Knowledge as presented above. Advanced degree MAY be substituted for experience, where applicable.

Contacts are primarily with immediate manager and others in the group.

job summary:
Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.


Software Engineering 

professionals work across the Service Delivery Lifecycle to analyze, design, build, test, implement and/or maintain multiple system components or applications for Accenture or our clients.


Job Description


Java Technology Platform professionals develop application using Java technology. The Java Technology Platform is a computing environment that allows for developing and executing applications for small and mobile devices (consumer and embedded systems), PC desktops and medium to large businesses.


Java and JVM Languages provide experience and skills using Java and other JVM programming languages to develop and deploy applications. Demonstrate experience with core language features and the Java SE core libraries.


A professional at this position level within Accenture has the following responsibilities: Adapts existing methods and procedures to create possible alternative solutions to moderately complex problems. Understands the strategic direction set by senior management as it relates to team goals. Uses considerable judgment to determine solution and seeks guidance on complex problems. Primary upward interaction is with direct supervisor. May interact with peers and/or management levels at a client and/or within Accenture.Determines methods and procedures on new assignments with guidance. Decisions often impact the team in which they reside. Manages small teams and/or work efforts (if in an individual contributor role) at a client or within Accenture. 

Basic Qualifications


3+ years of Java development experience and JVM technologies


Ability to meet travel requirements, when applicable


Bachelors degree or equivalent


Professional Skill Requirements


Proven success in contributing to a team-oriented environment Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment Desire to work in an information systems environment Excellent leadership, communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills


Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).


Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.


Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.


Equal Employment Opportunity

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.


Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.


Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.
