You won’t just keep up, you’ll break new ground.

There are hundreds of opportunities to make your mark on technology and life at American Express. Here’s just some of what you’ll be doing:

Taking your place as a core member of an agile team driving the latest development practices

Writing code and unit tests, working with API specs and automation

Identifying opportunities for adopting new technologies

At the core of Software Engineering

Every member of our team must be able to demonstrate the following technical, functional, leadership and business core competencies, including:

Agile Practices

Porting/Software Configuration

Programming Languages and Frameworks

Business Analysis

Analytical Thinking

Business Product Knowledge
Why American Express

Talk to our people and you’ll find out what we’re really all about. Open, creative, risk-taking, collaborative and innovative are just some of the expressions you’ll hear. It’s our culture that makes American Express an outstanding place to work, and a big part of why we regularly win best workplace awards all over the world. If you’re ready to take on a challenge and make an impact, you owe it to yourself to launch or grow your career here.

Job Description:
Client is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative payment products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team!
One of the big bets for the company is Commercial Lending. The newly formed team will pave the way for the Company for launching new and innovative lending products across Lines of Business and markets worldwide. You will be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team responsible for building world class, high performance platform for the Commercial Lending business using cutting-edge technology and data.
You will be challenged with identifying innovative ideas and proofs of concept to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers and generate new revenue streams for the Company. The Engineer will be responsible for designing and developing the brand new Commercial Lending Platform through world class technology. You need to have broad knowledge of the technology world and be willing to take up the challenge of leveraging the latest technologies in building the Platform. You should have an entrepreneurial spirit and the drive to bring new products to life. You must have the desire to continuously test and learn by putting in the right levers and gauges in place to monitor progress and performance. You need to be able to thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment with cross functional stakeholders working toward a common goal.

core member of an agile team that drives user story analysis and elaboration, designs and develops software applications, and tests and builds automation tools
perform hands-on software development and testing
core member of an agile engineering team that designs and develops software applications

Choice Hotels International is a cutting edge software development company that develops software to manage, reserve and book hotel rooms in its portfolio of 11 branded hotels. Choice provides innovative enterprise SOA solutions based on Open Source and AWS technologies. Choice is a tightknit team where you can enhance your skills in an environment that emphasizes creativity, sharing, teamwork, professionalism, and outstanding quality software. You will work alongside some of the most talented and dynamic professionals as they work to provide exceptional solutions to the many challenges our business and franchises face. If you are bright, driven, enjoy working with the latest technologies and have the right blend of business acumen, technically savvy and customer-facing skills then this opportunity is for you. If you are willing to work hard, looking for a place to learn and grow, and have the skills we would like to hear from you.


The cool stuff you do:

Writes correct and clean code with guidance; consistently follows stated best practices and Choice SDP and guidelines.

job summary:
Albertsons-Safeway Company is one of the largest food and drug retailers with 2,300+ stores. The Albertsons-Safeway family of brands includes some of the most prominent brands in food retailing, with a growing base of loyal shoppers. Thanks to the professionalism, diversity, spirit and friendliness of our people, we have locations across the U.S.


The Information Technology Department has an opening for a Programmer/Analyst. This position is located in Phoenix, Arizona.


Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

• Determines and implements the most efficient and cost effective solution.

• Act as a liaison between clients and application area.

• Lead troubleshooting and root cause determination and proactively identify opportunities to fix issues.

• Must be able to make sound decisions based on incomplete information, under pressure and maintain project focus.

• Developing strong working relationships at levels in the business and IT community to ensure overall project satisfaction.

• Provide application design guidance and consultation, utilizing a thorough understanding of applicable technology, tools and existing designs.

• Analyze highly complex business requirements.

• Design and create technical specifications to design or redesign complex computer platforms and applications.

• Analyze problems outlined by Business Systems Analysts in terms of detailed technology requirements and capabilities.

• Ensure logic and design is in alignment with core architecture of the system/application.

• Analyze existing product software and recommends modifications which will enhance operating capacity and meet

business requirements.

• Verify program logic by overseeing the preparation of test data, testing and debugging of programs.

• Oversee overall systems testing and the migration of platforms and applications to production.

• Guide new documentation, departmental technical procedures and user guides.

• Develop positive and sustainable partnerships with business stakeholders, Enterprise Architecture, and other partners across the enterprise to create strategic roadmaps and detailed project plans for business and IT driven initiatives.

• Support, maintain, enhance existing applications

• Deliver full development lifecycle for new applications

• Investigate and resolve application issues encountered in live production

• Create and maintain application documents, especially for newly acquired applications


Qualifications:

• 4 year degree (Computer Science, Information Systems) and/or equivalent combination of education or work experience.

• 5+ years of programming experience including experience integrating applications across diverse technical platforms.

• 5+ years of VB6 experience and strong VBA programming experience (Access/Excel)

• 3+ years relevant work experience in a C-based programming environment

• Proficient with coding and analysis in C#, VB.net, and PL/SQL

• Experience in Java design and programming, a huge plus

• Strong experience with database technologies (Oracle, DB2, SQL Server).

• Strong experience with the full software development lifecycle and software development methodologies (Waterfall, Agile).

• Excellent organizational and troubleshooting skills with attention to detail.

• Strong knowledge of programming documentation processes/procedures.

• Strong ability to understand client expectations and to resolve issues that may affect delivery.

• Ability to build constructive relationships with senior application architects and project managers and gain their trust.

• Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively in a matrixed organization.

• Strong ability to mentor, coach and train lower level programmer analysts.

• Self-starter, with a demonstrated ability to learn beyond formal training with a strong aptitude for delivering quality products.

• Excellent communications skills (written and oral), customer service and problem solving skills.

• Ability to contribute to making critical and successful decisions under pressure.

• Must possess superior problem solving skills, be action-oriented and decisive.

• Excellent organizational change management skills and the ability to balance competing priorities in meeting business deadlines.

• Excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal communications skills.

• Ability to effectively articulate and present complex concepts, ideas and strategies to business end-users

• Extensive creativity, drive, high energy level, and the ability to self-manage.

• Adeptness with asynchronous programming, a plus.

• Background in Microsoft Silverlight, a plus

• Self-sufficient, and willing to learn other programming languages/ platforms

• Excellent oral and written English communication skills.


How to Apply: Interested candidates are encouraged to submit a resume by visiting careersatsafeway.com

We believe that building successful relationships with our customers and our communities is only possible through the diversity of our people. A diverse workforce leads to better teamwork and creative thinking, as well as mutual understanding and respect.

job summary:
There are two openings for this position, both located in Oklahoma City, OK!

The Flight Dynamics Software Engineer will be responsible for the design and implementation of simulation software solutions, software integration of COTS software packages and support of the organization’s software maintenance activities. The Flight Dynamics Software Engineer will develop and/or enhance real-time, man-in-the-loop, flight dynamics simulation software models for military or civilian aircraft, both fixed and rotary wing. The Flight Dynamics Software Engineer will work closely with other members of the software development team, project management and product management to ensure that projects are executed with a high level of technical excellence; with demonstrable functional and technical quality; and within allotted time frames. The Flight Dynamics Software Engineer will work with a diverse group of software engineers, spanning multiple technologies and solution domains.

Responsible for planning, prioritizing, organizing and performing technical work and ensuring the integrity of significant and diverse projects; provides input to the analysis and conceptual design of proposed projects.

Coordinates design activity with other engineers on technical aspects relating to the project; proactively spreads knowledge within the team and demonstrates software development best practices within projects.

Actively supports the company’s software engineering processes and standards.

Establishes and maintains thorough and accurate documentation of all work; writes and demonstrates for others proper technical specification documentation.

Implements, unit tests, debugs and integrates code of high complexity; tests to verify the functionality, accuracy, and efficiency of developed or enhanced software; analyzes results for conformance to plans and specifications making recommendations based on the results; develops and initiates design changes or enhancements as necessary.

Must possess the following skills:
Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Aeronautical or Aerospace Engineering required

Level of Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in flight dynamics simulation

Experience developing real-time, man-in-the-loop, flight simulation software models for military and/or civilian aircraft

Experience in correcting/enhancing flight dynamics simulation software models on existing flight simulators/training devices

Ability to effectively analyze existing flight simulator software models and modify them to address discrepancies

Ability to modify existing/legacy flight simulator software written in FORTRAN

Skilled with object oriented programming (OOP) concepts and principles

Expert level understanding of C++

Experience with one or more scripting languages (e.g., Lua, Batch, PERL, Java script)

Experience with the Visual, Studio Integrated Development Environment (IDE)

Experience with Team Foundation Server (TFS) for source control and issue tracking

Knowledgeable in the .Net Framework

Experience developing GUI apps (Windows Forms, Qt, WPF)

Experience integrating third-party libraries/APIs

Familiar with multi-threaded programming, and related development and debug of multithreaded processes

Understanding of SQL database concepts

Ability to effectively debug complex code

Good communication skills, both oral and written

Good interpersonal and communication skills; ability to communicate effectively with peers, clients, and management.

The ability to prepare and present, in an organized and coherent manner, design disclosures and status review data to peers and to management

job summary:
OPPORTUNITY: We are seeking a Sr. Java Developer to be a part of a senior engineering team building a Cloudfinder application! The team follows a modified SCRUM agile process, with time boxed sprints.

Cloudfinder is one of the premier solutions for cloud-to-cloud backup, providing backup, point-in-time restore, and instant search of data for Google Apps, Office 365, and Salesforce. It is a horizontally scaled application to handle petabytes of data and is written in a combination of Java and C#.

The ideal candidate must be a hands-on, get-it-done type that will support their team in any way possible. Through pragmatic application of agile principles and good management, they are able to take the technical vision of the company and translate that into predictable, sustainable execution, delivering demonstrably high quality software concurrent with an energetic engineering culture that retains talent and breeds innovation.

We are looking for full-time members of the team, who are energized by hard problems and have an unquestioning commitment to delivering exceptional products!


REQUIREMENTS:

• 5+ years experience with Java in a web-based environment

• Strong Java SE experience

• Strong experience in OOP/OOD

• Working knowledge of the Spring Framework

• Experience in small latency asynchronous systems

• Familiarity with programming specifics like asynchronous I/O, concurrency, distributed data system

• Test-driven development with JUnit; behavior-driven development

• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience

• Knowledge of Maven/Gradle

• Experience building web services (SOAP and ReST)

• Experience working in an Agile Environment

NICE TO HAVE:

• M.Sc. or PhD

• StackOverflow or GitHub accounts

• Experience with Elasticsearch, MongoDB/NoSQL, S3, messaging brokers

• Experience with micro services


COMPANY: eFolder has built the most comprehensive cloud data protection and business continuity solution portfolio available on the market. Our solutions provide protection/DR for email, laptops, tablets, phones, files, NAS/SAN devices, servers, VMs, desktops, and SaaS cloud apps (e.g., Office 365, Google Apps, Salesforce). We further enable realtime sync and access to data across any device on almost any platform. These solutions are enabled by four key software product lines: Anchor, BDR, Cloudfinder, and Replibit. With this unique position in the market, we are experiencing rapid growth, and have a deep vision of future innovation driven by both technical proficiency and a passion for quality products. Come join us as we disrupt this very competitive market at scale!

job summary:
Job Number: 01222552


Key Role:

Support DoD Red Team efforts, conducting covert-focused target penetration testing of DoD installations through focused threat-based methodologies as a simulated adversary to expose and exploit vulnerabilities to improve the Cyber readiness of DoD Combatant Commands, Services, and Agencies (CC/S/A). Develop attack vectors, conduct reconnaissance, collect open-source intelligence, enumeration, and foot printing of target networks and services, and develop exploit payloads and system backdoors. Provide support to the DoD client in Red Team penetration testing using tools and techniques to conduct Cyber vulnerability and penetration testing of exercise and test events. Participate in event planning stages to develop Cyber assessment plans and conduct no-notice penetration tests against DoD installations. This position is located in Wichita, KS.


Job Requirements
Basic Qualifications:

-5+ years of experience with technical Cybersecurity

-3 years of experience with Red Team or penetration testing or offensive Cyber testing

-Experience with Bash scripting and basic Perl, Java, or Python

-Experience with malware analysis tools

-Knowledge of DoD networks and communications, Windows and UNIX, TCP/IP, networking, and Kali Linux

-Knowledge of the functionality and capabilities of computer network defense technologies, including Router ACLs, firewalls, IDS/IPS, antivirus, and Web content filtering

-Ability to perform in a military environment

-Ability to travel for approximately 25% of the time to stateside and international locations

-Ability to achieve a passing grade on a client qualification exam within 3 months of hire

-Top Secret clearance


Additional Qualifications:

-Experience with multi-vector penetration testing using Core Impact preferred

-Ability to work in a fast-paced environment

-TS/SCI clearance preferred

-BA or BS degree

-8570 IAT Level II Certification and CNDSP Auditor Level I or Level II preferred

-CEH and Offensive Security Certification, including OSCP, GPEN, or GWAPT


Clearance:

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Top Secret clearance is required.

job summary:
Looking for a rewarding and challenging career with a dynamic, growing organization? Phacil is your answer. We have an immediate need for a Remedy Administrator to support an important government customer in Wichita, KS


Clearance Level (Required to Start): Secret


Daily Job Responsibilities:

Assist with working with the Program Management Office in the integration of Remedy solution with the deployed Remedy solution in support of the migration of the network
Assist in the provisioning and management of the Remedy processes, structure and foundation data in the Remedy solution.
When directed the contractor shall assist the government in developing interim solutions for routing workflow between systems.
Advise & assist the PMO in all aspects of managing & developing the entire Remedy environment.
Implement changes to the existing Remedy environments at the request of the customer to include but not limited to:
Advise, implement, support and maintain all components of the Remedy system, at the request of the Government, including: Asset Management, Problem Management, Knowledge Management, Change Management and Service Level Management.
Advise, implement, support and maintain changes needed to leverage the CMDB to the customers advantage & to meet desired informational goals.
Advise, implement, support and maintain a process to facilitate enterprise sustainment.
Incorporate government directed process and workflow changes for all installed modules.
Advise, implement and maintain templates, where applicable, within the remedy environment to minimize user effort & data input.
Create or maintain all current remedy project documents. Documents include but are not limited to the Functional Specification, As Built documents, documents needed to fulfill Information Assurance (IA) requirements, standard project management documents and documents needed for the proper management & execution of this task.
Participate in the Vulnerability Lifecycle Management Process to include installing and managing any patches required by the Remedy system including Remedy patches, BMC service packs, Java, Apache Tomcat, Microsoft patches etc.
The contractor shall maintain an official configuration file on each configuration item within the managed environment.
Complete Request for Changes (RFCs), trouble tickets, and CAB actions as required to document new requirements, deviations, waivers, and technical order changes.
Maintain network diagrams, physical and logical topologies, system context diagrams etc. and update them within five (5) work days after a change has occurred.
Assist the Government in creating and executing a training program for Cyber Operators to include curriculum formulation, documentation, training artifacts both electronic & printed and any other output necessary to implement said training program.
Provide general Remedy systems, management, administration and support.
Implement all service pack migrations or Remedy upgrades as deemed necessary.
Assist the Government in completion of C&A; using the DIACAP process to include creation and maintenance of any IA artifacts or C&A; documentation necessary to submit a package for ATO consideration.
Provide customer support to include application training, troubleshooting customer issues, and addressing customer incidents.
Develop incident/change templates
Provide support to architecture team when required
Develop and run custom reports
Required Skills:

Understanding of DoD network systems and processes
Minimum of 5 years work related IT experience commensurate with tasks outlined in this service area.
Knowledge of IT governance and operations.
Knowledge of BMC Remedy operations and support.
Minimum Required Skills:

Ability to monitor systems and understand status updates.
Ability to deal with customers that may not be network savvy.
Ability to work in and enter tickets in Remedy ticketing systems.
Preferred Skills:

2 years extensive DoD enterprise experience
Degree: BS Preferred


Certification Requirements: ITILv3 certification, BMC Certified Professional, Security + (CE)


Travel Requirement: 5% if that much


Additional Information:


Mostly Monday-Friday, 8-9 hours per day, First and Second shift (may be adjusted in the future), to include weekend work when needed.

Are you looking for an exciting job where you can put your skills, talents and education to work at a company you can feel proud to be a part of? Do you want a workplace that will challenge you and offer you opportunities to learn and grow? A professional position at Xcel Energy could be just what you’re looking for.


Xcel Energy has an exciting opportunity for an Electric EMS/SCADA Programmer II or Electric EMS/SCADA Programmer III to join our team. This position may be located in Golden, Colorado or Amarillo, Texas with preference given to the Golden, Colorado location. The successful candidate will be placed in this job family based on their qualifications. The description below reflects the responsibilities for the Electric EMS/SCADA Programmer II. Higher levels within this job family may have additional responsibilities.


Summary

Position provides support for Electric Energy Management/Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (EMS/SCADA) systems. Works with specific applications within EMS, including Generation Dispatch and Control (GDC), Transmission Security Management (TSM), DispatcherTraining Simulator (DTS), and OATI webAccounting and webTrans. Provides support to entry-level programmers.


Essential Responsibilities

Designs, tests, and develops critical enhancements for the EMS/SCADA environment. Proficient in understanding how various applications support Xcel Energy's physical operations.
Work with the management team, users, and junior development staff to ensure business requirements are met in a timely and unobtrusive manner.
Works with the integration team to support integration of software into the test and production environments.
Gather, create, and document user requirements and work with the Electric EMS/SCADA team to ensure requirements are met. Ensure technical documentation is created and maintained and that standard change and release processes are supported.
Keep abreast of technology, industry and business trends to ensure that appropriate technologies are being considered in the planning process that meet organizational requirements.

Requirements for Level II

High school diploma or equivalent
Associate's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline (3 years experience developing in and/or supporting an Electric EMS/SCADA environment may substitute for the degree)
At least 3 years experience supporting Electric Energy Management/Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (EMS/SCADA) systems
Technical skills with regard to the following technologies: Oracle, GE Power On Reliance, PI, SQL Server, Unix OATI webAccounting/webTrans, and Windows
Object oriented programming languages C/C++, Java, XML

Preferred

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline
Appropriate technical and continuing education

Must be available to be on-call during nights and weekends.


Requirements for Level III

High school diploma or equivalent
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related technical field and appropriate technical and continuing education (6 years experience developing in and/or supporting an Electric EMS/SCADA environment may substitute for the degree)
5 years supporting Electric Energy Management/Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (EMS/SCADA) systems
Technical skills with regard to the following technologies; Oracle, C, Unix and Windows
Object oriented programming languages C/C++, Java
Ability to be on-call during nights and weekends

Preferred

Technical skills with regard to the following technologies; ICCP, PI, Oracle, SQL Server, GE Power On Reliance, Unix, webAccounting, and webTrans
Familiarity with one or more of the following: C/C++, Java, XML

Must be available to be on-call during nights and weekends.


_______________________________________________________________________________________________


As a leading combination electricity and natural gas energy company, Xcel Energy offers a comprehensive portfolio of energy-related products and services to 3.4 million electricity and 1.9 million natural gas customers across eight Western and Midwestern states. At Xcel Energy, we strive to be the preferred and trusted provider of the energy our customers need. If you’re ready to be a part of something big, we invite you to join our team.


Posting Notes: CO - Golden || CO - Golden; TX - Amarillo || United States (US) || Utilities and Corporate Servic || 41510:IO Transmission || Full-Time || Non-Bargaining ||


Requisition Number: 6115


Equal Opportunity Employer: Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran


Individuals with a disability who need an accommodation to apply please contact us at recruiting@xcelenergy.com

job summary:
Job Description:
Make a Difference!
We are looking for talented Engineer/IT professionals that are excited about using the latest technologies available to create critical data analysis and alerting capabilities for the dynamic US intelligence community. Answer the call to serve issued by President Obama at South by Southwest 2016 and join a highly talented engineering team developing solutions for intelligence community needs. As the threats against our nation and world increase, we need your expertise to apply industry tools and products to meet these challenges. Our client engagement processes underlay the way we collaborate, operate, and deliver value to create mission critical software applications.

We need top developers that are highly self-directed and motivated, collaborate respectfully with their teammates, and always keep the user mission first. We have a long track record delivering critical applications on-time and on-schedule. You will be part of a responsive team where communication skills and the ability to solve problems are critical to our success. You can expect to work with highly motivated teammates that will support and push you, and will expect reciprocal action on your part. This environment provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose us, and make delivering meaningful, innovative solutions part of your extraordinary career.

Offices for this opportunity are in Aurora, CO. We believe in a healthy home/work balance; both of our locations offer a wide variety of activities to balance with your work life. Check us out at http://www.caci.com/bit-systems/.

Job Responsibilities

Provide service design and development expertise in support of new application development and maintenance
Use industry proven design patterns and open source tools, staying educated on current technology trends
Support the entire product lifecycle to include systems engineering and requirement analysis, technical design, system integration, implementation and deployment
Translate customer needs into project requirements
Identify, mitigate, and resolve technical risks and issues
Use test driven and iterative development methodologies
Participate in a responsive team where communication skills and the ability to solve problems are critical to our success
Brief status and provide software demonstrations to government and community stakeholders
Translate customer and user needs into project requirements

Education and Experience

Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, related technical field or equivalent and 2 to 4 years of related experience in software development or related technical fields.
Education and Experience equivalents are considered on a case-by-case basis

Attributes and Skills

Excellent technical acumen and self-motivated with creativity to tackle hard-to-solve problems
Ability to work independently and within a distributed team environment
Strong interpersonal, teamwork, problem solving, organizational and multi-tasking skills
Comfortable working with a diverse set of contractors and customer personnel
Strong written and verbal communications skills
Experience with both Object Oriented and Functional Programming approaches
Experience with Web services and service-based development
Experience conducting rapid trade studies and analysis of competing technologies
Understanding of 12 Factor Architectures and how applications can transition to the Cloud
Understanding of agile development practices, including Agile Scrum
Experience with configuration management processes and tools
Understanding of identity management, access, and authorization solutions (PKI, LDAP)
Knowledge of Intelligence Community (IC) processes, policies and guidance

Technology Expertise

Use of Atlassian agile management tools, e.g. JIRA, Confluence
Strong Java skills, preferably including JEE and REST web services
Experience with Oracle, MySQL, or Postgres
Experience with Hadoop, Accumulo and Map Reduce techniques, including Apache Spark
Experience with stream data management and processing technologies, e.g. Kafka and Storm
Familiarity with NoSQL databases like MongoDB or Cassandra
Familiarity with open source indexing technologies, e.g. Elasticsearch, SolR
Understanding and use of public specifications such as OGC and W3C
Familiarity with community or enterprise JBoss
Experience with Git source code configuration management and Maven build automation tools
Hands-on experience with Jenkins continuous integration and automated test tools, e.g. Selenium and JUnit
Java Instrumentation and Performance Monitoring
Strong understanding of Linux operating systems in virtual environments such as Amazon Web Services

Security Clearance

TS/SCI Clearance with current SSBI or US Citizen clearable to TS/SCI with CI Poly

BIT Systems Inc. is a CACI company.

The commitment of our employees to "Engineering Results" is the catalyst that has propelled BITS to becoming a leader in software development, R&D;, sensor development, and signal processing. Our engineering teams are highly adept at solving complex problems with the application of leading-edge technology solutions, empowering our employees to make better mission-critical decisions. We provide the tools you need to succeed.

Our work environment is mission-focused but relaxed; is professional but casual; and requires individual responsibility within team constructs. We offer an environment where business casual and shorts/flip flops work side by side successfully; we let you be you.

BIT-Systems is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

job summary:
IQNavigator is seeking a Java developer to help support and enhance IQN Intelligence, our reporting and analytics suite for contingent workforce management. We are building high-performance operational reporting, embedded interactive visualization, and advanced machine intelligence capabilities supporting efficient and effective contingent workforce management.


We are seeking a Java developer to complement our group of database developers, data scientists, data analysts, and visualization experts. We seek well-rounded and versatile developers willing to take on a wide variety of full-stack development projects. You might take on such diverse tasks as building an interactive actionable dashboard showing up-to-date workforce information, fixing a bug in the existing reporting UI, deploying a predictive model into production, or containerizing our reporting components. A thirst for learning as well as a willingness to tackle whatever needs doing will be key to your success.


Key Responsibilities

Build data-driven capabilities into the IQNavigator platform using Java and other software programming languages
Work with product owners to understand user requirements and translate them into application features
Diagnose and resolve defects in the current reporting and analytics offering
Deploy predictive models into production, with the guidance of data scientists
Build suggestions and recommendations based on artificial intelligence into the application
Incorporate flexible user-configurable embedded visualization capabilities into our analytics suite
Unit test all software you develop
Participate in reviews of other team members’ code
Collaborate with the entire IQN Intelligence team to develop product strategy for delivering market leading reporting and analytics
Skills, Knowledge and Experience

Experience as a software programmer with exposure to diverse tools and languages including Java, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and SQL
Solid foundational understanding of object-oriented programming and relational data base systems
Understanding of unit testing techniques
Conceptual understanding of service oriented architectures
Ability to quickly learn new tools, technologies, and methods
Familiarity with Agile software development practices
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Interest in leveraging data assets to transform business processes
Desired Experience

Experience with any or all of the following tools: Grails, Git, JIRA, Tableau
User interface design experience
Interest in or knowledge of machine learning techniques, natural language processing, full text search, and/or advanced statistical methods
Desired Competencies

Ability and desire to drive change
Must be an outstanding communicator and team player who demonstrates attention to detail, and who also understands how to ensure finance initiatives that support the long term strategy of the business
High-energy, can-do attitude; comfortable working in a high-performance, entrepreneurial, open-door environment
Outstanding executive presence and presentation skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Culture


At IQNavigator, we cultivate a positive work environment and are passionate about who we are and what we do. We are looking for talented, driven, and adaptable people who will contribute to vision, mission and our future! Ideal candidates are intensely curious about globalization and technology, exhibit a can-do attitude, and approach their work with vigor and determination. Candidates should have demonstrated the ability to learn quickly and work effectively in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment, and be excellent at multi-tasking.

job summary:
:

994480

Introduction

Staples is the world’s largest office products company and a trusted source for office solutions. The company provides products, services and expertise in office supplies, copy & print, technology, facilities and breakroom, and furniture. Staples invented the office superstore concept in 1986 and now has annual sales of $22 billion. With more than 70,000 associates worldwide, Staples operates in 26 countries throughout North and South America, Europe, Asia and Australia, making it easy for businesses of all sizes, and consumers. The company is headquartered outside Boston. More information about Staples (NASDAQ: SPLS) is available at

www.staples.com/media

.

Position Summary

Part of the Staples Customer Service organization, the Application Development Team works closely with functional business users to identify process improvement needs. The team delivers applications so the business units may increase productivity and control information. A Web Application Developer has multi-site responsibilities supporting the Staples network of contact centers. This role designs, builds and manages applications for contact center needs, demonstrating expert abilities in application design and delivery.

Primary Responsibilities

Create custom web pages, desktop (Windows) Automation Processes, Microsoft Access databases, SQL stored procedures, and desktop applications to support the efficiency and profitability goals of Staples Customer Service. Plan, design, develop, test and deploy data driven web and desktop applications using ASP.Net and MS SQL development tools. Utilize AJAX, AngularJS, Java script, CSS, HTML and VB.Net coding as needed to enhance application functionality and the end user experience.

Meet with project stakeholders to gather and document requirements, create design documentation and mockups, coordinate user acceptance testing, and create training documentation for supported applications.

Partner with Customer Service DBAs to design and implement transactional data models. Identify and develop various techniques to facilitate information storage. Build and maintain data interfaces and databases to automate and simplify processes. Ensure applications meet data accuracy, performance, usability, and functionality requirements.

Possess knowledge of a variety of databases and applications used by the organization like ticket tracking, attendance, and call tracking. Demonstrate an understanding of the business metrics and data points. Your expertise will be from both a business and technical perspective.

Use development best practices and migration procedures when building Web applications. Add and update application code, forms and files to Team Foundation Server as part of the Team’s Source code repository.

Participate in and deliver results for ad-hoc, analysis, and web projects as assigned. Projects will require intermediate technology skills and contact with the Business Analysis and Project Services teams.

Fulfill ad-hoc requests from customers.

Qualifications

Basic

This role may be performed in the following locations: Aurora, CO; Halifax, Nova Scotia; and Florence, KY.

Associate or Technical Degree or a minimum of 5 years working in an Information Technology discipline.

1 year of experience working with MS Access databases and Visual Basic (VBA) applications.

3 years of experience designing and creating web based applications using ASP.NET and Visual Studio.

1 year of experience building Automation for clients.

3 years of experience querying relational databases and working with transactional models. Successful experience building productive relationships with peers, DBAs, and other technology professionals.

Preferred

Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology studies.

Communication skills that demonstrate confidence with technology and business process. Must be able to express complex technical concepts verbally and in writing.

Flexibility and ability to juggle multiple projects and changing priorities in a fast paced, customer centric environment.

Experience with building of ASP.net RESTful APIs

Experience with AngularJS

Experience supporting Web Servers running IIS and ASP.

Experience developing stored procedures for data interfaces.

Experience with call center technologies such as Avaya, Kana, Aspect, Moxie, etc.

Knowledge of Contact Center business processes. Contact Center experience.

Experience with Agile Scrum methodology or JIRA

Experience with Jama

Experience with Jia or other Enterprise oriented desktop Automation

OPPORTUNITY: We are seeking a Sr. Java Developer to be a part of a senior engineering team building a Cloudfinder application! The team follows a modified SCRUM agile process, with time boxed sprints.

Cloudfinder is one of the premier solutions for cloud-to-cloud backup, providing backup, point-in-time restore, and instant search of data for Google Apps, Office 365, and Salesforce. It is a horizontally scaled application to handle petabytes of data and is written in a combination of Java and C#.

The ideal candidate must be a hands-on, get-it-done type that will support their team in any way possible. Through pragmatic application of agile principles and good management, they are able to take the technical vision of the company and translate that into predictable, sustainable execution, delivering demonstrably high quality software concurrent with an energetic engineering culture that retains talent and breeds innovation.

We are looking for full-time members of the team, who are energized by hard problems and have an unquestioning commitment to delivering exceptional products!


REQUIREMENTS:

• 5+ years experience with Java in a web-based environment

• Strong Java SE experience

• Strong experience in OOP/OOD

• Working knowledge of the Spring Framework

• Experience in small latency asynchronous systems

• Familiarity with programming specifics like asynchronous I/O, concurrency, distributed data system

• Test-driven development with JUnit; behavior-driven development

• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience

• Knowledge of Maven/Gradle

• Experience building web services (SOAP and ReST)

• Experience working in an Agile Environment

NICE TO HAVE:

• M.Sc. or PhD

• StackOverflow or GitHub accounts

• Experience with Elasticsearch, MongoDB/NoSQL, S3, messaging brokers

• Experience with micro services


COMPANY: eFolder has built the most comprehensive cloud data protection and business continuity solution portfolio available on the market. Our solutions provide protection/DR for email, laptops, tablets, phones, files, NAS/SAN devices, servers, VMs, desktops, and SaaS cloud apps (e.g., Office 365, Google Apps, Salesforce). We further enable realtime sync and access to data across any device on almost any platform. These solutions are enabled by four key software product lines: Anchor, BDR, Cloudfinder, and Replibit. With this unique position in the market, we are experiencing rapid growth, and have a deep vision of future innovation driven by both technical proficiency and a passion for quality products. Come join us as we disrupt this very competitive market at scale!

job summary:
SpatialKey is looking for an exceptional Back End Software Engineer to join its lean and nimble team!

SpatialKey is a Software as a Service (SaaS) mapping and data visualization platform. We create applications that let enterprise customers take large amounts of data they might have about their businesses and turn it into information they can use. Currently we are focused on the insurance industry and creating apps giving these customers the ability to know how many buildings they have in the path of an oncoming hurricane, or what the flood risk is at a given location, or how much damage the worst theoretical tornado strike can do to their portfolio, etc.

We’re a 100% remote company of about 35 people, with about half of that being dev. You’ll be part of an agile server software team that brings our product to life by implementing services and application programming interfaces using a wide range of Open Source technologies that our incredible front end developers utilize to create amazing user experiences. If you have a desire to develop and ship complex enterprise applications in a team environment, let’s chat.

The following are some of the primary responsibilities:

Write, maintain and debug production level server Java code
Learn new technologies and think about how they may or may not fit
Collaborate closely with QA, PM, UX, and other Software Engineers
Understand and improve upon current build/deployment practices
Identify opportunities for improvements and optimizations
Advocate for the performance and integrity of solutions
Troubleshoot customer support issues

Why work with us?

We are committed to building a high growth business alongside very supportive clients, who are also pursuing competitive edge and innovation. We have been in business since 2011; and have strong brand recognition and equity, a profit-positive balance sheet, an exciting growth story, and a proven vision. We are committed to an autonomous and remote work environment with headquarters in Denver, but with our entire team working remotely across the globe. We are growing deliberately by carefully hiring the best people in the industry.

About Us

SpatialKey is reinventing the way insurers transform data into actionable intelligence. SpatialKey solutions amplify the value of insured data and expert content through unmatched user experiences and breakthrough geospatial business intelligence. Through focused analytics and agile visualizations, SpatialKey helps more than 100 insurers understand global risk accumulations and composition, respond to live catastrophe events, and manage exposure proactively at the point of underwriting.

About the job

There is a lot to learn and a lot of opportunity to grow with SpatialKey as the company grows. We are looking for someone with a solid base of programming knowledge, a love of open source software and a continuous drive to learn something new daily. Don’t worry if you are not familiar with some of our core areas we will mentor and assist but be ready for the challenge. Here are some of the potential areas where you may spend your time:


SpatialKey Server: Using Java, Hibernate and Spring to build out REST-based services for the SpatialKey front end.
Geocoding integration: Working with industry leading geocoding solutions (we have worked with MapQuest, TomTom, Google, Geocommons) and integrating them into SpatialKey.
SpatialKey Cloud Analytics: Creating analytical services used to to process large amounts of custom data leveraging the latest parallel processing tools & techniques.
And much more…

We love technology and new stuff excites us. We are constantly pushing the envelope to find new ways to innovate and make our product better. That includes you finding new technology to improve our products. Open source is an essential element of our DNA. Our current stack is Linux, Apache, Tomcat, PostgreSQL with PostGIS, MongoDB, GridGain, Jenkins, Maven, Flex, React.js, Flux Pattern, Browserify, Phantom.js, and Leaflet. We may not know everything about each of these, but we’re constantly listening, learning, teaching, and contributing.

About you

Being a distributed team takes great communication skills. You can’t be afraid to raise your hand if you’re stuck on something. We need someone who has the ability to work independently and function with little direction. That doesn’t mean we will leave you on an island. You will be surrounded by strong technical resources willing to help and answer questions but ultimately the work you deliver is your responsibility. You should be able to work autonomously and in a small agile team environment. You also need to be self-motivated and continuously keeping up with new technology to drive innovation within SpatialKey.

Required experience:

Ability to be proactive and work independently with limited direction
Good communication skills and ability to function in a remote environment.
Experience with Java (highly recommended), C#, Python or similar language.
Good understanding of object oriented programming, including abstraction, polymorphism and inheritance.
Excellent problem solving capabilities

(understands how to translate a problem into code)

Linux command line experience
Hands-on experience with IntelliJ, Eclipse or other IDE development tools
Experience in software development environments using the Agile approach
Experience with distributed source control systems such as Git or Mercurial
Writing unit tests in testing framework such as JUnit.

Preferred Experience:

Experience with Hibernate
Experience with Spring

(Understanding IoC Inversion of Control & Dependency Injection)

Spring Boot
PostgreSQL & PostGIS or GIS related experience (GDAL, ESRI...etc)
Experience developing, testing and consuming REST APIs
SQL and RDBMS skills – able to generate and troubleshoot queries.
Experience and knowledge of cloud enabled services / applications (Amazon EC2)
Experience with Continuous Integration and related tools (Jenkins, Hudson, CruiseControl, Maven)
Test driven development

job summary:
Location(s): CO - Golden; TX - Amarillo


Are you looking for an exciting job where you can put your skills, talents and education to work at a company you can feel proud to be a part of? Do you want a workplace that will challenge you and offer you opportunities to learn and grow? A professional position at Xcel Energy could be just what you’re looking for.


Xcel Energy has an exciting opportunity for an Electric EMS/SCADA Programmer II or Electric EMS/SCADA Programmer III to join our team. This position may be located in Golden, Colorado or Amarillo, Texas with preference given to the Golden, Colorado location. The successful candidate will be placed in this job family based on their qualifications. The description below reflects the responsibilities for the Electric EMS/SCADA Programmer II. Higher levels within this job family may have additional responsibilities.


Summary

Position provides support for Electric Energy Management/Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (EMS/SCADA) systems. Works with specific applications within EMS, including Generation Dispatch and Control (GDC), Transmission Security Management (TSM), DispatcherTraining Simulator (DTS), and OATI webAccounting and webTrans. Provides support to entry-level programmers.


Essential Responsibilities

Designs, tests, and develops critical enhancements for the EMS/SCADA environment. Proficient in understanding how various applications support Xcel Energy's physical operations.
Work with the management team, users, and junior development staff to ensure business requirements are met in a timely and unobtrusive manner.
Works with the integration team to support integration of software into the test and production environments.
Gather, create, and document user requirements and work with the Electric EMS/SCADA team to ensure requirements are met. Ensure technical documentation is created and maintained and that standard change and release processes are supported.
Keep abreast of technology, industry and business trends to ensure that appropriate technologies are being considered in the planning process that meet organizational requirements.

Requirements for Level II

High school diploma or equivalent
Associate's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline (3 years experience developing in and/or supporting an Electric EMS/SCADA environment may substitute for the degree)
At least 3 years experience supporting Electric Energy Management/Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (EMS/SCADA) systems
Technical skills with regard to the following technologies: Oracle, GE Power On Reliance, PI, SQL Server, Unix OATI webAccounting/webTrans, and Windows
Object oriented programming languages C/C++, Java, XML

Preferred

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline
Appropriate technical and continuing education

Must be available to be on-call during nights and weekends.


Requirements for Level III

High school diploma or equivalent
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related technical field and appropriate technical and continuing education (6 years experience developing in and/or supporting an Electric EMS/SCADA environment may substitute for the degree)
5 years supporting Electric Energy Management/Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (EMS/SCADA) systems
Technical skills with regard to the following technologies; Oracle, C, Unix and Windows
Object oriented programming languages C/C++, Java
Ability to be on-call during nights and weekends

Preferred

Technical skills with regard to the following technologies; ICCP, PI, Oracle, SQL Server, GE Power On Reliance, Unix, webAccounting, and webTrans
Familiarity with one or more of the following: C/C++, Java, XML

Must be available to be on-call during nights and weekends.


_______________________________________________________________________________________________


As a leading combination electricity and natural gas energy company, Xcel Energy offers a comprehensive portfolio of energy-related products and services to 3.4 million electricity and 1.9 million natural gas customers across eight Western and Midwestern states. At Xcel Energy, we strive to be the preferred and trusted provider of the energy our customers need. If you’re ready to be a part of something big, we invite you to join our team.

job summary:
At CARDFREE, we ensure Merchant Mobile Apps delight users and keep them engaged. From innovative solutions for Offers and Loyalty to Stored Value and Order Ahead, we build products that power user engagement and measure key metrics so merchants can sharpen their mobile business. We have won the best Mobile Startup Award with the MEA, listed as part of the Red Herring Top 100 North America Award, and also powering the Dunkin Donuts new mobile application launch.

As a part of the Engineering team, you will be building scalable solution that millions of users will be using as their primary mobile interface to submit and pay for their orders. We nurture creativity and encourage individuality to generate a great work environment with personality. In turn, we are seeking talent that doesn’t always want to do it the corporate way but strives to create innovative solutions that amaze and have some fun while doing it.

Experience working with AWS technologies

job summary:
IQNavigator is seeking a Java developer to help support and enhance IQN Intelligence, our reporting and analytics suite for contingent workforce management. We are building high-performance operational reporting, embedded interactive visualization, and advanced machine intelligence capabilities supporting efficient and effective contingent workforce management.


We are seeking a Java developer to complement our group of database developers, data scientists, data analysts, and visualization experts. We seek well-rounded and versatile developers willing to take on a wide variety of full-stack development projects. You might take on such diverse tasks as building an interactive actionable dashboard showing up-to-date workforce information, fixing a bug in the existing reporting UI, deploying a predictive model into production, or containerizing our reporting components. A thirst for learning as well as a willingness to tackle whatever needs doing will be key to your success.


Key Responsibilities

Build data-driven capabilities into the IQNavigator platform using Java and other software programming languages
Work with product owners to understand user requirements and translate them into application features
Diagnose and resolve defects in the current reporting and analytics offering
Deploy predictive models into production, with the guidance of data scientists
Build suggestions and recommendations based on artificial intelligence into the application
Incorporate flexible user-configurable embedded visualization capabilities into our analytics suite
Unit test all software you develop
Participate in reviews of other team members’ code
Collaborate with the entire IQN Intelligence team to develop product strategy for delivering market leading reporting and analytics
Skills, Knowledge and Experience

Experience as a software programmer with exposure to diverse tools and languages including Java, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and SQL
Solid foundational understanding of object-oriented programming and relational data base systems
Understanding of unit testing techniques
Conceptual understanding of service oriented architectures
Ability to quickly learn new tools, technologies, and methods
Familiarity with Agile software development practices
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Interest in leveraging data assets to transform business processes
Desired Experience

Experience with any or all of the following tools: Grails, Git, JIRA, Tableau
User interface design experience
Interest in or knowledge of machine learning techniques, natural language processing, full text search, and/or advanced statistical methods
Desired Competencies

Ability and desire to drive change
Must be an outstanding communicator and team player who demonstrates attention to detail, and who also understands how to ensure finance initiatives that support the long term strategy of the business
High-energy, can-do attitude; comfortable working in a high-performance, entrepreneurial, open-door environment
Outstanding executive presence and presentation skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Culture


At IQNavigator, we cultivate a positive work environment and are passionate about who we are and what we do. We are looking for talented, driven, and adaptable people who will contribute to vision, mission and our future! Ideal candidates are intensely curious about globalization and technology, exhibit a can-do attitude, and approach their work with vigor and determination. Candidates should have demonstrated the ability to learn quickly and work effectively in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment, and be excellent at multi-tasking.

DISH is a Fortune 200 company with more than $15 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. job summary:
Responsibilities will include empowering the Granicus Team to use Salesforce.com efficiently and effectively. Working with stakeholders across the company, the Business Systems Developer will support the day-to-day activities of business users in Salesforce.com. This will include improvements for the overall instance of Salesforce.com, including process, training, reporting, dashboards, automation and integrations. The Business Systems Developer will also assist in ensuring that all data is clean, accurate and relevant. The entry-level Business Systems Developer must develop a practical understanding and the skill to perform the normal day-to-day administration of Salesforce.com, as well as the ability to drive the business processes throughout the company.


What You Get To Do:

Provide day-to day end user support of the Salesforce.com application
Perform administrator functions such as user management, profiles, roles, permissions, rules, assignment rules, queues, licenses, capacity and storage management
Implement logic-based business processes to increase efficiency and data quality
Manage dashboards, reports, forms templates, page layouts workflows and approvals, create and maintain customer objects, object relationships, standard and custom fields
Develop small custom code applications built on the Salesforce.com platform
Support and improve all Salesforce.com integrations, including marketing automation, project management and financial systems
Maintain and ensure consistent data quality across Salesforce.com and other company systems
What We Need In You:

Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or related field preferred
Experience with programming languages, Java is a plus
Self-starter with a passion for learning new things
Ability to work digitally with team members across different physical locations
Excellent analytical, written and oral communication skills
Flexibility and ability to deal with ambiguity
Ability to adapt to the changes of a rapidly growing company
Salesforce Certification is a plus
Currently, Granicus manages the world’s largest and most reliable legislative content network—containing more than 5 million government media files and public records and maintaining a 99.98% uptime track-record. We also have 20,000+ government users currently leveraging our technology to successfully run their day-to-day government information tasks including webcasting public meetings, managing and delivering legislative information, collaborating with citizens, and more.


Granicus is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer!

job summary:
Colorado Interactive, a subsidiary of NIC Inc., the nation’s leading provider of eGovernment services (NASDAQ: EGOV), is seeking a Web Applications Developer to help with designing and implementing new web applications and enhancements to existing web-based projects and service implementations for the state of Colorado’s web portal ( www.colorado.gov ).


Responsibilities:

• Collaboration with PMO to define requirements and use cases for a new application or enhancement to an existing application.

• Designing and implementing new web applications and enhancements to existing web applications.

• Development of unit tests and functional tests for web applications.

• Generation of technical documentation and support procedure documentation.

• Code reviews

• Preparation of production deployment plans for new release of applications.

• Development of standalone processes for support purposes or for scheduled delivery of required business artifacts.

• Periodic assistance with diagnosing production issues with an application.


Qualifications:

• Should have 3-5 years of experience developing web applications in a java based environment

• Strong analytical and problem solving skills.

• Strong oral and written communications skills.

• Ability to work independently or as part of a team involving project managers, designers and QA.

• Ability to meet deadlines and adjust to changing priorities in a fast paced environment.

• Must be able to contribute to advancements in process documentation and advancement of tools used in the development and support processes.


Required Skills:

• Java based web development using the servlet API or standard java MVC frameworks.

• Solid understanding of databases, including the ability to construct complex SQL queries, creation and modification tables, understanding of constraints and a basic understanding of query optimization (preferably in oracle).

• Strong knowledge of JDBC or Hibernate

• Web service production and consumption (REST/SOAP)

• High level understanding of networking concepts

• Understanding of web application security principles

• Ability to work comfortably in a *nix environment and solid command line skills

• Experience with JUnit or TestNG

• Version control experience with Git, Mercurial or Subversion


Optional Skills:

• Maven

• Jenkins

• Ability to create and modify shell scripts

• Knowledge of Perl or Python

• Experience building E-Commerce applications.

• Puppet

• Knowledge of Spring Frameworks

• Experience Developing in an Agile Environment


Benefits:

• Competitive compensation program

• No-cost group medical/dental insurance

• Stock purchase plan

• Matching 401(k) contributions with 100% vesting

• Disability insurance

• Life insurance

• Company wellness program

• Casual and fun office environment

• Paid State holidays and vacation

• Tuition reimbursement


NIC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

job summary:
The tension between possibility and practicality is what we resolve. At Arrow, we've come full circle- from being a parts supplier at the physical heart of the radio business to being a global partner in the ongoing transformation of the most complex and exciting business on the planet. We are visionaries. Innovators. Mentors. In order to thrive and survive in today's marketplace, we anticipate what will come tomorrow for our forward-thinking partners.


Arrow serves as a supply channel partner for over 100,000 original equipment manufacturers, contract manufacturers and commercial customers through a global network of more than 460 locations in 56 countries.


We are a Fortune 150 company with over 17,000 employees globally. Headquartered in beautiful Denver, Colorado, with offices worldwide.


Five Years Out is a community of builders, designers, engineers and imaginers who navigate the path between possibility and practicality. Creating the future of everything from coffee makers to cars. Are you one of them? Then you're working with us.


Stay connected with us through social media

Twitter

Instagram

Facebook

Glassdoor


Arrow Electronics Inc. Digital Group has experienced years of rapid growth, and is now home to the world's largest online inventory of traceable factory stock published directly by electronic component manufacturers and their franchised distributors. The Arrow Digital Group is looking for individuals that utilize their skill and experience to solve challenging problems and to continue this rapid business growth. The individuals will be members of an exciting, lively, and highly skilled team interested in creating solutions that are developed with superb quality and design.


Java Developer - Search Focus

Our newest team member will be responsible for the design, implementation and maintenance of highly scalable software solutions. The ideal candidate is someone with a strong sense of good design principles, coding practices, and an analytical mind for approaching and solving problems logically and thoroughly. We are looking for someone who is excited about being a member of our team, and contributing to the team's collective growth and success. We want someone who will question and prod to find the best solution to a problem, and carry that solution through to production.

Our team is highly energetic, collaborative, and passionate about our work. We pride ourselves on adherence to Agile programming methodologies, resulting in well-functioning processes that consistently deliver on-time, on-target releases while minimizing unnecessary meetings and busywork. We mix up responsibilities, never allowing our team members to become siloed, and are always exploring the latest technologies. We're looking for a team member who wants to work hard, find innovative solutions, learn more about the leading edge of web technology, and see results in real-world applications.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Assist with technical design for solutions to business requirements
Develop server APIs to support client applications
Perform complex, intensive business-to-business integration development
Troubleshoot and fix defects
Perform performance tuning
Document designs and implementation REQUIRED SKILLS:

Strong Java / J2EE background in a team environment
Solid understanding of object-oriented design and practices
Experience implementing Solr or Elasticsearch
Demonstrated ability to develop scalable solutions from business requirements
Experience designing and developing relational database-driven applications (MySQL or Oracle preferred)
Experience working with Git repositories
Excellent written and verbal communication skills PREFERRED SKILLS:

Experience with Hibernate 4, JPA 2.0 and Spring 4.x frameworks
Experience with the Agile development methodology
Knowledge of build systems such as Maven and Ant
Experience with testing frameworks like JUnit and JMeter
Familiarity with a Mac or Linux development environment
Experience with writing basic SQL statements

What is in it for you?

Training
Skills development
Performance coaching
Medical, dental, vision, paid time off, 401k domestic partners program and more.
Community involvement opportunities FUNCTION: Engineering

At Arrow, we are driving innovation and choice by offering employees a variety of benefits designed to keep you and your family physically and financially healthy.

Java Developer – Search Focus

We are looking for someone who is excited about being a member of our team, and contributing to the team's collective growth and success. We want someone who will question and prod to find the best solution to a problem, and carry that solution through to production.

job summary:
OPPORTUNITY: We are seeking a Sr. Java Developer to be a part of a senior engineering team building a Cloudfinder application! The team follows a modified SCRUM agile process, with time boxed sprints.

Cloudfinder is one of the premier solutions for cloud-to-cloud backup, providing backup, point-in-time restore, and instant search of data for Google Apps, Office 365, and Salesforce. It is a horizontally scaled application to handle petabytes of data and is written in a combination of Java and C#.

The ideal candidate must be a hands-on, get-it-done type that will support their team in any way possible. Through pragmatic application of agile principles and good management, they are able to take the technical vision of the company and translate that into predictable, sustainable execution, delivering demonstrably high quality software concurrent with an energetic engineering culture that retains talent and breeds innovation.

We are looking for full-time members of the team, who are energized by hard problems and have an unquestioning commitment to delivering exceptional products!


REQUIREMENTS:

• 5+ years experience with Java in a web-based environment

• Strong Java SE experience

• Strong experience in OOP/OOD

• Working knowledge of the Spring Framework

• Experience in small latency asynchronous systems

• Familiarity with programming specifics like asynchronous I/O, concurrency, distributed data system

• Test-driven development with JUnit; behavior-driven development

• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience

• Knowledge of Maven/Gradle

• Experience building web services (SOAP and ReST)

• Experience working in an Agile Environment

NICE TO HAVE:

• M.Sc. or PhD

• StackOverflow or GitHub accounts

• Experience with Elasticsearch, MongoDB/NoSQL, S3, messaging brokers

• Experience with micro services


COMPANY: eFolder has built the most comprehensive cloud data protection and business continuity solution portfolio available on the market. Our solutions provide protection/DR for email, laptops, tablets, phones, files, NAS/SAN devices, servers, VMs, desktops, and SaaS cloud apps (e.g., Office 365, Google Apps, Salesforce). We further enable realtime sync and access to data across any device on almost any platform. These solutions are enabled by four key software product lines: Anchor, BDR, Cloudfinder, and Replibit. With this unique position in the market, we are experiencing rapid growth, and have a deep vision of future innovation driven by both technical proficiency and a passion for quality products. Come join us as we disrupt this very competitive market at scale!

job summary:
Job Description:
Make a Difference!
We are looking for talented Engineer/IT professionals that are excited about using the latest technologies available to create critical data analysis and alerting capabilities for the dynamic US intelligence community. Answer the call to serve issued by President Obama at South by Southwest 2016 and join a highly talented engineering team developing solutions for intelligence community needs. As the threats against our nation and world increase, we need your expertise to apply industry tools and products to meet these challenges. Our client engagement processes underlay the way we collaborate, operate, and deliver value to create mission critical software applications.

We need top developers that are highly self-directed and motivated, collaborate respectfully with their teammates, and always keep the user mission first. We have a long track record delivering critical applications on-time and on-schedule. You will be part of a responsive team where communication skills and the ability to solve problems are critical to our success. You can expect to work with highly motivated teammates that will support and push you, and will expect reciprocal action on your part. This environment provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose us, and make delivering meaningful, innovative solutions part of your extraordinary career.

Offices for this opportunity are in Aurora, CO. We believe in a healthy home/work balance; both of our locations offer a wide variety of activities to balance with your work life. Check us out at http://www.caci.com/bit-systems/.

Job Responsibilities

Provide service design and development expertise in support of new application development and maintenance
Use industry proven design patterns and open source tools, staying educated on current technology trends
Support the entire product lifecycle to include systems engineering and requirement analysis, technical design, system integration, implementation and deployment
Translate customer needs into project requirements
Identify, mitigate, and resolve technical risks and issues
Use test driven and iterative development methodologies
Participate in a responsive team where communication skills and the ability to solve problems are critical to our success
Brief status and provide software demonstrations to government and community stakeholders
Translate customer and user needs into project requirements

Education and Experience

Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, related technical field or equivalent and 2 to 4 years of related experience in software development or related technical fields.
Education and Experience equivalents are considered on a case-by-case basis

Attributes and Skills

Excellent technical acumen and self-motivated with creativity to tackle hard-to-solve problems
Ability to work independently and within a distributed team environment
Strong interpersonal, teamwork, problem solving, organizational and multi-tasking skills
Comfortable working with a diverse set of contractors and customer personnel
Strong written and verbal communications skills
Experience with both Object Oriented and Functional Programming approaches
Experience with Web services and service-based development
Experience conducting rapid trade studies and analysis of competing technologies
Understanding of 12 Factor Architectures and how applications can transition to the Cloud
Understanding of agile development practices, including Agile Scrum
Experience with configuration management processes and tools
Understanding of identity management, access, and authorization solutions (PKI, LDAP)
Knowledge of Intelligence Community (IC) processes, policies and guidance

Technology Expertise

Use of Atlassian agile management tools, e.g. JIRA, Confluence
Strong Java skills, preferably including JEE and REST web services
Experience with Oracle, MySQL, or Postgres
Experience with Hadoop, Accumulo and Map Reduce techniques, including Apache Spark
Experience with stream data management and processing technologies, e.g. Kafka and Storm
Familiarity with NoSQL databases like MongoDB or Cassandra
Familiarity with open source indexing technologies, e.g. Elasticsearch, SolR
Understanding and use of public specifications such as OGC and W3C
Familiarity with community or enterprise JBoss
Experience with Git source code configuration management and Maven build automation tools
Hands-on experience with Jenkins continuous integration and automated test tools, e.g. Selenium and JUnit
Java Instrumentation and Performance Monitoring
Strong understanding of Linux operating systems in virtual environments such as Amazon Web Services

Security Clearance

TS/SCI Clearance with current SSBI or US Citizen clearable to TS/SCI with CI Poly

The commitment of our employees to "Engineering Results" is the catalyst that has propelled BITS to becoming a leader in software development, R&D;, sensor development, and signal processing. Our engineering teams are highly adept at solving complex problems with the application of leading-edge technology solutions, empowering our employees to make better mission-critical decisions. We provide the tools you need to succeed.

Our work environment is mission-focused but relaxed; is professional but casual; and requires individual responsibility within team constructs. We offer an environment where business casual and shorts/flip flops work side by side successfully; we let you be you.
