job summary:
Job Description

The J2EE Solution Architect will be responsible for the realization of detailed design and implement architectural strategies for the application, guides development teams with technical implementation details surrounding Program level technology architecture for our client. The Solution Architect will partner with business stakeholders and solutioning team, as well as external vendors and consulting partners, to help determine best-in-class enterprise implementation in accordance with client’s application development and operations standards.

The individual should act as a Subject matter Expert in architecting solutions using J2EE technologies to solve common problems related to multiple modules of the overall solution. (Ex: Application Security, centralized logging, messaging, REST, SOA).
Work with other client technology teams and partners to identify and support cross-business and cross-functional opportunities for collaboration, standardization and reuse of enterprise technologies. Should be able to evaluate new products using execution model for proof of concepts and evaluate the product feasibility for the program.
Should have ability to present to executives architecture concepts and design decisions at right level.
Adhere to the highest degree of professional standards and strict confidentiality in matters that require discretion.
Facilitate sessions with various developers and provide application level architecture direction.
Promote continuous integration and unit testing to all module teams.
Need to be hand-on in anticipating performance issues and guide both on-shore and off-shore teams with best coding practices.
Need to be hands on in identifying performance bottlenecks and help team to produce better code artifacts.
Understands high availability needs and come up with tactical and strategic solutions to meet high availability needs.
Perform other job-related duties as necessary Qualifications

The individual should have demonstrated as a Senior Architect in J2EE space for past 3 years. The individual has to be a Subject Matter Expert in one or many of these technologies.

Bachelor's degree in computer science or related fields.
10+ years of J2EE programming experience
3+ years of experience in architecting J2EE application
Experience in Event Driven Architecture.
Experience with RESTful architecture and SOA architecture.
Experience in designing solutions using in industry standard open source frameworks, such as Spring framework, Hibernate, Logging Frameworks, Object caching, integration patterns.
Experience in core java development using concurrent threading model, JVM tuning, GC management. Experience in Database sql tuning, non-sql DB is a plus.
Expertise in one or more of the J2EE containers (Tomcat, JBoss, Websphere, Weblogic)
Strong mobile application architecture and development background with modern JavaScript framework and Mobile development platform, including CSS5, HTML5, JQuery, AngularJS, Node.js.
Must have work as architect for high volume high throughput applications in the past.
Should have excellent presentation skills and ability to express conceptual and physical architecture to directors and other key strategic partners.
Experience in ‘Media and Entertainment’ industry desirable.

Additional Information

Must be local or will to relocate to Orlando, FL.

These enhance their ability to be successful through world-class software solutions and leading-edge infrastructure. Description
Sr. Specialist Java Applications Developer

As a Java Applications Developer, the candidate will be responsible for the design, development, and unit testing for our J2EE and Web based Application. The lead will be accountable for building Java/J2EE Applications for Broker Dealer Services. Additionally, you will play a critical IT leadership role during requirement, testing, and implementation phases. You will work closely with IT management and product owners to identify and specify complex business requirements and processes. Additionally, you will work with our architecture team to research and evaluate alternative solutions and make recommendations.

education level/skills required / respon: Experience in Java or similar OO language (C#, C++). Founded in 2013, TE2 is headquartered in San Diego, CA with additional offices in Orlando, FL and Cork,...
job summary:
Founded in 2013, TE2 is headquartered in San Diego, CA with additional offices in Orlando, FL and Cork, Ireland. TE2’s platform, the Experience Operating System (eOS), is a leader in the growing customer experience management market. This market is expected to reach $20B by 2020. The eOS provides consumer facing enterprises an engine to drive personalization, recommendations and commerce for, the physical world, in real-time. We believe every consumer facing business with physical locations will benefit from a machine-learning based platform that provides deep insights and recommendations for how consumers interact and ultimately spend with global brands.

With accelerating advancements in IoT, cloud, mobility, analytics, payments, and machine learning, industries like Hotels/Resorts, Universities, Hospitals, Theme Parks, Casinos, Cruise Ships, and Quick Service Restaurants are quickly recognizing the benefits and massive potential of personalization. Featured TE2 customers include Sea World, Arby's, Cedar Fair, Merlin Entertainment, Grupo Vidanta and Arizona State University, among others.

Position Overview

As a Software Engineer at TE2, you will be part of the core engineering team that is designing and developing key components of TE2’s eOS (Experience Operating System) that drives personalization, recommendations and commerce for the physical world, in real-time.

Some of what you will be working on:

Enabling personalized guest experiences based on specific location using location-based technologies (BLE Beacons, GPS, and WiFi Position Triangulation)
Perfecting turn-by-turn navigation and indoor wayfinding
Enabling augmented reality
Mapping global places and venues
Developing software to revolutionize the integrations between eOS and a wide variety of customer systems of record
Building frameworks which will enable rapid deployment of new customers and real-time monitoring of the environment
Integrating with payment platforms to reduce the friction and allow easier access to personalized experiences
Exposing our customers' product catalogs through mobile apps tightly integrated with location services
Providing analytics on user browse, search, and purchasing activity that drive personalized recommendations
Enabling redemption of experiences through integrations with barcode scanners, ticketing systems, and wearable devices
Implementing the latest in service-based authentication security protocols and solutions
Capturing, storing, and protecting profile data in order to build an overall snapshot of a consumer
Mapping and determining relationships amongst various user identities whether it be individually, between people, or groups of people (Identity Management)

Technical challenges you may tackle include:

Contributing to our platform architectural transformation into a modern, scalable microservices foundation
Assisting in the design and implementation of a secure, restful API Gateway with routing to platform micro-services
Helping to design and implement a distributed trace logging for all eOS micro-services
Contributing to data modeling and migration from single-tenant Couchbase databases into a multi-tenant cluster
Implementing complex domain-model mappings between our client-facing APIs and customer systems of record
Implementing our product suite in ways that provide simple, usable common functionality, while allowing customer-specific added functionality
Continuously deploying our software into a cloud-based platform using tools such as Jenkins, Docker, and Kubernetes
Building reusable, multi-tenant software components that integrate with content management systems, commerce systems, and other industry-specific platforms

Some of the technologies you will be working with:

Java 8
AWS, Cloud Elastic Architectures
Multiple Apache projects, including: ServiceMix, CXF (JAX-RS), ActiveMQ
Spring Boot
Microservice Technologies: Eureka, Ribbon, Hystrix
RESTful / JSON web API service layerCouchbase (NoSQL) data persistence and cache layer
Continuous delivery integration through Jenkins pipelines

Your background


6+ years of related work experience
BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (preferred, but not necessary)
Experience in Java or similar OO language (C#, C++)
Strong grasp of OO programming principles
Experience with REST APIs
Willingness and ability to embrace an AGILE development methodology

Perks & Benefits


Paid time off
Paid holidays
Equity opportunity
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Life insurance and disability benefits
​401K

Contact Us

If you don't have an up-to-date resume completed, but have a Stack Overflow, Github, LinkedIn profile (or similar), please pass that along. We are looking forward to hearing from you.

TE2 is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

**Note to third-party recruiters. At this time, we are not working with any outside recruiting agencies.

job summary:
JT3 is dedicated to being the nation's premier provider of joint test, tactics, and training support. We provide engineering and technical support to four of the western test ranges for the U.S. Air Force and Navy under the Joint Range Technical Services Contract, better known as J-Tech. The company is a joint venture of Raytheon and AECOM and is supported by 9 teammate companies. Together we develop and maintain realistic integrated test and training environments. We prepare our nation's war-fighting aircraft, weapons systems, and air crews for today's missions and tomorrow's global challenges.


We are recruiting an experienced Java Software Developer to work within a research and development engineering group to be responsible for a wide variety of tasks. The primary tasking will be the implementation of various aspects of a distributed data processing system. We are looking for a dynamic, hardworking software developer who works well in both theoretical and practical domains as part of an iterative process to create innovative solutions for a multitude of data processing challenges.


SPECIFIC FUNCTIONS/DUTIES


This position requires the following abilities:

Create and manage Spring Boot micro-services with REST endpoints
Design interactive Web User Interfaces (UIs) for data processing input and analysis
Write and conduct unit tests to ensure developed code executes as intended
Implement algorithms as described by domain experts
Prototype code to determine design feasibility
Design and apply new system architectures for data processing and analysis systems
Embrace opportunities to learn new technologies and implement solutions to new subject matter
Write requirements documents, theories of operation, etc.
Apply sound system engineering principles
Proficiency with JDK8, Spring Boot, XML/JSON, SQL and other relevant technologies
GENERAL FUNCTIONS/DUTIES


Provides software and systems engineering services, generally within a work unit or group.

Advises team and project managers on technical problems
Interacts with customers and project managers on a regular basis
Works independently of direct supervision on projects of high complexity
Uses judgment and initiative in developing complex analytical and computational technologies and methodologies for solving problems, which may be technically unique to the industry
Interprets customer requirements, develops and analyzes the most appropriate approach to solve technical problems
Develops the design of the system/software and the associated design documentation. Prepares and conducts design reviews
Implements the design through software coding or hardware and documents the implementation appropriately
Plans and executes unit, integration, and systems testing
Participates in the maintenance and sustainment activities of the system/software
May provide work direction or other guidance to lower level technical staff
Establishes and maintains positive customer relations
May support pursuit of new business efforts, lead proposal efforts, and act as a technical consultant
Performs other duties as assigned
Additionally, depending upon experience, the following may also apply:

Provides software and systems engineering services, generally as a senior member of a work unit or group
Manages software/system projects, and provides guidance to the technical staff
Uses broad judgment in defining and solving technical or managerial issues of the highest complexity or of far reaching significance
Captures and manages customer requirements at a system level, develops and analyzes the most appropriate approach to solve complex technical problems
Functions as the System Architect overseeing the overall design and configuration management of systems
Manages the maintenance and sustainment activities of the system/software
EDUCATION, TECHNICAL AND WORK EXPERIENCE


Required:

Must have a Bachelor's Degree in an associated discipline and at least 6 years of related experience or have a Master's Degree in an associated discipline and at least 2 years of experience, or a PhD in an associated discipline
Must have experience with computer based systems and applications
Must have experience with systems engineering and software development lifecycles
Must use superior communications skills, both verbal and written, in day-to-day project activities as well as in briefing customers and in writing reports
Must have experience with systems engineering and software development lifecycles.
Must have programming skills in languages used for job specific programming tasks, and familiarization with the application of industry standard hardware and software design and documentation techniques
Must possess planning/organizing skills and have a working knowledge of computer systems and computer-based engineering tools
Proficiency with JDK8, Spring Boot, XML/JSON, SQL and other relevant technologies
Must qualify for and maintain a government security clearance and must have a valid, current state-issued driver's license
Must possess the ability to:

Create and manage Spring Boot micro-services with REST endpoints
Design interactive Web User Interfaces (UIs) for data processing input and analysis
Write and conduct unit tests to ensure developed code executes as intended
Implement algorithms as described by domain experts
Prototype code to determine design feasibility
Design and apply new system architectures for data processing and analysis systems
Embrace opportunities to learn new technologies and implement solutions to new subject matter
Write requirements documents, theories of operation, etc.
Apply sound system engineering principles
Desired:

Have a Bachelor's Degree in an associated discipline and at least 10 years of related experience or have a Master's Degree in an associated discipline and at least 6 years of experience, or a PhD in an associated discipline and at least 4 years of experience
Have excellent programming skills in languages used for job specific programming tasks
Have experience in the application of industry standard hardware and software design and documentation techniques. Applicant must have extensive knowledge of systems engineering and software development lifecycles
Proficiency with Groovy, Gradle/Maven, Jenkins/Bamboo, NoSQL and other relevant technologies
OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES

Each employee must read, understand, and implement the general and specific operational, safety, quality, and environmental requirements of all plans, procedures, and policies pertaining to his/her job.
WORKING CONDITIONS

Typical office environment with no unusual hazards, occasional lifting to 20 pounds, constant sitting while using a computer, constant use of sight abilities while programming and drafting/reviewing documents, constant use of speech/hearing abilities for communication, constant mental alertness, must possess planning/organizing skills, and must be able to work under deadlines.
DISCLAIMER

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of persons so classified.
LOCATION


This position is based in Las Vegas, NV where nearly two million residents enjoy close to 300 days of sunshine a year. Residents can choose from a wide array of affordable neighborhoods and enjoy community events at local city and county parks and cultural centers. With our nearby state and national parks (Red Rock, Valley of Fire, Mount Charleston, and Lake Mead to name a few) within an hour of the city's center, Southern Nevada is a hub for outdoor enthusiasts. Of course there are plenty of dining and entertainment options on the famous Las Vegas Strip and many residents also enjoy sporting events at UNLV's Thomas and Mack Center or take in NASCAR racing at the Las Vegas Motor Speedway. Need to take a break from the desert? Within a radius of a four to five hour drive there are Los Angeles and San Diego offering shoreline activities or other fantastic attractions, and Utah and Northern Arizona offering remote mountainous splendors at the other end of the spectrum. Nevadans enjoy a unique financial benefit too; we're 1 of only 7 states with no state income tax!

Job Summary

The Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) is responsible for developing and executing comprehensive suites of automation test plans and test cases, maintaining and adding to existing automation framework, continued evaluation of test cases for inclusion in regression suites, automation for newly integrated features, and development of toolsets to augment QA and Development testing. The SDET will also work closely with Software Developers and other QA engineers in small scrum teams to deliver the highest quality products in a timely and cost-effective manner.

Roles & Responsibilities


Follow the established agile/scrum methodology for software builds and test automation, design and code reviews; ensuring product quality and reliability
As a member of a SCRUM Team, work with other team members to understand, design and develop risk based testing strategies
Design, develop and integrate automated tests into existing automated testing infrastructure

Required Skills/Experience


BS in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Programming: C++, Java, C#, Python
Knowledge of at least one of the popular test automation frameworks such as Sahi, Soapui or Selenium
Ability to learn quickly and deliver high quality tests on schedule
Highly effective communication skills

Desired Skills/Experience


Hands-on experience with Sahi, Selenium, jUnit or other Unit testing frameworks
Exposure to testing of systems that deal with OS internals, low level networking and multi-threaded distributed systems
Experience working in a agile/Scrum environment

Must be eligible to work full time in the United States

Must be willing to relocate to Henderson, NV area (Relocation not provided)

Company Description

Kaseya is the leading provider of complete IT systems, security and network management software. Kaseya solutions allow Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and IT organizations to efficiently manage and secure IT in order to drive IT service and business success. Offered as both industry-leading SaaS solutions and on-premises software, Kaseya solutions empower MSPs and mid-sized enterprises to command all of IT centrally, manage remote and distributed environments with ease, and automate across IT management functions.

Kaseya solutions currently manage over 10 million endpoints worldwide and are in use by customers in a wide variety of industries, including retail, manufacturing, healthcare, education, government, media, technology, finance, and more.

Kaseya is a rapidly growing, private-equity-backed company on track for a successful initial public offering in the next few years. On a trajectory to hyper growth, Kaseya is the ideal place for you to grow and develop your career among hard-working, creative professionals with a shared vision to transform the industry.

job summary:
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

The primary responsibility of this position is to perform complex system design and functional design work.


Responsibilities include, but may not be limited to the following:

• Formulate systems scope and objectives, by devising and modifying programs and procedures to solve programmatic problems using information systems.


• Competent to design, code, and test the most complex systems analysis projects.


• Prepare detailed specifications from which associate programmers and/or programmers use to write, design, code, test, debug, and maintain the most complex programs.


• Direct the associate programmers and/or programmers on specific projects.


• Demonstrate problem solving and project management skills by defining and presenting programmatic system solutions for identified programming issues.


• Document activities from design to completion to assist future analysts in understanding work solutions.


• Participate in testing of projects within confines of current systems.


• May assume project management responsibility over simple projects.


• Take complex technical ideas and bring them to a high-level to encourage understanding at all levels.


• Deliver a complete solution to ensure thorough understanding of the system (documentation, procedures, training, escalation, error process, etc.).


• Plan and manage a small team.


• Recognize a request as being within or out of scope and communicate to all involved.


• Proactively escalates to the next level of management and provides recommendation from available options.


• Engage others with related code/products/etc to work together to understand root cause, ripple effects, and an integrated solution.


• Provide input into capacity plans; able to assist with load tests.


• Write efficient, reusable and stable code for complex application logic.


• Perform code review for others, in increasing levels of complexity.


• Plan, schedule tasks, and communicate with customers/co-workers to deliver satisfactory outcomes.


• Use project teams and task forces effectively; delegate and hold people accountable to expected outcomes.


KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE


At least 3 years of Requirement Analysis and impact analysis, 3 years of Agile and Waterfall methodologies, and 3 years of programming (which includes java, javascript, JDBC, JMS, EJBs, shell programming, stored procedures, Unix, Eclipse, HTML, Websphere Application Servers, and relational database); problem solving skills acquired through college courses, technical training and/or previous work experience. Basic knowledge of systems design theory and project management required.


Also preferred but not required is knowledge of Struts, Spring, Maven, Jenkins, and Hibernate.


Requires functional skills in two major areas or technical functions or has developed an exceptional expertise in one area or technical function. Knowledge of multiple programming languages is preferred.


EDUCATION

Bachelors degree in Information Systems OR technical training equivalent.

Are you passionate about developing world-class cloud and mobile software? Do you enjoy tackling challenges and working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment? If this is you, come join the Kaseya Engineering team in Henderson, NV (near Las Vegas)! Kaseya is revolutionizing the IT management industry with exciting new cloud-based applications that accelerate and simplify IT management for millions of users.

Position Summary

The QA Engineer will be responsible for creating automated and manual tests of our applications. We are searching for someone eager to collaborate with our engineers to improve automated test infrastructure and enable rapid deployment of new features. The ideal candidate for the SQE engineering role will have a background in QA, in addition to having strong Windows skills. The primary focus will be testing our applications in a QA environment.

Responsibilities

Create test plans and test cases for existing and new features

Design, develop and integrate automated tests into existing automated testing infrastructure

Complete work on schedule in an agile/scrum work environment

Design, script and debug tests in various automation tooling

Ability to collaborate cross-team to recommend improvements to test systems

Promote the use of best practices within team and make suggestions as necessary to improve the efficiency and quality of the work produced by the team

Attend standups

Define testability for feature areas

Evaluate the coverage of existing automated tests and how to improve coverage

May execute tests to validate non-functional requirements, such as performance, scalability and reliability

Use UI test tools and frameworks to improve automated testing of web interfaces

Report on metrics that assess the quality of software products and software development process

Evaluate and analyze test results for trends or common issues

File and track bugs

Required Skills/Experience

BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or related field

Programming skills: C++, Java, C#, Python

Ability to solve problems quickly and completely

Highly effective communication skills

Desired Skills/Experience

Hands-on experience with Sahi, Selenium, jUnit or other Unit testing frameworks

Experience working in a agile/Scrum environment

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Kaseya is the leading cloud provider of IT systems management software, offering a complete IT management solution delivered both via cloud and on-premise. Kaseya technology empowers MSPs and mid-sized enterprises to proactively manage and control their IT environments remotely, easily and efficiently from a single platform. Kaseya solutions are in use by more than 10,000 customers worldwide in a wide variety of industries, including retail, manufacturing, healthcare, education, government, media, technology, finance, and more. Kaseya has a presence in over 20 countries. To learn more, please visit http://www.kaseya.com.

We're looking for an experienced Java developer to help design, architect and develop innovative new features for the IrisPR platform. The ideal candidate has experience with Java apps and a great attitude.

You won’t just shape the world of software.
You’ll shape the world of life, work and play.

Our Software Engineers not only understand how technology works, but how that technology intersects with the people who count on it every day. Today, innovative ideas, insight and new perspectives are at the core of how we create a more powerful, personal and fulfilling experience for all our customers. So if you’re interested in a career creating breakthrough software and making an impact on an audience of millions, look no further.

American Express is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative payment products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team!

You won’t just keep up, you’ll break new ground.

Agile Practices

Why American Express

Talk to our people and you’ll find out what we’re really all about. Open, creative, risk-taking, collaborative and innovative are just some of the expressions you’ll hear. Client is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. The Engineer will be responsible for designing and developing the brand new Commercial Lending Platform through world class technology. You need to have broad knowledge of the technology world and be willing to take up the challenge of leveraging the latest technologies in building the Platform. You should have an entrepreneurial spirit and the drive to bring new products to life. job summary:
Albertsons-Safeway Company is one of the largest food and drug retailers with 2,300+ stores. The Albertsons-Safeway family of brands includes some of the most prominent brands in food retailing, with a growing base of loyal shoppers. Thanks to the professionalism, diversity, spirit and friendliness of our people, we have locations across the U.S.


The Information Technology Department has an opening for a Programmer/Analyst. This position is located in Phoenix, Arizona.


Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

• Determines and implements the most efficient and cost effective solution.

• Act as a liaison between clients and application area.

• Lead troubleshooting and root cause determination and proactively identify opportunities to fix issues.

• Must be able to make sound decisions based on incomplete information, under pressure and maintain project focus.

• Developing strong working relationships at levels in the business and IT community to ensure overall project satisfaction.

• Provide application design guidance and consultation, utilizing a thorough understanding of applicable technology, tools and existing designs.

• Analyze highly complex business requirements.

• Design and create technical specifications to design or redesign complex computer platforms and applications.

• Analyze problems outlined by Business Systems Analysts in terms of detailed technology requirements and capabilities.

• Ensure logic and design is in alignment with core architecture of the system/application.

• Analyze existing product software and recommends modifications which will enhance operating capacity and meet

business requirements.

• Verify program logic by overseeing the preparation of test data, testing and debugging of programs.

• Oversee overall systems testing and the migration of platforms and applications to production.

• Guide new documentation, departmental technical procedures and user guides.

• Develop positive and sustainable partnerships with business stakeholders, Enterprise Architecture, and other partners across the enterprise to create strategic roadmaps and detailed project plans for business and IT driven initiatives.

• Support, maintain, enhance existing applications

• Deliver full development lifecycle for new applications

• Investigate and resolve application issues encountered in live production

• Create and maintain application documents, especially for newly acquired applications


Qualifications:

• 4 year degree (Computer Science, Information Systems) and/or equivalent combination of education or work experience.

• 5+ years of programming experience including experience integrating applications across diverse technical platforms.

• 5+ years of VB6 experience and strong VBA programming experience (Access/Excel)

• 3+ years relevant work experience in a C-based programming environment

• Proficient with coding and analysis in C#, VB.net, and PL/SQL

• Experience in Java design and programming, a huge plus

• Strong experience with database technologies (Oracle, DB2, SQL Server).

• Strong experience with the full software development lifecycle and software development methodologies (Waterfall, Agile).

• Excellent organizational and troubleshooting skills with attention to detail.

• Strong knowledge of programming documentation processes/procedures.

• Strong ability to understand client expectations and to resolve issues that may affect delivery.

• Ability to build constructive relationships with senior application architects and project managers and gain their trust.

• Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively in a matrixed organization.

• Strong ability to mentor, coach and train lower level programmer analysts.

• Self-starter, with a demonstrated ability to learn beyond formal training with a strong aptitude for delivering quality products.

• Excellent communications skills (written and oral), customer service and problem solving skills.

• Ability to contribute to making critical and successful decisions under pressure.

• Must possess superior problem solving skills, be action-oriented and decisive.

• Excellent organizational change management skills and the ability to balance competing priorities in meeting business deadlines.

• Excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal communications skills.

• Ability to effectively articulate and present complex concepts, ideas and strategies to business end-users

• Extensive creativity, drive, high energy level, and the ability to self-manage.

• Adeptness with asynchronous programming, a plus.

• Background in Microsoft Silverlight, a plus

• Self-sufficient, and willing to learn other programming languages/ platforms

• Excellent oral and written English communication skills.


How to Apply: Interested candidates are encouraged to submit a resume by visiting careersatsafeway.com

We believe that building successful relationships with our customers and our communities is only possible through the diversity of our people. A diverse workforce leads to better teamwork and creative thinking, as well as mutual understanding and respect.

job summary:
Choice Hotels International is a cutting edge software development company that develops software to manage, reserve and book hotel rooms in its portfolio of 11 branded hotels. Choice provides innovative enterprise SOA solutions based on Open Source and AWS technologies. Choice is a tightknit team where you can enhance your skills in an environment that emphasizes creativity, sharing, teamwork, professionalism, and outstanding quality software. You will work alongside some of the most talented and dynamic professionals as they work to provide exceptional solutions to the many challenges our business and franchises face. If you are bright, driven, enjoy working with the latest technologies and have the right blend of business acumen, technically savvy and customer-facing skills then this opportunity is for you. If you are willing to work hard, looking for a place to learn and grow, and have the skills we would like to hear from you.


The cool stuff you do:

Writes correct and clean code with guidance; consistently follows stated best practices and Choice SDP and guidelines.
Participates in technical design of features with guidance.
Rarely makes the same mistake twice, begins to focus on attaining expertise in one or more areas (eg, AngularJS/Java/Oracle/Cassandra) development, performance best practices, efficient use of data stores, messaging, etc)..
Learns quickly and makes steady progress without the need for constant significant feedback from more senior engineers.
Internal or external certifications in one Choice core standardized technologies.
Makes steady progress on tasks; knows when to ask for help in order to get themselves unblocked.
Able to own small-to-medium features from technical design through completion.
Capable of prioritizing tasks; avoids getting caught up in unimportant details and endless "bikeshedding".
Self-sufficient in at least one large area of the codebase (multiple services in a pillar, all frontend code related to a main funnel flow) with a high-level understanding of other components.
Capable of providing on-call support for their area including systems that they are not familiar with.
Can be called upon to give technical interviews to new possible candidates.

Your education and experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, or related field, from a four-year college or university, or one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Can have up to 1 to 3 years relevant experience in software development, information systems, or equivalent technical environment, including previous experience in the development of highly transactional, mission critical applications in heterogeneous environments/architectures for multi-user systems.

You are awesome at:


Proficiency or familiar with the following technologies:

Front End Technologies (1 to 3 years).
Angular JS/ HTML5 / CSS/ JavaScript
Service oriented designs and technologies (AJAX, XML/JSON)
Web service protocols, such as SOAP or REST.
Source control. Subversion and/or GIT.
Excellent knowledge of all aspects of the software development lifecycle: design, functional and technical requirements, coding, debugging, testing, release, and operational support.
Knowledge of agile software development methodologies, Service Oriented Architecture and object-oriented programming methodologies.
Knowledge of software development best practices, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Knowledge of relational database management system technologies and tools.
Exceptional verbal, written and listening communication skills.
Exceptional interpersonal skills and demeanor.
Proficient in the use of MS Office suite including Visio.

You’re get cool points if you have done any of the following:


Added value proficiencies in the following technologies:

Java knowledge is a plus
Spring MVC Framework is a plus
Familiar with continuous integration tools such as Jenkins, Sonar, Stash.

job summary:
Information Technology Trainee – 

Entry Level Position:


Work for an industry leader while learning cutting edge technology. Eagle Creek Software Services, a rapidly growing Software Services company, is currently seeking entry level software consultants for our Technology Center in Valley City, North Dakota (relocation assistance available). At the technology center you will receive hands-on training to work toward becoming an IT consultant, engaged on software implementations from project initiation to final customer roll out.


Paid Training Program Provides:

Comprehensive instruction on general topics and tools including Unix/Linix administration, SQL, SSIS, SSRS, and quality assurance, programming languages (Java, .Net), database skills, CRM and BI
Classroom and small group environment training
Work on simulated projects adapted from real life scenarios that our technology center consultants are engaged on from day-to-day
After instruction on general topics and tools, trainees will focus on two of the three technology stacks that Eagle Creek specializes in, including application development, CRM, or BI
By training at Eagle Creek, you will quickly develop a wide range of new skills, ideal for career development into the IT consultant position.

Working at the Technology Center:


At our Technology Center, you are encouraged to set your sights on your career goals within Eagle Creek, and to work toward them while adding value to the organization. Our state-of-the art facilities offer an opportunity to work within a structured organization where you can advance. Projects tend to be mid-to-long term and diversified. Assignments can be challenging but also exciting and rewarding. You will have a great opportunity to make an impact immediately as well as grow professionally. Travel, if any, would be infrequent.


Position Location: Valley City, ND


Position Responsibilities:

Actively learn all of the aspects of the tools and technologies related to two technology stacks
Learn and engage as a team member and individually
Actively and successfully progress and transition from Trainee to an IT associate consulting position within the designated timeframes

As an Associate Consultant:

Work alone and collaboratively to solve business problems and develop the functionality our customers demand
Analyze the business issues that face our Fortune 2000 clients, design original and innovative solutions, and deliver them to our clients
Within the application development technology stack, work within all aspects of the Software Development Life Cycle: Requirements definition, Functional and Technical Design, Configuration, scripting, integration, data transformation and manipulation, testing, training and documentation
Within the CRM technology stack work with such technologies as Salesforce.com or Siebel
Within the BI technology stack work with such technologies as Informatica or OBIEE

Position Requirements:


An Eagle Creek Software Consultant will work in a team environment for the successful development and implementation of software applications at the site from project initiation to full customer product roll out with minimal supervision. In this capacity, consultants will be experienced in application functionally and technically.


To be a part of the Eagle Creek Software Services team you must meet or exceed the following requirements:

Bachelors Degree in MIS, CS, IS, IT, Engineering or Associates degree with relevant experience
An understanding of Object Oriented Programming languages
Experience developing code
Excellent communication skills and be able to work well in a collaborative team environment
Understand standard business practices
Posses a passion for leveraging technology to create enterprise wide solutions

quired

job summary:
The Skunk Works (Lockheed Martin Advanced Development Program) is looking for world class talent in Software Systems to be a part of a team that will carry on our 70 year tradition making history in advanced aircraft development.


The selected candidate will utilize agile development and advanced technical concepts in support of real-time and near real-time on-board and off-board (ground based) software products within Advanced Development Programs (ADP). He/she will support the Definition of Operational requirements and definition of software architecture for new or existing executive software on complex computer systems. The selected candidate will be responsible for the design, development and testing of airborne avionics embedded software, for performing hands on integration and test of software with target hardware in the loop and for interfacing with various disciplines including system and integration and test engineering.


Applicant will be given tasks such as designing, architecting and integrating real time aircraft mission systems and simulations with specific experience developing software and system designs based on agile development and advanced technical concepts, methodologies, technology, theories, and techniques.


Candidate will gain experience in avionics subsystems such as navigation guidance, datalinks, communication links, stores management, weapon integration, mission computers, electronic warfare and EO/IR & RF sensors. The candidate may gain experience working with serial interfaces, analog and digital I/O and TCP/IP.


The applicant must have software development experience and must be proficient in C++ with Java as a plus. Experience with visual modeling, simulation, and debug tools which include: Qt, Visual Studio, and Git with OpengGL, TCP/IP networking, and Matlab as a plus. Experience with Linux, Windows, and knowledge of RTOS fundamentals. Experience supporting the agile software development life cycle and working in a mature software process environment is desired.


Candidate must be capable of independently designing and creating software solutions based on limited information on rapidly evolving projects. Must be able to clearly communicate and share design decisions to the team. This role requires a highly motivated, organized engineer that is familiar with all aspects of avionics systems development.


Ability to telecommute part time is a possibility.


Basic Qualifications

• Knowledge of Programming Languages C or C++

• Experience working with Sensors and/or Datalinks


Desired skills

• Knowledge of scripting languages and GUI development

• Working knowledge of Distributed Interactive Simulation (DIS) standards

• TS/SCI and/or DoD Top Secret Preferred


As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.


Join us at Lockheed Martin, where we’re engineering a better tomorrow.


Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

education level/skills required / respon: Java, Tuxedo, Oracle, Windows, etc.). PeopleSoft ESSI MSS architecture maintenance and support. AVH requires PeopleSoft HCM 9.1 and Knonos WorkForce Central...
job summary:
AVH requires PeopleSoft HCM 9.1 and Knonos WorkForce Central Timekeeping 6.3 and Tele Time application programmer/ analyst to support HR, HRIS, Benefits, Payroll, and Timekeeping functions. There are multiple positions that are required so individual task assignments will be a subset of those listed below. Assignments will be based on the knowledge and experience of each selected candidate. Overall, the tasks that need to be performed are detailed below.


Job Responsibilities:

Ensure that the PeopleSoft, WorkForce Central Timekeeping, and Tele Time applications are online, functioning properly for user availability. Tasks will include, but are not limited to troubleshooting server/ hardware/ operating systems issues, troubleshooting underlying database issues, manage database optimization and performance with support from DBAs, manage application, database and batch server availability, performance and optimization.
Ensure that PeopleSoft, WorkForce Central Timekeeping, and Tele Time applications are backed up and restorable in case of unexpected conditions. This will include management of database archival and recovery, management of recovery and restore plans, management of disaster plan.
Respond to and resolve use reported incidents of application downtime, workstation conflicts and errors, and network connectivity issues.
Ensure that application synchronizations (compatible versions) are maintained across PeopleSoft, WorkForce Central Timekeeping, and Tele Time software and 3 rd party software (i.e. Java, Tuxedo, Oracle, Windows, etc.) on servers, networks and workstations.
Maintain, modify, and develop integration and interface code or API's across PeopleSoft, Workforce Central Timekeeping, and Tele Time.
Responsible for the support of existent and the development of new integration code and API's.
Liaise with Business Owners and HRIS and PYIS Business Systems Analysts to resolve reported issues, enhancements and upgrades/ updates requests.
Support the migrations of all PeopleSoft, Workforce Central Timekeeping, and Tele Time setup tables/ configuration across test and production environments.
Coordinate testing with HRIS/PYIS Business System Analyst for configuration changes.
Perform migration to Production environment for all approved move requests. Ensure and validate data and configuration accuracy in migrations.
Maintain and develop libraries of standardized and adhoc complex data queries and reports for IT development (not user based queries) in support of all HRIS business processes.
Develop and support complex Genies, Hyperfind Queries, PS Queries, Query/ CML, SQR reports requiring IT development
Organize and post into standard libraries
Maintain and develop libraries of AVH developed custom program (SQR/SQL, Application Engine, PeopleCode Objects, Kronos AIP's, Scripts) assigned for IT development in support of all functions.
Develop and support complex custom programs requiring IT development
Organize and post into standard libraries
Provide technical application support for troubleshooting when unexpected or erroneous results occur and are reported to IT support. Liaise with Payroll Manger, Timekeepers, Payroll, Human Resources, and Benefits departments for integration across PeopleSoft, WorkForce Central Timekeeping, and Tele Time.
Provide technical knowledge and support of the Employee Demographics and Employee Leave Balances imports and API's form PepleSoft into WorkForce Central Timekeeping
Provide technical knowledge and support of the WorkForce Central Timekeeping exports interfaces to PeopleSoft T&L; Staging
Provide technical knowledge and support of the Tele Time application behavior based on loads from imports
Provide technical knowledge and support of the PeopleSoft application interfaces to and from internal and 3' party systems. There are approximately 36 interfaces to be supported
Provide direction and testing support for all future software updates, patches, and fixes.
Perform software updates, upgrades, patches, and fixes
Resolve errors and issues related to code line synchronicity
Liaise with Payroll Manage, Timekeepers, Payroll Specialists, HRIS and PYIS Business Systems Analysts Support to resolve testing issues/ problems
Provide technical support to maintain the following:
Batch Processing Support
Security
PeopleSoft ESSI MSS architecture maintenance and support
Job Requirements:

5-7+ years of experience with PeopleSoft HRMS development, application programming, business analysis and system support, specifically with the Payroll, HR, Base Benefits, and Benefits Admin modules.
Must possess the technical skills and knowledge to be considered a Subject Matter Expert in PeopleSoft system development and technical support. Possess thorough understanding of entire development process including specification, documentation,

Closing Statement


Looking for an opportunity to work in healthcare the way you always dreamed you could? At Antelope Valley Hospital, our employees are at the heart of what we do best – delivering high quality, patient-centered healthcare.


Antelope Valley Hospital, a 420 bed acute care facility, located just 60 miles north of Los Angeles, the Antelope Valley is one of Southern California’s fasted growing communities. We are a Level II Trauma Center and Joint Commission Primary Stroke Center Accredited . Serving the community for over 50 years, our non-profit hospital has grown to be the preeminent healthcare facility for our district’s nearly 1.2 million residents.


An Equal Opportunity Employer.

• Must have strong interpersonal and organizational skills, as well as excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• Experience leading teams and interfacing with external customers. Experience in leading code development teams and basic project management skill sets desired

job summary:
Location: Edwards Air Force Base, California
Do you have what it takes to be mission critical?
Your skills and experience could be mission critical for our Unisys team supporting the Federal Government in their mission to protect and defend our nation, and transform the way government agencies manage information and improve responsiveness to their customers.
As a member of our diverse team, you'll gain valuable career-enhancing experience as we support the design, development, testing, implementation, training, and maintenance of our federal government's critical systems.

Position Summary / Responsibilities:
We are currently seeking a motivated, career and customer oriented Programmer to join our team and begin an exciting and challenging career with Unisys Federal Systems.

Education & Experience:
BS Degree & 5 years of related IT experience or equivalent.

Required Experience:
Applicants selected must meet the requirements to obtain and maintain US government security clearances and ability to meet US Citizenship requirement.
Security+ certification or ability to certify quickly.
MSCE, A+, or equivalent experience required
Intermediate to advanced level knowledge and experience with database design, creation and maintenance utilizing some or all of the following database technologies: SQL Server, Microsoft Access, and/or Oracle.
Intermediate to advanced level knowledge and experience with some or all of the following programming languages: C, C++, C#, Java, ASP, ASP.NET, Visual Basic, VB.NET, HTML, XML, JavaScript, CSS, ADO, ADO.NET, SQL, TSQL, PL/SQL and Visual Studio.
Intermediate to Advanced level knowledge and experience with software engineering, system engineering, lifecycle and tools including requirements development, requirements management, design/modeling, implementation, testing, deployment, configuration management, and software sustainment.
Experience and knowledge with PC operating systems and productivity software including: Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook, Word, and Windows.
Develop software solutions to business problems. May define and develop system and software architecture frameworks.

job summary:
Lockheed Martin is looking for world-class talent in Operations Analysis to join our historic Skunk Works team in Palmdale, CA. We are seeking a candidate who thinks strategically and creatively with proven analytical and engineering problem-solving skills; is passionate about working on cutting-edge design concepts and comfortable with ambiguity; and thrives in a high-performing team environment.


As a member of the Operations Analysis organization, the candidate will be responsible for researching and analyzing advancements in weapon system technologies, operations and employment in order to quantify the impact on survivability and mission effectiveness of system concepts operating in a system of systems environment. The candidate will be expected to apply engineering and mathematical techniques to model advanced technologies and emerging domains in constructive simulations enabling quantitative analysis to define requirements, evaluate concept of operations, perform operational and cost effectiveness studies, and assess military utility; with focus on electronic warfare, cyber, communications, and air and space integration. The candidate will be responsible for analyzing threat weapon system performance and operations; quantifying Measures-of-Effectiveness (MOEs), analyzing simulation results to draw meaningful conclusions, preparing reports/briefings and presenting analysis results.

As a member of a high-performing multi-site team, the selected applicant must be self-motivated with a strong work ethic, time-management, and interpersonal skills. The ability to work in a dynamic, multi-disciplinary, virtual team environment is critical. The successful candidate must demonstrate effective communication skills as the position will require frequent interactions and collaboration with leadership, project leads, other team members, engineers in other disciplines, and customers. The ability to travel on occasion is required.

Applicant selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.


Basic Qualifications

Must have an active Top Secret clearance with a current background investigation and ability to obtain SAR program clearances

• Technical degree in engineering, mathematics, physics, or computer science with appropriate number years of professional experience

• Experience researching and modeling weapon systems performance

• Proficiency executing analysis, post-processing data, and presenting results

• Experience in Windows/Linux experience

• Background in Fundamentals of Radar

• Experience in applying engineering principles, analytical techniques, and mathematical concepts to model and analyze the performance & effectiveness of systems


Desired skills

• Knowledge of an Integrated Air Defense System; including operations of air and ground systems

• Knowledge of surface and airborne threats and the ability to locate and extract parametrics

• Skilled in using EWIR and Common Emitter Databases

• Technical knowledge of radar, electronic warfare, or communication systems and operations

• Electromagnetics background

• Practical/applied operational experience (Electronic Warfare Officer; Scientific and Technical Intelligence Analyst; FME Experience)

• Proven customer engagement experience; with demonstrated skill to develop & deliver effective presentations

• MATLAB or Perl/Python experience or similar programming/scripting language (C++/JAVA /XML); with networking experience valuable

• Military operations analysis experience; applying constructive simulations (e.g. Suppressor, AFSIM, EADSIM, ESAMS, BRAWLER)

• Design of experiments and/or test design experience

• Proficiency in data analytics, test data analysis, and scoring; including statistical analysis

• Good written and verbal communication skills

job summary:
The Operations Analysis team in Palmdale, California is seeking a candidate to develop and use engineering-based techniques, advanced analytical methods, and critical thinking to analyze the performance of system concepts, inform and improve decision-making, and quantify value propositions. Collaborating with a team of analysts, the selected candidate will perform modeling & analysis to quantify the impact of system design, payloads, weapons & tactics, Concept of Operations (CONOPS), and advanced technology employment on survivability & mission effectiveness; supporting requirements definition, operational & cost effectiveness studies, and military utility assessment.

Primary responsibilities will include: modeling military systems performance and operational scenarios in digital simulations; developing analytical approaches, methods and tools to facilitate analyses; running engagement/mission/campaign simulations; data analytics & statistical analysis; and developing effective presentations that succinctly communicate results and findings.

The selected candidate will support internal and external customers and must be: an effective communicator, have the ability to research & analyze technical performance data, desire to learn and analyze military operations, and be a self-starter who can rapidly learn new subjects & skills. Tasking will include quick-turn individual analysis projects and larger on-going initiatives that require the ability to produce results in a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team environment. The ability to travel on occasion is required. This position leads to an Operations Analyst career path.

• Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools, especially Excel, PowerPoint, and Word

• Demonstrated analytical thinking & problem solving, as well as engineering & mathematical skills to understand & interpret technical system performance data

• Programming or scripting language(s) knowledge & experience - MATLAB, Perl/Python, C/C++, or Java

• Must have the ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance


Must be a US Citizen, position is located at a facility that requires special access.

• Proficiency in mathematical and statistical modeling

• Proficiency in design of experiments, trade space exploration, and optimization

• Experience in data mining, reduction, and analysis

• Knowledge of military aircraft, missions, and operations

• Active government clearance and previous intern experience

Candidate must be a self-starter and very motivated to apply fundamentals of aircraft conceptual design, particularly vehicle configuration layout, aircraft sizing, optimization, trade study execution, and sensitivity analysis. The individual will work with CATIA V5 and legacy analysis systems coupled with the LM Aero Rapid Conceptual Design suite of tools, using them to build aircraft configurations and execute conceptual design trade studies on multiple programs. Design analysis tasks require coordination with other vehicle analysis disciplines and as a result, clear communication skills are an absolute necessity.


Candidate should be able to discuss sizing rationale, assumptions, and other technical project details appropriately with management and customer representatives.


Desired skills

The ability to integrate and apply analysis tools using ModelCenter in the LM Aero Rapid Conceptual Design (RCD) framework is desired.


Must be proficient with Microsoft Office products and multiple computer languages for scientific use.

job summary:
This position is with our Advanced Development Programs known as the Skunk Works located in Fort Worth Texas. This is a full time senior technical position for the Virtual Prototyping group. The Virtual Prototyping group is an engineering visualization provider of Modeling and Simulation (M&S;) services and solutions to Lockheed Martin Corporation and its customers worldwide. Through the power of visualization, Virtual Prototyping helps people understand complex systems and ideas by “bringing concepts to life,” allowing for better, faster decision making and, ultimately, assisting programs in winning new business and performing on existing programs. From conceptual design to sustainment, Virtual Prototyping provides discriminating technologies to support the complete product life cycle that articulate information using simulation, visualization, virtual collaboration, human computer interfaces, and synthetic real-time environments. These capabilities save time, reduce costs and risks, improve quality, and enhance safety by increasing product and process understanding. The group provides unique capabilities and tailored solutions through product visualization, manufacturing simulation, serious games applications, vehicle simulation, operational awareness, virtual training, maintainability & sustainment operations, virtual & augmented reality, battle space visualization, continuous improvement efforts, facilities development, and much more.


This engineering position must have a strong and diverse technical background being able to develop, integrate, and apply various M&S; technologies in the fields of visualization, simulation, and human computer interfaces. Individual must be able to learn and quickly pickup technical concepts and software applications in effort to apply them to meet demanding program requirements. Candidate needs to have a strong programming (i.e. C++, C#, Java, .net, XML, etc.) background for rapid software prototyping development and the ability to integrate code into 3D applications including gaming technologies, augmented reality, virtual reality, and other real-time simulation tools. The candidate will be responsible to work with the Virtual Prototyping programming team on real-time 3D M&S; applications and other software development tasks. The candidate will also be leveraged for additional M&S; research and development tasks.


The candidate should have good communication, coordination, and organizational skills. This individual will need to be able to collaborate well with a multi-site software development team and be able to multi-task in a time critical environment.


Basic Qualifications

(1) Programming and scripting experience in C++ and other coding languages including, but not limited to, C#, .Net, VB, XML, Perl, etc.;


(2) Experience with wide variety of real-time 3D visual simulation tools;


(3) Game programming experience


Must be a US Citizen, position is located at a facility that requires special access.


Desired skills

(1) Presagis tools (Vega Prime and Creator), MaK VR’s DI-Guy, DiSTI’s GL Studio as well as an understanding of vehicle flight dynamics to support visual simulations; (2) Specific experience with gaming technologies such as Unreal, CryEngine, Unity3D, and Prepar3D; (3) Web based programming (i.e. HTML5, SQL, CSS, ASP, Ajax, WebGL, etc.); (4) 3D graphics programming to include GPGPU, OpenGL, DirectX, etc.

This exciting position is with the Skunk Works, located in Palmdale, California. This highly select intern position will both use and develop a wide variety of cyber skills. The ideal candidate is on a Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering degree track and has firm understanding of computer systems including hardware architectures, software architectures, software defined radios, wireless communication systems and has a fascination with how to manipulate each of these to get specific desired results. Talented sophomores or juniors that intuitively understand how cyber systems work and can create solutions for the future challenges our country will be facing are preferred. Interns for this area must be United States citizens. Even if the candidate does not currently have a security clearance, they must be able to obtain and keep one.

Within the team, the selected candidate will participate in basic research, applied research, conceptual design and development; mentored project tracking; and coordination, integration and test of real world applications within a Service Oriented Architecture framework. job summary:
The Skunk Works (Lockheed Martin Advanced Development Program) is looking for world class talent in Software Systems to be a part of a team that will carry on our 70 year tradition making history in advanced aircraft development.


The selected candidate will utilize object-oriented and advanced technical concepts in support of real-time embedded avionics software products within Advanced Development Programs (ADP). He/she will support the Definition of Operational Flight Program requirements and definition of software architecture for new or existing executive software on complex computer systems. The selected candidate will be responsible for the design, development and testing of airborne avionics embedded software, for performing hands on integration and test of software with target hardware in the loop and for interfacing with various disciplines including system and integration and test engineering.


Applicant will be given tasks such as designing, architecting and integrating real time aircraft mission systems and simulations with specific experience developing software and system designs based on object-oriented and advanced technical concepts, methodologies, technology, theories, and techniques.


Candidate will gain experience in avionics subsystems such as navigation guidance, datalinks, communication links, stores management, weapon integration, mission computers, electronic warfare and EO/IR & RF sensors. The candidate may gain experience working with serial interfaces, analog and digital I/O and TCP/IP.


The applicant must have software development experience and must have experience with C, C++, C#, and/or Java. Experience with modern development tools (visual modeling, simulation, debug, and bus analyzers) and experience with Wind River VxWorks, Green Hills Integrity, Linux, QNX RTOS and/or Windows is a plus. Experience supporting the full software development life cycle and working in a mature software process environment is desired.


Candidate must be capable of independently designing and creating software solutions based on limited information on rapidly evolving projects. Must be able to clearly communicate and share design decisions to the team. This role requires a highly motivated, organized engineer that is familiar with all aspects of avionics systems development.


The ideal candidate will be familiar with software requirements and configuration management. Candidate must have excellent oral and written communication skills and be highly energetic and self-motivated.


Basic Qualifications

job summary:
The Skunk Works (Lockheed Martin Advanced Development Program) is looking for world class talent in Software Systems to be a part of a team that will carry on our 70 year tradition making history in advanced aircraft development.


The selected candidate will utilize object-oriented and advanced technical concepts in support of real-time embedded avionics software products within Advanced Development Programs (ADP). He/she will support the Definition of Operational Flight Program requirements and definition of software architecture for new or existing executive software on complex computer systems. The selected candidate will be responsible for the design, development and testing of airborne avionics embedded software, for performing hands on integration and test of software with target hardware in the loop and for interfacing with various disciplines including system and integration and test engineering.


Applicant will be given tasks such as designing, architecting and integrating real time aircraft mission systems and simulations with specific experience developing software and system designs based on object-oriented and advanced technical concepts, methodologies, technology, theories, and techniques.


Candidate will gain experience in avionics subsystems such as navigation guidance, datalinks, communication links, stores management, weapon integration, mission computers, electronic warfare and EO/IR & RF sensors. The candidate may gain experience working with serial interfaces, analog and digital I/O and TCP/IP.


The applicant must have software development experience and must have experience with C, C++, C#, and/or Java. Experience with modern development tools (visual modeling, simulation, debug, and bus analyzers) and experience with Wind River VxWorks, Green Hills Integrity, Linux, QNX RTOS and/or Windows is a plus. Experience supporting the full software development life cycle and working in a mature software process environment is desired.


Candidate must be capable of independently designing and creating software solutions based on limited information on rapidly evolving projects. Must be able to clearly communicate and share design decisions to the team. This role requires a highly motivated, organized engineer that is familiar with all aspects of avionics systems development.


The ideal candidate will be familiar with software requirements and configuration management. Candidate must have excellent oral and written communication skills and be highly energetic and self-motivated.


Basic Qualifications


RedHat Linux


Experience with Virtual Machines


Knowledge of Eclipse, Visual Studio, C++, GNU Tool Chain, Java, ActiveMQ, or XML


Knowledge of Object Oriented Development or Service Oriented Architectures


Experience with UML or SysML


Experience using Rhapsody


Desired skills


Design and Development of real-time operational software


Knowledge of C, C# or Java


Knowledge of Model View Controller/Model View View-Controller Controller

REPRESENTATIVE DUTIES: E = indicates essential duties of the position Use District data element dictionary in developing programs to prepare MIS reports as required (E) Design and develop programs to augment Ellucian Banner database(s) utilization and to facilitate District business processes as requested (E) Work with the Oracle and Ellucian Banner computer systems to extract required information as part of program development and implementation (E) Develop and maintain program specific documentation; including program operating procedures; prepare documentation to accompany all programs and program changes, documenting dates and specific nature of design/change to all code developed/modified (E) Maintain system code and configurations associated with District database and MIS systems and update programs and parameters and client access and usage procedures as required (E) Perform data extractions, migrations, back ups, merges, and integrations and prepare reports as required Design and develop programs to facilitate automated workflow systems as required (E) Recommend improvements to District systems, programs and utilities as needed Analyze and recommend new or modified computer applications (E) Conduct operational efficiency studies on programs and software applications used for database systems and other District systems (E) Interact with District personnel as required to provide database and management information system program and operational information; provide documentation and assistance to program and system users Learns and implements software provided by outside vendors (E) Design, develop, and augment GUI forms utilizing the Oracle Developer suite Design, develop, and implement web applications for District systems Perform related duties as assigned EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Any combination equivalent to: graduation with a Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related discipline, and two years’ experience in relational database systems programming (preferably Oracle) and UNIX/LINUX. Year-for-year full time experience can be substituted for degree requirement.

CONTACTS : Co-workers, 3rd party technical support, vendor/developer support services, other departmental staff, and colleagues from other educational institutions. PHYSICAL EFFORT : Requires the ability to exert some physical effort, such as walking, standing and light lifting Minimal dexterity in the use of fingers, limbs and body in the operation of office equipment Tasks require extended periods of time at a keyboard Requires the ability to maintain effective audio-visual discrimination and perception required for communicating with others WORKING CONDITIONS : Indoors, office/computer center environment. job summary:
This computer systems architect position is located with the historic Skunk Works in Palmdale, California. The selected applicant will develop, implement and gain customer concurrence on Security Systems Architecture for both enterprise and embedded systems within Advanced Development Programs (ADP). In addition, the candidate will provide system security engineering designs and implementation to all aspects of Cybersecurity/System Security Engineering. Tasks will include: development of assessments and mitigation of system security threats/risks throughout the program life cycle; validate system security requirements definition and analysis are built into the systems and software architecture; establish and implement security designs in hardware, software, data, and procedures (processes) to address emerging technologies and threats; verify security requirements; perform system assessment and authorization (A&A;) planning, testing, and liaison activities. The selected candidate will be responsible for interfacing with various disciplines including software development teams, Systems Engineering, System Integration, and Test engineering. May also interface with the Chief Architect or Chief Engineer as needed.


Candidate must have experience in developing Security Systems Architecture, Anti-Tamper approaches with embedded systems. Candidate must also have experience designing, architecting and integrating real time aircraft mission systems & simulations, with specific experience developing software and system designs based on object-oriented and advanced technical concepts, methodologies, technology, theories, and techniques.


Candidate will ensure that classified information systems (IS) are in compliance with the Joint Security Implementation Guide (JSIG) government directive. Experience with the Joint Air Force/Army/Navy (JAFAN 6/3) government directive is also valued. Candidate will assist with interpretation of government system security directives (such as DoD Instruction 8500.01) to determine technical system security requirements and prepare System Security Plans (SSPs), Protection Profiles, and reports associated with system assessment & authorization in accordance with the Risk Management Framework (RMF).

LM AEROP


Basic Qualifications

Systems Design and Engineering

System Security Requirement analysis

C++, Python and Java programming

Bachelor's degree in engineering or technical discipline

Ability to work through complex problems successfully

Security + certification


Desired skills

CISSP

Work across multi disciplined teams

Ability to present to customers, leadership and train engineers in cyber security issues

Understanding of the need to stay current with changes in this field.

Requirements decomposition and traceability

Enterprise Applications Engineer


Summary
Enterprise Application Engineer is the primary technical resource for installing, configuring, tuning and maintaining Enterprise Applications and COTS (Commercial off the Shelf) products. Installs web infrastructure and clusters to support load requirements, schedules application batch jobs and system automation. The Enterprise Application Engineer also assumes configuration management responsibilities, promoting application code and configurations through system environments. Supports and triages production issues.


Requirements:
* 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Experience with web servers such as Apache HTTPD, nginx and Microsoft IIS.
* Understanding of Linux and/or commercial UNIX operating systems sufficient enough to install, configure and maintain software.
* Basic understand of Java Enterprise Edition – Ability to read code and understand stack traces. Basic knowledge of garbage collection and heaps.
* Experience with Java application servers such as IBM WebSphere, Oracle WebLogic, JBoss, Jetty.
* Good understanding of networking basics, including TCP/IP, subnets, NAT, DMZ, sufficient enough to troubleshoot application connectivity.
* Experience with scripting languages such as perl, python, Windows Batch and POSIX shell scripting.
* Familiarity with scheduling and automation using tools like Cron and Windows Task Manager.
* Experience in a formal development environment where SDLC and release/change management principles are used.
* Must be authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
Recommended
* 
Experience with a continuous integration / continuous delivery platforms such as Jenkins. Experience in an agile software development environment.
* Experience administering high-load, high-traffic web applications with clustered, highly available components.
* Experience with Public Key Infrastructure technologies including (but not limited to) SSL, TLS, and public/private key encryption.
* Experience in application environments that utilize a Service Oriented Architecture.
* Experience with an enterprise scheduling tools such as Control-M or Tivoli Workload Scheduler.
* Experience administering and/or developing systems in government healthcare regulatory environments such as HIPAA and NIST 800-53.
Please note: This position is located on-site in Ridgeland, Mississippi. Relocation is not provided.

Our client has a need for Mid-Sr. level Mobile App Developer for a Direct Placement. They are looking for someone with 3-7 years of experience supporting/developing applications using Java, Spring, JSON, SOAP and XML. Also any experience with HTML and CSS, are welcome with Javascript. Front end Development and Design, RUP methodologies. Bachelor's Degree is required for perm.
