The applications developed will intergrate with other products such as Apple and Samsung. This group provides support for customer facing intergration with outside products to function on the the network. They enhance the ability for commerce to be sold via the network without being physically in the stores. Our client wants their customers to be able to do everything online that they can do in a store as well as establish the Web site as the initial POC for service.


Business Casual Enviroment. Opportunity to advance into Business Analyst or Architecture career path. Our client offers excellent benefits on perm such as paid family medical, phone and monthly plan and a 15% funded retirement plan.


This position requires the candidate to Support the development team around 70% of the time. 30% of the time the focus will be on build management, deployments, and on call.

Candidate will be directly involved in planning and execution activities to analyze, configure and implement a solution from IBM Open Pages for the enterprise Governance, Risk, and Compliance (eGRC) project. This project will enable processes to promote the aggregation, integration and correlation of risk data across the organization. This individual will be involved in data analysis, data integration design, recommend configuration options to promote efficient use of resources and reduce redundancy in systems across the enterprise. Implementation will also require a content and development framework to integrate authoritive libraries for Organization Hierarchy, Process, Risk and Control, Policy and Issue Register. This candidate will become a technical SME for the eGRC system functionality.

Top level technical expert with extensive business knowledge responsible for supporting a major application or suite of applications within an IT Section.

job summary:
Purpose of PositionThis position plays the role of Scrum Master in a scrum-based software development environment for Passport Point of Sale (POS) product. The POS Scrum Master’s main purpose is to ensure at all times that a Scrum Team’s productivity is maximized. The POS Scrum Master accomplishes this by coaching the Scrum Team on teamwork on a daily basis, as well as facilitating resolution of any impediment blocking traction or affecting productivity. The POS Scrum Master facilitates and enforces Scrum as the tactical framework for a Scrum Team to follow during execution.

Key Responsibilities• Coach a Scrum Team on teamwork, encouraging daily interaction within Team and between Team and external actors• Coach a Scrum Team on resolution of problems, with a strong focus on continuous improvement• Drive immediate resolution of impediments blocking a Scrum Team’s traction• Anticipate and drive resolution of impediments affecting a Scrum Team’s efficiency• Enforce Scrum as the tactical framework the Team uses during execution• Facilitate Scrum meetings: Release Planning, Sprint Planning, Sprint Review, Sprint Retrospective• Hold Product Owner and any other external actors accountable for what the Team needs to move forward• When needed, coach Product Owner and any other external actors on what the best way is to provide the Team with what they need to move forward Relationships• Daily interaction with members of the Passport development team, Quality Assurance, and Project Managers• Frequent interaction with Business Analysts, Marketing, Sales, Service, Support, customers, and 3rd parties• Interaction with any areas of the Company as required to resolve impediments affecting a Scrum Team’s traction or efficiency Qualifications Required: • Certified Scrum Master (CSM)• 5+ years experience in software development, preferably with Object Oriented languages such as C++, C# or Java• Experience as Scrum Master, team lead, or senior developer with team coaching responsibilities Preferred: • 4 year degree in Computer Science or related field• Experience in the Retail industry, electronic payment systems, and/or Point-Of-Sale systems Scrum Master, team lead, senior developer, coaching, facilitation, issue resolution, C++, C#, Java, Retail industry, electronic payment systems, Point-Of-Sale systems

job summary:
Leverage your software skills to improve cancer care. As part of Varian’s Translational Research Software Team you will engage with R&D; partners to help solve clinical and research problems in radiotherapy. You will participate in the development of an Oncology Information System (OIS) to enhance its use for radiotherapy R&D; projects through creation of new software libraries, new tools, web services, and API extensions to existing products. In so doing you will enable R&D; and help streamline adoption of Varian’s product offerings for our partners. This position involves all software engineering activities from analysis and design through coding and testing of software. The position also requires deep engagement and daily work with R&D; partners to understand their research and clinical needs and to help them with technical questions and provide examples. You will be sited with the Cone Health Department of Radiation Oncology software development team in Greensboro, North Carolina.


You are expected to build a deep understanding of Varian’s current product offering and its external programming interfaces. You should be comfortable working in a fast paced and innovative environment focused on creating safe, reliable software while meeting schedule commitments.


Job Requirements

Self-motivated and able to work well in a team environment. Strong problem analysis and solving capability.


Bachelor’s degree in software engineering, computer science or related discipline.


3 years professional work experience developing and testing software for medical devices.


Experience with OO design and Java, C# /.NET and/or C++ programming.


Experience with web programming and technologies.


Experience with SQL Server or similar database systems.


Experience doing formal verification testing.


Excellent communication and teamwork skills.


Prefer candidates with a deep knowledge of radiotherapy OIS, PACS and/or treatment planning systems.


Percentage of Travel Required

0-25%

job summary:
Market America, a productbrokerage and Internet marketing company that specializes in One-to-OneMarketing, is seeking an experienced Senior Java DevOps Engineer for our ITTeam. The team is currently in the midst of implementing new initiativeswith technologies/platforms like Docker, Glassfish/Payara and Microservices.

Position Summary
We are seeking talentedDevOps Engineer coming from a JAVA development background, who is a highlymotivated individual and who wants to innovate and contribute at a very highpace and leave a lasting impression. You will be expected to be a thought leader,driving conceptualization to realization. You will work with the middlewareteam and other software development groups to align on design, APIs anddelivery dates.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Collaborateswith members of project team in agile development to effectively developspecifications, feasibility analysis, testing requirements, and deployment.
Writes original code andrevises existing code to effectively meet project standards.
Creates, documents, andimplements test plans, scripts, and tests to ensure optimal functionality.
Develops documentation toaccurately summarize code.
Identifies coding errors andprovides recommendation for system improvements.
Designs coding systems toeffectively translate owners needs into technical language.
Recommends improvements insystems for optimal functionality.
Designs and sets updevelopment and POC (Proof Of Concept) environments such as VMs, IDEs,containers, etc.
Supports production systemsas part of the DevOps group.
Works with deployment team settingup build scripts, server environments and CI systems.
Acts as a mentor to otherengineers.
Ability to work with minimalsupervision.
Participates in the on-callrotation, as needed.
Complies with companypolicies and procedures.
Performs other duties asneeded.

Education and Experience
Bachelors degree in computerscience or related field. Or combination of equivalent experience, educationand training.
An EXPERT level Javaprogrammer.
Experienceusing and developing RESTful APIs.
Experience in agiledevelopment methodology, use of source code management systems like svn or gitand build tools like ant, maven, gradle or make.
One year experience inautomated build and deployment tools.
One year experience usingdesign patterns, developing web-based and multithreaded applications.
One year experience introubleshooting JAVA applications on UNIX/LINUX environments.

Skills
Deep understanding ofmiddleware software architecture.
Strong understanding of JAVAclass loaders.
Strong familiarity withapplication servers, web servers and load balancing technologies.
Understanding of networkcommunications, including TCP/IP, HTTP, and RPC protocols.
Strong understanding of theHTTP protocol, WebSocket, SSE, and other web technologies.
Familiarity with securityprinciples using SSL protocols and data encryption.
Familiarity with commonmiddleware issues such as virtualization, logging (log4j/log4j2, SLF4j), highavailability active-active solutions, service availability, patching withoutservice downtime, etc.
Familiarity with SSH andbasic BASH commands.
Good written and verbalcommunication skills.
Proficiencyin JavaEE/J2EE, Java application servers, JUnit, source control, standaloneJava applications, UML, and JDBC/JPA.
Moderate to above moderatelevels of English speaking, writing, and active listening; critical thinking;problem solving; analysis; troubleshooting; judgment; and leadership.

Preferred experience andSkills

Familiarity in setting upLINUX environments.
Experience in working withDocker containers, Kubernetes.
Experience in utilizing IaaSand PaaS cloud platforms such as AWS, Microsoft Azure, Heroku, Open SHIFT.

Market America offerscompetitive salary and generous benefits, including health, dental, vision, life,short and long-term disability insurance, a 401(k) retirement plan with companymatch, and an on-site health clinic.

Qualified candidates should apply online. This position is based in GreensboroNC. Not a telecommuting position.

Market America is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

ABOUT MARKET AMERICA, INC. & SHOP.COM
Market America, Inc. is aproduct brokerage and Internet marketing company that specializes in One-to-OneMarketing. Its mission is to provide a robust business system for entrepreneurs,while providing consumers a better way to shop. Headquartered inGreensboro, NC, the company was founded in 1992 by President and CEO JRRidinger and has generated over $5.3 billion in accumulated sales. MarketAmerica employs nearly 700 people globally with operations in the UnitedStates, Canada, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Australia, United Kingdom and Mexico. Through the companys shopping website, SHOP.COM, consumers have accessto over 40 million products, including Market America exclusive brands andthousands of top retail brands. By combining Market Americas entrepreneurialbusiness model with SHOP.COMs powerful comparative shopping engine, Cashbackprogram, Hot Deals, ShopBuddy, social shopping integration and countless otherfeatures, the company has become the ultimate online shopping destination.

For more information:
United States: http://www.marketamerica.com or http://www.SHOP.COM

job summary:
The Journey Begins with you.


There's quite a distance between wondering and knowing. And for patients waiting for answers to important health questions, it's a road they want to travel as quickly as possible.


At Quest Diagnostics Incorporated, we understand urgency. But more than speed, we focus our energies on accuracy. Currently, we seek a Engineer, Software - Lead I in our Greensboro, NC location.


Schedule: Monday – Friday, 8:30am – 5:30pm, Day shift


*Salary dependent upon experience*


REQ # 3768163


Responsibilities


Basic Purpose:

Work as part of a small agile team to design and implement new features and technologies. Deliver high quality, high performance code in an agile environment. Use, evaluate, and learn exciting new technologies that keep products and teams on the cutting edge. Provide technical direction and oversight for a single development project. Contribute to the leadership of cross-functional teams. Help lead the design, development, and maintenance of complex solutions with a focus on quality, performance, and resiliency.


Duties and Responsibilities:

1. Oversee the work being done by other software engineers working on the team, coordinating team activities with other teams and product groups, maintaining software architecture standards.

2. Consistently defines and applies technologies, standards and software engineering practices, mentoring other team members

3. Contributes in leading and directing software engineering resources to ensure timely and quality delivery of services.

4. Responsible for mentoring junior talent as well as directing technical staff through technical challenges, tasks and projects.

5. Develop key product features within existing large-scale enterprise applications & new strategic initiatives.

6. Participate in the full SDLC involving design, implementation, testing, and launching.

7. Collaborate with cross-functional partners (QA, Business Analyst, Tech Pubs, etc.) in an Agile/Scrum team environment.

8. Assist with the generation and analysis of business and functional requirements for proposed software solutions.

9. Participate in and sometimes lead architectural and database design discussions as they relate to product direction.

10. Create design specifications, documentation, and unit testing plans as defined by the Agile development process.

11. Generate data for project planning, including task breakdown and estimation of work for a project. Tracks status within the project as necessary.

12. Delegates tasks to project team members to balance work and increase team cross-training

13. Raises long-term architecture issues within project

14. Own the delivery of an entire piece of a system or application, and serve as a technical lead on small to midsize complex projects.

15. Build software solutions where the problem is not well defined. Design and define the interaction between the other component pieces.

16. Maintain and support software solutions post-production.

17. Implements and debugs some of the more involved/complex functionality.


Qualifications:

Education Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent.


Work Experience: 5-7 years of professional experience in software development.


Physical and Mental: Ability to multi-task, Analytical skills, Ability to follow verbal or written instructions, Thinking analytically, Communication, Using effective verbal communication, Using effective written communication, Handling stress & emotions, Concentrating on tasks, Making decisions, Adjusting to change, Examining/observing details, Sitting for long periods at a time


Other:

• Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented (OO) design patterns, distributed databases, and data modeling techniques.

• Proficiency in Enterprise Java programming plus one or more modern programming languages

• Ability to direct and motivate other technical resources.

• Ability to work well with people and be both highly motivated and motivating

• Experience in development of distributed/scalable systems and high-volume transaction applications.

• Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.

• Motivation to drive tasks to completion and take ownership of projects.


Expert Knowledge of Infor's Cloverleaf product requried.


How To Apply


Please Log In or Register to Upload a Resume and complete the online Application. Because of the large number of applicants to job openings, Quest Diagnostics will only contact candidates to be interviewed


Closing Statement


Quest Diagnostics has many career opportunities for individuals whose talent, initiative and dedication will complement our belief that the patient comes first and that values do matter. We work to earn our customers’ trust every day by providing the highest quality diagnostic information services in a professional, accessible and informative way. Our workforce is diverse and talented and believes in our vision: "Empowering Better Health with Diagnostic Insights."


[All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.]


Quest Diagnostics is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Women / Minorities / Veterans / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity.


*CB*

Requisition #13943


About the Company


Lincoln Financial Group provides advice and solutions that help empower Americans to take charge of their financial lives with confidence and optimism. Today, more than 17 million customers trust our retirement, insurance and wealth protection expertise to help address their lifestyle, savings and income goals, as well as to guard against long-term care expenses. Headquartered in Radnor, Pennsylvania, Lincoln Financial Group is the marketing name for Lincoln National Corporation (NYSE: LNC) and its affiliates. The company had $222 billion in assets under management as of March 31, 2015.


The Role


The Sr. Analyst, Enterprise Architecture ensures that complex architecture decisions are implemented consistently across the assigned line of business (Lincoln Retirement Planning Services "RPS") and IT, in order to support the business and IT strategy. S/he will be primarily responsible for working across the RPS and technology teams to deliver a 3+ year technology investment plan and implementation roadmap for the business line they are aligned.


Responsibilities


Technical

Translate business strategies into a technology investment roadmap for RPS.
Collaborates with RPS and technology teams and serves as a subject matter expert to deliver and understand the complex technology roadmap for their assigned business line.
Understands complex business unit needs and where RPS strategy is taking LFG from technology perspective and interpolates ways that systems can be used across enterprise.
S/he will define and maintain complex target technology architectures for RPS.
Responsible for having an advanced understanding of IT industry trends and enterprise standards and methodology in the Insurance or Financial Services space.
The role will be knowledgeable of the complex enterprise systems and applications, and can be called upon to provide subject matter expertise in multiple areas, i.e., Java-based Architectures, Data Analytics or Mobile applications

Execution

Influencing the technology solutions & technology investments that will deliver the business strategy
Provides direction and guidance to scope and architect major technology change projects, leading strategic options analysis, proposing end-to-end solutions, and highlighting trade-offs and risks
Review evolving designs of major technology projects to identify strategic opportunities and resolve design issues during delivery
Ensure IT projects align with strategic capabilities, target architectures & technology standards.
Oversee the management of the application portfolio management system for their area(s) of responsibility.
Identify key technology enablers to optimize Lincoln’s IT investments including new and innovative uses of emerging enterprise technology platforms
Influence key IT vendors and partners.

Education

4 Year/Bachelors Degree or equivalent work experience (4 years of experience in lieu of Bachelors) (Minimum Required)

Experience

5-7 years of experience in Enterprise Architecture that directly aligns with the specific responsibilities for this position (Required)
Strong experience partnering with the business in the Retirement Planning space.
Confident, comfortable communicator with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strong presentation skills with demonstrated ability to influence at all levels of management through clear, informed and logical discussions/presentations.
Ability to analyze complex information and to evaluate the implications of a course of action or solution.
Ability to analyze information and to evaluate the implications of a course of action or solution.
Ability to interpret and apply common sense understanding to carry out a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.
Ability to solve problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
Define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.
Evaluate trends in data or information.
Demonstrated ability to identify and recommend processes improvements.
Demonstrated strong relationship management skills with internal clients (e.g. senior management, peers and colleagues); proven ability to develop creative and collaborative approaches.
Demonstrates strong interpersonal skills with a collaborative style.
Demonstrates strong project management leadership skills including, critical ability to coordinate and balance multiple projects in a time-sensitive environment, under pressure, and meeting deadlines.
Finds common ground and can gain collaboration among senior/executive management, colleagues and peers; can influence outcomes without directing or commanding.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). #LI-KM1

This position may be subject to Lincoln’s Political Contribution Policy. An offer of employment may be contingent upon disclosing to Lincoln the details of certain political contributions. Lincoln may decline to extend an offer or terminate employment for this role if it determines political contributions made could have an adverse impact on Lincoln’s current or future business interests, misrepresentations were made, or for failure to fully disclose applicable political contributions and or fundraising activities.

Requisition #16621

About The Company

Lincoln Financial Group provides advice and solutions that help empower Americans to take charge of their financial lives with confidence and optimism. Today, more than 17 million customers trust our retirement, insurance and wealth protection expertise to help address their lifestyle, savings and income goals, as well as to guard against long-term care expenses. Headquartered in Radnor, Pennsylvania, Lincoln Financial Group is the marketing name for Lincoln National Corporation (NYSE: LNC) and its affiliates. The company had $222 billion in assets under management as of March 31, 2015.

The Role

The Sr. Application Security Analyst is responsible for working with application development and infrastructure teams to ensure applications are designed, coded, and implemented securely. S/he will be will act as a subject matter expert on design review, code review, and dynamic analysis. S/he will drive the improvement of policies, standards, and other supporting documentation. This is a hands-on technical position that you will find yourself collaborating with multiple groups across the organization. Strong communication skills are needed to explain complex security to a wide variety of technical levels. Experience as a developer is helpful, but not required.

Responsibilities


Responsibility for the security of LFG applications and services
Conduct design review, code review, and dynamic analysis
Identify, communicate, and drive the resolution of vulnerabilities

Experience


5-7+ years of experience in Information Technology that directly aligns with the specific responsibilities for this position
Extensive experience in web application security
Strong knowledge of application security throughout the SDLC

Experience dynamic analysis with tools such as AppScan, Webinspect, BurpSuite, and OWASP ZAP, etc.

job summary:
Market America, a product brokerage and Internet marketing companythat specializes in One-to-One Marketing, is seeking an experienced MarketplaceIntegration Specialist.
Position Summary
We are looking for an individual that will be a part of our SHOPMarketplace Network Team to provide support for our new merchants that join ourprogram and get them setup on SHOP.COM. This is a technical position with agreat opportunity for learning behind the scenes of setting up loyalty rewardprograms and tracking sales. This individual should be creative and willing tothink outside the box to help introduce new ideas for our current cashbackprogram.
Essential Duties andResponsibilities
Assist merchants in all markets with integration of trackingcode to ensure that all sales SHOP.COM redirects to advertisers website trackproperly.
This involves: Review of agreement with advertisers Technical correspondence with developers onadvertisers side (all markets of SHOP.COM). Schedule testing and product integration Review of website code to make sure trackingcode is displaying correctly. Oversee integration to SHOP.COM site of linksand ads. Communication to Sales teams in market countryof new advertisers integrated. Work with Department Director to help keep upwith all affiliate network technologies to ensure efficiency of loyalty rewardprogram. Assist with overflow of incoming request fromcustomer service to field order inquiries and other issues with affiliateadvertisers. Assist with Development projects with researchand technical specs to help development team implement new programs.
Supervisory Responsibilities None.
Education and Experience Bachelors degree from afour year college or university; or 2 years related experience and/ ortraining, or equivalent combination of education and experience 2+ years of HTML and basicwebsite development skills. Programming knowledge a plus but not required such as (PHP,ColdFusion, JAVA, SQL or MySQL, etc) Proficient with MicrosoftOffice Programs, especially Excel. Ability to multi-taskrequired. Familiar with XML andDatabases Communication and follow-upskills a must. Creative and detailedoriented.

Working Conditions and Environment Intermittently lift, carry,pull, and push up to 20 pounds. Continuously see, sit,balance, grasp, and have repetitive use of arms, wrists, hands, and fingers. Intermittently stand,stoop, bend, twist, crouch, kneel, crawl, walk, operate foot and hand controls,squeeze, and reach above shoulders. Exposure to electricalequipment, low noise levels, and mild indoor temperatures of hot and cold. Constant use of computer. Long or odd hours, asneeded.

Market America offers competitive salary and generous benefits,including health, dental, vision, life, short and long-term disability insurance,a 401(k) retirement plan with company match, and an on-site health clinic.

Qualified candidates should apply online. This position is based in GreensboroNC.

Market America is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

ABOUT MARKET AMERICA, INC. & SHOP.COM

Market America is a product brokerage and Internet marketing company thatspecializes in One-to-One Marketing. With more than six million customers and 180,000Independent Shop Consultants worldwide, the company has generated over $5.3billion in accumulated retail sales. Headquartered in Greensboro, NC, thecompany was founded in 1992 by President and CEO JR Ridinger and employs nearly700 people globally with international operations in the United States, Canada,Taiwan, Hong Kong, Australia, United Kingdom and Mexico. Through itsrevolutionary One-to-One Marketing concept, Market America combines theInternet with the power of people creating the ultimate online shoppingdestination at SHOP.COM . More information is available at MarketAmerica.com ( http://www.marketamerica.com ).

SHOP.COM is a comparison shopping site designedto meet the shopping needs of the consumer and the business needs of merchants.Leveraging the features of our patented OneCart®, along with extensive partnermarketplace integration, a robust Cashback program, and thousands of pages ofunique shopping-centric editorial, SHOP.COM helps customers "Shop Smart, Save Big" across thousands of onlinestores. SHOP.COM also powers ShopCompanion® andThe Shopping Vine® ( http://theshoppingvine.com ),a shopping blog network. For more information, please visit SHOP.COM ( http://www.SHOP.com ).

job summary:
The primary role of the Project Manager is to clearly define and manage projects’ scope while delivering quality assets in a fast-paced environment. In this capacity, Project Managers are the main liaison between the client Account teams and all of the Creative, Development, Interactive Design, Social Community Management, QA Testers and Analytics teams . Impeccable communication and organizational abilities are a prerequisite for consideration.


Job Qualifications
Education: Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience


Experience:


4-7 years of experience as a Project Manager (per time-lengths outlined below as a guideline), specifically in the fields of Marketing, Publishing, New Media, Advertising, or Software Development (client, agency, or firm). Other prior work experience will be considered on a case-by-case basis.


Skills:

Experience working on teams using Agile and/or SCRUM methodologies preferred
General familiarity with Development and QA processes (SDLC or PDLC)
Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks simultaneously and efficiently
Excellent writing, grammatical/proofing, communication, presentation, and follow-up skills
Exceptional organizing and resource planning skills
Extreme attention to detail
Proficiency in MS Office ( Word, Excel, PowerPoint )
Familiarity in at least one Project Management suite
Familiarity with Project Management and Time Tracking tools
Familiarity with Bug Tracking tools like JIRA
Familiarity with at least one CMS (Content Mgmt System) such as WordPress, Expression Engine, Alfresco, etc.
General familiarity with other tools, such as Analytics Reporting Suites ( SiteCatalyst, Google Analytics ), DAM (Digital Asset Mgmt), FTP utilities, and SEO products
General familiarity with Internet applications and technologies preferred (HTML, .PHP, CSS, Java, Flash, social media platforms), preferred.
Responsibilities: The Project Manager is responsible for the coordination, completion, and delivery of projects. The Project Manager oversees all aspects of a project, from initial request (prior to Discovery) through Deployment and subsequent Maintenance. They manage multiple projects of widely varying time-lengths, from quick-turnaround content initiatives to large-scale web platform development projects. Many projects may have competing interests and overlapping resource requirements.


Projects: Projects cover a wide range of topics, including creating brand content, social assets, websites, micro sites, custom emails, marketing campaigns, mobile / web / tablet apps and tools, social media content, and videos, among others.


Tasks/Skills: Performs a variety of tasks, including defining project scopes, estimating costs and timelines, scheduling tasks and resources, balancing workloads, managing scope change, monitoring budgets, helping to develop strategy, and prioritizing tasks for product bugs, enhancement requests and maintenance updates. Sets deadlines, assigns responsibilities, monitors progress, and periodically summarizes and communicates project status for Account teams and/or upper management.


Relies on limited information and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. Familiar with a variety of marketing and (digital) publishing concepts, practices, and procedures, including Agile methodology. Must be able to work independently on multiple projects and also identify potential project risks via collaboration with product, technical, and creative stakeholders, including escalating where appropriate.


Environment: Works in a cross-matrix environment, in which PM reports to department manager while delivering projects to different Account teams. Leads and directs the work of Creative team members, Developers, Interactive Designers, Social Community Managers, QA Testers, and Analytics team members. Works with head of Project Management team to follow existing processes and suggest improvements.

job summary: Position OverviewAs our CM Specialist, you will be responsible for working with the team to fully administer the source code tools, developer access and source code. Your responsibilities include branching and merging methodology to support multiple, concurrent teams working on independent delivery cadences. This will include working closely with our CI Build Manager to support multiple build streams for each function or bundled code segment being enhanced. The CM specialist will need to support between 8 and 30 simultaneous work streams with source code and access control. The CM Specialist will be expected to be provide labeling, i.e., labeled builds, that the CI Build Manager can directly reference. You will be responsible bundling the exact source for a specific build. Other duties include providing CM audits and identification of 3rd party library dependencies. The project is a large software development effort for a high visibility government web site. As the CM Specialist, you will be able to make a difference in the quality of our software deliverables.ResponsibilitiesYou will have the opportunity to work with a distributed development team of over 50 developers to implement continuous integration tools, processes, and procedures. During the first thirty days, you will work with the team to understand the current source code environment, identify issues, document success criteria, and define any initiatives to improve source code management. After this initial period, you will be responsible for total source control and the implementation of any improvement initiatives. You will need to integrate well with an established team, using both technical and consensus building skills to support the multi-stream development being accomplished by up to 6 teams. The program is complex, using Agile SAFE processes, and distributed geographically. As our CM Specialist, you must be team oriented and able to facilitate discussions with the Development and Release teams. This position offers the ability to make a difference by improving and expanding source code management to streamline development and help us to build better products. You will have the opportunity to support technical teams with defining, documenting, baselining, and changing configuration items. You will manage the baseline configuration for source code; we may expand this role to include off the shelf software, hardware, and related documents as well as manage and track changes to baselines; you will engage as liaison with our client on status and impacts of change management and requests. You will be responsible for planning, coordinating, and implementing measures to safeguard information in computer files against accidental or unauthorized change, modification, or disclosure. You will also schedule and perform independent audits - comparing audit results to actual IT infrastructure. You will lead the team to develop and improve CM process, working methods, and tools.Essential Job FunctionsDevelops and maintains account/region standards and procedures to ensure that configuration management controls are capable of supporting deployment activities and implementations to meet business needs.Develop and support tools to improve the efficiency of source code management, configuration and control for the software development and related build processesInterprets configuration management activities and tools as defined for the account and applies them to project activities. Works with the project manager to develop configuration management plans, milestones, and schedules for projects. Revises and assists in implementing new strategies as appropriate.Manage all access to the source code repository;Decomposes configuration items into appropriate configuration units for the specific projects or tasks. Identifies problem issues and recommends solutions as appropriate.Provide source code branching and merging policies to support a multi-work stream environment;Document policies and processes to be used by the team;Ensures version control integrity for software and non-software components by reviewing account requirements. Establishes approach for resolving discrepancies to ensure requirements are met.Define source code backup and off-site retention;Perform configuration audits;Performs audits for projects or accounts according to the configuration management plans. Ensures baselines are established and approved by the appropriate control board.Identify source code anomalies and implement solutions;Provide SCM support in branch management, merge conflict resolution;Assist with providing technical deployment documentation.Develops initial technical installation guidelines and other documentation of hardware and software standards to facilitate tracking. Assists customers and support personnel in understanding product configuration.Assists lead personnel for assigned accounts/regions.Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel.Basic QualificationsBachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experienceBachelor's degree in business administration, management information systems, or related field preferredExperience implementing configuration controls for a large distributed teamSVNRational Clear Case or equivalent Rational tool;AWS or other hosting server environment;Six or more years of configuration analysis experienceExperience working with distributed computer systems, software and associated communication networksDemonstrated experience with branching and merging source code control for projects with multiple work streams;Demonstrated skills with establishing configuration control policies for a team with greater than 50 developers;Experience working with networking principles and local area networksMust have great interpersonal and written and verbal communications skills.Experience working with company software and hardware productsOther QualificationsGood skills in configuring and installing various operating systems and application softwareGood communication skills to interact with team members, customers, and support personnelSoftware development experience in a Java technology stackGood analytical and problem solving skills to resolve technological problemsProficiency with SQL scripts and HTMLExperience with Rational/Jazz productsPrevious experience with the Department of Veterans AffairsAgile team experienceLeadership skills to instruct and mentor less experienced personnelBasic project management skillsVA EVSSAbility to work independently and as part of a teamJob Type: Full-timeRequired education:Bachelor's

job summary:
Responsible for building applications, reports, and processes that enhance and support the systems used for fundraising at UC Davis. Under general supervision of the Assistant Director of Business Intelligence Services, work as part of the Advancement Services team supporting fund raising at UC Davis.

Design, implement, document, and support new and existing critical web applications, data integrations, and reports. Delight customers with easy to use business applications, ensure data integrity, and adhere to secure coding practices to meet campus cyber security standards.

Consult with clients and recommend and or approve acquisition of new technology solutions to improve or automate existing processes; coordinate and prioritize client requests; create implementation plans and conduct project management activities.

Serve as part of a team of decision makers who analyze system functionality, coding, and practices for continual improvement. Make recommendations for programmatic data correction, including data downloading, analyzing, programmatic correction, and uploading into an enterprise scale database environment for improving and enforcing data standards. Provide overall database analysis and development across a variety of platforms.


Physical Demands:

Work in close quarters.


Sit and work in front of a personal computer for extended periods of time.


Work Environment:

Work occasional evenings.


UC Davis is a smoke and tobacco free campus effective January 1, 2014. Smoking, the use of smokeless tobacco products, and the use of unregulated nicotine products (e-cigarettes) will be strictly prohibited on any UC Davis owned or leased property, indoors and outdoors, including parking lots and residential space.


Background Check Required:


This position is a critical position and subject to a background check. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of background investigation including criminal history and identity checks.

Yes


Qualifications


Minimum Qualifications:

Experience architecting, developing, and maintaining complex web applications using an object oriented programming language such as C# or Java. Preference will be given towards C# on the ASP.NET platform.


Experience with CSS, JavaScript and HTML.


Experience using Git distributed version control or other version control systems and incorporating continuous build, deployment and integration technologies.


Experience with relational database development using Oracle, MS SQL Server or equivalent, including the ability to write and implement Queries, Stored Procedures, Views, Functions, and other standard SQL objects and concepts.


Experience developing technical specifications, writing clear, grammatically correct documentation, and documenting all code and procedures.


Organizational skills to determine priorities, delegate responsibilities, exercise independent judgment and make appropriate decisions.


Interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills to interact effectively and diplomatically with management, peer institutions, software vendors, donors, customers, students, staff and/or university administrators.


Skills in statistical and data analysis to sample and test existing databases, determine error rates, establish minimum quality standards, and summarize and effectively present information.


Knowledge of Microsoft Office Products.


Preferred Qualifications:

Experience developing robust applications using Visual Studio and ASP.NET MVC, and C#.


Experience developing for the Microsoft Azure Cloud Application platform using Azure SQL and the Azure .NET SDK.


Experience developing application to application communication interfaces utilizing web services architecture using REST, XML/JSON, SOAP, or WSDL.


Experience developing unit and functional tests on the .NET/MVC framework using libraries such as MSTest or NUnit, including a deep understanding of test isolation, test doubles, and code coverage.


Skills to conduct training sessions develop training materials and make presentations in front of large and small groups.


Experience developing database application systems related to fundraising, personnel, students, payroll, and other administrative functions using campus data sources (AFS, PPS, etc).


Experience with a data visualization tool such as MS Power BI or Tableau.

education level/skills required / respon: You will work on application modernization projects to help transform application code written in native/legacy languages (e.g., COBOL, Natural, PL/1) into...
job summary:
Are you a talented, creative software development professional, interested in working in a team atmosphere to help solve our clients’ most complex issues? Are you interested in working in one of the hottest areas of the market today, modernizing applications for our clients, all the while working with high caliber team members and continually learning and expanding your skills?


Work you’ll do


As a Senior Consultant you will bring considerable technical, functional, and product expertise to deliver application and systems modernization solutions effective to clients. You will work on application modernization projects to help transform application code written in native/legacy languages (e.g., COBOL, Natural, PL/1) into modern languages (e.g., Java, .NET). This process helps our clients solve problems, improve operations, and update their applications more easily, quickly, efficiently, and cost-effectively. Beyond that, you will serve on engagement teams as they help our clients modernize prioritized functionality in their systems (e.g., Business Rules Engines, Mobile Applications). You will have responsibility to:

Work on teams on Application Modernization efforts serving clients, either in the Code Refactoring/Migration stage or in a Modernization effort of systems that have refactored code 
Serve as lead liaison between the clients and our Deloitte teams Manage junior resources, upholding quality standards, and following Deloitte methodologies on Application Modernization approach and processes Contribute to teams performing analysis of refactored code defects in custom-made refactoring tools; collaborate with a team of engineers and products developers to execute work and solve problems Contribute to practical solutions and methodologies to further support the Application Modernization offering Contribute to proposal work as we compete for new business

The team


Systems Integration


At Deloitte Consulting LLP, our systems integration specialists help clients manage the complexity inherent with technology change, from requirements planning to architecture, testing to deployment, and beyond, helping to link their IT programs to organizational goals. And we offer a complete range of industry-leading services, including systems development, solution and platform integration. Learn more about our Systems Integration practice .


Application Modernization Senior Consultants are required to have:

4 years of relevant consulting or industry experience 
At least 2 years of experience leading small teams, either development/technical teams or other teams performing on technology implementations, migrations, or system updates A minimum of 2 full system development life cycle implementations Demonstrated understanding of tool based modernization, including code analysis, code conversion and automated testing tools Demonstrated experience executing the SDLC against large systems implementations At least 2 years of experience with solution development and application architecture with JEE(J2EE) or .Net At least 2 years of performing conceptual and technical designs, including the use of object-oriented analysis and design techniques A willingness to travel 80 - 100% of the time A Bachelor's Degree or higher, preferably in a Computer, Information, or Engineering or equivalent experience

In addition, successful Application Modernization Senior Consultants will have the following preferred background:

Experience or passion for implementing cloud solutions on Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and/or Google Cloud Platform 

Experience of DevOps practices and tools Understanding of user experience, user centered design and responsive web design Experience with application or core modernization – either through the use of custom-built tools or through MOTS/COTS products Experience working with mainframe technologies (COBOL, NATURAL, PL/1, VSAM, JCL, ADABASE), either as a programmer or manager of teams who work with these languages Experience working as a programmer in JEE(J2EE) or .NET Experience with Testing across all phases: System, Integration, and Performance Testing and experience with requirements traceability Ability to work independently and manage multiple task assignments Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint) Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment Eagerness to mentor junior staff

How you’ll grow


At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center.


Benefits


At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.


Deloitte’s culture


Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.


Corporate citizenship


Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.


Recruiter tips


We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

job summary:
Responsibilities

You will be a part of the Corporate Network & Technology organization focusing on the strategic technology evolution across our organization specifically with orchestration of virtualized network functions. As part of this team you will lead the overall deployment, designing and feature roadmap for our orchestration and assurance solution(s). You’ll have a positive impact on our organization, and change the way that our customers live, work, and play.
Integrate with various facets of Verizon’s virtualization efforts inclusive of new on-boarding methodologies, open loop and closed loop service assurance practices, and tying in with new and legacy tools to enhance and automate aspects of FCAPS.
Exhibit decision making capability to enable the transformation to new DevOps best practices. This redesign is expected to take full advantage of all of the operational efficiencies envisioned by a software defined network that can be programmed and managed through a cohesive orchestration layer.
Interface extensively with many functions within the business including internal and external system architects, product line managers, network operations leads, DevOps leads and a variety of both business and technical organizations spanning Verizon's enterprise.
Qualifications

Must have: A Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent work experience. Six or more years of relevant experience. Experience with Datacenter virtualization technologies (servers, networks and software stacks), monitoring tools and processes. Experience Linking and communicating procedural change to specific financial and operational benefits. Experience transforming longstanding procedures and operations within the organization. Experience in supporting application virtualization within a service provider network.
Ideally, you’ll also have: A Master’s degree. Even better if its MS EE/CS, MBA or equivalent Six or more years of telecommunications and IT industry experience. Five or more years of Verizon operations/maintenance engineering/network engineering & planning experience. Knowledge in IP networking, Application traffic flows, and Security best practices. Understanding of SDN, NFV, Openstack, Docker, Containers Concepts as well as the FCAPS model to support Service level orchestration and assurance Hands-on knowledge in the majority of following areas: In-depth working knowledge of the 4G Evolved Packet System architecture to be able to determine impact changes on part of the network can have on the rest. Working knowledge of the standards (3GPP, 3GPP2, IETF, GSMA, etc.) specifications. Hands on knowledge and Subject Matter Expertise in IP networking, Application traffic flows, and Security best practices. Experience in supporting application virtualization within a service provider network. Understanding of SDN, NFV, OpenStack, Docker, Containers Concepts as well as the FCAPS model to support Service level orchestration and assurance. Hands on knowledge of Openstack CLI, Netconf/Yang and Linux/Unix scripting especially for TCP/IP stack, Firewalls (iptables), DNS and VPNs. Experience with deployment or use of configuration management tools such as Puppet, Chef, or Ansible, Jenkins. Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies quickly. Proven ability to perform independent system analysis, design and plan implementation, paying special attention to details and objectives. Strong engineering and innovative talents to foster technical creativity with management. Excellent communications, interpersonal, organizational, critical thinking, problem solving, project management; presentation and multi-tasking skills. Proficient in engaging and influencing large teams and executive leaders. Proven ability to thrive in a dynamic work environment and meet deadlines. Meticulous attention to detail, with results-oriented focus. Familiarity or experience with Software Defined Networking principals or system. Knowledge of wireline networks and services – Private and Public IP network services, Switched Ethernet Services, Managed network services using Viptella, Versa. Programming aptitude in Python, Java scripts, SOAP, Ruby, PHP. API development based on JSON, XML. Experience with server provisioning using cloud-init and cloud config. Experience with TOSCA and YAML based file formats. Experience with HOT Template and OVF based VNF descriptors.
Leadership & Decision Making: Demonstrated ability to influence within the group and is recognized as a leader within and outside of work group. Demonstrated a positive, proactive leadership role including taking the initiative to identify matters of importance; resolving problems in a timely fashion; fostering a sense of teamwork; and working well in an unstructured environment. Proven ability to translate functional/operational goals into team goals. Exercise judgment and subject matter expertise in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results and driving change. Establish and modify processes as needed to meet new challenges. Demonstrate original thinking, openness to change, and alternative solutions Initiate action; assume ownership for decisions and results. Make appropriate use of all available information and data available. Anticipate future requirements and situations and prepare accordingly. Recognize impact of decision upon the rest of the organization. Solicit and receive broad guidance and feedback from both internal external sources. Responsible for the leadership of broad programs in support of organizational.
Communication Skills: Communicate, verbally and in writing, in a clear and concise manner. Present ideas in a logical, compelling manner in both small and large group settings. Adjust to meet the needs of the reader or listener, able to communicate technical information to a non-technical audience. Demonstrated ability to integrate large volumes of information from multiple sources.
Not to boast, but a little bit about us
Verizon powers America’s fastest and most reliable network. We’re also leading the way in cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and video entertainment. Technology moves fast and so do we. We believe that bringing great ideas and customer experiences to life should be recognized and rewarded. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Verizon is a Federal Contractor
Verizon requests veteran priority referrals
Verizon is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer M/F/Disability/Vet.

Java

job summary:
Rockland Trust is currently seeking an IT Operations Analyst to work with our Information Technology Department in Plymouth. This position supports the centralized detection, assessment, communication and remediation of security vulnerabilities and responsibilities administering many IT applications and platforms.


Responsibilities & Duties


Strong communication and documentation skills.
Manage the CME vulnerability scanning infrastructure, services, schedules and reporting processes. Research and remediate most known and new vulnerabilities provide solutions to foster the initiative through. Escalate vulnerabilities that require risk assessment or alternate mitigation strategies to determine enterprise mitigation requirements. Within defined bank SLA’s.
Verify implementation and makes adjustments to vulnerabilities while documenting the solution and providing clarification and support.
Prioritize the order in which the organization addresses vulnerability remediation based on established risk remediation profiles. Assist teams with vulnerability remediation planning based on risk level and required remediation target timelines.
Design and recommend 3rd party foundational software hardening standards (examples are Apache, Tomcat, IIS etc).
Works with Information Security to create operational security solutions and procedures.
Experience with Linux and Windows systems, Citrix, VMware and cloud computing.
Must be able to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Ability to multitask and enjoy working as a team member as well as independently.
May be required to lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
Required Skills
LANGUAGE SKILLS

Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations.
Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.
REASONING ABILITY

Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
Required Experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science from an accredited college or university; or equivalent education/experience in the computer science field.


Minimum of five years’ experience with Microsoft Operating System and software at both the server and workstation levels (Windows 7/8/8.1/10, Windows Server 2008/2012, Exchange 2010 and newer, SQL server 2008 and newer, Active Directory, etc.).


Experience with patch and vulnerability management solutions.


Experience with Citrix XenApp, Netscaler, and DLP solutions.


Experience with VMware vSphere 5.1 or newer.


Experience with Java, Apache and IIS.


Familiarity with CVSS scoring and security standards, such as NIST Cyber Security Framework, NIST SP800-53, COBIT, ISO27001, is a plus.


Ability to interact and communicate with internal and external users and vendors on both technical and non-technical matters.


Familiarity working in a regulated financial industry environment preferred.

job summary:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) has multiple openings for Entry Level Software Engineers in our Taunton, MA location.


The position provides an opportunity to develop the cutting-edge technology that supports some of our nation's fundamental defense services. GDMS employees work closely with esteemed clients to develop solutions that allow them to carry out high-stakes national security missions. The selected candidate will work with collaborative teams to perform technical activities that impact the design and manufacturing of advanced electronic systems. In addition, the Entry Level Software Engineer will enhance their skill-set by working among a talented and technically accomplished group of colleagues.


In this role, you will be responsible for the development of software and systems products in a Linux and/or Windows-based workstation environment. This role will offer you the opportunity to:

Integrate as a member of a software development team and complete assigned tasks, that will nurture and expand your technical skills
Learn systems in order to update information
Enter data into various systems
Research and document various data processes
Abide by all safety procedures outlined by the company

Basic Qualifications:
The Entry Level Software Engineer position requires a bachelor’s degree in software engineering, electrical engineering, computer engineering or a related technical field, or the equivalent experience.


A U.S. Government Secret security clearance is required within 24 months of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.


Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.


Qualifications (Preferred):
TECHNICAL SKILLS:

Java/J2EE, C++, JavaScript, C#, HTML, CSS, and XAML
Comfortable working with Visual Studios and Eclipse IDEs
Experienced with various Server Frameworks, DOM, and Java Web App Platform (Tomcat)
Adept with Microsoft Office - especially Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Comfortable working with operating systems, such as Windows 7 and 10, Windows Server 2008 and 2012, Mac OSX Mavericks (10.6+), and Linux (RedHat 5 and 7)

RELATED COURSES a plus

Database Management Systems
Object-Oriented Programming in Java
Advanced Programming
Operating Systems
Data Structures, Algorithms & Complexity
Computer Architecture

Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) offers a powerful and robust portfolio of products, services and solutions that help customers successfully execute their missions in today’s dynamic environment. With unsurpassed engineering using an open systems approach, General Dynamics Mission Systems solves our customers’ most complex challenges while foreseeing future needs.


At GDMS, our employees work in collaborative teams with leading edge technology and the best in the industry to solve tough customer problems while keeping our nation safe. Individuals are empowered to do their best work in an environment that encourages and supports innovative, collaborative and creative thinking. The General Dynamics ethos of honesty, transparency and trust is apparent in the way we work with our colleagues and our customers.


We look forward to you joining our high performance team at GD Mission Systems!


General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran.

job summary:
Onset is seeking a DevOps engineer with strong Java and Amazon Web Services (AWS) experience. The ideal candidate will utilize several AWS services that support our custom Java based software services ( www.hobolink.com and www.intempconnect.com ). The candidate will need to set up, configure, and monitor the whole stack: load balancers to filesystems and databases.


Requirements


The role requires working collaboratively with Engineering and IT to:

Deploy and operate our systems
Help automate and streamline our operations and processes
Build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring, and operations
Monitor and maintain network security
Troubleshoot and resolve issues in our development, staging, and stable (production) environments
Share 24x7x365 pager duty with one or two other team members
Key skills

Strong background in Linux/Unix Administration (3+ years required)
Strong background in Java EE (Web applications) (3+ years required)
Experience with automation/configuration management using Go and Maven or an equivalent
Experience with cloud-based monitoring tools (preferably AWS CloudWatch)
Ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies and cloud services (2+ years with AWS or Google Cloud is required)
Experience with Highly Available (HA) services and infrastructure (load balancers, database clusters and replication, application server pools)
Strong experience with SQL and MySQL (3+ years required)
Experience with Redshift or other data warehouse engine
Experience with REST web services
A working understanding of scripting languages (PHP, Python, Perl and/or Ruby)
Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service
Education

BS degree

Machine Operator

The machine operator assembles electronics according to written manufacturing instructions and product specifications.


Duties and Responsibilities

Assembly and inspection of Onset products, and other duties as deemed required by immediate supervisor/Team Lead
Operate automated equipment used in the manufacture of Onset’s products
Perform daily/weekly/monthly preventive maintenance (PM) on all automated equipment and document properly
Perform inspection, simple and advanced rework on both SMT and Thru-hole parts as needed
Edit programs on both the pick/place and selective solder machines as required
Work with Manufacturing and Development Engineering on new products to help define best practices and diagnosis of potential problems
Competencies

Attention to Detail, Communication, Customer Focus
Decision-Making & Judgement, Initiative & Change
Job Knowledge & Skills, Problem Solving, Productivity & Quality
Self-Development & Teamwork
Education/Experience

Mechanical reasoning and ability to work on/with the automated equipment
Relies on written and verbal instructions and pre-established guidelines to perform the functions of the job
Works under general supervision
Must have the ability to work within a team environment and assist others for the common goal
Reports to Team Lead
Requires a high school diploma or its equivalent and 3 to 5 years of experience
Workplace Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Office employees must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Light-assembly employees, engineers, and warehouse employees must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.
Other duties as assigned
Currently, we have two openings – first and second shift .

Network Systems Technician

The Network Systems Technician responds to queries, answers questions, and resolves hardware and software problems in a multiple platform environment. Maintains a small inventory of production ready PCs to keep all production PCs up while reformatting problem PCs. Diagnoses, identifies, and resolves problems. Implements corrective actions within established parameters or refers more co mplex problems to higher-level technical staff personnel for resolution. Utilizes diagnostic software and technical support personnel to diagnose and resolve problems. Ensures corrective actions are implemented and hardware and/or software are functioning properly. Generates appropriate documentation. Maintains records of problems, equipment and installations, cabling diagrams, and work performed. The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this position. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and duties required of personnel so classified.


Position Type/Expected Hours of Work


This position is full-time and non-exempt. Hours of work are Monday-Friday 8-5. The individual responsible for the role will also be required to be "on-call" during non-business hours.


Qualifications and Education Requirements

Education/Experience: High school diploma and specialized training, 1-3 years of related experience.
Computer Skills: To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Microsoft Word; Microsoft Excel; Microsoft Internet Explorer.
Equipment Used: Ability to install and utilize PC and Macintosh network hardware and software. Ability to apply information technologies and industry network standards. The NST must have very high ethics, and have the ability to work on computers with company confidential.
Other Qualifications: Ability to solve network problems within standardized guidelines and procedures. Ability to read, analyze, and interpret technical materials Ability to communicate ideas and problem resolutions in a clear and succinct manner, both orally and in writing.
Workplace Environment


This position will operate in an office and manufacturing environment.


Manual Duties/Physical Requirements


This position will requier standing and/or kneeling for long periods of time. Position does require the ability to lift 25 pounds.


EEO/AA. Apply to: jobs@onsetcomp.com No calls please.

Vice President - Sales

The Vice President of Sales has the overall responsibility for leading the Sales team, directing the achievement of sales, and establishing all sales strategies, plans, and programs for Onset. The VP will take the lead in strategic planning and the implementation and improvement of customer relationships and engagement, will be responsible for maximizing the sales of Onset’s products and solutions to meet or exceed the business plan, and will be responsible for developing and maintaining the needed sales infrastructure to support both current and future operations.


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS


Execute the Onset Sales Strategy

Develop plans and strategies for growing business and achieving the company’s sales goals
Lead with compelling strategic vision that’s in alignment with the organization’s short- and long-term goals
Participate as part of the senior management team in setting organizational goals, strategies, forecasting, reporting, and measurement
Manage the Sales Operations

Develop, recommend, and implement sales programs, procedures, and goals to align with company objectives; contribute to the formulation and validation of corporate objectives and business plans
Develop workforce and financial requirement forecasts for Sales; consolidate projections into operating and capital expenditure budgets
Develop and communicate the Sales business plan in conjunction with forecasting and budgeting and in relation to overall company goals and objectives; provides Sales forecasts by partner, channel, and product lines
Ensure that the Sales function has the necessary infrastructure (technology, systems, etc.) to support both current and planned sales and marketing activities
Oversee Partner Relationship Management and Engagement Process

Develop and maintain strong relationships with key partners and contacts
Directly manage major and critical developing client accounts, and coordinate the management of all other accounts; capable of personally handling “key accounts” as necessary
Keep management informed of developments and trends in the industry and with key customers/partners
Responsible for customer engagement through customer-focused Sales processes and planning
Ensures the company is using the appropriate mix of Sales processes that match the needs and receptiveness of customers in varying market segments— large account, domestic, international, etc.
Manage, Upgrade and Design the Sales Team Structure

Define the optimal Sales force structure.
Responsible for the optimal deployment and territory/account assignment of Sales personnel.
Make recommendations for changing Sales roles, coverage models, or team configurations in order to maximize Sales productivity; leads a change management process to build organizational understanding of proposed changes, establish support from key leadership stakeholders, and effectively implement new deployment and job models
Ensure the Sale force possesses and uses the needed competencies, knowledge, and skills to achieve both current sales targets and intended market growth; develop and implement strategies to provide needed learning and development activities to fill any gaps in existing capabilities
Responsible for properly staffing the Sales department; develop overall plan for staffing needs to meet Sales activities envisioned in the company’s strategic and operational plans; ensure that needed succession and recruitment planning occurs
Appraise performance of staff against position requirements, established goals, expectations, and standards; provide effective and continuous feedback; assure the development and direction of a dynamic Sales and Marketing department that will meet or exceed company goals
Work with Human Resources to design and manage compensation programs
Create the Culture Needed for a High-Performing Sales Team

Create a culture of success and ongoing business and goal achievement
Maintain/enhance the Sales staff compensation and incentive programs that motivate the Sales team to achieve their sales targets
Ensure that cross-functional collaboration exists between Sales other corporate functions
Establish sales quotas for the Sales department and individual Sales staff; communicate to staff relative to achievement of these goals
Additional Responsibilities

Travel 25-40% of time (10% international) as needed for in-person meetings with customers and partners and to develop key relationships
Exhibit desirable and appropriate professional behavior including leadership, sense of urgency, independent judgment, industriousness, teamwork, ability to get along with others, creative thinking, and personal integrity to provide for a cohesive, productive unit dedicated to the achievement of corporate goals
Other duties as assigned or required
KNOWLEDGE AND EDUCATION

Bachelor’s degree in related field; Master’s degree (MBA) preferred
Extensive knowledge of business and sales operations
Electronics manufacturing knowledge
EXPERIENCE AND TRAINING

5+ years of experience in a director-level Sales role within a company of $50-150M annual revenue
Experience in building, developing, and motivating a high-performance and accountable Sales team that is committed to results
Experience with channel and e-commerce web and international sales
Proven track record of sales performance
Experience with transactional, consultative, relationship, and direct sales methods
An entrepreneur within position or industry, requiring commanding presence and dynamic qualities
Experience developing sales forecasts, business and new product strategies, budgets, quotas, and business plans
Experience developing and delivering presentations, both internal and external
Experience designing and developing sales organizations that are models for success within the industry
15+ years of experience selling hardware and/or software/systems solutions with a solid understanding of device manufacturing
SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Ability to develop constructive and effective working relationships within and outside the organization
Ability to design the Sales force to effectively target the full account space with a structure that best aligns with the Sales process strategies (i.e., account assignments, territory allocation, design, etc.)
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing with all levels of the organization and with external contacts; ability to create and deliver powerful and effective presentations
Ability to plan, lead, motivate and develop staff; highly-developed skills in leadership, including selection and hiring, training, coaching, developing and administering measurement tools, and providing performance feedback effectively
Proven ability to operate as entrepreneur within the organization and instill this quality in others
Function effectively as part of the senior management team and execute strategically
Demonstrated ability to develop programs, procedures, and staff that are customer-focused, and instill this quality in others
Highly-effective time management and organizational skills, with the ability to instill these qualities in others
Proven ability to exercise sound judgement both in sales, leadership, and as part of a management team
Ability to develop a strategic sales plan in conjunction with the overall corporate strategic plan; proven ability to generate strategic thinking from Sales staff and instill ability to carry out tactics associated with the plan
Demonstrated ability to design, communicate, and execute effective forecasts and budgets
Local candidates. EEO/AA. No calls please.

Position: Java Engineer

To support our growing team, we are looking for an agile developer. You’re the right fit if you’re a great team player and there isn’t a problem you can’t solve. We need an application developer who is passionate about writing code that meets business needs.

You will be working on a team amongst teams building enhancements and new functionality for applications that are used to issue life insurance. These applications are evolving with vision of a digital client experience for Northwestern Mutual. This team is located in Franklin.

Your general milestones are as follows:
Within the first month – while working with other developers on the teams, be able to jump head-first into modifying applications and ask the appropriate questions / do the appropriate research to identify the general functions and behaviors of the applications you’re working on.
Within three months – be able to pick up and work on any existing application, contribute directly to technical discussions that affect the current and future state of the applications. Essentially, contributing to the team at your full capacity.

Fast learner and self-starter. The people you will work with are incredibly kind, talented, and extremely willing to share knowledge and a helping hand, but you have to be willing to take ownership of the outlined goals and make things happen.
Ability to take initiative and work with minimal supervision, yet actively interact with other team members in person or over the Internet (chat, videoconference, email).
Work collaboratively on creative solutions with product owners and developers.
Bring new ideas and new ways of solving problems to the team.

Education / Professional Experience

Bachelor's degree or Associate's degree in Computer Science or a related field
5+ years Development experience in Java
Experience with REST / SOAP services and clients, Websphere App Server and Websphere MQ
Working knowledge of the Struts Framework, jQuery, and Junit
Experience writing and debugging multithreaded Java applications
Familiarity with business process management software (ex. WPS) is a plus
