job summary:
Information Technology Trainee – 

Entry Level Position:


Work for an industry leader while learning cutting edge technology. Eagle Creek Software Services, a rapidly growing Software Services company, is currently seeking entry level software consultants for our Technology Center in Valley City, North Dakota (relocation assistance available). At the technology center you will receive hands-on training to work toward becoming an IT consultant, engaged on software implementations from project initiation to final customer roll out.


Paid Training Program Provides:

Comprehensive instruction on general topics and tools including Unix/Linix administration, SQL, SSIS, SSRS, and quality assurance, programming languages (Java, .Net), database skills, CRM and BI
Classroom and small group environment training
Work on simulated projects adapted from real life scenarios that our technology center consultants are engaged on from day-to-day
After instruction on general topics and tools, trainees will focus on two of the three technology stacks that Eagle Creek specializes in, including application development, CRM, or BI
By training at Eagle Creek, you will quickly develop a wide range of new skills, ideal for career development into the IT consultant position.

Working at the Technology Center:


At our Technology Center, you are encouraged to set your sights on your career goals within Eagle Creek, and to work toward them while adding value to the organization. Our state-of-the art facilities offer an opportunity to work within a structured organization where you can advance. Projects tend to be mid-to-long term and diversified. Assignments can be challenging but also exciting and rewarding. You will have a great opportunity to make an impact immediately as well as grow professionally. Travel, if any, would be infrequent.


Position Location: Valley City, ND


Position Responsibilities:

Actively learn all of the aspects of the tools and technologies related to two technology stacks
Learn and engage as a team member and individually
Actively and successfully progress and transition from Trainee to an IT associate consulting position within the designated timeframes

As an Associate Consultant:

Work alone and collaboratively to solve business problems and develop the functionality our customers demand
Analyze the business issues that face our Fortune 2000 clients, design original and innovative solutions, and deliver them to our clients
Within the application development technology stack, work within all aspects of the Software Development Life Cycle: Requirements definition, Functional and Technical Design, Configuration, scripting, integration, data transformation and manipulation, testing, training and documentation
Within the CRM technology stack work with such technologies as Salesforce.com or Siebel
Within the BI technology stack work with such technologies as Informatica or OBIEE

Position Requirements:


An Eagle Creek Software Consultant will work in a team environment for the successful development and implementation of software applications at the site from project initiation to full customer product roll out with minimal supervision. In this capacity, consultants will be experienced in application functionally and technically.


To be a part of the Eagle Creek Software Services team you must meet or exceed the following requirements:

Bachelors Degree in MIS, CS, IS, IT, Engineering or Associates degree with relevant experience
An understanding of Object Oriented Programming languages
Experience developing code
Excellent communication skills and be able to work well in a collaborative team environment
Understand standard business practices
Posses a passion for leveraging technology to create enterprise wide solutions

job summary:
We are looking for a talented software engineer to join us in continuing to innovate the encryption and key management space. We love to work with people that have a strong sense of ownership, strong entrepreneurial mindset, high tolerance for ambiguity and insatiable curiosity.


Responsibilities
Work as a member of a cross-functional team responsible for taking products from idea to customer deployment
Design and implement encryption applications across a wide variety of cryptographic services, key interfaces, certificate and key types based on industry standard technologies
Write code across multiple platforms including Windows, MacOS, Linux, Solaris, AIX, HP-UX, iOS and Android
Make changes to existing product code base as directed
Develop and perform cross-platform tests
Troubleshoot and resolve software defects
Requirements and Skills
8-10 years of experience building software products
2-3 years of experience building software security products
Experience programming in C, C++, C#, .NET and Java
Solid understanding of fundamentals such as processes, inter-process communication, multi-threading, race conditions and deadlocks.
Strong problem solving, analytical and debugging skills are required
Experience with OpenSSL, CAPI/CNG preferred
PKWARE, Inc., is…
More than two decades ago, PKWARE revolutionized data compression with the invention of the ZIP standard. Today, through continuous innovation and development, PKWARE has become the only complete system for reducing, securing, moving and storing data across the extended enterprise, both internally and externally, from mainframes to servers to desktops and into the cloud. Used by more than 30,000 corporate entities and over 200 government agencies, PKWARE is the industry standard for portability, ensuring data security and cross-platform computing. The PKWARE Solution is used billions of times a day to manage cost risks associated with data security breaches while avoiding increased storage costs with data reduction of up to 95% and improving service delivery. PKWARE is a privately held company based in Milwaukee, WI with additional offices in New York, Dayton Ohio and the United Kingdom.


And just so you know…
PKWARE provides equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, veteran status, membership in the national guard, state defense force or any reserve component of the federal or state military forces, age, non-relevant arrest or conviction record, use or nonuse of lawful products off the company's premises during non-working hours, or other characteristic protected by law.

job summary:
Join a dynamic team that’s using Agile to develop the next generation of mobile patient monitors & cloud-based networks. As a Staff Platform Services Engineer, you’ll be working on a state of the art platform that provides clinical intelligence at the point of need for caregivers. We’re developing a first of its kind hospital wide solution. Be part of a team that’s redefining the patient monitoring portfolio: mobile, cableless, cloud enabled.


Essential Responsibilities

• Responsible for enabling, executing and delivering Software defined networking/services in virtualized Linux environments.

• Owns software defined services/networking development process(es) for large and complex releases of a product and at times expands the scope across multiple concurrent releases. Focuses on scale and efficiency

• Manages key deliverables and mentors junior team members

• Contributes in driving initiatives such as defining standards and processes to ensure quality

• Demonstrates expert knowledge in Linux Configuration, Administration, Scripting and Distributed Logging

• Current on latest Linux virtualization and software services and methodologies and promotes across the team.

• Works with developers and stakeholders to deliver quality software/environments for the MDH Platform

• Partners with and provides direction to fellow team members to diagnose bugs and formulate solutions

• Uses industry best practices to improve Virtualization processes

• Works cross functionally with other business departments to align activities and deliverables

• Develops and enhances the test infrastructure and continuous integration framework used across teams

• Aware of and complies with the GEHC Quality Manual, Quality Management System, Quality Management Policy, Quality Goals, and applicable laws and regulations as they apply.


Qualifications/Requirements

• Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related computer degree

• Minimum of 8 years’ experience in Linux configuration & environment administration (KVM).

• Ability to troubleshoot network, virtual machine, and build system issues that could be due to hardware, software or network faults.

• Good analytic and problem solving skills.

• Distributed Logging (SysLog)

• Experience with Scripting (Bash, Python, Perl, and/or Ruby)

• Effective oral and written communication skills.


U.S. (Country) Specific Qualifications:

• Must be legally authorized to work in the United States full-time

• Must be willing to work in our Milwaukee, WI facility full-time

• Must submit application for employment through gecareers.com (or COS if internal).

• Must be 18 years of age or older

• Must be willing to take a drug test as part of the selection process

• Must be willing to submit to a background investigation, including for example, verification of your past employment, criminal history, and educational background


Additional Eligibility Qualifications

GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen.


Desired Characteristics

• Working knowledge of Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) – OpenStack

• Working knowledge of Platforming as a Service (PaaS) and/or Fog technologies

• Experience with Software Defined Networking

• Experience with Load Balancing

• Experience with Hardware specs (compute/storage/network)

• Experience with SAN/NAS configuration & administration

• Experience with NTP, DHCP, DNS configuration & administration

• Experience with Distributed System Management (Nagios, Elastic Stack/ELK)

• Experience with Licensing solutions in a distributed environment

• Demonstrated effective problem solving capabilities

• Demonstrated ability to work effectively within and across various teams

• Experience in Continuous Integration/Testing (TeamCity, Jenkins)

• Experience with Build Tools (Maven, Gradle, *make)

• Strategic planner and thinker with ability to drive change

• Self-starter, energizing, results-oriented, and able to multi-task; tenacious and organized

• Demonstrated ability to make recommendations to technical and program leadership to improve the product, process or technology

• Outstanding communication, facilitation and influencing skills; ability to present ideas clearly and concisely

• Experience working with medical devices or in a regulated industry


“Nice to Have” Qualifications:


• “Nice to Have” previous work experience with:

o Experience with Kubernetes, Openshift

o Demonstrated experience with Data Center configuration management tools (Chef, Ansible, Puppet)

o Experience in Scalability/High Availability strategies for Java Services and Microservices

job summary:
Information Technology Trainee – 

Entry Level Position:


Work for an industry leader while learning cutting edge technology. Eagle Creek Software Services, a rapidly growing Software Services company, is currently seeking entry level software consultants for our Technology Center in Valley City, North Dakota (relocation assistance available). At the technology center you will receive hands-on training to work toward becoming an IT consultant, engaged on software implementations from project initiation to final customer roll out.


Paid Training Program Provides:

Comprehensive instruction on general topics and tools including Unix/Linix administration, SQL, SSIS, SSRS, and quality assurance, programming languages (Java, .Net), database skills, CRM and BI
Classroom and small group environment training
Work on simulated projects adapted from real life scenarios that our technology center consultants are engaged on from day-to-day
After instruction on general topics and tools, trainees will focus on two of the three technology stacks that Eagle Creek specializes in, including application development, CRM, or BI
By training at Eagle Creek, you will quickly develop a wide range of new skills, ideal for career development into the IT consultant position.

Working at the Technology Center:


At our Technology Center, you are encouraged to set your sights on your career goals within Eagle Creek, and to work toward them while adding value to the organization. Our state-of-the art facilities offer an opportunity to work within a structured organization where you can advance. Projects tend to be mid-to-long term and diversified. Assignments can be challenging but also exciting and rewarding. You will have a great opportunity to make an impact immediately as well as grow professionally. Travel, if any, would be infrequent.


Position Location: Valley City, ND


Position Responsibilities:

Actively learn all of the aspects of the tools and technologies related to two technology stacks
Learn and engage as a team member and individually
Actively and successfully progress and transition from Trainee to an IT associate consulting position within the designated timeframes

As an Associate Consultant:

Work alone and collaboratively to solve business problems and develop the functionality our customers demand
Analyze the business issues that face our Fortune 2000 clients, design original and innovative solutions, and deliver them to our clients
Within the application development technology stack, work within all aspects of the Software Development Life Cycle: Requirements definition, Functional and Technical Design, Configuration, scripting, integration, data transformation and manipulation, testing, training and documentation
Within the CRM technology stack work with such technologies as Salesforce.com or Siebel
Within the BI technology stack work with such technologies as Informatica or OBIEE

Position Requirements:


An Eagle Creek Software Consultant will work in a team environment for the successful development and implementation of software applications at the site from project initiation to full customer product roll out with minimal supervision. In this capacity, consultants will be experienced in application functionally and technically.


To be a part of the Eagle Creek Software Services team you must meet or exceed the following requirements:

Bachelors Degree in MIS, CS, IS, IT, Engineering or Associates degree with relevant experience
An understanding of Object Oriented Programming languages
Experience developing code
Excellent communication skills and be able to work well in a collaborative team environment
Understand standard business practices
Posses a passion for leveraging technology to create enterprise wide solutions

job summary:
DESCRIPTION

ProShip, Inc. seeks a Software Engineer to join its software integration team, to implement and integrate ProShip Software Suite solutions. The ProShip product suite is an enterprise-class software solution that automates the multi-carrier shipping needs of the largest parcel shippers globally. The position will involve a mixture of: installation and implementation of supply chain management and logistics automation software, integration to end-user ERP/WMS of same software, troubleshooting, user training and documentation.

The ideal candidate will have a Computer Science, relevant Engineering degree or equivalent experience, with at least internship experience, preferably in the development and integration of an enterprise-class, server-based commercial software product.

REQUIREMENTS

Required:

Excellent working knowledge or ability to pick up VB.NET, C#, and VB Script
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ideal knowledge of PHP, ASP and ASP.NET
Basic computer and server administration (Linux and Windows)
A deep rooted drive to learn industry-specific knowledge
Basic database skills (SQL, without a GUI)
Experience with data manipulation algorithms
Familiarity with a variety of RDMS platforms, including MySQL, Oracle, and SQL Server

Desired Experience:

C, including familiarity with low level Win32 API calls
Experience with agile development methodologies
Linux and Windows System administration skills
Competency with popular virtualization technologies
Logistics and supply chain concepts
Skills in HCI (specifically, aesthetics in UI Design)
Advanced proficiency with MSSQL and MySQL
Skills creating and consuming web services
LAMP or MEAN stack experience
Experience with PLCs and/or embedded controllers
Apple/Mac development experience
Java competency
Experience in the shipping industry
Knowledge of a variety of peripheral devices, including label printers and hand-held scanners

OVERVIEW OF PROSHIP, INC

Who We Are

ProShip, Inc. is a Neopost company that provides software, technology, service and support while creating solutions that give our customers a competitive advantage. By prioritizing speed, compliance and support ProShip has become an industry leader in multi-carrier shipping software. Businesses like Trek Bicycle Corp, Kohl's, American Girl, TigerDirect, Miles Kimball, Parker Hannifin, Derco Aerospace, Sephora, and Louis Vuitton utilize our software to create a simple, one-touch shipping process to handle their packages worldwide.

ProShip began as a one-man shop that has grown into the comprehensive company it is today with offices in Brookfield, WI and Chicago, IL. Our team is made up of seasoned software engineers, customer service experts, dedicated sales professionals and marketing specialists that bring countless years of experience when it comes to the shipping and IT industries.

http://www.proshipinc.com

http://www.proshipsoftware.com

Who We Need

We are growing at a rapid rate -- with over $12 million in sales last year, we always look forward to finding the next person to join our team. Wondering if you'll be the right fit? We look for people who are keen to staying up-to-date on the changing and complex world of technology, enjoy facing new challenges each day and want to contribute to the success of our customers.

Why Work Here

ProShip is a company that values its people --those that work here and those we work with. A career at ProShip will allow you to be challenged, grow professionally and work in a positive environment. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes:


Medical, dental and vision coverage
Life and accident insurance
Short-term and long-term disability
Flexible spending and dependent care options
401(k) plan with company match
Wellness program
Tuition assistance
Vacation, holiday, and sick paid-time off

ProShip, Inc. by Neopost is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

job summary:
At JDA , we’re fearless leaders. We’re the leading provider of end-to-end, integrated retail, omni-channel and supply chain planning and execution solutions for more than 4,000 customers worldwide. Our unique solutions empower our clients to reduce costs, increase profitability and improve collaboration so they can deliver on their customer promises every time. Using JDA, you can plan to deliver. www.jda.com

Position Overview:
The Software Engineer will work with the team in the design and development of software products for JDA. The associate is responsible for research and validation of application framework solutions using a variety of technologies including but not limited to Java, .NET, open source, and potentially 3rd party solutions. You may also be required to provide technical training and/or assistance.

Responsibilities:
Work as part of a fast-paced and challenging development team

Provide comprehensive code fixes for issues determined to be defects

Utilize the Agile process to design and build features and functionality delivered on time and within scope

Develop automated tests to validate newly added functionality on Continuous Integration servers

Troubleshoot technical issues on internal servers/environments and provide resolutions for defects found in the field

Required Skills

Bachelor’s Degree required; preferably in Computer Science or related field

Required Technical Skills:
Java

SQL and database concepts

Preferred Technical Skills :
JavaScript experience highly desired

An understanding of software application development practices and life-cycle

Critical thinking, excellent research, and strong analytical skills with superb attention-to-detail

Ability to work independently and take initiative while also serving as a team player

Strong time management and organizational skills

About You:
You are flexible! You define “good attitude.”

You enjoy working with a team and alone as the situation dictates.

You have a great sense of humor.

You are passionate and optimistic.

You have an insatiable thirst for knowledge and improvement and the desire to grow in your role.

You evoke inspiration in those around you and encourage them to create their best work.

You are up to speed in the latest technical trends and thinking, but don’t always accept them.

You work for the best interest of the group at all times.

You have unwavering personal integrity and work ethic.

You are proactive.

You graciously give and receive feedback.

You buy into the scrum methodology.

Join the conversation online by connecting with us on Twitter @JDASoftware @JDACareers and Facebook (http://bit.ly/9s2DVE).

Also, check out JDA's blog - Supply Chain Nation - the platform for supply chain trends and innovations at http://blog.jda.com.

You will be responsible for leading design and implementation of software subsystems in exciting mobile X-ray products. Owning complex software modules, providing technical leadership to plan, develop and test quality software, and conceive innovative software platform solutions by closely collaborating with a Systems team and Software Architects are expected.


Essential Responsibilities

• Be responsible for providing technical leadership and defining, developing, and evolving software using the latest software development technologies and infrastructure
• Understand X-ray product, its modules and the interrelationship between them while being an expert in the assigned component or module

• Translate requirements into design, and deliver to required timelines and quality standards

• Drive design reviews, define interfaces between code modules, and apply existing technology to designs

• Drive increased efficiency across the teams, eliminating duplication, leveraging product and technology reuse

• Support process improvements which guide the development, sustaining & support activities

• Coach, mentor and lead a small team of software engineers

• Work cross functionally with other software teams to align activities and deliverables

• Drive world-class quality in the development of X-ray products

• Apply principles of SDLC, Product Security, Scalability, Documentation Practices, refactoring and Testing Techniques

• Be an expert in writing code that meets standards to deliver software functionality in X-ray systems


• Understand performance parameters and assess application performance

• Work on core data structures and algorithms and implement them using technology chosen


Qualifications/Requirements

• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or in “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math

• A minimum of 5 years of professional experience in software development OR Master’s degree with 3 years of experience in software development.

• Strong analytical skills, knowledge of Object Oriented Analysis and Software Design Patterns

• Experience with Unix / Linux based platforms and core C/C++ and Java programming skills

• Experience working in complex software development projects

• Experience in all steps of the software development cycle and knowledge of configuration management tools

• Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen

• Must be willing to work out of an office located in Waukesha, WI

GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen.

Preferred

• Ability to takes ownership of small and medium sized tasks and deliver while mentoring and helping team members

• Ensures understanding of issues and presents clear rationale. Able to speak to mutual needs and win-win solutions. Uses two-way communication to influence outcomes and ongoing results

• Identifies misalignments with goals, objectives, and work direction against the organizational strategy. Makes suggestions to course correct

• Continuously measures deliverables of self and team against scheduled commitments. Effectively balances different, competing objectives

job summary:
Come join GE Healthcare in reinventing MRI (Magnetic Resonance Imaging). In this role, you will have the opportunity to help lay the foundation for our next generation of scanners based on the latest technologies. Agile development principles and continuous customer engagement help us stay ahead of today’s fast-paced medical technology marketplace and provide our customers with the best performing, highest quality and easiest to use products possible today.


Essential Responsibilities

1. As a software developer understand MR clinical needs and translate those to viable product features and requirements.

2. Responsibility across the full development lifecycle of requirements, design, implementation and testing.

3. Implement simple solutions to complex problems

4. Live for continuous improvement

5. Expect top tier quality from yourself and your peers

6. Learn new tools and technologies to keep our software on the cutting edge

7. Collaborate to advance the state of the art in areas including, but not limited to:

a. User Interface and Modern user workflow

b. DICOM image creation and management

c. State machine design for controlling the scanner

d. Patient and prescription data management

8. Apply principles of SDLC and methodologies like Lean/Agile/XP, CI, Software and Product Security, Scalability, Documentation Practices, refactoring and Testing Techniques


Qualifications/Requirements

Desired Characteristics:

Technical Expertise:

1. 5+ years of experience with Java, C++, or another object-oriented language in a production software environment

2. Experience developing web services (Spring framework, RESTful,Web Services)

3. Experience with modern tooling (Gradle, Maven, Perforce, Git)

4. Experienced with unit testing and continuous integration

1. Has the ability to break down problems and estimate time for development tasks

2. Has the ability to make basic technology choices based on experience

3. Demonstrates awareness about competitors and industry


Leadership:

1. Has the ability to take ownership of small tasks and deliver without supervision while using their discretion to seek help when necessary

2. Voices opinions and presents clear rationale. Uses data or factual evidence to influence

3. Recognizes collaborative behavior and participates in collaborative activities

4. Learns organization vision statement and decision making framework. Able to understand how team and personal goals/objectives contribute to the organization vision

job summary:
Company Description

Dematic is a global engineering company that provides a comprehensive range of intelligent warehouse logistics and materials handling solutions. With a global knowledge network of more than 4,000 skilled logistics professionals, Dematic is able to provide customers with a unique perspective in world-class materials handling solution design. Our commitment to solution development, combined with engineering centers and manufacturing plants in North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, ensures Dematic has the range and capability to provide reliable, flexible, cost-effective solutions globally. Our successful track record has led to the development and implementation of more than 5,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium, and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors. Dematic generates a global business volume of approximately $2 billion.


Job Description

Are you looking for challenging work with variety and advancement opportunities? Dematic Corp has a need for a Software Application Engineer at our office located in New Berlin, WI. This position will be within the Software Application Engineering team. The successful candidate should have some knowledge in the following skill sets:

Java
Relational databases such as Oracle or SQL Server
Object oriented concepts
VB.net

Additional skills in the following areas are highly desired:

Good communication skills
HTML & CSS
Familiarity with version control
Virtualization (VMWare, etc.)
Familiarity with web servers (Tomcat, etc.)
ADO
Knowledge of software/hardware setup
Good problem solving skills
Duties to include:

Assisting project and technical engineers in integration of new systems.
Assisting technical and development personnel in application quality testing.
Working on site to install, commission, and test installation of material handling solutions.
Providing specified technical support to customers on-site, when assigned.


Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience.
2-5 years of software development experience is desired but will train new graduates
Willingness to travel 20% - 40%.

General Requirements

Job Family Responsibilities:


Participates in semi-complex design, maintenance, enhancement, testing, implementation, and support of software. Supports the development of software test requirements for semi-complex modules under development, may execute semi-complex test specifications. Participates in providing estimates for semi-complex modules under development, and may estimate own work. Supports the reviewing of semi-complex customers standards specification and other documentation to determine software engineering requirements. Participates in presentations of semi-complex technical findings and developments. Provides support with the software quality process through the execution of semi-complex module, subsystem and system test procedures.


Key Responsibilities:


Performs important areas of standard professional level work that typically requires processing and interpreting, more complex, less clearly-defined issues. Refers semi-complex, unusual problems to others. Identifies and resolves readily identifiable, clearly-defined problems.


Education:


Typically BS/BA in related discipline or advanced degree. Certification may be required in some areas.


Knowledge and Experience:


Demonstrates a good grasp of knowledge and principles of field of specialization and applies through successful completion of assignments. Successfully applies knowledge of fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of particular area of specialization. Typically 0-5 years of successful experience in related field and successful demonstration of Key Responsibilities and Knowledge as presented above. Advanced degree MAY be substituted for experience, where applicable.


Direction of Others:


May provide general guidance or train lower level support staff.


Key Working Relationships:


Primarily intra-organizational contacts and some external contacts.


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

job summary:
Expectation for All Employees

Supports the organization’s mission, vision, and beliefs by exhibiting the following behaviors: excellence and competence, collaboration, innovation, respect personalization, commitment to our community, and accountability and ownership.

Position Summary

As an Embedded Firmware Engineer on a fast-paced consumer product development team, each team member is responsible for contributing to the development process, from initial concept development through production support and product sustainment for electro-mechanical products.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities :
Develop firmware for custom hardware platforms which leverage a wide range of technologies including, but not limited to, Microsoft Cloud Services, Apple MFI, IFTTT, and Amazon AWS.

Participate in design of firmware based on provided functional specifications and requirements

Implement software components based on high and low-level design descriptions

Write test software for hardware products and participate in testing and debugging of new hardware and software designs

Study and understand existing firmware and hardware design and implementation. Modify, extend, and/or debug past implementations to support revised or novel products.

Develop software building blocks based on design specifications. This task may involve development of wide range of software components such as interpreted scripts, application programs, device drivers, unit tests, web pages, and graphical user interfaces.

Develop unit testing software to aid the testing and debugging of hardware products.

Evaluates, defines and communicates new standard methods and concepts of IoT technology.

Essential Skills and Knowledge Requirements:
Knowledge in provisioning, commissioning and remote device management in the context of IoT.

Hands on experience with one or more of the following languages: C, C#, C++, Java.

Knowledge of embedded firmware, real-time operating system (RTOS), and HW/SW interactions.

Familiar with network protocols and concepts including TCP/UDP client and server applications, XML, JSON and REST APIs.

Understanding of computer architecture, embedded programming techniques, command line compilation tools, build systems based on Makefiles.

Knowledge of firmware development environments including compilers, debuggers, emulators, and tool-chains.

Familiarity with source control (SVN, GIT) software engineering tools

Experience working with common IDE’s such as Microchip, Atmel, TI, and Visual Studio.

Good analytical, integration, support, and debugging skills

Proficiency in the tools of the industry, including a variety of modern programming languages and open-source technologies

Must be able to perform in a fast-paced interactive development environment.

Strong verbal and written communication skills for interfacing with architecture, validation, manufacturing, and other disciplines

Experience with troubleshooting firmware implementations on digital systems and circuits and communicating design issues to hardware engineers.

Microsoft Office including Excel, Word, Power Point, Vizio and Project.

Education / Experience / Certification :
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and/or Computer Engineering

Five or more years of relevant work experience

Strong understanding of object-oriented development principles, data structures and algorithm design.

Experience designing reusable architecture with well-defined interfaces along with an understanding of tradeoffs.

Familiarity with common tools used to manually assemble/patch and test PCBs e.g. microscope, soldering iron, amp meter, and an oscilloscope.

Candidates must be able to legally work and reside in the US, without sponsorship

Work Schedule :
40-hour work week/Full Time Employee

Required to execute and fulfill requirements of “Confidentiality, Intellectual Property Rights Assignment, Non-Solicitation and Non-Competition Agreement”

XJ6

job summary:
AECOM has an opportunity for a Software Engineering Support Lead in Tallahassee, Florida. Position will be part of the AECOM Florida ITS Transportation organization that provides leading technologies for Florida’s highway and roadway infrastructure. This Software Engineering Support Lead provides oversight support for team responsible for all aspects of the SunGuide ATMS planning scheduling and deployment at the customer premises in Tallahassee, Florida.


The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

Interaction with traffic engineering staff to understand and document needs and issues related to SunGuide and other applications


Periodic oversight or installation of the SunGuide application itself, including patches, upgrades, etc.


Interaction with the SunGuide software and hardware vendors, including opening and managing issue tickets and providing assistance in resolving issues


Troubleshooting application and system data issues using logs, network analysis tools, and ad-hoc scripts and applications


Development of software tools that enhance and improve our support and management capabilities


This is a project-based environment, and less than 20% of the typical week will be spent on other projects. Some travel may be required.


NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES:


Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.


Minimum Requirements

Bachelor's degree in related field


10+ years as part of a software development team, in any combination of management, support, test, or development.


Strong project management skills


Experience in a team environment


Strong systems Testing experience


Technical skills in a clustered Windows server environment


Experience with MS SQL and SQL Server


Experience programming in C#


Experience in Device Integration and testing


Superior communications and organizational skills


Self-motivated and managed


Ability to pass a background check


Preferred Qualifications

Experience programming in Java


Experience programming in at least one scripting language


Recent current experience in the Intelligent Transportation Industry


What We Offer


AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow.


AECOM is an equal opportunity employer and Minorities, Females, Veterans, and Disabled persons are encouraged to apply. For further information, please click here at http://www.aecom.com/content/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/EEO-is-the-Law-poster-supplement.pdf to view the EEO Is The Law poster.

Background
In October 2004, APD became an agency separate from the Florida Department of Children and Families (DCF), specifically tasked with serving the needs of Floridians with developmental disabilities. Prior to that time, it existed as the Development Disabilities Program within DCF.
APD supports persons with developmental disabilities in living, learning, and working in their communities. APD is responsible for providing services to persons with developmental disabilities, including the operation of all state institutional programs and the programmatic and operational management of Medicaid home and community based waivers established to provide services to persons with developmental disabilities.
One of the core objectives is to increase our Medicaid Information Technology Architecture (MITA) maturity in the Care Management Business Area by improving the needs of the individual member, their treatment plan needs, health outcomes and health status.
APD currently relies heavily on manual processes, along with legacy systems to collect and track data consistently and accurately. As a result, there is very limited capability to collect, track, report, and analyze critical data for detection and prevention of fraud, waste and abuse and for needed oversight of the service system.
APD has initiatives and projects underway to increase program accountability, to provide an automated interface with FMMIS, to ensure federal funding is maintained for services, and most importantly, to assure customer health and safety needs are met.
Intent
The Agency for Persons with Disabilities (“APD”, “Agency”) is seeking a Software as a Service (SaaS)/COTS product configuration and support specialist.
Scope of Work
The Configuration Specialist will act as the subject matter expert and performs configuration tasks for the Software as a Service (SaaS) modules of the Client Data Management System (CDMS). The CDMS project is a highly cross-matrixed and medium to high complexity project. The Candidate will need to work across IT and the multiple business teams to accomplish project objectives and help deliver the project on time and within budget.
This is a full time staff augmentation effort, which will require one (1) Configuration Specialist from January 2017 through June 2017. The resulting contract may be renewed for up to an additional year upon the renewal or successor of DMS State Contract 973-561-010-1.
The vendor shall submit up to three (3) candidate(s) for this position. For each Candidate information must be submitted as a complete package (including all required documents).
The candidate selected shall work on-site at APD in Tallahassee, Florida, Monday – Friday, 8 AM
– 5 PM, or as approved by the Agency, and adhere to the published state holiday schedule. Requests for time off or schedule variance must be approved by the Agency.
The Agency is seeking one (1) Configuration Specialist who meets all of the following “Minimum Qualifications”. Qualifications must be clearly stated on the candidate’s resume and verifiable via reference checks. Knowledge and proficiencies claimed by the candidate must be clearly indicated on actual work experiences listed in the resume.
Minimum Qualifications
Academic
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, management information systems, engineering or related field.
Skills and Abilities
1. Must be skilled in Database Developer Tools (SQL Management Studio / TOAD / Access).
2. Must possess SQL Query Writing and Execution skills.
3. Must have Web Form Development (HTML / ASP.NET / Java / PHP) skills.
4. Must have thorough understanding of Relational Database Design and Development (SQL Server / Oracle).
5. Must possess Application Administration (Code Tables / System Admin Settings) and User-Account Management skills.
6. Must be skilled in Application Form Customization and Publishing.
7. Must have Report Development skills with experience with standard tools (SSRS
8. / Crystal Reports / Access / Excel).
9. Must have SaaS / COTS Product Maintenance and Support skills.
10. Must have strong documentation skills.
11. Must be highly self-motivated and directed.
12. Must have strong analytical and interpersonal skills.
13. Must have excellent oral and written communication skills and be able to adapt message to a variety of stakeholders.
14. Must have keen attention to details.
15. Ability to build partnerships and collaboration between individuals and project teams.
16. Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment as well as the ability to work effectively while under pressure.
17. Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks.
18. Ability to present ideas and multi-task in an organized and highly efficient manner.
Experience
1. 12+ Years of overall IT experience across various phases of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) projects.
2. 7+ Experience in Business Analysis and Development of Process Flows
3. 5+ Experience in Database & Application design.
4. 5+ Experience in configuring and administering SAAS / COTS products.
5. Experience in Data Analysis & Reporting.
6. Experience in Use Case development.
7. Experience working on Application Architecture.
8. Experience working on High Availability applications.
9. Quality Assurance (QA) / Testing experience.
10. Experience working and collaborating with vendor and diverse stakeholder groups.
11. Experience developing configuration solutions for business functions.
Certifications
Certification(s) in related fields is desirable.
General
1. Office Automation/Productivity Tools: Proficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Project, SharePoint, Visio, and Word.
2. Communication: Team player with excellent verbal and written communication skills; Active Toastmasters strongly preferred.
3. Experience in Health & Human Services domain is a plus.
Responsibilities
The Configuration Specialist will be responsible for the following.
1. Understand and administer the Business Analysis (BA) documents and Visio Process Flows delivered by the vendor.
2. Identify the gaps in BA documents and Process Flows, and provide solutions to fill the identified gaps.
3. Document the gaps, missing components and additional requirements.
4. Create / Update Process Flows as needed.
5. Understanding the touch points across various clusters/modules of the product / application.
6. Data Analysis, Collection and mapping between APD current systems and the new system.
7. Complete study and learning of new system in terms of Application functionality and data flow.
8. Act as primary Point-of-Contact for supporting the new system from APD end.
9. Configure the system as needed and directed by APD.
10. Administration of Application level settings (Code Tables Maintenance / System Admin functions).
11. Create / Update / Test customizable forms and publish them.
12. Train the functional Subject Matter Experts (SME) on the system functionality.
13. Help create test plans for System / User Acceptance testing by identifying test cases.
14. Follow and coordinate the Change Management, Release Management, and Deployment process.
15. Act as a liaison between SMEs and IT.
16. Create ad-hoc reports using advanced reporting methods.
17. Work closely with other technical support personnel (internal and external) to resolve operational issues
18. Act as an effective team player and communicator
19. Validation of Configuration Work Books provided by Vendor
20. Communicate consistently and effectively with the project team.
21. Help identify issues and risks; and, suggest mitigation strategies and contingency plans.
22. Review deliverables for accuracy and completeness working with the vendor project team to address any deficiencies.
23. Work effectively with cross-functional business units and groups with varying functional backgrounds (operational, technical, managerial, programmatic, etc.).
24. Build partnerships and collaboration between individuals and project teams.

job summary:
Sensus is a leading clean technology solutions company shaping the future of smart grid, smart water and smart cities. Today we create the smart meters, communication systems, software and services that help electric, gas, and water industries drive operational efficiency and customer engagement. And we’re designing with tomorrow in mind. Our applications range from advanced meter reading, data acquisition, demand response, distribution automation, home area networking and outdoor lighting control to big data solutions and cloud-based management. Customers worldwide trust the innovation, quality and reliability of Sensus solutions for the intelligent use and conservation of energy and water and to create the sustainable cities of tomorrow.


Can you envision yourself in a start-up-like environment growing its smart infrastructure solutions portfolio? Wouldn’t it be cool to work with the largest Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) bases in the world, having real-time impact today and creating possibilities for tomorrow? Sensus is more than 3500 strong on five continents. Join our world-wide Research & Development facility in Research Triangle Park where you can bring your great ideas and energy to our no spectators allowed culture. Read below on how this critical role will impact our business objectives while helping the world!


The Role: Sensus USA seeks to hire a Software Developer. As a member of the Sensus Professional Services Team, the developer will architect, design and implement software based on customer defined use cases. This individual will work closely with the customers to ensure that design and deliverables are meeting requirements and expectations. The successful candidate will have the ability to multiplex and work on multiple projects simultaneously in a fast paced, fluid environment. This individual will have experience interacting with clients. Travel to client sites is required.


Looking for someone to

Design and implement software applications and analytics for Utility industry
Has strong sense of ownership and drive
Has excellent written and verbal communication skills
Is comfortable interfacing with Customer, Vendors and various Sensus teams
Takes pride in delivery of quality software
This role has the ability to be a full time remote role
Requirements:

BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent.
7+ years of experience in a commercial software development
Strong object-oriented design and coding skills (Java, and/or C++), preferably on a UNIX or Linux platform developing Systems software
Solid understanding of data structures and algorithms
Ability to collaborate within a team environment of engineers to meet aggressive goals and high quality standards
It would be Nice to:

Have experience in databases, analytics, big data systems or business intelligence products
Delivered a low-latency, consumer-internet-scale web services operating in a 24x7 environment
Have experience with OO modeling, web services, UNIX, middleware, Spring

job summary:
Applied Memetics LLC (AM LLC) is seeking an J2EE / Java Developer with deep knowledge of maintaining custom web and mobile software applications to support a Veterans Affairs program.

Must be a US Citizen

Project Overview for the J2EE / Java Developer

The Clinical Knowledge Management (CKM) program is part of Veterans Affairs' Connected Health Office (CHO) that provides benefits and services to Veterans. A primary goal of the CHO is to design and implement user-friendly, high-quality mobile devices, software, and services for Veterans and their medical caregivers. Specifically, the CKM program ensures a seamless clinical, portfolio, architectural, and operational optimization of these mobile health applications.

Responsibilities:
Responsibilities of the J2EE / Java Developer:
The Contracted J2EE / Java Developer shall support mobile health applications by providing maintenance activities including, but not limited to: Reviewing and correcting or replacing of the middle-tier service layer for VistA data integration Developing or maintaining of shared MAE services (e.g., MDWS and VistA exchange) to support mission objectives Writing scalable web services in Spring / MVC Develop and configure J2EE Containers

Qualifications:
General Requirements of the J2EE / Java Developer: Minimum 7 years of experience as a team member and subject matter expert in an Agile / Scrum Java / J2EE software development environment Excellent communication skills and a good command of the English language

Required Skills of the J2EE / Java Developer:
Must have experience writing scalable web services in Spring / MVC

Deep understanding of web service technologies, to include:
Interface definitions (e.g., WSDL , WADL , ICDs )
Data Schemas ( XSD , JSON-Schema )
Developing and consuming with SOAP- and REST-based services
Developing and testing web services in js ( Express ) and Java (e.g., JAX-RS, Spring Web Services )
Experience developing in and configuring J2EE containers
Experience with Javascript and Java Development
Fluency in developing shared MAE services (e.g., MDWS and VistA exchange)
Experience with Git and distributed version control systems
Backend services: Java J2EE, RESTful services, Spring, Spring Security, & Spring MVC knowledge, object-oriented design principles, SOA principles, WebLogic, Tomcat app server, JPA
UI layer : Knowledge of mobile applications development (IOS and/or Android), Backbone, Node.js, Angular.js, Cordova (Phonegap), Xcode (Objective-C/Swift), JS/CSS/HTML5, and JQuery
Databases: Oracle, MySQL, MongoDB
Development build tools: Git, Ant/Maven, Gradle, Jenkins, Docker, continuous integration

Preferred Skills of the J2EE / Java Developer:
Working with legacy RPC-based systems

Educational Requirements of the J2EE / Java Developer:
Bachelors degree in Information Technology, Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics or related field

**Experience working in federal government environments is preferred.**

The

The Leap Program is an exciting learning and development opportunity within Fidelity Investments’ Technology Organization. Leap is designed to accelerate the development of recent IT graduates to become best-in-class technologists. Participants will benefit from an enriched on-boarding program followed by specific technology, business, and professional skills training. The program will challenge and excite you with responsibility and visibility. Opportunities exist in multiple roles and locations throughout the US.

Software Engineer:
You are an analytical problem-solver with applied experience in Software Development Lifecycle, Object Oriented program concepts, Java, JavaScript, C#, and JQuery

Agile Engineer:
You are a Software Engineer at hear but also enjoy participating in all phases of the end-to-end software development process to build innovative software solutions

Systems Analyst:
You are a curious, strong communicator with analytical skills with understanding of Software Development Lifecycle with the ability to break tasks down as well as the ability to read programming languages & query in SQL

Data Engineer:
You are a conceptual, analytical thinker with a passion for data design and analysis with proficient working knowledge of SQL and a strong understanding of programming and scripting concepts (PL/SQL)

Mainframe Engineer:
You have a passion for technology and analytical skills with experience in, or interest in learning, COBOL, TSO, DB2, VSAM, JCL, and DB2 Stored Procedures

Systems Engineer:
You are interested in enterprise technical infrastructure as a career track and have hands-on fluency in a programming and/or scripting language such as Powershell, Bash and Python with an understanding of systems engineering, architecture and infrastructure: server, network, storage, database, application support, and security

Client-focused, results-driven mindset

Critical thinking skills and an entrepreneurial spirit

Job title: Senior Software Engineer, Full Stack - Life Sciences
education level/skills required / respon: Java and NodeJS experience is a plus. Ready for an exciting and fast-paced career?...
job summary:
Ready for an exciting and fast-paced career? Have a passion for turning business issues into opportunities for growth, resilience and long-term advantage? CIS by Deloitte is an integral part of Deloitte Advisory’s leading life and health care practice. Our services focus on risk mitigation and operational performance. As part of our team, you will commit to providing deep industry and compliance knowledge to our clients, being a subject matter specialist, and supporting a technology platform to manage complex commercial operations. You will have the opportunity to build your professional skills in a variety of project experiences and be involved in helping our clients understand, analyze, and respond to various business opportunities and challenges presented by the changing regulatory marketplace.


Work you’ll do 
The Full Stack Senior Software Engineer will lead and serve as part of a team supporting established projects and creating products from the ground up. The ideal candidate is leader, a team player and is passionate about learning and applying their technical skills and experience to solve real-world problems. You will be responsible for contributing to the Architecture, Design and Development across the full stack of Deloitte's products in addition to working with multiple teams to guide and influence the architecture and design of the various products. Responsibilities also include investigating technologies that could benefit our development and success of our products and build, refine and tune our data pipeline to feed multiple services, and develop and deploy micro-services using Docker and Docker Swarm. 

The Team 
As the regulatory landscape continues to shift and grow in complexity, companies are facing unprecedented compliance challenges and close regulatory scrutiny. CIS by Deloitte provides solutions in health care compliance, risk and technology-driven managed services. Managing your financial, operational, and reputation risk to allow you to focus on what matters most - the patient, innovation, and the greater health care marketplace. 

Visit www.cisbydeloitte.com to find out more about CIS by Deloitte and our health care compliance consulting and technology-driven managed services.


Required Qualifications :

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
Python (2.7, ++3,5) and the Flask framework
JavaScript (++ECMAScript6, Angular, React)
Experience developing applications in a micro-services architecture
Experience with Apache Kafka or similar message queues (Rabbit, ZeroMQ)
Experience developing applications deployed on a public cloud (++Azure or AWS)
Experience with SQL and NoSQL Databases
Agile development experience 
Preferred Qualifications :

Experience with Python Tornado framework

Experience with Test Driven Development

Java and NodeJS experience is a plus

Experience developing multi-threaded or multi-process software

Experience in model/slave architectural patterns or distributed systems
Experience with GIT, Jira, and Confluence
Strong analytical skills 
How you’ll grow 
At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center. 

Benefits 
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you. 

Deloitte’s culture 
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte. 

Corporate citizenship 
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world. 

Recruiter tips 
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

-

1609041

The Managed Accounts & Guidance Technology organization is looking for a passionate Full Stack Principal Software Engineer to build and support world-class products for its highly business critical Advice & Planning Platform (APP). Our engineering team is innovative, diverse, passionate and self-driven. We work in a very dynamic agile environment.

The

Purpose

of Your Role

As hands on principal software engineer on the team in writing web services APIs, you will be responsible for providing technology leadership to the team in coming up with, guiding the team on, and implementing best in class engineering solutions to our services platform. You are expected to quickly gain understanding of all the components of our web service based platform to be able to lead/ contribute to strategic roadmaps and initiatives related to the enhancement, maintenance, and support of the platform.

The

Expertise

We’re Looking For

Bachelor's / Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering

Extraordinary problem solving skills dealing with complex distributed deployments

Strong leadership skills: you must be passionate about engineering excellence, highly focused, innovative, team player, self-starter, collaborator, and someone who’s eager to learn and teach every day.

8+ years of experience in services development in Java, Spring MVC / Spring Core / Web Services (SOAP/REST) and configuring web containers.

4+ years of experience leading complex technology initiatives, architecting best engineering solutions, and being in the trenches with the software engineers every day.

2+ years’ experience working in scrum environment.

Ability to prioritize and delegate the work based on strategic nature of the work, importance, and urgency.

Champion and advocate of Test Driven Development, Unit testing (preferably using JUnit)

Hands on with IDE’s Spring Tool Suite and Eclipse - within a UNIX and Windows environment.

Fully hands on with application builds and deploys using Continuous Integration/ Deployment (CI/CD) tools like Jenkins, Maven, uDeploy, etc.

Good understanding of cloud-computing / on-demand computing platform

Your Responsibilities

Lead multiple development work streams through integration and ensure architecture is scalable and extensible.

Collaborate with other principal developers in the team to ensure a common vision & proactive communication, both, horizontally and vertically.

Align with the leadership’s vision of the platform and help protect the platform from day to day tactical requests that may lead to a compromise to the vision.

Lead the team to think in terms of design patterns and Object Oriented Methodology

Mentor other engineers/ sr. engineers to foster engineering & problem solving mindset.

Enforce existing engineering practices and setting new ones as and when needed.

Lead the effort to define, maintain, and support Java development environment and best practices, such as Maven, Sonar, and other Open Source tools.

Lead in identifying, isolating, resolving, and communicating the complex problems within the production and nonproduction environment.

Ensure a robust code review process is in place.

Proactively lead process/ technology improvement initiatives.

The

Value

You Deliver

Understand the leadership vision, ask clarifications, and figure out what needs to happen to help convert it in a plan.

Help strengthen further the culture of innovation by setting examples

Finding creative ways to get things done, and do them right

Keeping an eye on the best in class software engineering practices

Exercising a passion for keeping your knowledge up-to-date with the latest and greatest

Help maintain the high level of integrity in the team

Taking ownership and accountability for figuring out what needs to be done

How Your Work

Impacts

the Organization

Our ever-evolving technology stack ensures a great learning culture in the team. We are always exploring new technologies and new ways to continually provide value to our customers. This team has a direct and positive impact on Fidelity’s customers.

Company Overview

At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. For information about working at Fidelity, visit

FidelityCareers.com

Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer.

education level/skills required / respon: Expertise coding in Java (PHP, Python, or other languages a plus). As part of Bronto's Engineering team, the Java Developer will play a key role in our...
job summary:
As part of Bronto's Engineering team, the Java Software Engineer will be a core member of our Durham, NC office and will play a key role in our continued growth.


Bronto Software provides a best of breed E-commerce marketing application which is consistently recommended by more than 9 out of 10 Bronto Customers, an integrated sales and marketing engine and the training and investment to promote continued success.


Over the past 4 years Bronto has successfully launched regional offices in London, Sydney, and in 2015 we have branched out into New York and LA. This has provided our team opportunities to take on increasing responsibilities as we continue to grow.


Responsibilities:
As part of Bronto's Engineering team, the Java Developer will play a key role in our continued growth. Bronto Software tracks and aggregates tens of millions of data points every day and provides near real-time analysis and reporting to our customers. We are utilizing leading Open Source technologies including Hadoop, HBase, Redis, and Solr to develop our data collection and analysis platform for scale and availability. Our Software Engineering team is small and nimble, deploying new code to production every week.


Candidates will need to have experience with medium-to-large-scale web development. New developers will have an immediate and direct impact on the design and development of Bronto's next generation of e-commerce analytics and automation applications. If you are a self-motivated and technologically curious person then we would love to hear from you.


Only apply if you want to:

Be a part of a fast moving team, working with the latest tools and technologies
Design and develop our next generation of RESTful APIs in a highly available environment
Design and develop innovative algorithms/techniques for high-volume data analysis
Use advanced, distributed technologies to process, store, and quickly retrieve huge volumes of data
Work on a development team using agile methodologies

Software Engineering projects include:

Re-architect existing functionality to maximize scalability and increase throughput


Design and develop platform services and their RESTful interfaces


Design and develop new application features using technologies to handle Bronto’s large data and transaction volumes


Qualifications:
BS/BA degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related
8 years experience in software development
Expertise coding in Java (PHP, Python, or other languages a plus)
Solid object-oriented design skills
Familiarity with design patterns and writing testable code
Knowledge of n-tier or service oriented architectures
Comfortable with Linux or OS X development environments
Experience working with Git, Subversion or other SCM tools
Working knowledge of Tomcat, Apache or Nginx

Other:

Located out of our Durham, NC HQ
Bronto Software provides a cloud-based marketing platform for retailers to drive revenue through their email, mobile and social campaigns. Building upon consistent growth since its founding in 2002, We are now in the midst of a period of fast-paced growth as it expands its mission beyond email to become the leading marketing platform for retailers and other commerce focused companies. Bronto Software is consistently recognized for our products and services.


Why Bronto? 
Clear Vision of our purpose and mission Great Location on American Tobacco Campus Triangle Business Journal "Best Places to Work" five-time-winner All Brontos are given company time to volunteer at area non-profits Active Lifestyle with subsidized Y membership and wellness events Free beverages, snacks, and planned social activities

LIVE OUR VALUES – TRANSPARENT, APPROACHABLE, PASSIONATE.


To see the Bronto life through words, photos and videos, visit http://blogs.bronto.com/brontonation

job summary:
Description

Looking for a unique opportunity to show off your skills at a cool and exciting company? Digital Turbine is looking for an experienced Software Developer to be part of our team, offering an opportunity to maintain and extend our sophisticated natural language processing engine using cutting edge technologies and services. This position requires a proven ability to understand and implement business requirements for new systems and enhancements to existing systems in an Agile environment. Additionally, the candidate must exhibit the ability to analyze and debug new and existing software systems.

Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to conceptualize, build, test and ship software solutions that business needs.

Conduct design and code reviews.

Maintain existing software systems.

Push mobile technologies to the limits to help better our products and services.

Gain a working knowledge of the mathematic and algorithmic theory behind our engine.

Work with geographically dispersed team members.

Implement scalable and cost effective software systems that meet business requirements.

Minimum Job Requirements

BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience.

5+ years of software development experience (Java and C#/.Net).

Experience working with Git, Subversion or other SCM tools.

Experience with continuous integration systems (Jenkins, Bamboo, Travis CI, etc.)

Experience working with remote data via REST and JSON.

Working knowledge of key data structures and algorithms (indexing, hash tables, joins, aggregation).

Solid understanding of software development best practices and methodologies.

Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.

Excellent communication and collaborative problem-solving skills.

Can lead by example & motivate fellow developers to meet challenging goals.

Preferred Experience

Knowledge and applicable experience with agile methodologies such as SCRUM.

Experience with NoSQL datastores such as ElasticSearch, Aerospike, MongoDB or Redis.

Experience with distributed data handling and storage technologies like Apache Hadoop, Apache Kafka, Apache Flume, Amazon S3, Avro.

Experience with scripting and interpreted languages such as Bash, Python, Ruby, etc..

Practical experience with relational database systems such as SQL Server,Oracle,MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc..

Experience with data stream processing frameworks like Apache Storm, Apache Spark, or Apache Samza.

Exposure to functional programming

Experience with networking protocols on various levels of OSI/ISO stack.

Good time management skills and structured work methodology.

Experience with cloud-based environments like AWS.

Mobile industry experience

About Digital Turbine, Inc.

Digital Turbine works at the convergence of media and mobile communications, delivering end-to-end products and solutions for mobile operators, app advertisers, device OEMs and other third parties to enable them to effectively monetize mobile content and acquire higher value user acquisition. The company's products include DT Ignite™, a mobile device management solution with targeted app distribution capabilities, DT IQ™, a customized user experience and app discovery tool, DT Marketplace™, an application and content store, and DT Pay™, a content management and mobile payment solution, DT Media, an advertiser solution for unique and exclusive carrier inventory, and Appia, a leading worldwide mobile user acquisition network. Digital Turbine has delivered more than 100 million app installs for hundreds of advertisers. In addition, more than 31 million customers use Digital Turbine's solutions each month across more than 20 global operators. Headquartered in Austin, Texas with global offices in Durham, Berlin, Singapore, Sydney and Tel Aviv. For additional information visit www.digitalturbine.com or connect with Digital Turbine on Twitter at @DigitalTurbine.

Employment decisions are based on the principles of equal opportunity and affirmative action; without regard to race, creed, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job summary:
Purpose

A Research and Development facility in East Tennessee is seeking to hire a software-defined radio (SDR) communications engineer for the creation, design, and development of a broad spectrum of SDR systems, i.e., radio communications systems that are software programmable, in support of the ORNL Cognitive Radio Program. The successful candidate will join a team of researchers actively developing advanced communications systems for national security applications. The RF, Communications, and Intelligent Systems Group perform R&D; in four core areas: robust communications in extreme environments, cognition and intelligent systems, tagging, tracking, and locating systems, and RF- and microwave-based measurement systems. The Group’s capabilities include the development of communications platforms, system architecture design, learning from signals, custom electronics design, model-based development, hardware-in-the-loop simulations, novel antenna design, and electromagnetic characterizations.

Major Duties/Responsibilities

The successful candidate will:
Design and prototype SDR-based communications systems
Design and develop signal processing techniques for communications systems
Conduct communications systems analysis
Establish communications systems requirements specifications
Select appropriate software and hardware to fill requirements
Participate on technical teams
Participate in preparing white papers and proposals
Prepare and deliver presentations to sponsors, technical peers, and at professional society meetings•
Prepare technical reports for sponsors, program managers, and technical peers

Qualifications Required

The successful candidate should have a Ph.D. or an M.S. degree with equivalent experience in electrical engineering and 1-to-5 years of relevant experience related to SDR and cognitive radio skills, including RF electronics design, RF modeling and simulation tools (MATLAB, SIMULINK, SYSGEN, RHAPSODY, etc.), communication systems (transmitters, receivers, antennas, filters, modulation techniques, etc.) and electromagnetic fields.

Qualifications include:
Knowledge of MATLAB and Simulink modeling and simulation tools
Creation, design, prototype, test, and troubleshooting SDR and cognitive radio systems
Microprocessor programming and experience with multi-core processors
Development of communication waveforms at the physical and data link layers
Experience with poly-phase signal processing
Experience with OFDM signal processing
Good communication skills in a team environment
Experience in technical or scientific writing in order to prepare reports, presentations, and journal articles
The ability to obtain and maintain a DOE security clearance is required. A current DOE or DOD clearance is preferred

Additional desired attributes include:
Knowledge of the following programming languages: C/C++, Assembly, Java, Verilog, and UML/SysML
Knowledge of Vehicle Electronic Systems -- Networks and/or Wiring Harnesses
Experience with development of Machine Learning Tools
Experience in Signal Processing of EM/RF Signals
Experience with GNU Radio use and development
Linux system installation and configuration experience•
A strong interest in organizing technical teams and developing new projects
Experience in completing R&D; projects to successful conclusion
Developmental troubleshooting experience

Dura-Line Corporation (DLC) is the global leader in the design and manufacturing of high density polyethylene-based (HDPE) conduit and pipe solutions used in mission-critical applications for the telecommunications, energy and infrastructure related markets. Headquartered in Knoxville, TN., DLC has 10 US manufacturing centers, as well as eight overseas, and serves customers in over 50 countries. Its US-manufactured products are compliant with the Buy American requirements of the 2009 American Recovery and Reinvestment Act, and Dura-Line is ISO-9001 certified..


Due to our ongoing commitment to quality and our expanded capacity, DLC has the following challenging and exciting opportunity for a SAP Application Development Manager in our corporate Knoxville office.

Job Summary


The SAP Application Development Manager will lead the Application Development team and provide core SAP expertise for the development and maintenance of systems. This is a hands-on position responsible for the systems design, analysis, development, enhancement and modifications, of our recently implemented SAP ECC 6.0 system and other applications. The Manager will work closely with business unit members to understand business requirements and ensure that application systems properly function to meet business needs, delivering value across the organization.
