job summary:
We are seeking an enthusiastic, charismatic, and knowledgeable Pre-Sales Solutions Consultant to help drive new product sales of our EBX5 master and reference data management software in the U.S. market and to provide technical account management to existing customers, primarily in the eastern U.S. and Canada.


Our Company


Orchestra Networks is a pure-play, independent master and reference data management software provider with operations in Europe, North America and Asia-Pacific. Since our founding in 2000, 120+ large organization worldwide have met their data management needs with EBX5, our comprehensive, business focused-MDM software.


We help organizations manage their most important data: the products they manufacture, the assets they own, the customers they sell to, the partners they deal with, the financial accounts they report on – any data shared between business teams and IT applications.


Orchestra Networks is positioned by Gartner in both its Magic Quadrants for MDM with one single software solution and was ranked #1 MDM technology four years in a row by The Information Difference.


Great Team and Work Environment


Since 2000, we have built and exceptional team of highly talented people, in order to develop the next generation platform for master and reference data management. We’re looking for smart people, ready to work in a fast growing, dynamic organization.


Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Delivering product demos that are relevant to specific clients and industries
Answering product-related and technical questions in RFI/RFPs
Customizing and delivering in-depth presentations about product functionality, architecture, customization/implementation and application integration
Delivering proof-of-concept implementations using customer data, data models, and functional use cases
Providing technical account management to existing customers

Your profile


You have 3+ years’ experience in enterprise software pre-sales, working with IT and business teams in Global 500 organizations. While you work independently, possibly from a home or remote office, you are also capable of collaborating with your peers across our organization, including sales, professional services, pre-sales, support, engineering, and other pre-sales solutions consultants. A willingness to travel, mostly within the eastern region of the U.S. is required. Specific qualifications, skills, and experience should include:

Enterprise software presales
Experience in data management, data integration, data quality, and/or data governance domains
Data modeling
Enterprise architecture
Proficient in Java
Excellent oral and written communication skills, fluency in English
Bachelor’s degree

Your Opportunity


We are looking for a Pre-Sales Solutions Consultant who will work with some of our largest prospects and customers in addressing enterprise MDM requirements. Your work will span master data domains, industries, and architectural patterns. Working in a dynamic, growing company you will have abundant opportunity for professional and career growth, working alongside talented and committed colleagues.

Bachelor's degree plus 2 to 4 years of relevant work experience. Degree must be in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or a related discipline.
In some cases, educational requirements may be adjusted for comparable work experience. Work experience may be adjusted based on education, or highly specialized knowledge or uniquely applicable experience for positions involving new technology or labor market shortages as reflected by market survey data.
Required operating systems knowledge: Linux (Red Hat, Ubuntu, Debian, etc.), Solaris10/11, Virtualized OS instantiations (VMware, OpenXT, XEN, VirtualBox), Windows 2008R2 through 2016R2. Windows 7 and Windows 10 Professional knowledge also highly desirable.
Languages: Java, SQL, JavaScript, HTML, XML, C++, C, Visual Basic, PERL, Operating System scripting (such as Windows PowerShell) are highly desirable.
Database Systems: Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, PosgreSQL Certifications: Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) or Security+, Oracle, Linux, VMWare, Windows or Cisco Certification a plus. Networking knowledge is also highly desired.
Clearance requirement: Top Secret/SCI
Travel: May require extensive travel, Passport is required.

Help students achieve their goals as a full-time game development professor at SCAD Savannah.

- Professional-level visual art and design production experience preferred

- University-level teaching experience preferred

- Experience teaching and developing online coursework also preferred

Description 
Experian Automotive is seeking a software developer to join its technology team. Software developer analyzes, designs, develops programs, tests B2C/B2B web applications. This position is responsible for all phases or the program life cycles. This position will work closely with product market team, scrum masters and peer developers to address technical design and code delivery for vehicle history suite of products. 

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Interact with product team, understand business requirements and design technical solutions Develop programs for eCommerce web application, B2B XML/Rest web services, and Unix shell scripts for batch processes Perform technical design, develop new programs, modify existing programs, and prepare functional specifications documents Analyze program performance during execution using various programming languages and techniques Responsible for writing unit test and perform integration tests Responsible for troubleshooting and debugging application issues Perform code review and follow change management process Maintain cutting edge knowledge of current and emerging technologies, industry trends and standards 
Qualifications

Working knowledge of JAVA/J2EE development, Struts, Spring, AJAX, JBoss Working knowledge of MyEclipse IDE, Junit, ANT, Maven, CVS, SVN Working knowledge of server side development using servlets, XML/XSD, Web services Working knowledge of mobile app development both iOS and Android, either native or mobile app framework such as Phonegap Experience with DB2 SQL Experience with Hybris eCommerce Platform is a plus Demonstrated knowledge of agile development processes, software testing and documentation Ability to comprehend detailed project specifications as well as the ability to adapt to various technologies and simultaneously work on multiple projects Solid analytical and problem solving skills. Proven oral and written communication skills, both technical and business focused. Demonstrated ability to exercise good judgment, prioritize multiple tasks, and problem solve under pressure of deadlines and resource constraints. Thrives in a fast-paced environment, able to share knowledge and skills with co-workers

Job title: Information Technology Trainee – Entry Level Position
education level/skills required / respon: Posses a passion for leveraging technology to create enterprise wide solutions. Information Technology Trainee – Entry Level Position:....
job summary:
Information Technology Trainee – 

Entry Level Position:


Work for an industry leader while learning cutting edge technology. Eagle Creek Software Services, a rapidly growing Software Services company, is currently seeking entry level software consultants for our Technology Center in Valley City, North Dakota (relocation assistance available). At the technology center you will receive hands-on training to work toward becoming an IT consultant, engaged on software implementations from project initiation to final customer roll out.


Paid Training Program Provides:

Comprehensive instruction on general topics and tools including Unix/Linix administration, SQL, SSIS, SSRS, and quality assurance, programming languages (Java, .Net), database skills, CRM and BI
Classroom and small group environment training
Work on simulated projects adapted from real life scenarios that our technology center consultants are engaged on from day-to-day
After instruction on general topics and tools, trainees will focus on two of the three technology stacks that Eagle Creek specializes in, including application development, CRM, or BI
By training at Eagle Creek, you will quickly develop a wide range of new skills, ideal for career development into the IT consultant position.

Working at the Technology Center:


At our Technology Center, you are encouraged to set your sights on your career goals within Eagle Creek, and to work toward them while adding value to the organization. Our state-of-the art facilities offer an opportunity to work within a structured organization where you can advance. Projects tend to be mid-to-long term and diversified. Assignments can be challenging but also exciting and rewarding. You will have a great opportunity to make an impact immediately as well as grow professionally. Travel, if any, would be infrequent.


Position Location: Valley City, ND


Position Responsibilities:

Actively learn all of the aspects of the tools and technologies related to two technology stacks
Learn and engage as a team member and individually
Actively and successfully progress and transition from Trainee to an IT associate consulting position within the designated timeframes

As an Associate Consultant:

Work alone and collaboratively to solve business problems and develop the functionality our customers demand
Analyze the business issues that face our Fortune 2000 clients, design original and innovative solutions, and deliver them to our clients
Within the application development technology stack, work within all aspects of the Software Development Life Cycle: Requirements definition, Functional and Technical Design, Configuration, scripting, integration, data transformation and manipulation, testing, training and documentation
Within the CRM technology stack work with such technologies as Salesforce.com or Siebel
Within the BI technology stack work with such technologies as Informatica or OBIEE

Position Requirements:


An Eagle Creek Software Consultant will work in a team environment for the successful development and implementation of software applications at the site from project initiation to full customer product roll out with minimal supervision. In this capacity, consultants will be experienced in application functionally and technically.


To be a part of the Eagle Creek Software Services team you must meet or exceed the following requirements:

Bachelors Degree in MIS, CS, IS, IT, Engineering or Associates degree with relevant experience
An understanding of Object Oriented Programming languages
Experience developing code
Excellent communication skills and be able to work well in a collaborative team environment
Understand standard business practices
Posses a passion for leveraging technology to create enterprise wide solutions

Re
quired

job summary:
Are you looking to make a difference that dramatically impacts others’ lives with the software you develop?

Do you prefer programming in languages like Java or Groovy?

When you write code does your work seem to be more efficient and of higher quality than your colleagues’?

Do you take the initiative to work independently yet work well with a team?

Do you have a talent for removing obstacles from the process?

Are you positive and energetic? Do you thrive in an evolving, complex and innovative environment?

Do you always live up to your commitments?

If you can answer YES to these questions, we want to speak with you. Talent Plus, a locally owned international human resource consulting firm, is seeking a talented Junior Software Developer to join our quality-focused team. The ideal candidate will have knowledge and skills with Java-based web applications, HTML/CSS and JavaScript. Knowledge and experience with Groovy/Grails, jQuery and Apache HTTP Server is also preferred.

This is a full-time position in our Lincoln, NE, corporate headquarters; remote, contract and workers requiring visa sponsorship will not be considered at this time.

WE OFFER:
An opportunity to work with those who appreciate and reward performance
An opportunity to work with a diverse portfolio of technologies that impact clients in a variety of industries
A stimulating growth environment and highly engaged company culture – we are a five-time winner by Great Place to Work ® as one of the best small and medium workplaces in the United States
An opportunity to make a difference for clients through technology
An opportunity to express your creativity

Apply NOW or call to schedule a confidential interview with Kyle Bruss or Kesha Harris at 402-489-2000.

Equal opportunity employer

All financial and background records will be checked

Disclaimer: We hate job descriptions! We believe every person has talent and we cater roles to the unique gifts of each of our associates. The description above and below is meant to be a conceptual representation of this role. Every role at Talent Plus has the primary focus of serving our internal and external customers.

Basic Description

The Junior Software Developer will work on our development team building our suite of web applications, core APIs and 3rd party integrations. The junior software developer will work with the software development team and product management to design product specifications, delivery timelines and completed application, as well as participate in the development and support of both commercial and internal business applications. The junior software developer will support the development of multiple projects including but not limited to: creating and maintaining high quality code documentation, conducting research on emerging technologies and determining how to apply them to current initiatives.

Preferences for Success:
Degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience in software development

Prefer knowledge and skills in the following:
Java

Groovy/Grails

MySQL database

HTML/CSS

JavaScript (JQuery)

Apache

job summary:
Do you have a passion for technology? AND you want to help create the next best thing in the technology world?

Does your passion include finding connections and creating pathways of integration for systems and platforms?

ReSource Pro is seeking an Integration Developer for our newly created Technology Solutions Lab. Our business is focused on providing our customers with automation, technology solutions and operational efficiencies to help them make better decisions - faster, better and increasing their bottom line in the process.

Your primary role will be to design and support the integration of existing systems and platforms within our internal systems while playing a critical part of creating industry specific technology. You will be the primary go-to for building the products we provide to our customers – both internally and externally. Success depends on you.

This role will also include:
Platform Integration – work closely with Integration Solution Architects, other technology architects and developers from Global IT to understand integration needs as well as data to support business processes.

Process Creation – create designs to support integration processes and to bridge the gap between business processes.

Gathering Requirements – working closely with customers to better understand their needs and apply design, analysis, and modeling experience to move quickly towards a Proof of Concepts.

Process Observations - You will be involved at all stages - you need to see it to get it. When you do - your mission becomes making it more efficient for everyone. Identify opportunities for automations, efficiencies and the development of technology enabled products.

What’s in it for you?

With ReSource Pro, you are in a growing organization, with global opportunities and cross-cultural experiences. We recognize, compensate and promote performance excellent and talent (yes, we actually do this!)

This opportunity is located in Lincoln, NE.

Desired Skills and Experience

Preferably a bachelor's degree (Computer Science, Developing, etc.) but if you have the experience, we know you'll have the knowledge.

3-5 years developer experience with increased complexity in projects and design.

Competent in working with different protocols and standards such as HTTP(s), MQ, SOAP, REST, WSDL, XSD, XML, JSON, and Swagger.

Understanding of Service and API Governance, as well as API design and development experience is desirable.

You have become the master of consistently being curious in the technology world to understand applications and developing and mastering them to be better.

WE WANT YOU!

Click APPLY to get in touch with us - we're waiting for you to get started!

job summary:
Celerion, a leading global contract research organization, seeks a Scientist-Lab Automation for our Bioanalytical Method Development team. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and implementing the department's automation strategy. This position requires substantial knowledge of information technology and interaction with multifunctional teams as it relates to the automation strategy.
This full-time benefited role is located at our Lincoln, NE facility.
Role: The role of the Scientist-Lab Automation is a hands-on position working with the laboratory automation systems, LIMS, and electronic laboratory notebook. A key component of the role is utilize software application and computer science knowledge in order to translate scientific requirements into the automation software. The incumbent will combine his/her scientific and computer science expertise to build the department's automation strategy.

Responsibilities:

Write application software for liquid-handling and instrument-tending laboratory robots
Collaborate with scientists to translate scientific protocol requirements into application software
Facilitate the development and validation of automated methods for bioanalysis
Contribute to the development of core tools, in Java and other software environment, SQL query, and excel macros to simplify application programming
Collaborate with business partners in preparation and review of protocols/ reports for instrument validation/ operation to include risk assessments, user requirements, validation strategy documents, installation/ operation/ performance qualifications and Standard Operating Procedures
Collaborate with operations to identify automation opportunities, prepare justification, obtain vendor quotes and draft budget items
Collaborate with Laboratory Information Systems stakeholders to integrate automated data systems processes into analytical testing
Act as a Subject Matter Expert to provide training and support, as needed, for automation techniques
Prepare/ review documents for method validation to include protocols and reports
Troubleshoot field service issues

Education/ Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in biomedical sciences, bioengineering, engineering, computer science or applicable field and 2+ years of experience
Experience with common analytical techniques is preferred
Thorough knowledge of automation systems such as Hamilton, Sciclone, etc. is preferred
Must have advanced knowledge of LIMS or Laboratory Notebook systems
Proficiency with Excel macros and automation software is preferred
Previous instrument or software validation experience is preferred

About Celerion:
In addition to providing clinical pharmacology and early clinical research services in North America and Europe, Celerion operates two bioanalytical laboratories where the latest analytical technologies are leveraged to provide quantitative measures of drug, metabolite and biomarkers in samples collected from humans participating in research studies. With over 750 employees and over 40 years of experience conducting early clinical research Celerion is the provider of choice for many of the world's leading pharmaceutical companies. In addition, Celerion scientists bring a depth of experience in drug development that is proving important for growing businesses in Asia and other parts of the world.

job summary:
Expedia

The online travel market never stands still. At Expedia Affiliate Network, we’re smack in the middle of it.

We’re an entrepreneurial start-up inside the world’s biggest travel company. We create the tools and technology that help millions of travelers find the perfect hotels for their next trips. As the world’s largest and fastest-growing affiliate network ($2 billion in sales and counting), we work with over 10,000 partners in 33 countries to turn their web traffic into hotel bookings and happy customers.

We offer the chance to surround yourself with the brightest minds in the travel business in an energetic and international work environment focused on innovation, creative problem-solving and collaboration.

Why build your career at EAN?
We’re re-inventing online travel, one day at a time – it’s an exciting challenge. We’re super-motivated and setting the pace.
We’ve got the scope and the freedom to make a difference. We don’t do ordinary.
We work with some really smart partners – from search marketing whiz kids to the world’s leading airlines and travel agents.
We make a positive impact on how the world’s travelers plan and book their perfect trip. 30,267 times a day, actually.
We’re a team of passionate, hard-working travel enthusiasts. We just love what we do!
We define the questions, not the answers, for an industry that changes every day. Isn’t that cool?
Want to change the way the world travels? Come and join us!

You:
We are building a premier technology team. Would you like to work on a team that aspires for excellence, rewards creativity, and values your technical knowledge? Are you the type of person who can handle the hard problems in a little while and the impossible just takes a bit longer?
We are creating a small, highly agile team to take our existing technology and move it to the next level of stability, scalability, and pure coolness. This will be a challenge, our application has to scale to hundreds of thousands of requests per hour, be resilient to service failures, and be very stable. Some people can’t do this; if you can we are looking for you.
If you are ready to move to the next level, to be challenged and challenge those you work with, now’s the time to join us in building something great.

The Job:
Design and develop services and web applications to support online travel affiliates.
Work with the business and technology groups to refine requirements and functional specifications.
Develop code and unit tests in a continuously integrated environment.
Promote good development methodologies via code review and great software design.
Work with our quality engineers to automate testing and make sure all issues are bug free.
Provide estimates and commitments for each sprint.

The Background:
BS in Computer Science or related field
4-6 years of software development experience
Java coding experience using Java 5 and 6
Should have a strong background in computer fundamentals : data processing, run times, network protocols, memory management, appropriate data structures.
Expertise with web applications deployed to cluster or cloud environment. Including handling state, deploying data across distributed servers and distributed caching.
Ability to design software and algorithms to solve problems or model specific scenarios.
Understanding of threading, concurrency and problems that can result from concurrent processing.
Experience using relational databases (SQL Server and Derby experience is advantageous).
Experience processing data from different sources, such as xml, soap services, RSS, JSON.
Ability to quickly find and resolve software problems from a stack trace or thread dump.
Experience debugging software using standard tools.
Basic understanding of http protocol, JavaScript, and html markup.
Experience with Agile development and process including scrum.
Experience working with small to medium teams on all size projects.
Knowledge of basic Unix command line tools, modern automated development and test frameworks.
In depth experience with Java VM and VM configuration.
Experience with test driven development or unit test.
Experience with distributed caching and data storage.

About Expedia, Inc.

Our mission is to revolutionize travel through the power of technology.
Collectively, the Expedia, Inc. brands cover virtually every aspect of researching, planning, and booking travel, from choosing the best airplane seat, to reading personal travel reviews of hotels, to planning what to do in a destination once you arrive. The Expedia, Inc. portfolio serves both leisure and business travelers with tastes and budgets ranging from modest to luxury. Expedia delivers consumer travel demand from nearly every continent to nearly 149,000 hotels and hundreds of airlines, tour operators, car rental companies and destination services supply partners. Please visit http://bit.ly/expediabrands to learn more about our travel brands.

Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. job summary:
Our Engineers build software that creates a better quality of life for thousands of post-acute care patients. Occasionally, they help Senior Support Representatives when they get stuck on a client issue. Most importantly, they help us continue to set the bar in our industry.
Our Software Engineers code, debug, modify and test code for a variety of complex processes in web-based applications environment. Software Engineers develop technical specifications and serve as technical experts in assigned products (Clinical, Census, Financial). They improve knowledge of internal programming languages and tools, extended healthcare industry, and relationship with other software products. Our Software Engineers also recommend improvements to cross-functional processes and mentors/trains less experienced engineers.
The successful candidate for this position will have these qualifications
3-5 years’ experience as an engineer, and preferably some of that doing development for the web. An understanding of Object Oriented Programming preferred.
We are mostly a Microsoft shop. We use .NET for a large portion of our product. It’s not a requirement that you are an expert, but you need to be able to learn
Must be able to develop complex code which impacts multiple functions for a Microsoft SQL server database.
Must be able to read and interpret business requirements and write technical specification documents. Includes having a basic understanding of source control/configuration management.
You should be passionate about software development and be willing to keep your skills fresh. We love what we do, and we want you to as well.
You should be familiar with Relational Databases.
Mobile experience in either iOS or Android is a plus
Problem solving is a lot of what development is. If challenges are something you like to dig into then you will fit right in.
You should have good communication skills, both in person and written.

Technical Skills Needed:
ASP.Net – Familiar through reading and/or introductory-to-intermediate courses required, including reading and writing simple code and developing simple processes.
Object-Oriented Programming – Proficient knowledge of language (JAVA, Visual Basic, C# or F#). Can read, write and mentor others. Can apply to complex, multi-functional processes. Generally 5-10 years.
SQL – Knowledgeable of language. Has done project work using code. Has good working application/experience. Can apply principals to multi-process applications. Generally 1-2 years.
HTML – Knowledgeable of language. Has done project work using code. Has good working application/experience. Can apply principals to multi-process applications. Generally 1-2 years.
JAVA Script - Familiar through reading or introductory course preferred, including reading and writing simple code and developing simple processes.

WHY WORK FOR DMP?

job summary:
Job Description

Jack Henry & Associates is looking for a passionate, talented, hands on Application Architect , who blends solid software architecture and product development expertise with proven experience designing and implementing SaaS based applications within a progressive technology stack utilizing Java, .Net, Web technologies, and open source frameworks. Are you a Big Data expert who gets excited about working on an agile team, who loves landing, mining and manipulating large data sets, and is an expert in Hadoop, Hive, MapReduce or Spark? Do you want to leverage your skills to gather large datasets? Would you like to work directly with decision-makers to set direction, grow an enterprise capability, and drive business value through analytics-fueled products?
If your answer is “Yes!” this position is for you!
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
6 years of experience working as an architect on enterprise scale architecture.
3 years of hands on experience to create/maintain micro services: Have proficiency with micro services using REST/JSON, Java, open source frameworks (i.e. Spring, etc.), Docker and Kubernetes.
3 years of experience in working with relational databases and SQL, including MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle
Able to work extended hours as business needs dictate.
Occasional overnight travel
PREFERRED SKILLS
At least 5 years of experience with Java programming including Java/J2EE, Spring Framework
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science
3 years of experience in ETL software development using technologies like Talend, Clover ETL
3 years of experience in big data and cloud based technologies like Hadoop / Cloudera
Experience with Agile software development
Good Experience with NoSQL platforms
Good understanding in Data Modeling concepts
Good Experience with Continuous Integration and hands-on experience (tools like Jenkins, TeamCity, Maven, Ant, Bamboo)
Strong understanding of DevOps technologies such as Chef, Ansible, Puppet, Zookeeper etc.
Proficient in current development and source code management tools (Eclipse, Git, SVN)
Good Experience with HBase, Cassandra, DynamoDB, CouchDB, Map Reduce
Good understanding in event processing/messaging, i.e. Kafka/Rabbit MQ, as well as logging, auditing and metrics, i.e. ElasticSearch/Kibana, Hadoop/Spark
In-depth knowledge in IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, and cloud solution implementation
Thorough understanding of big data architectures including physical composition (e.g. network, storage, compute, and hardware) as well as physical modeling, distribution, partitioning, and parallelism.
Thorough understanding of Data Warehousing architectures, techniques, and methodologies; including Star Schemas, Snowflake Schemas, Slowly Changing Dimensions, and Aggregation Techniques
Ability to remain organized, pay strict attention to detail, and meet critical deadlines within a high volume, fast-paced environment
Excellent time management skills, Strong communication skills, ability to support multiple projects, and effectively manage a large volume of work
Self-motivated, with the ability to meet and exceed position requirements under minimal direction and supervision
Ability to operate professionally, effectively and ethically as an individual contributor and member of a team
Analytical, with strong problem-solving abilities and creative resolution skills
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Collaborate with technology partners to understand enterprise requirements and develop or identify appropriate architecture plans
Produce appropriate design artifacts representing desired changes in technical architecture
Build consensus among technical staff by evaluating potential solutions
Provides direction for design activities.
Evaluate emerging technologies and the evolution of current technologies to define a future vision roadmap for optimal application of technology to meet business needs
Provides architectural and “big picture” oversight for development of new or enhanced products.
Translates customer business requirements into specific systems, applications or process designs for solutions and integrating architecture.
Acts as an advocate for the customer, as the ultimate authority on the architecture designed to address customer’s business problems.
Provides technical advice to other departments within the company, and is responsible for integrating components built by product developers.
Analyzes the scope, timeline and specifications of tasks; delegates tasks to other architects. Writes implementation plans for enhancements and fixes.

job summary:
At American National we put our core values of financial strength, integrity, respect, service and teamwork at the heart of everything we do. If you share these values and would like to grow your career at a strong, respected company, here’s an opportunity for you.

At American National we put our core values of financial strength, integrity, respect, service and teamwork at the heart of everything we do. If you share these values and would like to grow your career at a strong, respected company, here’s an opportunity for you.
Senior Programmer Analyst II- Are you up to the challenge?
In today’s market, gifted programmers have the edge. The majority of companies have more IT openings than talented people to fill them. With all the options available, why should you choose American National?
American National supports talented and resourceful minds that have a passion for technology and creating an innovative and useful product. Collaboration and strong communication skills are key attributes to a successful career. We believe in a solid work/life balance and are committed to providing our team members with a flexible and creative work environment. We provide benefits that are both anticipated (comprehensive benefits including multiple health options and paid disability, community involvement, and a matching 401k plan) and refreshing (37.5 hour work week, educational opportunities and tuition reimbursement, career growth paths, and a health and wellness program with an on-site coach).
Our IT Division offers the creative development opportunities you crave, along with a balance you won’t find elsewhere. You’ll have the opportunity to work with a wide scope of technology solutions, as well as learn new ones! You won’t be stuck logging endless hours of overtime, or riding the wave of technology cycles. Projects at American National are steady, stable, and challenging.
A Senior Programmer Analyst II is needed to grow our team! This opportunity requires an experience programmer with Object Oriented skills who will be working on our innovative claims system initiative to configure the base product to meet our business requirements.

Key activities include:
Creating Asynchronous Messaging Architectures
Defining and Implementing Process Models
Creating Data Integration and Workflow Designs
Writing business rules and other business logic in GOSU
Defining insurance products in the Guidewire application
Creating and managing sample data
Managing the application Integrations and merging them with new releases of the Guidewire application
Resolving issues identified in testing

Job Requirements:
To successfully fit this position, you need experience in one or more of the following areas:
4 year degree in computer information systems or related field or equivalent work experience
Strong SQL Server knowledge (2008 or later)
Strong Web Service, SOAP, and XML knowledge
Proficient in Object Oriented programming languages Java or C# to relate to GOSU
Strong relational database and database modeling skills
Experience with Agile methodology is a plus
Experience with SSIS is a plus
Experience with COBOL, JCL, DB2, and VSAM is a plus
Insurance knowledge is a plus
Experience with Microsoft Office is a plus

job summary:
Plano 3 (31063), United States of America, Plano, Texas

Software Engineer, Full-Stack

Do you want to work for a tech company that writes its own code, develops its own software, and builds its own products? We experiment and innovate leveraging the latest technologies, engineer breakthrough customer experiences, and bring simplicity and humanity to banking. We make a difference for 65 million customers. At Capital One, you'll be part of a group of makers, breakers, doers and disruptors, who love to solve real problems and meet real customer needs. We want you to be curious and ask “what if”?

As a Capital One Software Engineer, you'll work on everything from customer-facing web and mobile applications using cutting-edge open source frameworks, to highly-available RESTful services, to back-end systems using the hottest techniques in Big Data. You will drive the design, implementation, testing, deployment, and post-release support in an agile application development environment. You will execute on engineering and release priorities successfully through strong leadership and communication. Whether a bug fix or an awesome feature, you will own your work and deliver the most elegant and scalable solutions.

Responsibilities:

Work as part of forward leaning team of makers to design and develop software solutions
Research competing platforms and contribute to the product development process
Drive innovation through rapid prototyping and iterative development
Identify and enable adoption of new technologies and patterns particularly in Public Cloud, API and Web frameworks
Demonstrate strong technical ability, awareness and track record of proposing and integrating technologies and solutions
Maintain all-round view of solution, understanding both business and technical challenges and also both functional and non-functional needs of solution
Provide technical leadership to the design, development/implementation, and testing of business solutions, integrating legacy and new technologies
Work with the developers, quality engineers product managers and subject matter experts to design and develop end-to-end solution options
Develop and recommending novel and innovative approaches to solving business and technical problems.
Focus massively on delivering with speed and quality
Keep up-to-date on new technology, standards, protocols and tools in areas relevant to the rapidly changing digital environment
Apply sound Dev Ops and automation best practices
Prepare and present potential technical solutions and advising the business on the technical and business value of the proposition
Actively participate in internal and external Communities of Practice

Who you are:
You yearn to be part of cutting edge, high profile projects and are motivated by delivering world-class solutions on an aggressive schedule
Someone who is not intimidated by challenges; thrives even under pressure; is passionate about their craft; and hyper focused on delivering exceptional results
You love to learn new technologies and mentor junior engineers to raise the bar on your team
It would be awesome if you have a robust portfolio on Github and / or open source contributions you are proud to share
Passionate about intuitive and engaging user interfaces, as well as new/emerging concepts and techniques in web design

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree or military experience
At least 5 years of hands-on experience in software engineering
At least 2 years experience in JVM based web application development
At least 2 years experience in HTML5 and CSS
At least 3 years of current experience with Java development
At least 3 years of experience in API development
At least 2 years of experience using Angular JS

Preferred Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in object-oriented and functional programming in Java and JavaScript
2+ years of experience building RESTful web services with server-side frameworks like Spring Boot and Play
2+ years of experience working with NoSQL and distributed storage technology including Hadoop, HBase, Cassandra, Elasticsearch, and Redis
1+ year of experience with microservices architecture
1+ year of experience with front end technology stack, such as React.js/AngularJS and Babel/TypeScript
1+ year of experience with Scala and Groovy languages
1+ year of experience in AWS or similar cloud computing environments with infrastructure and configuration management tools like Ansible, Docker, and Mesos

Capital One will consider sponsoring you for employment authorization for this position.

Sr. Object-Oriented Programmer Analyst


Job Description


American Airlines, Inc. has multiple openings for an Object Oriented Programmer Analyst to perform the following duties: Support development activities in applications in the Crews and Flight Operations area. Support and develop multiple web-based Java or .NET applications, and web services. Interface with management, business analysts, project managers, IT Architects, other developers and internal customers to understand requirements and develop needs according to business requirements. Maintain and enhance existing services, applications, and platforms including, but not limited to, bug fixes, feature enhancements and performance tuning. Application integration development using approved languages, tools, and platforms. Troubleshoot and debug complex issues; identify and implement solutions. Perform testing of various types including Test Driven Development, unit, system, integration, and non-functional testing. Participate in promotion of software releases across all environments and change management. Support production issues on call. Work with a team to create detailed project specifications, requirements and estimates. Work with production operations department to ensure deployments roll out smoothly and customers receive appropriate support. Research and implement new technologies to enhance current processes, security and performance. Document software designs. Develop and enforce policy and procedural changes within the development group. Develop coding standards and adhere to best practices and security guidelines. Participate in code reviews. Work closely with software architects to ensure decisions meet long-term enterprise needs. Analyze system requirements, design, and document solutions using specified tools and methodologies.

job summary:
Raytheon IIS is the #1 provider of real time imagery and signal intelligence as well as the world’s best flight control system UAS safety records. We are a leader in cyber security supplying 10x the detection capabilities of our nearest competitors as well as being the source of protection for several of the most sensitive systems in the world. We provide one of the world’s largest immigration and control systems and are the #1 provider of weather data in the United States. IIS is the only company with support personnel on every continent and in the war zone, providing mission support services for more than 8,000 unique customer missions each year, in 80 nations. 

Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services, located in Richardson, Texas is looking for a candidate to join our world-class engineering team as a Software Engineer. As a candidate for this opportunity you should have a good foundation in one or more software development languages (preferably C++ or Java) and be able to use various software tools on HP or SUN workstations in a UNIX or LINUX environment. The candidate should have a fundamental understanding of software principles, theories, and concepts related to software engineering (including software development lifecycle and software development process) and Object Oriented analysis, design, and programming. 

The Software organization partners with Systems engineering and other disciplines to provide affordable, cost-effective software solutions to IIS programs and initiatives. They will provide SW architecture and database design, SW development and sustainment through traditional or agile methods, and SW integration and test (SWIT), including continuous integration techniques. 

Required Skills: 

· 2+ years experience developing SW in Java or C++ 

· Strong problem-solving ability and self-motivation 

· Desire to work and thrive in a team environment 

· Able to work independently, with very little supervision 

· Must be able to communicate effectively both in writing and verbally 

· A ctive TS/SCI security clearance 

Desired Skills: 

· Experience coding applications interfacing with Oracle Database 

· Experience using Clearcase, Clearquest or other software configuration management tools 

Required Education (including Major): 

· Bachelor's Degree in engineering, computer science or similar

job summary:
GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The JavaScript Developer II is responsible for the detail design, documentation, development, unit testing and maintenance of planned and unplanned internally developed applications created for Availity business partners. The position is also responsible for the design, documentation, evaluation and system performance testing of externally purchased software products against major business processes and specifications. Incumbents may be called upon to serve in multiple roles in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial corporate environment.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Application Development


Writes application code for a range of simple to moderately complex system designs
Writes programs that span platforms. Code to and/or create Application Programming Interfaces (API)
Writes and/or modifies application code to enhance existing programs or developing new programs
Identifies system and functional requirements
Reviews code developed by less experienced Developers and recommends changes
Writes detailed technical specifications for subsystems and identifies integration points
Reports missing elements found in system and functional requirements and explains the impacts on subsystems to other Developers, System Analysts, Product Owners, Technical Leads, System Architects, and Product Managers
Supports transition of application throughout the Product Development life cycle
Documents applications and/or code that needs to be migrated. May require more coordination points for subsystems

Collaboration


Consults with Developers, System Analysts, System Architects, Product Managers, and vendors (occasionally)
Accurately scopes project time and resources required to complete programming objectives
Reviews and confirms project scope and time line estimates with senior Developers, System Analysts, and/or Project Managers
Guides less experienced Developers as needed with regard to project estimates, development, and testing

Testing


Performs unit testing and debugging. Establishes test conditions based on code specifications. May collaborate with senior Developers and other team members to debug more complex errors
Consults with senior Developers on testing plans and results
Work with senior Developers to resolve/debug program errors
Reviews vendor research. Conducts vendor product gap analysis and makes valid comparisons

The above cited duties and responsibilities describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to the job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all the duties and responsibilities that an incumbent may be expected or asked to perform.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE


Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent in relevant work experience
4 - 8 years of progressive work experience designing business processes, process mapping, working on process improvement initiatives, and business applications system design
Experience testing and debugging business application systems and processes
Experience developing software products for clinical environments and medical labs
Experience integrating both in house developed software and externally purchased software for large applications
Web portal development experience
JavaScript (Node, Angular, React, Bootstrap, Knockout)
Experience with data modeling, relational databases, data structures and design a plus
Experience working with Product and Business Management teams a plus
Experience working in an entrepreneurial company a plus

SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE

Technical Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Knowledge, skills, and experience to write detailed technical documentation, specifically business requirements and functional specifications for application development
Ability and experience to facilitate JAD sessions or other requirements gathering processes. May work with senior Developers to resolve/debug program errors
Knowledge and ability to apply OOD ( HTML, XML, Java Script,and Patterns) and impact to the application development process
Knowledge of web development methodologies (preferably Agile/Scrum), application design, navigation, and information architecture
Knowledge of database design and query language
Understanding of web services (REST & SOAP)
Understanding of unit testing a plus
Working knowledge of MVC a plus
In depth knowledge of HIPAA X12 transactions a plus
Working knowledge of EDIFECS a plus
Demonstrated proficiency using PC skills such as; MS Suite products, flowcharting tools, e-mail, and electronic calendar scheduling

Soft Skills:

Strong relationship management and collaboration skills requirements and functional specifications for application development
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships, supporting company leadership and other team members
Ability to work under pressure. Maintains composure and professionalism in an interrupt-driven environment
Ability to manage multiple and changing priorities/tasks
Must be flexible and embrace change

CUSTOMER SCOPE


Seeking a working knowledge in the following areas:

o Test Driven Development

o Pair Programming

o HTML, JQuery, and CSS


Understanding of Git a plus
Knowledge of AngularJS a plus

job summary:
At BBVA, we’re working to make banking better for everyone. That’s where you come in. We’re looking for smart, team-oriented people who want to be part of a world-class workforce that gives people the tools they need to meet their financial goals, all while delivering an outstanding client experience. Learn more below.


Responsibilities
About BBVA Dallas Creation Center


BBVA Dallas Creation Center started with the goal of transforming the way financial products and services are delivered to our customers by creating unique and amazing experiences that revolutionize the way we do banking. Read more about the Dallas Creation Center here - https://www.bbva.com/en/news/disciplines/technologies/new-dallas-center-accelerates-bbvas-shift-digital-first-mindset/


At BBVA, we are looking for candidates like you – talented individuals who possess ambition, creativity and integrity. As we continue to expand our Dallas Creation Center, our focus is hiring the next generation of talent across data analytics, software engineering, and user experience and design – those who are recent graduates with Computer Science background.


Responsibilities

Work with technical leads and product owners to understand desired application capabilities and testing scenarios
Work within Agile teams to design, develop, test, implement, and support technical solutions across a full-stack of development tools and technologies
Lead the solution design, availability, resilience, and scalability of your solution and continuously improve software engineering practices
Stay on top of technology trends, experiment with and learn new technologies, participate in internal & external technology communities, and evolve to mentor other members of the engineering community

Qualifications
Grade 16 Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics.
At least one of year of software development experience (through coursework, projects, internships
Experience in one or more of the following areas preferred:
Frontend web technologies (HTML5, Javascript, JS frameworks, CSS)
Development and programming experience in Java / J2EE
Mobile technologies - iOS, Android and hybrid applications development
Data Engineering - competency with computational tools i.e. Python, R, SAS. Statistical or predictive modeling using Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning.
Cloud technologies, DevOps, CI/CD concepts and tooling
MS degree in Computer Science preferred
Spanish language skills preferred

Grade 18 Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience in Computer Science or Applied Mathematics and 4 or more of year of relevant software development experience
Master’s Degree and 2 or more years of relevant software development experience
Relevant Experience in one or more of the following areas:
Frontend web technologies (HTML5, Javascript, JS frameworks, CSS)
Development and programming experience in Java / J2EE
Mobile technologies - iOS, Android and hybrid applications development
Data Engineering - competency with computational tools i.e. Python, R, SAS. Statistical or predictive modeling using Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning.
Cloud technologies, DevOps, CI/CD concepts and tooling
Spanish language skills preferred

About BBVA:


BBVA is a customer-centric global financial services group founded in 1857. The Group is the largest financial institution in Spain and Mexico and it has leading franchises in South America and the Sunbelt Region of the United States; and it is also the leading shareholder in Garanti, Turkey’s biggest bank for market capitalization. Its diversified business is focused on high-growth markets and it relies on technology as a key sustainable competitive advantage. Corporate responsibility is at the core of its business model. BBVA fosters financial education and inclusion, and supports scientific research and culture. It operates with the highest integrity, a long-term vision and applies the best practices. The Group is present in the main sustainability indexes.

job summary:
CA Technologies provides IT management solutions that help customers manage and secure complex IT environments to support agile business services. Organizations of all sizes leverage CA Technologies software and SaaS solutions to accelerate innovation, transform infrastructure and secure data and identities, from the data center to the cloud.


As a Mainframe Associate Software Engineer you will become a member of Software Engineering community and work alongside experienced engineers specializing in the IBM mainframe technology. In this role, you will not only build skills and gain increasing responsibility, you will also be making an impact by providing analysis related to software design and development, evaluating software performance, and making your recommendations to the software design community.


The Role

• Research and develop innovative new solutions that will help to shape the future direction of CA Technologies

• Work within a scrum team in an agile development environment, with an opportunity to gain exposure to many of the key agile roles

• Design and code moderately complex units/modules/products that meet functional and business requirements on schedule and within budget

• Participate in design and code reviews with other engineers

• Participate in test plan reviews and develop automated test scripts to deliver high quality software solutions


Role Training

The CA Mainframe Software Engineer position includes a 7-week training program in Pittsburgh, PA starting in June 2017. During this training, all participants' expenses (meals, travel and hotel) are covered by the company. After the training is complete all will return to their home offices and work with their Business Unit. The Mainframe Associate Software Engineer Training Program introduces you to the mainframe platform, including the following topics:

• The mainframe z/OS operating system

• User interfaces for developing on the mainframe

• Embedded UNIX-oriented operating system

• Programming in the mainframe’s Assembler, Metal C, and REXX scripting languages

• Popular mainframe transaction servers, databases, file structures, and change management systems

• The Agile development process


How YOU will stand out?

Must Haves:

• BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field between December 2015 to June 2017

• Languages- C, C++, Java

• Strong analytical skills to grasp operating system concepts

Like to have:

• Languages - Python, Ruby, Perl, Sql, HTML, JavaScript, COBOL, Assembler, REXX

• Proven Team experience; Agile Team experience is a plus

• User Interface/ User Experience (UI/UX) experience is a plus

• Working Knowledge of common operating systems (Linux, Windows, z/OS, Unix)

• Prior Internship experience in a Computer Software/ IT industry


The Perks

CA has earned scores of global Workplace Excellence awards in the last few years – and there’s a reason for that.

• This Enterprise Program is encompassed with both Product and Mainframe teams, it’s important to note that it’s a cohesive unit that allows you the opportunity to work, grow, expand across the Enterprise, which allows CA Technologies to provides best-in-class solutions for its Customers

• Competitive benefits package including Medical (including 24/7 online access to a physician), Vision, Dental, and 401k with match eligibility.

• Tuition Assistance Program

• Work life balance

• Parent, Pet Benefits

• 5 paid volunteer days during the year to use as agreed upon by manager


If you want to fulfill your potential, be acknowledged for your achievements, and be given autonomy to make decisions for your business and customers; if you want to work with a company that respects you as an individual - recognizing both your needs at work and your responsibilities outside of it - then CA Technologies is where you belong.


At CA Technologies your passion and expertise can directly impact the business and you’ll help offer our customers practical approaches to delivering new, innovative services and value through IT.


We offer competitive salary, company-sponsored premium Medical/Prescription & Dental Plans, company-paid Holidays, Vacation, Anniversary Service and Sick Days, 401(k) Plan, Education/Training Reimbursement, Charitable Gift Program, Adoption Assistance Program.


Learn more about CA Technologies and this opportunity now at http://ca.com/careers


We and all of our subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. As such, it is our corporate policy to fill positions with qualified candidates regardless of the candidate’s race, color, sex, age, religion, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability, pregnancy, military status, veteran status or any other protected group status.


Note to Recruiters and Placement Agencies
: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any of our employees. We will not pay fees to any third party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered our property and will be processed accordingly.


If you require an accommodation with the online application process, please contact Talent Acquisition at 1-800-454-3788.

job summary:
Job Title: Software Engineer
Reports To: Chief Information Advisor
Department: Information Technology
Location: Dallas, TX or Noblesville, IN

About:
RYZE Claim Solutions, is anchored by the strengths of the companies brought together to form this powerful hub of comprehensive claim services. With expansive service offerings, multiple business lines expertise and comprehensive claims knowledge, RYZE provides a wide range of solutions over a vast geographic area. These services include Daily Property, Catastrophe, Flood, TPA/Claims Administration, Casualty, Reinspections, Audits, Appraisal Services, and Training.

Description:
RYZE Claim Solutions is seeking a talented individual to join our growing team. This exciting in-house opportunity in the insurance adjusting industry is waiting for a highly-motivated software engineer with experience designing, implementing, and supporting both new and legacy software applications.
This position requires understanding and experience in both .NET/C# and Java. Additionally, strong preference will be given to candidates who have a solid understanding of systems and network administration and database design and administration. The individual must work onsite at either the Dallas, TX location, or the Noblesville, IN location. Must be available for regular business hours and occasional weekend or evening work may be required. Travel may be required up to 10% of the time with more frequent travel for training the first 3-4 months of employment (percentage undecided, needs to be open.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Designs, codes, tests and maintains software using both .NET/C# and Java/J2EE technologies
Provide technical software support to employees, contractors and partners of RYZE
Utilize revision control software to maintain all custom software and configurations
Work with other technical staff and business users to identify opportunities to improve business efficiency through the use of technology
Work with technical staff, business users, and partners to help define process and system requirements and specifications
Under the direction of the Chief Information Officer, design, implement, test, and maintain new tools and technical systems
Maintain, support and expand the functionality of existing software systems
Other duties as assigned
Required Skills and Competencies
Solid understanding of Java and J2EE technologies, with a minimum of 3 years of experience writing server-side and web presentation Java code
Solid understanding of C# and .NET, with a minimum of 3 years of experience writing server-side and web presentation C# code
Familiarity with ODBC and JDBC, with a minimum of 2 year experience writing code that queries and updates databases.
Strong understanding of OO programming concepts and data structures
Solid understanding of MVC architecture
Experience designing, implementing and supporting RESTful services
Experience working with integrated development environments, with strong preference given to candidates with experience in Visual Studio, Eclipse and Spring Test Suite.
Strong technical and analytical skills
Solid experience in problem analysis and resolution of software issues
Must excel in an agile environment where critical thinking and strong problem solving skills are required for success
Innovative thinker who is positive and proactive
Able to communicate and interact professionally with internal staff, clients, partners and consultants, including frequent interaction with executive management

Suggested Skills and Competencies
Experience working in both UNIX/Linux and Windows environments
Experience using git
Experience with IIS and Apache Tomcat
Comfortable working with a wide range of open source technologies
Familiarity with the configuration of Microsoft SQL and MySQL databases and creation of database schemas
Experience with and understanding of systems and network support in Windows and Linux environments
Experience in the property and casualty insurance adjusting field

Education and/or Experience
Bachelor (4-year) of Science in Computer Science or CIS/MIS
Four years of relevant work experience

Additionally in order to work for RYZE you will be required to take a drug test and go through our criminal background check process.
Employment with RYZE is "at will," terminable by the employee or the company at any time, with or without notice, with or without cause, except as otherwise provided by law.
RYZE is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

job summary:
Software Engineer in Test- Entry Level


Who We Are: Kibo. We provide industry leading eCommerce, distributed order management, and mobile point-of-sale solutions to retailers and branded manufacturers. Our cloud-based commerce suite enables customers to meet consumer demands anywhere, any time, and on any device. We have US offices in Texas and California and international offices in London.


Who You Are: A highly motivated individual interested in driving high quality software development! You will be contributing to the development effort of several enterprise level multi-tenant SaaS solutions, as well as mobile applications. The primary focus of this position is to drive high quality by building automated tests and tools that enable engineering wide efficiencies. You are passionate about creating superior software.


Why You Should Apply: This position offers you the opportunity to work with a newly formed organization on their industry leading eCommerce solutions. This role offers amazing growth potential for individuals looking to take their career to the next level.


Key Responsibilities:

Review business requirements and specifications for consistency in quality standards and preparation for testing .


Write and maintain detailed test plans, test cases, and test scripts both manual and automated .


Work under general direction with the ability to act independently when determining methods and procedures on new or existing functionality.


Work on complex projects and problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors and additional specialized technical knowledge.


Work with analysts and stakeholders to determine and refine feature requirements.


Create automation scripts for both functional and regression tests.


Record and track issues/defects; follow-through with resolution and validation.


Work closely with the business and development groups from conception to completion of multiple simultaneous projects.


Perform an integral role in the software development lifecycle as a participant in the development scrum team.


Skills & Requirements:

Experience with or knowledge of test automation best practices


Strong knowledge of web and internet technologies


Knowledge with software development life cycle


Excellent documentation skills communicating with technical and non-technical internal staff


Experience with Java and/or other programing languages


Experience in creation of test plans


Experience in creating test cases


Manual / Functional testing


Strong troubleshooting skills


Preferred Experience:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience


Automated testing and proficiency with Selenium or similar tools


Knowledge of JavaScript, jQuery, AJAX, CSS, HTML, JPA, JUnit


Knowledge of RESTful web service design principles


Knowledge of Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) and reusable components


Knowledge of AWS services and/or Cloud based methodologies


Knowledge of Hudson or Jenkins with builds


Experience with Linux/Unix preferred


Previous experience in the e-Commerce industry would be helpful


This Job Description indicates the general nature and level of work expected of the incumbent(s). It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities required of the incumbent. Incumbent(s) may be asked to perform other duties in addition to those described above.


Kibo Software Inc., is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of any status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local municipalities.
